title: A little off the beaten path
review: We stayed here during our recent trip to Florida.  The room was average (I agree with comments others have made on how dated the rooms feel).  The pool was very nice!  It was conceptually good to be "on a beach" but we only went to the beach here once. The beach is not so close to the hotel - they made up for it with golf cart service - and the sand isn't as clean as the beaches to the north.  But it was quieter here than the hotels to the north, so that was nice. Maybe we will be back someday?  We shall see.    PS - I find it unusual that the hotel manager feels the need to comment on every review.

title: Excellent experience
review: Dear Mr. Juckett: Thank you very much for letting us know regarding your experience staying with us. Unfortunately the long walk to the beach is due to the construction of the Jetti on the intercoastal waterway, it has pushed over sand  towards the Gulf of Mexico making the beach wider. Kind regards,

title: Good - but be aware
review: I would like to thank Brandon Young for going above and beyond. He is an example of what customer service should look like. I had an issue with the Marriott hotel across this property and Brandon was able to booked me a same day reservation and they didn't have an ocean view room he booked the best he could and would check the next day for a better one. Even though I mentioned to not to worry the next day he remembered it and mentioned having one available. I politely declined and asked instead if I could have extra toiletries; stepped away to grab a bite and when I get to the room the things that I asked where there.  Also the Ladies at the concierge were the best! I'm looking forward to come back again!

title: Needs Updating, great staff
review: Just back from a 5 night trip end of Oct - had a really good time and enjoyed it.  A few things to be aware of however, I picked this largely because it is a Sheraton and I have Platinum status and figured it was very close to Clearwater beach. It is a little too far to walk over the bridge into Clearwater but there is a free Trolley / Tram every 30mins the Jolly Trolley - free if you show your room card - we used this a lot and it comes right into the Sheraton Property.  The beach was a huge disappointment - given it is a mile down the coast I expected it to be more of the same compared to Clearwater - it isn’t - the Sand is quite compacted and not attractive at all, with quite a lot of small shells. The sea was not attractive at Clearwater either on the days we were there - maybe just churned up with the weather. I love relaxing on the beach but this beach doesn’t have any wow factor. It is nice and long for a walk though and plenty of people were collecting shells.  The beach is a 5 minute walk from the hotel pool - not a big deal at all for anyone able bodied - however, they have a golf buddy and will run you up there is if you wish.  The pool area is nice albeit small - strangely no umbrellas at all other than on tables so shade would be difficult to come by when the hotel is busy - this wasn’t a problem for us. The pool staff were great - esp the Aussie guy, super happy and chatting all the time. Loads of games and floats etc were available to use free of charge.  The hotel itself is very much long overdue a renovation - it looks very outdated - however it is clean and this didn’t bother us. We used SPG suite nights to get upgraded to a huge suite - which was very badly laid out but had plenty of space with a King and a large sofa bed for the kids.  As platinum we had access to the Executive lounge - this was great 6pm-8pm daily a few snacks and drinks beers, wines, spirits was a great stop off on the way back to the room before heading out for dinner. The ladies looking after us in there were excellent. The lounge is open morning to night for coffees and soft drinks too. As platinum we could have a continental breakfast in the lounge or use the Platinum benefit to upgrade the 2 Adults to full breakfast buffet in Rusty's - we did this and it was nice - not a wonderful buffet but had plenty of choice. Bacon, Sausage, potatoes, alternate days French toast and Pancakes, plus fruits yogurts, pastries and breads.  It was Halloween while we were there and the staff made a big effort and had a Pumpkin contest which was nice touch.  The only big complaint is that as you walked from the hotel through the conference area to the Trolley stop absolutely stank of mould - it was disgusting and it was there the whole trip - Management really need to sort that out and there didn't even seem to be an attempt to mask it with air freshener.  Recommend the “Little Toot” Dolphin trip in Clearwater- reasonable cost too.  Overall we had a nice time, but next time I would likely choose to stay in Clearwater Beach. I would come back but only if I got a good deal on rate or after they renovate. I could imagine some people giving a bad review, but we knew it was in need of renovation so apart from the smell in the conference center the other issues (beach, loaction) were beyond the hotels control.  Edit - just to add I almost forgot - the cost of the sunbeds in front of teh hotel and also on Clearwater beach is so expensive it defies belief - as said the beach isnt great anyway but the cost of 4 beds and an parasol was around $60!!!! I was being scammed (obviously didnt pay) either as similar cost on Clearwater beach and a big sign up for around $40 for 2 beds and a parasol.  There were about 3 couples on the beach beds at any time I walked down there - I wonder why! I dont think these were hotel controlled as far as I could make out - but good to be ware.     Definitely a contender for the most expenseive beds in the world…

title: Well situated hotel on the beach
review: Our room was clean in most respects, except we it wasn’t vacuumed. Found a penny on the carpet and a hairpin in different locations.  The offerings at the pool for lunch were not that good. Tried pizza....don’t bother...it was like cardboard with flavorless cheese. Salad was remade boxed, my husband’s sandwich was soggy. The hot tub was boiling....crazy hot.  Pool area great.  Beachfront property but 35 dollars if you want a chair after the long walk down to the beach.   It would have been nice to have more than one restaurant.  But overall a decent place.

title: Nice Stay
review: I stayed 5 nights for a conference. Hotel is older, but clean. There are currently some renovations going on. Staff is friendly and attentive. Island Grille has a nice salad bar and the drinks at the bar are great. Pool area and hot tub are very good. There are some games and hammocks on the sand close to the pool. There is a long walk to the beach, but golf carts run during the day. The beach connects to the Sand Key Park and is much quieter than the public beach near Pier 60. You can ride the Jolly Trolley free with your room key.

title: there for Conference
review: Your informative review is sincerely appreciated! It is an added bonus that when here at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort for a conference after a busy day of meetings you are also able to enjoy a taste the Florida vacation element as well. The Sheraton Sand Key Resort has been on this serene and relaxing island for many years, still we strive to maintain a fresh atmosphere within our guest rooms and common areas. As you stated we are renovating … we have some exciting changes in the near future regarding the new Sheraton vision and look forward to sharing more details at a future time It is always gratifying to read that your experience with our associates was very positive; with ambition, empowerment and heart their concern is for your satisfaction and their attention to detail is obvious and shows that they genuinely care. There is much this area has to offer so please hurry back.

title: Here for conference
review: I have to say first that Sidney was awesome...she got us into an a room with an AWESOME view...poolside 4th floor.  Although the hotel does need an update we did not have any issues with smell or bugs.  There is a small fridge and a coffee maker in every room.  Our only problem was with water pressure and hot water (lack of) truly not a real big deal...we had just a wonderful time.  The walk to the oceanside is beautiful...if you don't want to walk it there is a big golf cart that will gladly take you to the ocean.  The pool area is very clean as is the pool and there are plenty of chairs and tables.  Again just a wonderful time!

title: No way this is a 4-star hotel
review: We just love hearing that your first encounter when arriving to the Sheraton Sand Key Resort was with Cydney. She truly is awesome, professional, knowledgeable and most of all genuinely cares about you our guest ... whether here for business or leisure. She will be added to our Associate Recognition program and sends a personal thank you!  It sounds as when not busy with your meetings that you enjoyed the amenities offered and all the beauty that Mother Nature has surround us with. Beautiful views, breathtaking sunsets, walks to the shore and relaxing in the sun just what a conference/beach get-away should be. The Sheraton Sand Key Resort has been on this beautiful and tranquil island for many, many years, still we strive to maintain the highest standards, not only in service, but also with regards to maintaining the overall look and feel of the hotel. We are constantly renovating, replacing the worn with new, making changes and improvements, still we realize there is more to be done.  We have some exciting changes in the near future regarding the new Sheraton vision, most of our rooms will be converted to showers instead of tubs, which will make the bathroom roomier and more “functional” as well. We look forward to sharing our plans once details and scheduling are finalized. We also look forward to you returning.

title: Great fitness center, decent price
review: The pictures are very misleading.  Their private beach is nice, but everything else needs serious updating.  It has the old hotel smell.  I'm here for a conference, and but I would not come back for any other reason.

title: R&R
review: We have been to the Sheraton three times over the last 14 years. If you are looking for quiet R&R on one of the most beautiful beaches In Florida, this is it. The service is wonderful and the location can’t be beat. Staff is attentive and friendly. It is on the water but a bit of a walk to it. If you need assistance or are just too hot and tired to make the walk to the beach, there is a golf cart to take you there and back free of charge.   There are chairs/umbrellas you can rent for the day but a bit pricey. $37.00/day for two chairs and an umbrella. Rusty’s bistro inside  the hotel has excellent food. Have not been disappointed with the dinners/buffet. Dinners range from about $16-$40. Service is wonderful. No late night bands noise. Lots of families. Perfect every visit.

title: Lovely hotel
review: Three visits now that is loyalty and we thank you for this perfect review. You are correct this serene Island Oasis is the perfect place to enjoy Rest and Relaxation … swaying palm trees, waves kissing the shore on our large beautiful and private beach, along with lounging around the pool, napping in a hammock or enjoying a breathtaking sunset all which make a get-away to the Island of Sand Key memorable.  Being on the Island of Sand Key surrounded by all the beauty that Mother Nature has shared with us with and a great work environment does inspire positive attitudes among our associates. They truly take pride in being efficient, warm, and welcoming, thank you for recognizing them. Your information is correct Rusty’s Bistro is an award winning restaurant and we are delighted that you have always enjoyed your dining experience. The cabanas are $37 as we do not charge a resort fee and we do have a free beach shuttle to take you to the shore. There are also complementary loungers and tables with umbrellas sprinkled throughout the area around the hotel. A great fire pit to gather around and lots of beach games available … and if for some reason you would like to explore the area, try different dining venues or entertainment we offer complementary trolley rides throughout the 35 miles of these Barrier Islands and that saves parking issues and fees and stress. Hurry Back another perfect visit awaits you.

title: Home away from home!
review: We stayed here 3 nights on a coach tour, our last location, which was ideal for a chill-out before flying home. Good pool, private beach, and a walk over to the Clearwater beach. A very good trolley service into Clearwater itself, hop-on hop- off, just show your hotel room card. Nice room with all facilities including fridge. Friendly staff. Lots of sitting areas to use the Wifi.

title: What a Gem
review: We thank you for your lovely review! And for choosing the beautiful and tropical Island of Sand Key for your chill-out. It is the perfect place for long walks and beautiful views, relaxation therapy and a bit of fun. Discussing your trip and sharing some memories and hopefully making wonderful new memories.  Being on the Island of Sand Key surrounded by all the beauty that Mother Nature has shared with us with and a great work environment does inspire positive attitudes among our associates. They truly take joy from being warm and welcoming and ensuring your stay is the experience you anticipated The close proximity to Clearwater Beach and all the entertainment, activity and great dining venues along with complementary trolley ride to take you to not only the Clearwater Beach area but also to the many surrounding beach towns, each offering a distinct charm which allows you to find a stunning collection of recreational and cultural surprises sprinkled throughout this area … Hurry Back there is so much more to do, see and explore!

title: vacation in paradise
review: We are only and hour and 20 minutes away from this special property. Been coming here for 25 years and we have met and made friends with so much of the staff. We just celebrated my husbands birthday here, and I’m a lifetime titanium ambassador so the perks and service were amazing !!! From cheese and fruit platters daily from the GM , to the best comped cheesecake from the food and beverage manager to great drinks from our bartenders , it was so special. The suite upgrade was incredible! Not to mention the sunsets..... white sand beaches and lovely pool area. Ask for a room or suite facing the pool and the gulf. The sunsets won’t disappoint !

title: Great hotel
review: First the hotels location is great, its directly on the beach and on the quieter side of clearwater beach. The parking is free, free wifi (but only if you ask for, otherwise its 14$ a day). The rooms are large with tall beds and a nice balcony. I've read some reviews about the hotel being pretty old but I didn't see it as dramatic and it was no problem to me. The AC was not too loud and I was able to sleep while it was running. I also had a little fridge which was empty (finally a hotel with a fridge where I could put my own stuff in).  In the morning I could walk down the beach to go for a nice refreshening swim in the sea.  The hotels restaurants are good, the breakfast is a bit expensive but around there are many good places to go eat.

title: Trip
review: Thank you for this lovey and informative review. The Island of Sand Key is a tropical paradise; beautiful beaches, breathtaking sunsets and awesome views. The smell of salt water, the gentle roar of the waves all combine to create a sense of peace and calm here on the beaches of Sand Key. This is the perfect place for long walks on the beach, shelling and dips in the Gulf of Mexico, maybe even a Dolphin sighting. A day at the beach is synonymous with relaxation, fun, peacefulness and is a great source of stress relief.  The Sheraton Sand Key Resort has been on this tranquil Island for over forty years, we are constantly renovating, replacing the worn with new, changes and improvements and we thank you for your positive comments.  We hope that the beauty of the location, your positive interaction with our associates and the memories made will bring you back for another visit soon.

title: Great Stay as Always
review: My wife and I have stayed at Sand Key Resort three times. Each time our stay was wonderful. The people working in the hotel are kind and helpful. The General Manager, Dominic, went above and beyond to make our stay memorable.   Brian & Lisa

title: Great stay
review: Thank you for your very gratifying review and please know that you time spent here at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort does not go unnoticed, thank you. The exceptional service and personal touches that our associates give our guests demonstrate our commitment to turning everyday moments into memorable branded experiences. I am sure it was those many memories and the beauty that surrounds this tranquil island which has brought you back these past three visits and we hope there are many more visits yet to come. Dominic was delighted with your comment and sends a personal Hurry Back!

title: Grateful
review: Stayed at this hotel over 20 times, and the minute we set foot in the door our holiday starts.  The Staff are so so helpful throughout the hotel Janet on the desk is so so helpful. It is so relaxing a beautiful private beach a casual beach resort. I have read a lot of reviews people not happy with there rooms small bathroom thin walls. We have not had any problems at all and we have stayed 5 weeks this year. I am pleased that we have free parking and no resort fees added to the end bill at the end of our stay. Stayed 2 weeks in the spring Clearwater packed. Sand key did not have crowds plenty of room on the beach etc. This is the perfect hotel if you want a relaxed chilled holiday on the beach good restaurants in the hotel and a short walk to a strip of nice shops and…

title: Staff nice
review: After a long flight, It was nice to walk into the Sheraton, we immediately got a warm greeting from the mos walking across the foyer, that warm happy atmosphere continued from all the staff for the 2 nights we stayed. Sandy shelly beach, we lazily got picked up and dropped off at sea front from golf buggy giving regular lifts. Tried the restaurant buffet breakfast definitely worth the cost and was very varied, free parking with hotel.  Room was usual hotel room with 2 double beds and nice view of pool, bathroom is very small.Things to improve, the pool is a bit small for size of hotel and the air conditioning was very very noisy which is the main reason I can't give this hotel 5 stars. I trolley runs directly from outside the hotel very easy and quick to use to pier and is free…

title: A Anniversary getaway
review: We sincerely appreciate your lovely review; it was gratifying to read that warm description of your arrival, our associates are the people who live our brands every day and devote their energy to bringing them to life for you our guest. They are truly efficient, caring, knowledgeable and genuinely friendly, we thank you for recognizing them. Free parking and complementary Trolley rides are convenient amenities provided by the Sheraton Sand Key Resort and delighted to hear that you used them. I bet you enjoyed your visit with “Winter and Hope” It is our goal to ensure your get-away was the beach experience you anticipated. The Island of Sand Key does promote relaxation therapy with all the tropical beauty Mother Nature has surrounded us with. Waves crashing on shore which while lying in a hammock can lull you to sleep after a choice of competitive beach games. Lazy days and good food are truly what a stay on our Island is supposed to be like. We always appreciate our guests suggestions; the Sheraton Sand Key is a casual resort which has been on this beautiful and tranquil island for many years and that was the architectural design of the era in which the hotel was built, at that time there was a different concept of what minimum room space was. Although we are constantly renovating, replacing the worn with new, making changes and improvements we realize there is always more to be done. We have made the first steps towards that total renovation of our guest room bathrooms and look forward to sharing our plans once details and scheduling are finalize. I am also excited to tell you that new air conditioners are being replaced in 60 rooms this week, new carpets are being install in some rooms plus several hallways and we are replacing the elevators, one at a time so not to inconvenience our guests and … Another pool that is on high on our wish list. Hopefully your travels will bring you back to the Clearwater Beach area at a time when you can check out those new air conditioners and we can earn those 5 stars.

title: Disappointment
review: The Hotel and staff are very nice. Clean rooms and beautiful beach. We were surprised with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries from staff for our anniversary. What a treat. Gorgeous sunsets. Perfect spot to put your feet up and relax.

title: Premiere room gulf view
review: Room was not worthy of such an upscale expensive hotel!  We could hear our neighbors and children down the hall!  Bathroom was not renovated in many years.  The air conditioning was so noisy!  Every time it came on it sounded like there was a storm in our room!

title: Beautiful
review: Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we apologize for falling short of meeting those expectations. We strive to maintain the highest standards not only in service, but also with regards to maintaining the overall look and feel of the hotel. The Sheraton Sand Key Resort is not a luxury hotel, it is a casual, welcoming beach resort which has been on this beautiful Island for many years. We are constantly renovating, replacing the worn with new, making changes and improvements. During this our very short period of low occupancy; we are replacing over 60 of our guest rooms air conditioners, unfortunately it was not before your recent visit. In addition we are installing new carpets in many of those rooms, having new elevators installed one at a time so not to inconvenience our guests. We are excited that we have also made the first steps towards that total renovation of our guest room bathrooms and look forward to sharing our plans once details and scheduling are finalized. Again we sincerely apologize for your disappointment in your room and hope you will return at a time when we may better serve your needs and you can enjoy the peace and quiet you deserve.

title: Not exactly what we hoped for......
review: I really hate to give this place a bad review because I had wanted to visit this property for a long time but maybe I waited a little too long. It’s especially hard since the staff was so nice. Rooms were very small even our upgraded room and the furniture was well used and really needs replaced. Pool was way too small for the number of people and we visited during the slow season. It may have been more crowded than usual due to the heavy rains before we arrived apparently flooded the area between the hotel and the beach which I would guess usually acts to spread people out more but made it necessary to wade knee deep water to get to the beach. The constant running of the water pumps to take out the water was also very annoying and didn’t seem to be working since the water…

title: Conference Hotel
review: We recognize your time is valuable and appreciate the feedback you have provided. Our continued commitment is in providing you with outstanding service and an excellent customer experience and we sincerely apologize for your disappointment and for falling short of meeting those expectations in the areas noted.  Please understand the Sheraton Sand Key is a casual, welcoming beach resort which has been on this this island for many years. This was the architectural design of the era in which the hotel was built and at that time there was a different concept of what minimum room space was. Although we are constantly renovating, replacing the worn with new, making changes and improvements we realize there is always more to be done. You are correct another pool is needed and high on our priority list although at this time we are concentrating on new elevators, we have just started replacing sixty air conditioners in the guest rooms along with many other projects such as replacing worn carpets. We are excited that we have made the first steps towards that total renovation of our guest room bathrooms and look forward to sharing our plans once details and scheduling are finalized.   Of course the beach and pool are very much a part of your experience and I totally understand you were expecting some fun in the sun along with some relaxation therapy on the beautiful and tranquil Island of Sand Key. Then you arrive and due to the recent storms it not the picturesque beach setting you were anticipating and disappointment sets in. Even if you had not planned your beach vacation around the wet and dry seasons, there's always a chance of rain. Getting rained on especially when expecting sunny skies over blue water, only to be met with downpours, having to dredge through water to get to the shore and listening to pumps can be quite a damper on the entire stay.  Please return when you can enjoy the experience you anticipated the Island of Sand Key would be, as it truly can be a tropical paradise with beautiful beaches, breathtaking sunsets and awesome views.

title: Dietary restriction? Bring Your Own Food
review: Hotel is comfortable and on the beach . Actual Gulf Coast probably 1/4 mile walk. There is a pool and you should visit the 9th floor great views especially for sunrise and sunset.  BEWARE  Evening time mosquitos will hammer you. So bad I stayed inside in evenings. Being from California I was not comfortable with the heat and humidity absolute muggy. But if rain comes in temps cool. Also have an umbrella or rain slicker. Rain can pop up whenever. We went to lunch walked over to Columbia restaurant EXCELLENT it was sunny. During lunch rainstorm moved in and we were drenched in walk back to hotel

title: 2 night stay
review: I'm a vegetarian and there are very few food options for me. Two of the three restaurants had no main meal options at all and the one that did is not open for dinner. The catered breakfast had ham and cheese croissants or meat filled burritos.  Gluten free? They had fruit. Lacrose intolerant? Might find a few more options.

title: Relaxing
review: Our continued commitment is in providing you with outstanding service and an excellent customer experience and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting those expectations. Your comments are very concerning, you were unfortunately misinformed. Our Director of Food and Beverage has many food allergies, he and our Executive Chef are acutely aware those options are needed by many of our valued guests and must be available no matter what dietary restrictions they might have. They had previously made it mandatory that our entire Food and Beverage staff be properly trained and will review that training starting immediately.  Upon arrival or to ensure we are properly prepared “before” your arrival if you let it be known by contacting the Sheraton Sand Key directly and speaking to our Executive Chef. He will personally review your dietary needs with you and will ensure we have those food options available during your entire stay. You are also able to speak to your server they will help with any special orders/needs. As for the catering menus you are able to make your Meeting Planner aware of your dietary needs so they are able to request any special needs to the Catering Manager and they will be honored.  For your next visit here are some things that are always available; many Gluten free breads and pastas (upon request), Soy and Almond Milk (upon request) along with many different salads in all outlets, there is always a vegetarian entree and a dinner salads on Rusty’s bistro menu which also can be order at the Mainstay Tavern. The Chef in each of our Food and Beverage outlets will be delighted to speak to you when ordering and if time allows they will even discuss some options. In the morning there are omelets, yogurt, eggs, fruit and much more. The Island Grille also has a Salad Bar and many times we offer Gluten free soup which are labeled and available throughout the F&B outlets in the hotel on that day.  We look forward to you next stay at a time when we may better serve your needs.

title: Horrible experience
review: Couple days of rain turned the "prestigious beach" into a lake you had to walk through to get to the ocean.  Not to mention the 3 water pumps running 24/7 trying to pump the lake out all day and night we had to listen to.  The resort is old and small with a tiny pool and not many amenities.   Staff was great but couldn't make up for a bad stay.  Have stayed at many Sheraton and Westin resorts but this one was different.  Just came from Tampa Marriott water street, which was beautiful, to this .....

title: A Little Beach Bum Visit...
review: It is gratifying that during your stay at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort you encountered many of our associates whose desire to ensure that you our guest receives exceptional service with the personal touch and they are genuine when doing so, thank you for recognizing them.  I truly understand you just came from a trendy upscale hotel in the center of all the entertainment and excitement that Downtown Tampa offers. You then reach the next part of your vacation and it is a casual, warm and welcoming “beach” resort which has been on this serene and calm Island for many years. You are now expecting some of the fun in the sun mixed with the relaxation therapy that this Island of Sand Key normally promotes.  Then you head out to the beach and it not the picturesque beach setting you were anticipating and disappointment sets in. Even if you had not planned your beach vacation around the wet and dry seasons, there's always a chance of rain. Getting rained on especially when expecting sunny skies over blue water, only to be met with downpours and having to dredge through water to get to the shore can be quite a damper on the entire stay and I totally can empathize with you. You are correct, to solve that issues we do need those pumps to expedite getting rid of water from the recent week of rain storms Of course these are not the memories we wanted you to leave “Our Island” with ... unfortunately we have no control over the weather. Please return at a time when you can enjoy sunshine all day, breathtaking sunsets in the evening, undisturbed nights under the stars and all those amenities that were unfortunately not available due to the beaches condition.

title: Pleasantly Surprised
review: Very nice beach getaway hotel. Private beach a nice location. Room was comfy and staff was awesome!!! Will be our go to spot when visiting Clearwater. Location to very good restaurants was a plus. Relaxing environment for sure. No need to leave the area.

title: Really?
review: A review such as this … especially coming from the Beach Doctor is certainly a great recommendation and very much appreciated. There is lots more relaxation therapy waiting to be had on the Island of Sand Key. Hurry Back!

title: Older but nice hotel...
review: Being a Marriott snob, I was a little reluctant to stay at this property for fear it didn’t have the Marriott touches I am accustomed.  We are also FL residents and stayed a few days to spend time with the kids before they headed back to college.  We stayed in a Suite with partial Gulf view and pool view on a Sunday - Tuesday.  Although our room was not ready upon our arrival, we were given access to the club lounge and fitness center to change into our swim attire.  By the time we scoped out the property (less than an hour) we received a call that our room was ready.  The suite was nice and large with a couch and two chairs to enjoy the TV and a small dining area with a wet bar/fridge/coffee maker.  Comfy beds and large bathroom with plenty of dressing area for the 4 of us to…

title: Decent
review: Booked this hotel on Marriott points so can’t be all that upset. Stayed in a suite with a gulf view, the price online was 426 dollars but wouldn’t ever pay that. The view was a little corner of the ocean and the rest of it was your neighbors to the left of you on their balcony’s. The food was pretty good at Rusty’s bistro and all of the employees were very nice. It rained the last day and there wasn’t much to do inside besides sit in your room or at the bar. Wouldn’t do much call this a resort, just another hotel on the beach.

title: Not worth the money
review: There are truly many choices for lodging in the Clearwater Beach area and we appreciate you choosing the Sheraton Sand Key Resort for your recent visit. We understand that what you are looking for in a hotel stay is a personal preference and there are many different factors involved when making your choice.  It was encouraging to read such positive comments concerning our associate and your dining experience at Rusty’s bistro … particularly when it comes from those who matter the most – you!   Getting rained on especially when expecting clear skies over blue water, only to be met with downpours can be quite a damper on the entire stay and I totally can empathize with you. Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting those expectations.

title: There for a conference
review: I booked this hotel because it does not have a resort fee; however, looking back I would have preferred to pay a resort fee and get a 4 star hotel experience . This hotel is older and outdated, has small rooms with very  little natural light -particularly on the first floor (making it feel claustrophobic) and the elevators have a food smell to them. The pool is definitely too small for the amount of rooms -it was a struggle no room to stand in the pool without constantly getting splashed by kids. The beach towels had large yellow stains. You have to pay $38 per day for beach chairs/umbrellas from a separate company out by the water ( if you want shade/seats out by the water- which most do).  The beach is not as close as it appears in the pictures, its a good walk out. This hotel…

title: July 2019
review: We recognize your time is valuable and appreciate your opinion and review. I apologize for your disappointment in our appearance and the amenities which are offered. We are not a luxury hotel, we are a casual, welcoming beach resort which has been on the Island of Sand Key for many years. You are correct, we do not charge a parking fee or resort fee which normally covers those cabanas, if you want to use a cabana there is a charge. We do provide hammocks and loungers in the sand which are complementary. We also provide many beach games; such as Pickle Ball, Volley Ball, Tennis Beach Tennis and much more.  Another pool is on the top of our wish list although at this time we are working on many projects for improvement. We are constantly renovating, replacing the worn with new, making changes and improvements and realize there is always more to be done. We are a true Island beach which offers 13 acres of tropical beauty and privacy, it is a 5 minute walk which is why we do provide a 6 person shuttle that runs continuously to and from the hotel area to the shore. Please know there are times that the Sheraton Sand Key Resort is the perfect place for families especially when the children are not in school. There are also many months when we are a serene and clam place, with lots of room in the pool, and much shade to be had and during those many months you find it is definitely a place to enjoy the relaxation therapy that this island promotes. I do hope that there were some positive memories that were made and will bring you back to the Clearwater Beach area.

title: Still a great place to stay.
review: Our conference was sufficiently accommodated. Food at our events was excellent. Greeted by a friendly staff upon arrival, check-in was quick, & our bellman (Danny) was delightful. I requested a room on a high floor with a Gulf view, balcony, & away from elevators. I got a 5th floor room with a view of the intracoastal waterway, balcony, not near elevators-everything I requested except for the view. The desk clerk checked with a supervisor to see if he could do anything about the view, to no avail, but said it was a "very nice room." I would call it a "just okay room." It was at the end of the hall, next to the stairwell, which the cleaning staff used. People were constantly going in and out that door, which slammed shut every time, cleaning carts rattling, & loud voices. A room…

title: Perfect Vacation Destination
review: We booked a late vacation and I was very impressed with how easy the Sheraton staff made it. There were plenty of options of entertainment or relaxation for all ages.   They had accomodations thought out from driving you to and from the beach in a golf cart so little legs don't get too tired, chairs and umbrellas to rent, a cart with essentials, plenty of easy bar/food options that you can charge to your room, they hosted games for kids and adults at the pool daily, and the Jolly Trolley into Clearwater was included in our stay.   The only thing I would recommend is a larger bathroom. We had 2 adults and a 4 year old and it was tight. It may have brought us closer as a unit though;-)   We will definitely being going back!

title: Regret Staying Here!
review: Your review is just the reason so many of us enjoy working in hospitality, thank you. Over the years of listening to the feedback and suggestions that you our guest have shared with us, we have gained much insight on what amenities were needed to make you our guests stay just exactly the experience you anticipated … a perfect vacation destination.  Of course being surrounded by the beauty Mother Nature does provide that there truly is something for every age as does the many amenities which are provided by the Sheraton Sand Key Resort, and we love little legs. All that is needed is for you to enjoy all the fun in the sun and relaxation therapy that this Island Oasis promotes. The close proximity to the Clearwater Beach area, the entertainment and activity it provides and including complementary trolley rides to get you there is an added plus for some. I am sure there were many new family memories made and it is gratifying to know that the Sheraton Sand Key Resort will be a part of those forever memories and thank you for including us.  The Sheraton Sand Key Resort has been on this beautiful and tranquil island for many years and that was the design of the era in which the hotel was built, at that time there was a different concept of room design. We are constantly renovating, replacing the worn with new and making changes and improvements, still we realize there is more to be done. We are excited that we have made the first steps towards that total renovation of our guest room bathrooms and look forward to sharing our plans once details and scheduling are finalized.  Now Hurry Back!

title: A great stay with staff that make the place special
review: I paid almost $400 for a King bed view of the parking lot, average room, dark and very basic. There is nothing  peaceful about this "resort and spa". Sitting on deck all you hear is the sound of air conditioners, as well as by the pool. It is not "exactly" right on the beach. Their private beach is a flattened piece of sand leading to the beach. I am so disappointed I spent  this much to stay here. Many other hotels, nicer, less expensive, better beach and more peaceful.

title: Stay for access to beach otherwise don’t bother
review: Dear Stephaniem, We recognize your time is valuable and appreciate the review you have provided. There are truly many choices for lodging in the Clearwater Beach area and we appreciate you choosing the Sheraton Sand Key Resort for your recent visit. We understand that what you are looking for in a hotel stay is a personal preference and there are many different factors involved when making your choice.  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for your disappointment and for falling short of meeting your expectations. When the hotel was built the Gulf of Mexico was much closer to the hotel it was actually right up to the break wall. Then the Sand Key jetty was built to the north of us in Sand Key Park by the Army Corps of Engineers, since then sand has been washed in a southerly direction which has caused a wide beach and the view of the water being a bit further then in the past. It is still beach front, it is just a bit of a walk to the shore (5 minutes) which is why we provide a six person beach shuttle. With safety from the elements being relevant during huge storms we are protected as are our guests and associates.  We are not nor do we advertise as being a luxury resort and spa, the Sheraton Sand Key is a casual, welcoming beach resort with no spa on property. It has been on this beautiful and tranquil island for many years and that was the design of the era in which the hotel was built, at that time there was a different concept of design. We are constantly renovating, replacing the worn with new and making changes and improvements, still we realize there is more to be done. We are excited that we have made the first steps towards that total renovation of our guest room bathrooms and look forward to sharing our plans once details and scheduling are finalized. I do hope you enjoyed the close proximity to all the activity and entertainment that the Clearwater Beach area offers. Along with the many surrounding beach towns, each offering a distinct charm which allows you to find a stunning collection of recreational and cultural surprises sprinkled throughout this area… and includes many dining venues and complementary trolley rides to get you there. I realize that my apology will regrettably not alter the outcome of your recent experiences although I do extend it with all sincerity.  We do hope that your travels will bring you back to the Clearwater Beach area there is truly much more to explore.

title: We spent three days at Sheraton San Key Resort
review: We stayed here as a family for 5 nights. The hotel is right on the beach and rooms at the front or the rear of the hotel have sea views due to the nature of the thin strip of land.   We we originally concerned after reading reviews that this hotel was going to be old and run down. When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. It was in good condition with the staff working very hard to keep it looking good. As another review mentioned, yes it’s old but that does not mean it is tired.   For a place to have a relaxing stay it was perfect. From a free pool table in the bar with a large selection of craft beer or cocktails to walking down the sea collecting shells.   For activities there was loads to do. There were swimming pool games in the afternoon for the kids (and adults!!)…

title: Absolutely WONDERFUL Hotel Property
review: Lifetime titanium member of Marriott, Inc, so I have seen more than a few hotel properties.  This place is fantastic.  Great location, right on a huge beach.  Walking distance to numerous restaurants including the Columbia restaurant.  Easy, short drive or Uber to many, many more restaurants.  Yes, the building is a little dated, but, BUT, its clean, nice, large, and full of employees who are exceptionally nice and helpful.   Even a man sweeping the pool water from the ground floor was smiling and laughing with us.  EVERY SINGLE person we encountered was fantastic.  People do make the difference.  A room with a balcony watching the dolphins cavort off of it, was special.  Concierge lounge standard offerings, but thats plenty for a beach location. We tried breakfast buffets and…

title: Awful! Do not stay here!
review: Coming from a Lifetime Marriott Bonvoy Titanium Elite your comments are truly an incentive for everyone from management down to continue to provide the customer service and amenities that made your stay at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort the experience you anticipated. A strong team is truly our foundation and all of our associates are largely accountable for that success. Thank you for recognizing them and for the fantastic, descriptive and informative review. Hurry Back!

title: Not a 4 star!!
review: Booked to stay here to relax after Orlando  - it was awful! The first room I was given faced onto a brick wall - I went down to complain and was straight away offered free breakfast to keep me happy!? I insisted on a room move. Second room I was given had a slightly better 'view' as there was no brick wall but instead there was a view of the fans which were clearly from the kitchens and made sitting on the balcony unbearable because of the smell. The room stank of damp and mildew, the bedding was stained it, the walls are so thin you can hear everything from every other room. The pool needs totally refurbing, its extremely tired and shabby. I tried to get moved the first day we arrived but due to the time difference my travel agent we had to endure one night. I left first thing…

title: Good family Vacation
review: Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for your disappointment. The Sheraton Sand Key is not a Luxury Hotel it is a casual, clean, comfortable and very welcoming Beach Resort on the beautiful and tranquil Island of Sand Key. We strive to maintain the highest standards, not only in service, but also with regards to maintaining the overall look and feel of the hotel. We are constantly renovating, replacing the worn with new, making improvements and changes still realize there is always more to be done. I am sure with all the rain and dampness during your short stay it was not the beach get-away you were anticipating. I hope you will return to the Clearwater Beach area at a time when you can enjoy all it has to offer.

title: Very nice facility on quiet beach
review: This hotel must have been a holiday inn in a previous life. If definitely is NOT a 4 star as described. More like a 2.5 star at best. No valet parking. The front lobby is similar to a Hampton inn. The Premium room was a shoe box and even smelled like someone’s old shoes. I will not be back!

title: Excellent Service!
review: The location is absolutely perfect! This is one of the most beautiful beaches in Florida! As frequent business Travelers, we were given club access level which was so appreciated. The hotel staff was great!   My only gripe is with the beach vendor, we took 4 kids to the beach at low tide and started applying sunscreen and set up shop near the shore (far down but in between the vendor chairs). An employee came over and asked us to move our belongings because we were blocking the view of the people who paid for the lounge chairs - We absolutely were not! We were purposefully in between the chairs and closer to the water. He then proceeded to try to pick up our items and "help us move" all while my kids were running off into the waves - it really bothered me and he started arguing…

title: Never again
review: It is always gratifying to receive reviews such as this and I am delighted that you enjoyed this Island Paradise. It is unfortunate when someone has to ruin a perfect memory. Please know that the cabanas are a private concession, still our General Manager will be addressing this and we sincerely appreciate this type of feedback so we can assure that it does not occur again in the future. Thank you and hurry back!

title: Absolutely beautiful hotel
review: My family visited Sheraton Sand Key for 5 days after having spent 3 days at Disney.  To say the least, I was disappointed.  The rooms have a musty, mildewed smell.  I had to call 3 of the 5 days after 3:30 pm and ask for our room to be cleaned.   While the pool area is beautiful, it is entirely too small for a hotel the size of the Sheraton Sand Key.  It was impossible to enjoy the pool without being shoulder to shoulder with other guest.  The walk to the beach was miserable because guest had to walk through standing water.  Lastly, the hotel claims free wi-fi but will charge 10.00 per day for phone and internet.  Management did remove the charge but I felt like they were misleading.  Upon return to the Clearwater areas, I will definitely stay at another resort.

title: Great Family Getaway
review: I totally understand after your busy time in Orlando you were expecting some fun in the sun along with some relaxation therapy on the beautiful and tranquil Island of Sand Key. Then you and your family arrive and it not the picturesque beach setting you were anticipating and disappointment sets in. Even if you had not planned your beach vacation around the wet and dry seasons, there's always a chance of rain. Getting rained on especially when expecting clear skies over blue water, only to be met with downpours and having to dredge through water to get to the shore can be quite a damper on the entire stay and I totally can empathize with you. I do hope that there were some treasure family memories made between those periods of rain. Yes we have become a very popular place for families and another pool is high on our wish list, although at this time we are working on a total renovation of all the guest room bathrooms.  Our Housekeeping team strives to maintain the highest standards in service and maintaining a fresh atmosphere within our guest rooms and common areas. Rest assure your comments have been heard and we have implemented a more aggressive cleaning procedures to combat the humidity/dampness issues that happen during this very rainy time. We hope that will ensure that this does not occur again in the future. Housekeeping also services the occupied rooms starting at 8am until 5pm, you our guest may request an earlier service or a precise time to attend to the room by dialing "0" and speaking with the operator. It is disconcerting you were not made aware of that option. I realize that an apology will regrettably not alter the outcome of your recent experiences I do extend it with all sincerity.

title: Nice Anniversary Trip
review: My family of 8 stayed at Sheraton Sand Key Resort late last month and it was great! Everyone there is friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and spacious, and of course the private beach was incredible. Definitely plan on staying here again.

title: Not a good value!
review: To be fair, I’ve only stayed at this location once.   The Good: - Five star location.  Off the main beach but close to the action.   - Staff friendly and helpful.   The Bad: - The room and furniture are all worn.  Bed is something your kids would be comfortable in.   - Hallways are not well air conditioned.  - Hotel smells musty.  - The ice maker on our floor was broken.   - Random light bulbs were out.

title: Back again!
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your comments regarding your recent stay and I sincerely apologize for your disappointment. I am pleased you enjoyed the beauty that surrounds us and the close proximity to all the activity and entertainment of Clearwater Beach. The Sheraton Sand Key Resort has been on this beautiful and tranquil island for many years and that was the architecture design of the era in which the hotel was built, at that time there was a different concept of what minimum room space was. We are excited that we have made the first steps towards that total renovation of our guest room bathrooms and look forward to sharing our plans once details and scheduling are finalized. I do hope you will return at a time when we may better serve your needs.

title: Great location and beach!
review: We are due to leave for Florida next week and cannot wait to return to the Sheraton Sand Key...this is our 3rd year at the hotel and it is so good we stay for 3 weeks.  Our 9 year daughter loves everything about the hotel especially the pool and the kids games that they run at times.  We cannot recommend this place enough and are very excited that our holiday is so close!

title: Better then Excellent!
review: We thank you and your family for becoming part of the Sheraton Sand Key family and I truly hope that your entire stay was all that you were anticipating it would be. Three weeks that is awesome and if you need anything just ask. It has been very busy so I am sure your daughter has met many new friends and I am pleased that although there has been rain there still has been more sunshine.

title: Beautiful pool area and great service!
review: Just got back from a great stay here! The resort was beautiful...very well kept and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. There were no resort fees and parking was easy and free, definitely a bonus! Beach area was beautiful and even had beach rides going back and forth if not up for the short walk on hot day. I would recommend the beach chair/umbrella rental if going to spend day down by the gulf as the sand is very shelly and nice to have the option of the umbrella when need a few breaks from the hot sun ($37 per day). Pool area was beautiful as well. Didn't eat at any of restaurants, but did look like they had few good options. Nice to have a fridge in room...we went to the nearest Publix and got snacks and bottled water. Also a little strip of restaurants across the street,…

title: Beautiful sunsets directly on the beach!
review: Sand Pearls location is fabulous, the sunsets directly on the beach are the best in the world, with sugar type sand between your toes you’ll enjoy the best vacation you’ll ever have, Kyle was so nice he delivers, drinks food etc. right to you whether in a cabana, or beach chair whatever you desire.  Martha is the concierge she is so very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly, she will arrange flowers champagne or whatever you need in your room for that special occasion, she knows all the highlights of Clearwater, Tampa, and St. Petersburg you won’t be disappointed going to the sand pearl this was our honeymoon paradise!

title: Nice place and good beach.
review: This was a nice surprise. Beach was nice. Staff is accommodating expect for check in with agent named Sophia. As a Titanium Elite Marriott member I was disappointed that we could not check in until 4 after I checked in online for 11:30 arrival. Sophia would not budge and was not willing to help us check in sooner for a club level room. She kept repeating herself that it didn’t matter what my status was and blew us off. We were approached by another agent later as we waited in lobby name Zhamarie. She was very nice and called housekeeping and got us checked in almost right away at 3:40 pm.   All other staffers was very nice and I won’t let the one bad experience stop me from returning. Beach staff is also awesome.

title: Small hotel feel with big perks!
review: It is so gratifying to read that this was truly the right place for you to be when you desire to get away, from the busy everyday life we all lead. When longing for gentle, temperate seas lined by sandy shores, naps in a hammock, shuttle rides to our beach which that day … that space was especially made for you. Sunshine and breezes during the day then sliding into the evening with spectacular sunsets.  Being on the Island of Sand Key surrounded by all the beauty that Mother Nature has shared with us with and a great work environment does inspire positive attitudes among our associates. All of our associate’s personal concern is for your satisfaction and their attention to detail is obvious and shows that they genuinely care. Thank you for recognizing Zhamarie and she has been added to our Associate Recognition program. Although we do deploy all efforts to honor our guest’s requests and Sophia was just following the procedures put in place, it was not personal. Resort properties such as the Sheraton Sand Key Resort are a little more limited in extending program benefits during high occupancy especially when many of those guests are Ambassadors and Titanium Elites such as yourself. There are many of the other non-resort hotels are able to extend early check-in and other incentives. We truly look forward to that next visit which will be filled with even better experience to remember.

title: Nice stay right in the beach for family
review: We have stayed at this hotel multiple years and love it. We started going to this hotel about 8 years ago when it was relatively unknown. There are a lot of options along Clearwater Beach and Sand Key, but this is the only one with a private beach area. You won’t have to finger the public access beaches to find a spot. Only hotel guests can hang out on the main portion of beach in from of this hotel. The costs to stay have increased over the years and I suspect it’s due to a tourism increase plus less private beach area. They have a nice little burger place in the hotel and had a canon ball contest for kids in the pool while we were there a couple years ago. There is also a sand volleyball court and snack/smoothie area near the pool. The hotel only has a few stories (maybe 4?),…

title: Great vacation
review: And we Love you, it was very rewarding reading your very descriptive and informative review. That your experiences over the past eight years has been just what you have been anticipating is truly the goal of the Sheraton Sand Key Resort and our associates, thank you. We are a casual, clean welcoming beach resort with 390 rooms which has been on the beautiful and tranquil island for many years. A place for flip flops, suntan lotion, fun in the sun and relaxation therapy. We boast 13 acres of private beach, shuttles to the shore, pool, many beach games and beach side amenities. Of course we do receive lots of help from Mother Nature and the beauty she surrounds us with. Yes the costs have increased due to the close proximity to Clearwater Beach and it being voted #1 beach in Florida several years in a row. Of course you deserve that sense of peace and calm you receive while here so please  HURRY BACK!

title: Can't ask for much more from a Beach Hotel
review: It seems like it has become the norm for hotels to demand a "resort fee" from guests and offer nothing in return.  It's totally annoying and is used to let hotels show up as 'cheapest' in searches, and then gouge you at checkout.   Sheraton Sand Key Resort is the exact opposite.  Offering dozens of delightful amenities and perks -- WITHOUT A RESORT FEE, PARKING FEE, FITNESS FEE, or any other annoying "hidden" costs.   Consider that we received the following at no additional charge: 1) Unlimited Beach/Pool Towels 2) Access to an Amazing Pool/Pool Bar/Lounge Chairs/Hammocks 3) Golf Carts that transport you up and down to the beach 4) Terrific Wifi at the pool, in the room, even at the BEACH! 5) Free Parking in a lot with easy exit/entrances 6) A Trolley stop that will take you…

title: Easy to get to the beach and nice stay
review: What an amazing review and if you are not in marketing you should be. You sharing your insight is truly appreciated and we thank you for this amazing review. All the amenities you named and enjoyed along with your positive interaction with our associates who truly care, is exactly the experience many of us in hospitality strive to provide each and every one of our valued guests daily. The Sheraton Sand Key is a casual, clean and welcoming beach resort which has been on the Island of Sand Key for many years. It is a place that promotes the beauty Mother Nature has surrounded us with, along with relaxation therapy and lots of fun whether you are here for business or pleasure. Thank you for letting us know that all we offer does not go unnoticed and hurry back!

title: What happened to the beach
review: The hotel maintained its facility very well. The staff are very helpful and friendly. I checked in late and got a room close to the elevator and lower floor. But the second day I changed to a higher floor and quiet room. It's facing to the beach and having the access to the beach. The pool is very popular when it's open. Nice hotel and good breakfast. Just a little pricy.

title: Great stay! Beautiful beach
review: We love this hotel but had not been back for a few years.  The hotel staff is quite nice and the rooms for a property that is 44 years old are nice.  The BEACH, what happend. We always remember the great white sand which we would love to walk on.  Now there are so many sea shells it is hard to walk.  I was told, that a new sea wall was built a mile up and now the beach gets all shells.  If you want a chase and umbrella, the cost is 37 dollars and if it rains an hour later, you still have to pay.  All this would be worth it, if the beach was still the beach.

title: Just what I needed
review: Thank you for choosing to return to the Sheraton Sand Key Resort and I hope there were many new memories made. I am pleased that you enjoyed your interaction with our associates as they are the people who live our brands every day and devote their energy to bringing them to life for our guests. They also are caring, efficient and genuinely friendly and thank you for recognizing them.  I do apologize for your disappointment concerning the beach, there are several reasons that during your recent visit was not the beach you remembered. The beach in front of the Sheraton Sand Key Resort is a nesting beach, a place where Sea Turtles have chosen to nest. Sea turtles they are now given legal protection in the United States and its waters under the Endangered Species Act (ESA). We are unable to take heavy equipment out to rake our beach unless we are given permission, which is actually a daily call from the Clearwater Aquarium during the months of May till October. Raking the shells and seaweed as well as bright lights can actually disturb nesting females and hatchlings and cause them to abort, there are large penalties and fines if the many guide lines are not followed. Also the associate who mentioned the break wall is also correct. Due to the break-wall to the North of Sand Key Park there are times that waves or current action deposits crushed shells and reworks the sediments. I am sure you also noted that the beach is also much larger that too is due to the break wall, they are built to protect and to reduce beach erosion. Much sand has been added by Mother Nature and the break wall to our beach Hopefully this gives you a better understanding of why our beach is left the condition Mother Nature desires it to be that day.  The hotel does provide complimentary loungers and hammocks in the sand, around the pool and many of the grassy areas around the Gulf side of the resort. Most area resorts include charges for the cabanas along the shore in a nightly resort fee. We have opted not to include a resort or parking fee. That is a private concession for the cabanas and they charge $35 per day for the usage should the guest so choose to use. Still on your walk down memory lane we hope you enjoyed this tropical paradise; with breathtaking sunsets and awesome views. The smell of salt water, the gentle roar of the waves all combine to create a sense of peace and calm here on the beaches of Sand Key. We look forward to when your travels next bring you back to the Clearwater Beach area.

title: Perfect Family Vacation Spot with Excellent Lounge
review: Reason for selecting this Resort: Selected the Sheraton Sand Key for part of my family vacation to Florida due to the many activities offered and direct beach access without crossing a road. The club lounge option and no resort fee sealed the deal in my selection of this property.  Marriott Bonvoy Ambassador: Ambassador status was well recognized at this property as I was given an upgrade to pool/ocean view on the 6th floor and access to the club lounge on the 9th floor. Selection of welcome points or complimentary breakfast was offered as well. I chose the points as breakfast is included in the lounge. The lounge access alone is worth a trip to this resort. Extended continental breakfast in the mornings and large selection of appetizers and open self-serve bar in the evenings!…

title: Service and location fantastic
review: We stayed here for the first time. I was deciding between here and the Hilton. We were very happy with out stay! I had 2 rooms for our group. I used a suite upgrade for bonvoy points for one room for the kids and the other was a standard king for my wife and I. Prior to the visit I called to ask for the rooms to be close due to a medical issue for my son where we need to check on him at times during the night. She was very helpful in putting a note in the res. I also called morning of our stay with the same request. She was very helpful and told me not only were they close, they were able to get us adjoining rooms! Went above and beyond. We found similar high quality service with the pool staff, bar staff, concierge lounge staff, front desk staff and housekeeping! Also, it is…

title: I could get used to  it :)
review: It was a delight to read that you enjoyed the serenity that the beautiful Island of Sand Key promotes, it is a fantastic place for a family vacation. There is truly something for everyone from fun in the sun to relaxation therapy. Yes! Our associates are the people who live our brands every day and devote their energy to bringing them to life for you our guest, they also are efficient, caring and focused on the details that will make your stay the experience you anticipated. What truly sets them apart is their desire to ensure our guests receive exceptional service with the personal touch and they are genuine when doing so, thank you for recognizing them. Mother Nature has been very generous with all the beauty she has surrounded us with, although the profile of the beach does change daily and depending on the weather. The beach in front of the Sheraton Sand Key Resort is a nesting beach, a place where Sea Turtles have chosen to nest. Sea turtles are given legal protection in the United States and its waters under the Endangered Species Act (ESA). We are unable to take heavy equipment out to rake our beach unless we are given permission, which is actually a daily call from the Clearwater Aquarium during the months of May till October. Raking the seaweed as well as bright lights can actually disturb nesting females and hatchlings and cause them to abort, there are large penalties and fines if the many guide lines are not followed. Hopefully this gives you a better understanding of why many days our beach is left the condition Mother Nature desires it to be that day. We are constantly renovating, replacing the worn with new, making changes and improvements we realize there is always more to be done. We are excited that we have made the first steps towards that total renovation of our guest room bathrooms and look forward to sharing our plans once details and scheduling are finalized.  There are many more memories waiting to be made so please hurry back.

title: Another successful visit
review: spent the weekend here in June for a wedding.It's a good 45 minutes from the Tampa airport to the resort; got an Uber ride pretty quickly on a Friday morning. The resort is pretty and comfortable. Check in was a breeze as they could not have been nicer giving us our room early, by 11:00 AM on a Friday. Had breakfast  three times in the restaurant by the check in. It wasn't extraordinary but I am a sucker for the standard breakfast buffet....you can skip that if you want to and order from the menu. The pool area is very nice, gets a little crowed as the day goes on. It's a family place so get ready for some children. Tiki Bar at the pool had good drinks. You can catch a ride on a hotel golf cart to the beach which is a good 200 yards from the pool area. We did this and It cost…

title: Third Visit
review: Just had another seven days at the Sheraton Sand key at the beginning of May (2019). Stayed for six days last year, and five the year before. In fact, we have been visiting here for the last 29 years. Perhaps the hotel is not perfect, we haven’t found one that is, but the Sheraton fulfils all our requirements. After so many visits there is a tendency to find quibbles, even minor ones. We can honestly say that this is not the case with this resort, we’ve never got picky with the Sheraton Sand Key. Again, it has met our expectations. We asked for a specific room, the one we had the previous years, off in a quiet corner, gulf, estuary, sunset and park views. Thanks to Darla Napoleon, and Pam Schusler for organising the room allocation, great stuff ladies. The bathroom was not…

title: Relax
review: We have stayed here about 16 times, always a joy to be here, great views, great rooms, good food, brilliant staff, nice and casual, superb beach. Can i say more....... No fuss, nothing is too much trouble, if not happy with position of room they are very obliging in moving you.

title: Beachfront Convenience
review: Your sixteen years of loyalty to the Sheraton Sand Key Resort have not gone unnoticed and are truly appreciated, you have definitely become part of the Sheraton Sand Key family. Delighted we are able to share all the beauty that surrounds us; from our seemingly endless white sandy beach, palms swaying in the breeze, warm Gulf waters ... along with all the beach side amenities offered to ensure your vacation is filled with fun in the sun and lots of relaxation therapy. Top all that off with associates who are efficient, warm, welcoming and who focus on the details to ensure your stay is just what you anticipated year after year. We look forward to many more years.

title: Peacefully Perfect
review: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel.   - It is a beachfront hotel, but note that it is quite the walk to the beach. We did manage to catch the golf cart once to take us back from the ocean front to the hotel which was nice. Despite the walk, id take it over having to drive or walk from across the street to get to the beach.  - Rooms- Definitely needs some updating but still functioned well for us. Bathroom was tiny and you cannot really close the door when you are in there. One thing that did annoy us was that room cleaning was inconsistent. One day we got to our room around 2:30 and it still wasnt clean. We had a little one that was napping so we didnt get our room made up and just asked for a few more towels. Then next day, we didnt get to our room until 4:30 and they…

title: Sheridan Sand Key
review: It was gratifying to hear that you enjoyed you stay, we thank you for this informative review and for sharing your thoughts and memories. The Sheraton Sand Key is a casual beach resort a place that promotes relaxation therapy and some fun in the sun. It is truly a great place for families as our beach is uncrowded and away from all the activity of Clearwater Beach. Your review did touch on many aspects of your stay and I am sure it will be helpful to anyone reading it, thank you. Our Beach is truly an Island beach and just as Mother Nature designed it. It is large private and beautiful 13 acers actually, which is why we offer a 6 person complementary shuttle to get you back and forth to the shore if needed. Concerning the beach chairs (Cabanas) along the shore, many area resorts include those charges in a nightly resort fee. We have opted not to include a resort or parking fee. There is a private concession for the chairs and umbrella they charge $35 per day for usage should the guest so choose to use. There are loungers and hammocks in the sand which are provided by the hotel and are complementary to you our guest. We have noted your comments regarding the room not being cleaned on time and we would like to apologize for not reaching your expectations and the any annoyance it caused. Please note that our Housekeeping team services the occupied rooms starting at 8am until 5pm. Our guests may request an earlier service or a precise time to attend to the room by dialing "0" and speaking with the operator. The Sheraton Sand Key Resort has been on this beautiful and tranquil island for many years and that was the architectural design of the era in which the hotel was built, at that time there was a different concept of what minimum room space was. Although we are constantly renovating, replacing the worn with new, making changes and improvements we realize there is always more to be done. We are excited that we have made the first steps towards that total renovation of our guest room bathrooms and look forward to sharing our plans once details and scheduling are finalized.  Hopefully your experience with our associates and the tranquility of the Island of Sand Key will bring you back soon!

title: A Paradise! This hotel deserves Diamond Level!
review: We have stayed at the Sheraton four times now and will continue to. The restaurant, Rustys, is amazing. The other two in the hotel are great as well, Mainstay is a great place to end your night after being out and about for a yummy drink. The staff is so very friendly, the rooms are clean, and the drinks are TO DIE. Definitely get a Mud Slide at the Turtle Bar and have a bite to eat at the poolside cafe!

title: Sandkey stay
review: Lovely stay at the sand key resort. Lovely sunsets on the beach and the fire pit was great on an evening! My only issue is for a hotel in 2019 to not offer free WiFi in the rooms is a bit of a joke!!!

title: Bedbugs
review: I stayed at this hotel for a company summit 5/15-5/16/19. I notice bump on my forehead 5/16 but did not think to much about it. Next morning, I woke up to more bumps that looked like bites. The bites were on my face, hand, arm, and back. I did not spend much time outside of the resort, only ate dinner on the beach. I called the hotel told them I believe I have bedbug bites. They told me I probably have sand flee bites. I told them I did not go to the resort for pleasure, I didn’t even go into the water, sand flees stay in the sand. The continue to blame it on the atmosphere but they said they will send me a service report. I emailed the CEO pictures of my bites and in return the service director emailed me an offer for 2 night stay free at their resort. The following Monday I…

title: Beautiful property, great service
review: We sincerely apologize for any discomfort and inconveniences caused during your stay. We mandate an aggressive pest control policy, this policy includes regularly scheduled inspections and, if necessary, elimination protocols. We have implemented a thorough training program for our housekeeping and maintenance personnel to assist in the early recognition of infestation. Then there is a thorough inspection done by a licensed pest control company is performed.These policies and protocols are implemented at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort following any reports of potential bug bites. Following these inspection we report back to the guest our findings and update them as to our next steps. As you know the Pest Control Company did state and you received documentation that there was no pest activity detected in that room. There were also guests booked into in that room the day of your departure since you did not report the situation till the day after your departure and there were no other complaints received.  Unfortunately in Florida many of our “pesky” inhabitants are not as hospitable as we would like. There are times we receive reports of insect bites from sand fleas and/or mosquitoes or biting midges which are frequently referred to as no see ums, which you might have been in contact with during your beach dinner. Truly I am sorry that you were bit up like that and your Memorial Day week-end was ruined.

title: Nice
review: A lovely hotel on the beach front at the Gulf of Mexico.  The property was beautifully maintained and the rooms were well appointed.  There are lots of activities available from the pool to volleyball to tennis.  The beachfront is a bit of a walk, but staff offer rides in a golf cart both to and from.  A third party vendor offers chair and umbrella rentals at the beach.  We watched the sunset from our fifth floor balcony.  All the staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful--really some of the best service I've experienced.  I would give a five-star rating except for the lack of free wifi.  Even the library has free wifi!  Otherwise, highly recommended for a quiet family getaway.

title: Still My Favorite Hotel in the United States
review: Mini family vacation here -  very pleasant staff at front desk and concierge-  room was good size with view of ocean - housekeeping was very accommodating with extra towels and amenities we needed - pool was crowded and look smaller than the website photo.   My only complaint is the long walk to the ocean from the hotel.  The beach is huge in this section where this hotel is located.   The tennis court were very well maintained and never crowded.  Also the parking was as issue.  The lot is free but ultra crowded.

title: Glorious Gals Weekend with Kickin Rum Runners & Pristine Beach
review: My GO TO for all date weekends, Gals Weekends and personal ME TIME getaways!  We were four friends onsite for a party weekend with the girls.  The cocktails were boozie and fun!  The beach is a paradise without all the crazy of Clearwater beach down the road.  Parking FREE!  Pool! Delightful!

title: Nice Hotel
review: My husband and I enjoyed our stay very much.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The room was a bit outdated, but comfortable and clean.  My biggest complaint was that no lounge chairs were provided at the beach, they had to be rented.  I found that to be aggravating at a beach front resort.  My other complaint was that the room didn’t get made up until 3:00 and 4:00.  I did complain about that, and was given a credit for a complimentary drink, which I appreciated. We enjoyed dinner at Rusty’s Bistro, and breakfast there too.  We would definitely return to the Sheraton at Clearwater.

title: Nice Beach, Friendly Staff but THATS IT!
review: This hotel is dated, the rooms dont seem to have enough air circulating through them, the food options in the hotel are not good at all and worst of all, they charge $10 PER DAY FOR WIFI! If you are solely looking for a place that has a good beach, is located near food options and has free parking, then this would be for you but if you're used to four star and up hotels and want nice updated accommodations with good food in-house, then this may not be your jam.

title: Mediocre
review: I apologize that our appearance was not what you were anticipating, The Sheraton Sand Key Resort is a welcoming casual beach resort on the Island of Sand Key with 13 acres of private beach. Which also offers a heated pool, hot tub, beach games, evenings around the fire pit and many more amenities to help you enjoy a beach get-away. It is truly a place that promotes relaxation therapy and a bit of fun in the sun.  Being on this Island for over forty years and although we continue to do major renovations, replacing the worn with the new, making changes and improvements we realize there is always more to be done. We are excited as all our guest room bathrooms are scheduled for a total renovation in the very near future.
