Rooms a little dated and smaller than I was expecting but having said that perfectly adequate. Didn't understand just how far out this hotel was and in hind sight would of preferred to stay in the centre of Clearwater but the free car parking was a bonus .

title: Great Family Weekend
review: Visiting the Island of Sand Key you are always able to find a secluded and tranquil spot on the beach. Our beaches are beautiful and there are many treasured memories to be made here. You are able to enjoy all the action Clearwater Beach (2.0 miles away) offers and then return to Sand Key for; relaxing times around the pool, walks along the shore, nights around the fire pit, and a comfortable place to lay your head at the end of the day. It is our goal is to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide the experience anticipated, it is gratifying to know we succeeded in doing so and we look forward to a return visit.

title: Good location on beach but not in main part of Clearwater
review: We recently stayed a weekend at the Sheraton Sand Key and having not been there since the late 90's, I was very pleased with the upkeep and the positive changes I noticed. First of all, you simply cannot beat the location just south of Sand Key Park with nothing between the hotel and the Gulf of Mexico but Sand. We had an ocean view room on the top floor with a sweeping view of the pool and the beach, out to the Gulf. The rooms have been upgraded since I was there last and all the staff seemed eager to please. Indeed the place was completely sold out, so you know they must be doing something right. We would stay again in a heartbeat.

title: Still a good hotel.
review: This is the third year in a row that we have visited this hotel, and I am pleased to say the service has been as good as the other times. Maybe we were just lucky, but could not fault the friendly service. Rooms were good, and food at the hotel was perfect. Took our relations from Clearwater for a meal there and it was really good, though a tad pricey. But you have to treat yourselves on holiday. Hopefully, we will be back next year.

title: Room to Nowhere
review: Your loyalty is very important to the Sheraton Sand Key resort and the Sheraton brand. I am pleased to read that you enjoy “Our Island” enough to return often. It is the training not luck that has to do with your service, I am pleased that you experienced the service you deserve and have grown accustomed to when visiting “Our Island.” It is almost impossible not to give great service to guests who appreciate the effort. Nice things happen to nice people ...Thank you and return soon.

title: Amazing hospitality!
review: We were at the Sheraton Sand key for a destination wedding. The views from the rooms on the website all showed rooms with balconies and beautiful views of the water and beach.Our reservation was made in January for a five night stay and we arrived around 1:pm and our room was not ready. Around 3:pm we slid the key in the door and I immediately knew their was a problem. No balcony and no view. Well, their was a view of a concrete floor littered with cigarette butts and garbage and a brick wall of sorts. Goodbye to morning coffee and cocktail hour on our balcony looking over the water. I complained but the hotel was fully booked. I tried the Marriott across the street the next morning. They were sympathetic but did not have an opening for four nights. I expect that in the entire…

title: Great Family destination
review: As a Starwood Preferred Gold member your loyalty is very important to our resort and hotels. Please let me address the unintentional inconveniences that we caused. We do our best to assign all SPG members to one of the rooms set aside for them. There are times where the occupancy does not permit us to do so; such as on Memorial Day week-end, we are always at full occupancy. It was truly unfortunate that we were unable to reassign you to a different room. I understand your disappointment in there not being a balcony and there is no excuse for the condition of the view outside your window. As part of our continuous strive for perfection, we are implementing a number of checks and measures to ensure mistakes like this does not occur again. You not being able to get an early check-in was not personal. Check in is at 3:00, I am sure the Front Desk and Housekeeping did deploy every effort to have your room ready as soon as possible.  Thank you for recognizing our associates they are the people who live our brands every day and devote their energy to bringing them to life for our guests. They also are caring, efficient and, genuinely friendly. I do hope that you might consider visiting us at a more tranquil time when we are better able to provide you with the type of room you were anticipating.

title: We first visited the Sheraton Sand Key twenty six years ago
review: Smiles and greetings from every staff member. Most amazing white sand beach. Pool chairs always available; didn't have to go reserve one at 7am! Hot tub. Rustys Bistro is excellent too. Try the nachos grande at the poolside cafe!

title: Thank you Janet!!
review: After a long day of travel, arrived at the hotel and was very thankful for Janet's hospitality. She was more than accommodating and made my transition into relaxation a breeze. A nice day at the beach, a little fun and sun!!

title: Lovely, Clean Hotel with great beachfront.
review: We appreciate your feedback and are delighted to hear that you had a great stay. With a spirit to serve, we take great pride in not only meeting, but exceeding your expectations. Associates such as Janet take pride in their part of making the Sheraton Sand Key the perfect place for true relaxation therapy, she truly enjoys the interaction with you our guest and wants to truly make you feel welcomed. Her satisfaction in a job well done comes from reviews such as this, we have shared your positive comment with Janet and she thanks you.

title: Kind of out of the way but fabulous beach
review: We stayed here one day over Memorial Day weekend. The pool was busy, but still fun and not to crowded. The hotel is located on a great stretch of beach and provides volleyball, hot tub, hammocks, kiddie pool and even sand toys for the kids. The kids found tons of great sea shells on the beach and the restaurants were fair. Hotel has a sundries and gift shop on the ground floor and a well equipped fitness center. Staff are helpful and friendly. We will definitely stay here again. I highly recommend for families with young children.

title: Great Stay!!
review: Huge beach that you could walk for miles!  Not the softest sand.... tons of shells though!   The room was clean, but the resort could use a good renovation. It was not that busy of a night when I was there, but the waitstaff and bartender on in the restaurant-was way overwhelmed and took forever to get and the food arrived cold.

title: AWESOME SERVICE !!!!!
review: Service at this property was excellent from bell services, guest services, engineering, housekeeping, F&B outlets and the pool side.  Clean and friendly!! Thank you for a great stay will be returning soon before summer ends!  Yolaida Rivero

title: AAC Baseball Tournament
review: Very nice hotel.  Staff is top notch and extremely friendly.  Check-in was a breeze.    Room accommodations were excellent as well.   Pool/beach areas were perfect.  Only wish the pool bars stayed open later especially given it is Memorial Day weekend.     Would definitely return here again.

title: Nice getaway
review: We appreciate your feedback and are delighted to hear that you had a great stay. With a spirit to serve, we take great pride in not only meeting, but exceeding your expectations. Your feedback is integral to our ability to continue to improve our service. I fully understand being on vacation there should be no clocks and I apoligize. Our Tiki Bar hours depend on volume they should be flexible on closing if they have customers that are enjoying their self. I did share your comment with the Food and Beverage Director of Services and he has addressed it with the bartenders. Thank you again for your time and come visit us again soon!

title: Vacation
review: Stayed here for 4 days, 3 nights in May.  My Husband, My self and 2 year old son.   Room: The room we had was great, it over looked the pool and had a view of the beach.  The room was clean as well.    Pool:  The pool was consistently crowded.  The "race for chairs" began at the crack of dawn.  There is a sign that says they will be removed, but in fact they are not.  We did watch a family ask the staff if there were any tables to sit at so their toddlers could have lunch, the staff told them that it looked like no one had been at a specific table for a long time and told them they could remove the towels themselves.  So they did and other resort guests got very upset at the family for doing that.  The family tried to explain they were just looking for a table for lunch, but the…

title: Great week to relax
review: We always appreciate when our guests take the time to share their experiences. There is much to say about the tranquility of “Our Island.”  Beautiful sunsets, warm breezes and sunny days defiantly makes our casual beach resort a place for some precious family time. This is a great place for children, they are able to use their imagination and energy on our expansive and private beach without the worries of being lost in the crowd. It gives the parents a little more relaxation therapy time. We are always adding new amenities such as the beach shuttle for you our guests’ convenience.  No worries about traveling with beach toys or having to buy them as many are supplied for the children by previous guests. Regarding the pool issue you are correct it certainly is not the guest’s responsibility to remove those towels and please know we find this very concerning. Frist thank you for being a concerned guest, we always appreciate hearing the voices of our guests. This issue has been addressed by the appropriate management and added to our training and also reviewed with the poolside attendants.  Our food prices are in line with other area hotels, you are correct there are many local places which are less expensive and it is fun to ride the Trolley and convenient when exploring the area. We do hope that your stay was memorable and those memories will bring you back for another visit.

title: Off the beaten path.
review: This is my wife and I first trip to Clearwater.. The Sheraton Sand Keys Resort is in a perfect location.. Very light traffic, breath taking views of the Gulf, 5 minutes away from great food.. But and it's always a but... My room wasn't ready at checkin.. I requested to arrive early and I was told my room would be ready within minutes.. I got here at 1:45pm and my room wasn't ready until 3:45pm 45 minutes after checkin time of 3:00pm.. I was kinda upset but the staff kept my updated with everything.. then on day number 2... a storm.. rain comes thru the bottom of the sliding door.. all I got for a fix was a towel to control the water.. so I know you're asking why 5 stars just take a look at the pic I'm posting

title: Just ok
review: The pool area was smaller than expected, but still nice enough.. landscaping is nice with a lot of palm trees. The beach was better, clear green water. Hotel a tad outdated.  Jerry greeted us with a smile and was so kind to offer to send a birthday cake up for my dad since I told him my sister and I brought him down for a father/daughter weekend. that was definitely a nice touch.  I have to say the pool and beach food menu is the WORST I have ever seen. Very limited options, not even a cheese burger, all unhealthy (except a fruit salad).   The beach has a cart that drives around which is good for drinks but only food is ham and Swiss sandwiches , turkey sandwich and like a Cesar salad. We were so frustrated with the lack of quality on this menu that we went offsite for lunch. …

title: Great place to relax
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback; we always appreciate when our guests take the time to share their concerns with us so we can continue to improve our service and focus on these issues. It is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service.   Sand Key can certainly give you that tropical feel with views which are so serene that it brings a calmness; beautiful sunsets, walks on along the shore, heated pool, loungers and hammocks available so you can just nap or relax. True the beach is a bit of a walk and I can empathize with you completely, Clearwater and Sand Key are known for their exceptionally large beaches. We do understand the distance can be an inconvenience which is the reason we have added a 6 person beach complementary shuttle to get you back and forth to the beach whenever need. Concerning the food options poolside, I have shared your comment with our Executive Chef to be reviewed. I am truly sorry it was not communicated to you that Room Service will deliver anything from their menu to the poolside area, our kitchen makes the best cheeseburgers and does have many healthy options. I realize this information does not help you at this time, hopefully when you will return. Time with your father is precious time and I am sure your Dad is proud to have such thoughtful daughters. I am pleased we were part of this memorable stay. Thank you for recognizing Jerry he truly enjoys “Going Beyond” he along with many of our associates sincerely enjoy having an impact on our guests experience here at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort. We sincerely apologize for your disappointment in the Hotel itself, we are constantly renovating and are always adding new amenities. We hope you will return when next planning a beach get-away.

title: Changed our hotel and very Happy we landed here!
review: We needed some rest and relaxation from my wife's medical issues. So we chose this resort for it's close proximity to our home and the all inclusiveness of the place. Everything was great from the condition of the property to the staff and the food. We ate and had drinks in the Mainstay Tavern and had breakfast at Rusty's Bistro. Very big portions of delicious food. We had planned to go to several places off property but found everything we needed here and so we never left. Great place to view a great sunset on the golf.

title: Good choice for the area
review: I am so pleased that you chose the Sheraton Sand Key to reap the amazing health benefits of the sun, surf, sand and salt water breezes. There are times all one needs is a change of scenery and a thoughtful husband. We all know that stress can affect your health, we try to ensure there is no stress here. Our associates are always pleased when they have someone to pamper. All you need to worry about is what time you want to hit the hot tub or what is for dinner and where do you want to eat. Grab a seat around the fire pit after witnessing some of Mother Nature’s perfect art work, a “Sand Key Sunset” Then end your evening in the comfort of one of our “Sweet Sleeper” beds. I am delighted you left feeling relaxed and we look forward to the next visit.

title: Outdated and boring
review: We have been going to Clearwater for the past couple of years.  Typically we stay at a more expensive, bigger name hotel.  This past time we ended up going less expensive as this trip was not planned and last minute.  Honestly, we may never go back to another hotel.  What we loved about this place was the private beach.  Its a long walk though to the water but the beach itself is worth it!  The food at the hotel was good and the rooms are fine if you are just sleeping in them.  I would pay for a better room to try to get a view if possible.  This place though has everything you would need and at a better price with a fantastic beach and just a short drive to the main, busy area of Clearwater.

title: Bad organization of internal procedures
review: Arrived at Sheraton - housekeeping took hours - no rooms were available. Pool was very crowed with no spaces available in the shade. Beach cabanas are at an extra charge of USD 27,00 per day. Fitness area is located 9th Floor - nice view.  First and Last Time in a Sheraton Hotel! Hilton, Marriott and others provide better quality. Very disappointed.

title: Mini Stay-cation
review: Your loyalty is very important to Sheraton Sand Key. We always appreciate when our guests take the time to share their concerns with us so we can continue to improve our service and focus on these issues. I realize first impressions are important and it is truly unfortunate that your stay did not start out well. I am very concerned that you were unable to check-in at 3:00 as it is definitely not the genuine service we strive to deliver. I realizes it was an inconvenience to you because it did not happening in a timely manner. The Front Desk is truly aware that you are ready to settle in and relax after your travels. Concerning the beach chairs along the shore, many area resorts include those charges in a nightly resort fee. We have opted not to include a resort fee. We only charge for amenities used. There is a private concession for the chairs and umbrella they charge $25 per day for usage should the guest so choose to use. There are loungers, hammocks and chairs with umbrellas in the sand which are free of charge. There are also umbrella chairs on the grass surrounding the pool area. Yes, the Sheraton Fitness does have an outstanding panoramic view. With a spirit to serve, we take great pride in not only meeting, but exceeding your expectations, I sincerely apologize for your disappointment and please know we truly would like you to return so we are better able to serve you.

title: Friendly Atmosphere
review: My roommates and I went over to Sand Key from Orlando for the night and it was lovely. We were greeted by Linda and Todd at the Front Desk, and they both were very helpful and kind throughout our check-in process. The pool bar was excellent and their pool is nice and quaint. The beach, the ocean specifically, is a little far of a walk but it is technically beach front...you just need to walk a little bit (not bad at all). The beds were lovely and the staff was nice. The bread pudding through room service was very tasty too! Worth the drive!

title: Enjoyable Stay
review: Nothing like a day trip to the beach; May your day on “Our Island” have been all sunshine, cool breezes, mixed with some fun and relaxation. When staying at the Sheraton Sand Key you can totally enjoy the beach experience without the worries of parking, less the stress of driving, along with a beautiful, private beach, a hot tub, a pool, loungers and hammocks provided. Cocktails delivered or if you are into mingling a very friendly Pool Bar. After all that fun and sun all you have to do is walk to your room for a shower and a nap. It is gratifying to read that your experience with our associates was very positive. Their concern is for your satisfaction and their attention to detail is obvious and shows that they genuinely care. Their goal is to provide you with an effortless and positive experience. I have shared your comment with Linda and Todd, they thank you. We look forward to your next beach get-away.

title: Top notch resort
review: The room was clean and the bed was amazing.  Best sleep every in a hotel.  I like that it was on the beach and the equipment in the work out room was top notch.  I had breakfast at one of the restaurants inside the hotel and the food was great!  They even offered a breakfast buffet that was very reasonable . I enjoyed sitting on the balcony in the evening to enjoy the view of ocean.    Clearly one of my new favorite places to stay.

title: Home away from home
review: When we arrived there was a plate of fruit, cheeses and crackers waiting in our room.  Along with a note.  We were on the first floor and could walk right out to the pool, tiki bar or patio area.  We would walk down to the beach and just sit there or walk up and down the beach.  The staff no matter where they worked were helpful and friendly.

title: Nice visit.
review: Went on my honeymoon May 8th. Reasonably priced, comfortable bed, nice size room. Good food, great drinks and nice beach. At night they had a fire pit not far from the pool and tiki bar. We sat at the fire pit every evening. So relaxing and we met so many wonderful people while having a cocktail and fun conversations. The pool is a bit small but was never over crowded. Now, I've read complaints about the beach being a far walk. For those who don't want to walk; don't!! They radio a golf cart that will drop you off and pick you up. There should be no complaint about this as it's a non issue. There are cabanas and chairs for rent and I believe with tax it was $27.00 and so worth it. The hotel is not outdated either so I don't understand that complaint. You're very close to the…

title: Over Priced Hotel on the Beach
review: Recently stayed for two nights at the Sheraton Sand Key.  The location is excellent as it sits right on the white sand beach over looking the turquoise waters of the Gulf of Mexico.  At $261 a night I expected a lot more.  $261 would have only gotten me a lower parking lot view but I was lucky my hotel status got me upgraded to a mid level ocean view corner room.  Interactions with front desk staff over a two day period varied from super helpful and friendly at check in to down right rude in the evening with a don't bother type of attitude.  The hotel condition was fairly nice on the whole.  The beds were very comfortable but I will say the bathroom had some rust around the edges.  I would put this hotel in more of the under $200 range rather than the close to $300 range.

title: Great pool and beach, second rate bathrooms
review: Loyal guests such as your self are truly appreciated. We truly appreciate your feedback and are delighted to hear that you had a great stay. With a spirit to serve, we take great pride in not only meeting, but exceeding your expectations. The exceptional service and personal touches that our associates give our guests demonstrate our commitment to turning everyday moments into memorable branded experiences. I am pleased that the interaction with the morning associates was exactly that. I have shared your comments on the lack of good judgment and attitude you received from the Front Desk in the evening with the Director of Guest Services, it has been addressed and I sincerely apologize. I am pleased you enjoy our “Sweet Sleeper” beds they were designed with your comfort in mind. It is always a plus when you receive a great night’s sleep when away from your own bed. We do acknowledge that we are not the newest hotel in Clearwater Beach area, however, we are the only resort property with a private beach. Although we are constantly renovating, there is always more to be done. I do hope you found The Sheraton Sand Key to be a warm and comfortable environment and I am pleased you were able to enjoy the beautiful location and the amenities offered.

title: 7 day break at Sheraton
review: I was here at a conference and so cannot speak to the cost of the rooms. The King bed room was nice, since I was on the SPG preferred floor I'm not certain if they are representative or lower in quality than the ocean view rooms. The only significant negative for this hotel is that the bathrooms have NO space around the sink which limits getting out ones toiletries. They do provide Starbucks coffee and I got 2 free bottles of water per day which was enough to make three "tall" coffees each morning. The exercise facility is wonderful with plenty of weight machines, free weights, and cardio machines which look out over the inland waterway.

title: Nice outside amenities
review: The amenities outside such as the pool, beach shuttle and even sand toys for the kids were great. Had lots of food options on the property and others places to eat nearby. Downside was the room. It didn't live up to the Sheraton brand. The room was a little small and bathroom smaller. To get to the toilet you had to go in standing sideways along to tub then close the door to get to it. Found the price dropped $140 after we checked in. After stating our case for a while the manager agreed to an adjustment.

title: Good place on beach; little older
review: Your loyalty is very important to our resort and to the Sheraton Sand key. Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback; it is truly appreciated. It is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service. Our associates concern is for your satisfaction and their attention to detail is obvious and shows that they truly care. They genuinely enjoy giving you the recognition and respect that you deserve.  Our beaches are beautiful and hopefully there were many treasured memories made here for your family. Being close to all the action that Clearwater Beach offers then returning to Sand Key for; relaxing times around the pool, walks along the shore, nights around the fire pit, and a comfortable place to lay your head at the end of the day is what a visit to “Our Island” is about. Our hotel was designed many years ago and although we are constantly renovating there is always more to do. We are seriously exploring different options concerning the bathroom issue, a solution should be decided the very near future. We hope that the resolution of a price adjustment was to your satisfaction and renewed the Sheraton promise of excellence in customer service. We do hope that it will bring you back to the Sheraton Sand Key for another relaxing beach vacation.

title: Service counts
review: Good hotel on the beach. Beach is a short walk away, as there is a large stretch of sand you have to walk across to get to the beach. Rooms are decent; renovated etc. Property looks slightly dated and will soon need a refresh.

title: Favorite Hotel in the Bay Area
review: This is an old style hotel and has that old fashioned style, the rooms, hallways , and reception areas are however not lacking in modern necessity . Housekeeping cannot be faulted  even with the high turnover of a convention hotel . The staff seem to manage business and pleasure guests with equal priority .The staff in the small kiosk always have time to chat and serve .With the park next door a great place for walking and to watch the nesting Ospreys. It is a walk to the sea but a golf buggy can be used to make the journey easier for the less able . This is one of our favourite hotels in Florida

title: Clean and away from the crowds
review: I regularly come to the Tampa Bay area for work and by far my favorite hotel is the Sheraton Sand Key.  The hotel/resort has everything you need.  The restaurants are all good, the work out area is tops and the beach and pool offer true enjoyment.  The staff is the best and it makes my travels much easier.  You can't go wrong staying here.

title: First leg of hoilday
review: Stayed here for 5 nights after landing at Orlando int. airport. First impressions of hotel are excellent. Check in was easy and staff were very helpful. Room was excellent with disabled access as requested. The carpet in the room made moving around in the wheelchair hard and the bed was high off the floor. Buffet breakfast was ok although a little light on choice. Disappointed that we had to pay extra for a hot drink. This should be included in the price of the buffet. Access around the hotel was excellent and the pool was no exception however there is a sign up that says towels will be removed from sun beds/chairs after 45 minutes if no one is using them. The hotel should stick to this as we were at the pool for over 4 hours next to a table and chairs where no one had sat.…

title: Anniversary Trip disaster
review: It is gratifying to read that your experience with our associates was positive. Their concern is for your satisfaction and their attention to detail is obvious and shows that they genuinely care. Their goal is to provide you with an effortless and positive experience. Yes I agree, unfortunately all hotels seems to be costly in the hot beverage department. We do have a Dunkin Donuts right across the street in the Shoppes of Sand Key, which is inexpensive. The Chef has agreed to include the coffee with the buffet when the new menu comes out. All rooms have carpeting, I do apologize that it was not compatible to the use of the wheel chair. Although we are constantly renovating, there is always more to be done. The beds can easily be adjusted to a lower position, you can note that when making a reservation or let them know at check-in.  I am pleased that there was easy access for the wheel chair, we want everyone to enjoy our beautiful and tropical Island. Concerning the enforcement of rules around the pool, that has been an issue and has been addressed several times. We always appreciate when our guests take the time to share their comments with us so we can continue to improve our service and focus on these areas. I truly hope you will consider giving us another chance when looking for a beach get-away as this area has much to explore and enjoy. We're always working on new ways to better care for you.

title: AMAZING !
review: We booked this trip for our one year anniversary. We called and told them it was our one year before we got there. We checked in and got the worst possible room ever. Our view was the top of the lobby. Also, the bathtub didn't drain. Gross.  We looked out of our window and saw Old wires and dead palm trees. We told them... they did nothing and were not concerned. We checked out the next morning. The website pictures are very misleading... when you walk to the "beach" it is almost a mile away. You can't even see the water. The pool is tiny. Everything is overpriced for the location and accommodations. Complete rip off. To top it off, They charged the wrong card for the FULL amount. After we gave them a new card to put the one night on. They have yet to refund the money and no one…

title: Pray for Good Weather
review: As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for your disappointment especially when celebrating something as special as your one year anniversary, not meeting our goals and your expectations is very concerning. Frist I have spoken to accounting, your card was adjusted on Monday it will post with your bank in 5-7 days. I am truly sorry that should not have happened, it has been addressed with the Director of Guest Services. With that on your mind it is understandable that you were unable to enjoy all we have to offer. We do understand the distance can be an inconvenience it is 1200 feet or 0.25 miles or around a 4-5 minute walk, Clearwater and Sand Key are known for their exceptionally large beaches. When the hotel was built the beach was much closer to the hotel actually right up to the break wall. We have added a 6 person beach complementary shuttle to get you back and forth to the beach whenever need. Concerning the palm trees; you are correct we had tree trimmers scheduled for after the season so it did not disturb our many guests. Those palm trees have been trimmed, unfortunately it was after your stay. Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Clearwater Beach.

title: Great Weekend Get Away
review: WONDERFUL staff! GREAT room with perfect views! Two gift shops.  Fitness room, spa nice beach! Heated pool, wifi and worth EVERY PENNY !! Right by gulf AND bay!  Bus to much of area is dressed like a trolly.. plenty of on site dinning And nearby as well! Fishing, boat tours, nimo's pirate cruisepeir 60 and lots and lots of beaches..  came just AFTER spring break! Great... great time !

title: Wonderful stay at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.
review: The staff at this resort are absolutely wonderful !  from the bell hops to the front desk- they could not have been more friendly or accommodating!!  The resort has it all: beach, pool, towel service, volleyball, tennis courts and beach tennis.  Beach tennis is a new sport that my daughter and I had so much fun with.   I really could not have had a better time.  The restaurants in the area are great-  and the restaurants in the hotel are also great.  Room service was wonderful and overall we had such a relaxing stay.  i have only positive feedback...

title: Good waterfront hotel
review: The beauty surrounding us is breathtaking and we are always pleased to be able to share it with our guests. I imagine it was fun learning to play beach tennis with your daughter. It is truly memorable when you are able to spend precious moments with your family. Although we cannot stop time, we can slow down our days and learn how to treasure the precious moments we have with our children. It is very gratifying to know we fulfilled your expectations, thank you for your positive feedback and we look forward to a return visit.

title: Wedding Reception
review: Nice Florida Gulf coast resort on the water . Rooms well appointed with free wi-fi . Ample free parking and close proximity to Clearwater beach main business drag yet across bridge for more privacy .Good buffet breakfast in the main restaurant. Same can not be said for pool grill which offers NO grilled food . Pool is smallish , congested and the walk to beach is a trek . Concierge staff very helpful with dinning suggestions and overall staff was great.  Overall pleasant stay and would recommend this resort

title: Perfect place to wake up for our tenth anniversary
review: We appreciate your feedback and are delighted to hear that you had a great stay. With a spirit to serve, we take great pride in not only meeting, but exceeding your expectations. Take one part water, one part sand, one part sun-soaked coastal charm, and you’ve got the recipe for some great relaxation therapy when visiting the Island of Sand Key and I am pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time with us. We agree we should have a grille in the Pool Side Café there are variables to why we do not. You are able to order from the pool side server as those orders come from the inside kitchen and we have great burgers available. Concerning the pool, a larger pool is on the top of our priority list. For the walk to the shore we have added several amenities to assist anyone who felt it was a bit of a walk or has to take all that is needed for a fun beach day, one being a six person beach shuttle. Thank you for your comments on our associates, their concern is for your satisfaction and their attention to detail is obvious and shows that they truly care. They realize and genuinely enjoy giving you the service, recognition and respect that you deserve. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope a return visit will be scheduled sometime in the future.

title: Good Amenities, Large Park With Beach
review: To start, this hotel is beautiful! Very clean and modernized. The employees at the front desk, concierge desk, house keeping, restaurants/bars are extremely friendly and professional. I hosted my wedding reception at their restaurant Rustys Bistro on Sunday 4/30/17. We had a group of 12 and Josh, our waiter was incredible. He took great care of us single handedly! I am so lucky to have found and chose this particular hotel for our special day. The rooms were spacious and clean. Amenities provided as well. It's location is perfect. The pool looked amazing although we did not have a chance to enjoy it. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for everything!

title: Great location, great service
review: This was our first trip to the Clearwater Beach area, and we were very happy that we selected the Sheraton Sand Key. It's location is perfect, directly on a large beach far from the crowds at Clearwater Beach. (which is a 5-minute ride away) Beach rentals (chairs with cabana or umbrella) are readily available, and can be charged to the room at reasonable rates. In addition to food and drink options on site, there are also some good dining options a few minutes stroll away at the Sand Key shopping plaza - a few shops along with several restaurants.(Columbia is one of them - very good!) Our room was a "premium oceanview" on the sixth floor, and provided a gorgeous view of the beach, pool/grounds and fantastic sunsets. As noted in other posts, the one downside is the bathroom and…

title: Inconvenient Beach
review: We appreciate your feedback and are delighted to hear that you had a great stay. With a spirit to serve, we take great pride in not only meeting, but exceeding your expectations. Our associate truly embrace “Going Beyond,” I have shared your comments with those associates mentioned, they thank you. Our beach is beautiful and private, there are many treasured memories to be made here on the Island of Sand Key. Enjoying all the action Clearwater Beach offers then returning to Sand Key for; relaxing times around the pool, walks along the shore, nights around the fire pit, and a comfortable place to lay your head at the end of the day is what a visit to “Our Island” is about. We are working on the bathroom issue improvements can be expected in the future. Your feedback is integral to our ability to continue to improve our service. Thank you again for your time and come visit us again soon!

title: Spring Break
review: The Sheraton Sand Key has many positive attributes, included comfortable and clean rooms, an excellent and friendly staff, well manicured grounds, very good food in the hotel restaurants. However if you are looking to spend quality time on the beach this may not be the place. The waterfront is about a one quarter of a mile walk on the sand from the pool area. If you happen to have left something in your room, you are then faced with a one half of a mile round trip.  The hotel does have a golf cart which maybe one out of twenty times you will be driven to or from the beach.   Compounding this issue is the fact that there are no bathroom facilities or water fountains close to the waterfront.  You must go back to the hotel for these amenities.

title: Overall a good stay
review: I thank you for your positive comments on the hotel its self and our associates, they the people who live our brands every day and devote their energy to bringing them to life for our guests. They also are efficient in ensuring our guest enjoy a warm, clean and comfortable environment. The Sheraton Sand Key is defiantly an island beach and private, due to environmental laws we are unable to build on that area of the beach.  Clearwater and Sand Key are known for their exceptionally large beaches, it is a five minute walk from the pool bathroom to the shore. When the hotel was built the beach was much closer to the hotel actually right up to the break wall. Then the Sand Key jetty was built in 1975, since then sand has been washed in a southerly direction which has caused a wide beach. We do understand the distance can be an inconvenience which is the reason we have added a 6 person beach complementary shuttle to get you back and forth to the beach whenever need. We have also added beach wagons which will conveniently help you get your children or what is needed down to the shore to enjoy your day at the beach. This time of the year we also have Summer in the Beach Buggy who delivers food and beverage right to the water’s edge and we now have a server taking and delivering orders right to your lounge chair or table around the pool. There have been hammocks, chairs and loungers placed in the sand for relaxing in the sun and conveniently near the bathrooms, turtle bar or what might be needed. Still I realize the distance to the shore can be an excursion. I do hope you enjoyed your stay and someday will revisit the area.

title: Good.
review: Plenty of fun things to do. Staying here provides you with a daily decision: beach or pool, or both. It was quiet at night, even during spring break, because everybody is so tired from having fun all day. The restaurant is nice and there are several other restaurants within walking distance. No worries here, just enjoy.

title: Summary: Wonderful Spring Break get-away for a family with kids
review: Context: SPG Platinum, family of four on a points stay.  Was originally booked for 6 nights, but extended to 9 when Delta stranded us in Tampa for 3 extra days. Booking: Used 2x (100k for 6 nights) points to confirm a suite as it was peak season and we wanted the extra room.  Originally my ambassador indicated there were no suites available, and then a few days later came back and said the hotel had availability.  The hotel was sold out several nights during our stay, so we likely would not have gotten an upgrade if I had relied on suite night awards for the larger room. Rooms: We were in two room types, our original booking and then a different room when we needed to extend our stay.  Room 1: We were given room 823, which was the first room on the left as you go down the leg of…

title: Just what the doctor ordered.
review: Perfect family vacations are days cherished; in some of our lives there are only a few moments when you can choose to pause and life long memories are made. It was gratifying to read your very informative review and that your experiences for the most part was a success. I am pleased a suite became available, they are so much more comfortable for families. You are correct it is easier to go to the South for dining options without all that traffic, although there are some great dining experiences to be had in Clearwater Beach. The associates manning the beach shuttle are never far, their base is at the towel hut and all arrangements can be made there. To address your comment on the club lounge; there are many, many times when occupancy does not allow us to upgrade the Sheraton Club. We are a large SPG redemption hotel and do a high volume of SPG Platinum guest such as yourself. We will do our utmost to ensure that are guests are comfortable and that the lounge is not overcrowded. I was pleased that our associated treated you with warmth and the comfort of home on the beautiful Island of Sand Key, they sincerely care. We look forward to the next "Spring Break" visit.

title: Wonderful end to the hectic Disney experience
review: We really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The entire staff was friendly and professional. They went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating. We requested early check in and received a room by the pool with an ocean view. We ate at the Grill and had night caps at the bar. Love the five dollar glasses of wine at the Grill! The beds were very comfortable, we slept great.  Regarding the negative comments, yes the bathroom is small but how much time do you really spend in it? Although it would be nice if it were vented. The room does come with a small refrigerator, coffee maker, and iron. The beach is a 5-8 minute walk and if you would rather not walk they do have cart service. Yes, it cost 25 dollars for a cabana, or 2 chairs and an umbrella but…

title: Good location, rooms need update
review: There is nothing more precious than spending quality time together and making memories that will last forever. Reviews such as yours is extremely helpful to future guests and I noticed your review was filled with many common sense tips, thank you. Relaxing on the beach, beautiful sunsets, nights around are fire pit, we were pleased to share that all with you. Please return when you next need to relax and refresh.

title: Beach stay after 2 weeks of theme parks
review: Firstly I will start that I am in the travel industry and went with my family for three days to rest after a wonderful busy 10 days. I wanted to go and experience this hotel as I would like to be confident in what I am selling. I paid for a seaview room and was delighted at what I could see. The room was very clean and the hotel staff were all lovely. The food I felt was reasonable and good quality. We liked the small pool as it was safe as there was a rope to stop the little ones from going into the deeper part. The water was warm and clean and even I went in the pool twice which is a rare moment. The Crab fest was on and it perhaps did take away from the feeling of open space it was so low key in relation to the event itself. It certainly in my mind didn't cause any issue to…

title: Best Service Ever!
review: This rating is mainly for the service at this resort; while there are things that can be improved, the service stood out and deserves the credit.  As a lifetime platinum Marriott Rewards member, this is the first time that I transferred points to SPG and booked a stay.  From the moment that we registered, the service was amazing.  From the front desk reception to the restaurant staff to the guy driving the golf cart to/from the beach, every single employee at this resort proactively engaged in conversation with us to make us feel special and welcome!  Even my kids pointed out how nice everyone was!  The good: 1. Top notch service!!! 2. Very nice resort; rooms were spacious. 3. Reasonable pricing; I'm so used to food costing a lot at these resorts, but everything here was…

title: Business and Pleasure
review: The Sheraton Sand Key is uniquely qualified to welcome you and make you feel right at home; it is our associate’s favorite part of their job, interacting with our guests and that they have empowerment to take initiative to make decisions that will make our guests stay memorable. The excitement we see in the children is an elixir to us all, which is what it is all about this time of the year. It is always a delight to read that we succeed in making your experience just what you anticipated. It is a tropical paradise; beautiful beaches, breathtaking sunsets and awesome views. The smell of salt water, the gentle roar of the waves all combine to create a sense of peace and calm here on the beaches of Sand Key. It is nice to catch some of the activities of Clearwater beach, it is also nice to come back and enjoy the tranquility of Sand Key. We hope we will continue to be your choice of the hotel for your family get-away. We always appreciate when our guests take the time to share their concerns with us so we can continue to improve our services.

title: Awesome hotel
review: We select this resort for its location, amenities, and the professional/warm staff.  We had a wonderful room on the tennis course side with minimal noise with the ocean view and it was wonderful.   We checked in early and Todd took special care of us.  While on this vacation, I had to work a bit and the Front/ Business Office was fast, quick, professional and responsive.  I was able to print my documents, notarized the documents and overnighted my documents the same day in less than 15 minutes.  I was so impressed.   Love where this resort is located since it is not in the heart of the busy tourist area near the marina.  It's over the bridge, just within the distance of all the shops and restaurants, yet still private with generous parking space.  The hotels are very nice for…

title: Slightly used, but not bad!
review: Welcome to our oasis, you are correct it is a tranquil island close enough to the activities but far enough that you are not right in the middle of it. This is a great place for a family vacation; associates whose main concern is to you make you feel truly at home, who live our brands every day and devote their energy to bringing them to life for our guests. They also are caring, efficient and most of all, genuinely friendly. Thank you for recognizing Todd by name and your comment has been shared, he is pleased. A large private beach, with warm breezes and fun in the sun is a great place for kids to use their imagination. A place where you can easily keep a watchful eye on the children while you catch some relaxation therapy. It was delightful to learn the children made many friends. We hope you enjoyed our fire pit which is a great place to gather around at the end of the evening for adults to make friends or just watch one of Sand Key’s beautiful sunsets. It does sound as if memories were made, we look forward to a return visit and we truly appreciate your loyalty.

title: Very nice hotel, great beach.
review: The only hotel for us when visiting Clearwater. I love the room service! I could just stay in our room for days. The food was yummy. The hotel is beautiful with lots of things to do. The pool was nice and the beach was walking distance from the resort.   The staff was amazing. Thank you guys!

title: Excellent hotel for families
review: Stayed here for 6 days with my two kids (ages 9 and 11).  We were put in a pool/gulf-facing room and it was fantastic.  I enjoyed sitting out on the balcony enjoying breakfast (we went to the grocery store and bought yogurts and cereals and kept in the fridge) and working on my laptop while waiting for the kids to wake up.  Kids loved the pool and beach.  Yes, the pool was on the small size and was always packed with kids but none of us complained.  They were thrilled to play with the other kids.  They had activities for the kids (contests, really) that my kids enjoyed.  I liked having the ability to go to the beach then pool and vice versa.  We played beach volleyball, beach tennis and corn hole.  The kids loved it.  The walk to the beach was indeed longer than I expected but I…

title: Outstanding hotel with beautiful beach
review: We realize that the interaction between guests and associates even in small but meaningful ways can have great impact on your experience. Our associates sincerely enjoy that interaction and I thank you for sharing your experience and for your wonderful review, it sounds like it was the experience you anticipated and that many life time memories were made. These are the reviews we all in the industry strive for. Nothing gives us more pleasure then finding out we put a smile on the children’s faces, it’s a plus when the adults are happy also. Easter is the perfect time for families and thank you for the comment on the Easter egg hunt, it has been an annual event for many years. We do have many months which are very tranquil, it is a great time for couples and people who are just looking for quiet time. You are correct no matter in which direction you go there are many great dining venues, going to the North is stress free, less traffic. We look forward to a return for next year’s Spring Break, there is more fun to be had and much more to explore.

title: Great 5 day Getaway
review: This is my second stays in Sheraton Sand Key resort Hotel location is amazing  Room was very clean and comfortable  Staff was friendly and professional  Very nice restaurant and shopping area Would definitely comeback again

title: Enjoyable, great location, great staff.
review: Your loyalty is very important to our resort and the Sheraton Brand. I am pleased to read that you enjoy “Our Island” enough to return once again. We do appreciate your comments on our associates. They are pleased to provide you with an effortless experience and they are efficient and genuinely friendly. They enjoy being here to ensure your stay is the experience you anticipated. It is truly a tropical paradise with beautiful beaches and breathtaking sunsets, there are many treasured memories to be made here on the Island of Sand Key.

title: Location with private beach top, but...
review: Traveled with my teenage daughter for a mother/daughter getaway.  The resort was very nice.  We traveled School break week and knew that it would be crowded with kids of all ages.  There are plenty of lounge chairs but need to get down to pool by 9:30 for prime spot.  As other have said pool is small and crowded but again knew this going in and didn't bother us.  Maybe someday they will put in a small adults only pool.The weather was unbelievable and actually found chairs on the other side in the grass to be very peaceful under the palm trees.  Food and drinks by the pool were not overly expensive and food was pretty good.  The beach is a walk but I  honestly I expected it to be really far by some of the reviews.  I counted 520 steps from pool area to the gulf.  I can see it…

title: Second time , I hope to be back again and again !
review: Had another great stay this year. The staff makes this place . Concierge guys are fun , and Anthony remembered my family from last year ! Great memory ! Front desk was polite at check in , and our housekeeper for the week Jericka  was awesome , she was super friendly and didn't mind our really messy room ! Always smiling and happy .  Food at mainstay tavern was really great , I would recommend it !  The only thing that could be better is the poolside grill , food was overpriced , never ready quick and the guy working there didn't give my 11 year old the correct change which was shady to me !  Pool is way over crowded as everyone has mentioned , but really it is !!!!   Beach is gorgeous , landscaping is beautiful and pool area is beautiful early in the morning when it's calm . …

title: Probably won't return
review: It is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service.  It is gratifying to read that your experience with many of our associates was very positive. Their concern is for your satisfaction and their attention to detail is obvious and shows that they genuinely care. I have shared your positive comments with Anthony who defiantly knows how to make you feel welcome and Jericka who is an example of being on brand, they thank you. The pool issue is a high priority; spring break is one of the busiest times along with when the children are out of school, yes another pool is very much needed. This area is truly paradise a defiant must for needed relaxation therapy, with its beautiful beaches, and tropical landscape. The incident with your child and the change has been addressed. It has been determined to be an honest mistake, it seems good judgment was not used. We also assure you that we have taken steps to insure such occurrence is not repeated and we thank you again for your feedback. I thank you for your accurate information on the areas amenities and taking the time for your review. Looking forward to seeing you for a third visit.

title: Family-friendly, pretty and fun.
review: Hotel was nice but a few things kind of ruin it. The pool is way too small for a resort of this size. Just wall to wall people. They need to double it. The food shack by the pool is not good. Can't even get a hamburger. They should have similar offerings to the Island Grill by the pool. They charge you $25.00 for chairs and an umbrella down by the beach. This is a slap in the face. If I pay to go to a resort these things are always complementary. The beach is far so you don't have access to a bar or service. There's a little cart with limited offerings. They may want to think about putting up a small tiki bar.

title: Excellent location
review: Thank you for taking the time to write and share feedback from your most recent stay.  Our guest feedback is important to us as it helps pinpoint areas of needed focus and improvement.    The months of March and April are considered Spring Break and the resort is a very different environment. It is more about families and children and we do enjoy having them here also. We realize having another pool at these times would be beneficial as we understand the pool area is a major part of your vacation experience.  Rest assured this is on the top of our wish list. We have expanded the complimentary chairs and hammocks on the beach area closest to the resort and do offer a beach concession at an additional charge closer to the water’s edge.  You will find at many resorts these charges (beach concessions) are included in a nightly resort fee. We have opted not to do that, and only charge for usage should the guest so choose.  We appreciate your comments as this is another concept that is often under discussion. We also appreciate your comments on the food offerings at our Poolside Café.  We have recently expanded the menu options, however, I will certainly share your comments with the Chef.

title: Watch out for a room with bay view
review: It is a place I knew we wanted to return to immediately. With a very young baby, a grandmother and a young adult we can easily say all of us felt comfortable and cared for. I (the grandma) loved the pretty landscaping and the shade provided by numerous palm trees. I also loved the huge variety of delicious drinks by the pool and the gorgeous ocean views. My daughter loved the way every aspect of the resort is family-friendly and was appreciative of front desk/Jerry switching our room to where we felt more comfortable. Baby liked her crib, poolside lounge chairs under palm trees, and all the onsite dining options that didn't mind that we brought her along. Planning a trip with more famiy members. Elegant but not pretentious. 100% loved it.

title: Great quick trip
review: Spent three nights the first week of April.  The customer service at the hotel is top notice.  The hotel is older but the service is fantastic and they are always doing upkeep of the property. Best part, they do not nickel and dime you.  No parking fee, no resort fee and they provide pool floats, sand toys for the kids, etc.  The ocean is a long way but manageable.  They do provide a seven person (+/-) golf cart to transport you to and from the beach.  They also have a service cart that delivers limited food/drinks.  You can rent two lounge chairs with a umbrella/shade cover for $25 and charge it to your room.  You can also rent jet skis and other things on the beach and charge to your room.   The food was good and well prices for a resort.  The location is great. Close to…

title: Great location and beach
review: The Sheraton Sand Key Resort has one of the best locations in Clearwater, assuming you have a car.  It's quiet, away from the hustle and bustle of clearwater, next to Sand Key Park, and has direct access to a beautiful beach.  We were able to drive over to the busy part of Clearwater for dinner and thankfully retreat to our quiet beach for sunset. However if you don't have a car, you may not find the separation as ideal, although I know there's some sort of trolly available.  The rooms are fine. It certainly wasn't the nicest hotel we stayed in on our trip - the hotel is a bit older, the bathroom is small - but it was clean and comfortable, had wifi, a great breakfast buffet, and again, a great location. We had a standard room and had a beautiful view of the water. The staff…

title: Wonderful venue for conference.
review: I appreciate you taking time to write such a positive review and pleased to know your experience was enjoyable. Your loyalty is truly very important to the Sheraton Sand Key and the Sheraton brand. We are a casual beach resort; our beaches are beautiful and there are many treasured memories to be made here on the Island of Sand Key. As you said it is so relaxing to retreat to the serenity of “Our Island.” after enjoying the activities of the surrounding area. Our associates concern is for your satisfaction and their attention to detail is obvious and shows that they truly care. They realize and genuinely enjoy giving you the recognition and respect that you deserve. I can defiantly understand your frustration with the issue of the reservation of the chairs around the pool by leaving towels and personal items the night before or even early in the morning. Due to all our guests being special it has been a challenging situation. It happens at Spring Break more than any other time. We feel that we have finally come up with a solution that should end this issue, with signage. This has just been put in place, we are in the process of training the poolside attendants to enforce the issue. Again we always appreciate when loyal guest such as yourself take the time to share their concerns and ideas with us so we can continue to improve our service and focus on these issues. We're always working on new ways to better care for you. Hopefully you will return to the area, it is ever changing

title: Beautiful Resort on Sand Key
review: Beautiful resort with comfortable beds and a short walk to the beach.  Breakfast in the main hotel restaurant is priced as you would expect for a hotel.  Slightly expensive but delicious.  The hotel was a great location for the conference I attended.

title: Great place
review: The Sheraton Sand Key is a beautiful resort on the Gulf of Mexico. The rooms are spacious and clean. The common areas are well cared for. We enjoyed sitting by the pool and having the option of eating lunch (closes at 6) and cocktails poolside. The beach is wide so it's quite a walk to get to the water. However, there is a golf cart to take you back and forth. The resort is away from all of the action of the main beach area making it especially nice for families or anyone who wants a relaxing beach getaway. The action is only a short trolley ride away if you are looking for shops, restaurants and bars.  I wouldn't recommend the breakfast buffet in the restaurant. Although it's convenient, there is not much of a selection and the buffet area is very small. Other meals might be…

title: Wonderful location!
review: Came with family and spent just over a week at high season (Spring Break) - we usually come to the area in October, but had a family gathering so braved the crowds.  As others have said, the hotel is somewhat dated, as it's the oldest in the area, but it's clean and well maintained. Rooms are to a good standard and the beds very comfortable.  Staff were generally lovely (with the exception of the Tavern, where they seemed somewhat indifferent, but probably because we saw them at the end of a very long and busy day).   The pool is a bit small for the size of hotel and it's disappointing that there isn't a dining room or bar which takes advantage of the wonderful location - the main restaurant and the bar are both entirely windowless and the poolside bar seems to close early.…

title: Staff are great but hotel is showing age
review: Thank you for the very informative review, our associates concern is for your satisfaction and their attention to detail is obvious and shows that they truly care. They genuinely enjoy giving you the recognition and respect that you deserve. Your comment on the Mainstay Tavern has been shared with the Food and Beverage Director of Services and addressed. Our beaches are beautiful and there are many treasured memories to be made here on the Island of Sand Key and I do hope that was the case. We always appreciate when our guests take the time to share their perception and concerns with us so we can continue to improve our service. The month of October you enjoy a totally different environment compared to Spring Break and we thank you for braving the crowds. I am sorry for your disappointment in the size of the pool. Please realize that when the pool was built it was sufficient for the amount of guests who used it. Since the popularity of the area business has increased tremendously and we realize another pool is needed. I also agree with your comment on the windows in the restaurant, to explain the restaurants were built in the middle of the hotel years ago, they are located so to be accessible to the kitchen area which expands the whole back of the hotel. I apologize that we are unable to give club access. We are a large SPG redemption hotel and do a high amount of Platinum and Platinum Elite there is a limit to the number of guest allowed in the Sheraton Club. You are correct what a panoramic view. I do hope you will return at a much more tranquil time when we are able to ensure you get treated like the VIP you are.

title: Dated hotel, great location
review: We typically stay in high end hotels but this time I traded in my points for this hotel which was directly on the beach.  I agree with most of the reviews... the rooms are small but we were not in our room that much. The bathrooms were also very tiny. The only thing I liked about the room was the bed, it was very comfortable. But overall the rooms were well worn and showed a lot of dirt. I would have rather stayed in a Fairfield Inn or Springhill suites. Also, the pool was way too small for the amount of people in it. It was a bit crazy. However, most every staff member we encountered was very nice. From bell service to breakfast to house keeping with I believe Mimosa, they were all happy to see you. Finally, the beach was not the soft white powder in Clearwater. It had a ton of…

title: Wonderful experience
review: There are many Sheratons that are luxurious, we are classed as a casual beach resort which other than Spring Break can be a tranquil and relaxing spot to visit. You are correct we are an older hotel, although we are constantly renovating still there is always more to be done. That does not make an excuse for being dirty we have addressed this issue with Director of Housekeeping and it has been reviewed with the associate, I apologize. We do appreciate your comments on our associates. They are pleased to provide you with an effortless experience and they are efficient and genuinely friendly. They enjoy being here to ensure your stay is the experience you anticipated. The beach here at Sand Key does have a different profile then Clearwater Beach due to the Sand Key jetty. Our beach is private, expansive and away from the crowds and you can always find your own private piece of paradise. We also have Our Beach Buggy that delivers food, beverage and alcoholic beverages to you along the shore, plus a 6 person shuttle to get back and forth to the shore. I am disappointed you will not be returning here, we do hope you will return of the area.

title: Too touristy
review: We stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key for a meeting.  I tagged along with my husband because I had never been to Clearwater Beach and we could use a getaway.  We came 2 days before the meeting started to have some time together.  My husband is an SPG Platinum, so we were hoping for an upgraded room and some nice perks to go along with it.  The property itself is lovely, and the location and beach are beautiful.  That being said, it can really use an update!  The hotel was packed due to spring break families.  Though my husband's profile specifically requests a king bed, we were given a choice of a king bed on the 3rd floor overlooking the parking lot, or 2 queens with a nice view.  Of course we took the view.  The room was one of the smallest we have been in, with barely room for a…

title: Lovely beach hotel
review: We had a room on the 3rd floor, near to the lifts and looking out over the tennis courts. I had requested a high floor, so the 3rd floor was a disappointment. We could not see the ocean from our balcony, but the room was very spacious and quiet. The best thing about this hotel is it's location on a beautiful beach- but be aware that you have to pay for the cabanas on the beach (a reasonable $27 a day) and it is a reasonable walk from the hotel yo the beach (the hotel does run a shuttle service via golf buggy for those needing help).  The restaurants in the hotel were so-so. Nothing to rave about. There are few alternative dining spots within walking distance- though a dunking donuts and cafe are very close by, and Clearwater beach itself about a 20 minute walk across a bridge.

title: Dream come true.
review: We booked two weeks in Florida and decided to start with 4 days at the beach. We chose the Sand Key Resort for no other reason than it looked nice in the brochure. We could not have made a better choice. The hotel was fantastic as were the staff. We had a balcony that gave a perfect view of the sun rising which was great for waking up with a coffee. The shoreline was about a 5 minute walk from the hotel over the beach, but a buggy was always available to take people to and from there.  The hotel has its own expanse of sand which was beautiful.  There is the "Turtle Bar Buggy" which drives on the beach for guests to buy drinks and food whilst soaking up the sun. The hotel facilities are top notch, with both restaurants offering very good food and the bar is friendly.  This will…

title: Beach front beauty!
review: Thank you for your very pleasing and visual review. We are so pleased that you choose the Sand Key for your beach days and that you are now a converted beach person. As they say “Happiness is sand between your toes” Our resort is a casual and comfortable place. It is the perfect place to wake up in the morning watching the sunrise with a cup of coffee and maybe catching a sunset in the evening with a cool beverage. Having fun in the sun or just spending a day on the beach which can be so serene that it brings a calmness; walking along the shore, taking a dip in the pool, maybe lounging in a hammocks, most of all knowing it is your choice. Whatever you chose you are where beverages and food are just a hand wave away whilst soaking up the sun … are you relaxed yet? I am so please you enjoyed the culinary options offered and the warm caring service of our associates who are just waiting to welcome you back.

title: spring break
review: A long weekend stay in this lovely hotel was just what the family needed.  Surrounded by bright blue water and white sand beaches we loved exploring the area and the beaches.  If you are lucky you will see dolphins out front!

title: Fabulous Girls Weekend
review: I am delighted you found our resort to be an oasis for your family, thank you for your lovely review. There is nothing more precious than spending quality time with family and making memories that will last forever. Relaxing, fun days on the beach, beautiful sunsets, and then slipping into nights around the fire pit or exploring the area ... a perfect day. Please return for another relaxing week-end soon.

title: Fabulous stay - honeymoon!
review: First things first, if you are in any doubt about whether to travel to Clearwater, do it! Stunning beaches, beautiful sunsets and amazing fun people. The hotel is not as 'modern' as some of its neighbours but don't let this put you off. The staff are all amazing, polite and go out of their way to be helpful.  Our room was beautiful - small bathroom (read other reviews) but like most other normal people we don't stay places for the size of the bathroom! The view from our balcony was stunning and so nice to wake up to every day! Huge comfortable bed!! Thank you for the lovely bottle of fizz that was waiting for us in the room - great way to relax after a long day travelling!  The pool area was a little crowded (it was spring break and we hadn't realised!) but there's plenty of sun…

title: Great hotel on Clearwater Beach
review: What an informative and awesome review, thank you. Our tropical island the perfect place to make lasting memories. This is just the experience we would hope all our guest would enjoy when visiting the Sheraton Sand Key Resort. The smell of salt water, the gentle roar of the waves all combine to create a sense of peace and calm here on the beaches of Sand Key. Add the steel drums along with the beautifully kept foliage and tropical flowers. Light evening breezes, and beautiful sunsets certainly add to the ambiance. Then ending your evening by sitting around the fire pit, all sounds like a beautiful, relaxing and romantic honeymoon experience. It does seem as if you took advantage of much of what this area offers. Such as a short walk to some local eateries and shops while enjoying a beautiful and tranquil view. Thank you for mentioning our associates such as Nate who genuinely care about you our guest and they truly enjoy taking care of details that will impact your stay. We are always working on new ways to better care for you. Concerning the cabanas we do not charge a resort fee which most area resorts do, as you mentioned there is a separate charge. I am pleased you enjoyed the complementary sunbeds. I am very pleased you were able to explore the area although there is much more to explore and the trolley waiting to take you, so you must return maybe for an anniversary someday in the future.

title: Spring Break Stay
review: Very relaxing hotel in an area called Sand Key.  Away from the hustle and bustle of the tourist area but about a minute drive or walk across a short bridge.  They have a poolside cafe, an upscale restaurant, poolside bar, a bar/tavern and a grill.  Pool is nice.  Not too large but nice.  Runs 4 ft to 8 1/2 ft.  It has a gift shop and an apparel shop as well as a gym and spa.  Beach is very large and has beach volleyball, beach tennis, hammocks, bean bag toss, tennis courts.  Front desk staff & room service staff was very friendly.  Highly recommend.

title: Fun in the sun!
review: I thank you for your great review and the recommendation. I am pleased you enjoyed your visit to the Island of Sand Key. For fun in the sun we have beach tennis Pro Coach Rhino as the Pool and Beach Activities Director he coordinates activities and provides resort guests with beach tennis lessons. Along with beach tennis, he can set up an array of activities for guests of all ages, such as beach tennis clinics, sand volleyball games, corn hole and other outside activities. After all that activity you can just lay back totally relax. This is the time you can certainly enjoy that tropical feel you get by being surrounded with views which are so serene that it brings a calmness most of us are unable to experience during our everyday lives. Along with beautiful sunsets, steel drums in the background, a heated pool, loungers and hammocks available so you can just nap or read your favorite book. Private beaches where you can spend uninterrupted time with your own thoughts and birdsong mingling with the ocean breeze, this is true therapy at its best. We truly thank you for your comments on our Front Desk and our In-Room Dining associates. All of our associates are pleased to provide you with an effortless experience and make you feel truly at home by being genuinely friendly, caring and efficient.  Please Hurry Back!

title: 2017 Spring Break Sand Key (4th Year)
review: We generally never go back to the same place twice, but this was our second stay here.  It is a great value, quiet area, and right on the beach, (especially when you can use SPG points to stay- (only 8k points each night when staying 5 nights!)  The kids loved playing tennis on the courts, using the hammocks and playing beach volleyball. The kids said the pool was warm,so even though it was chilly when we were there, they had no problem swimming all day. It is right next door to a park, and a short walk to Maggie Mays (favorite breakfast spot).  The Mainstay tavern onsite had great service and really good food and we could watch our favorite local hockey team play as we ate. We also like that it is not too far to from the Pier area with shops and entertainment, (short drive) or…

title: Nondescript and in Need of an Overhaul
review: I will go out of my way to compliment the staff at the hotel, and that includes the front desk, housekeeping, pool and beach attendants, restaurant staff and everyone else. Unfortunately, that does not make up for rooms being in need of a massive upgrade, in particular the bathroom configuration – the sink is outside of the bathroom and right next to the front door – and the bathroom fixtures are worn. We were supposed to have a king bed and ended up with two queens. Our room was billed as a King with a Sea View and balcony. The pool is fairly small and unless you stake your claim by 8:00 a.m., you won’t be sitting anywhere near it. Your best option is to rent one of the cabanas by the beach, but you don’t have any food or drink options down there and it’s a long walk back to…

title: Beautiful beach
review: It is gratifying to read that your experience with our associates was very positive; their goal is to provide you with an effortless and positive experience, their concern is for your satisfaction and their attention to detail is obvious and shows that they genuinely care. I have shared your comments with those appropriate managers, they will recognize their associates, thank you. Although our property has been on Sand Key for many years we are constantly renovating. I sincerely apologize that this was not the experience anticipated or the impression of the Sheraton Sand Key you had anticipated. I am sure it would have enhanced your stay if you were informed properly on what beach amenities were available. We are working on the final details to a solution concerning the saving of the lounge chairs around the pool. We also provide a 6 person shuttle to the shore and back, you just need to go to the hut where you were dropped off and they will be pleased to radio the shuttle to pick you up. If you rent a cabana or are just relaxing on the beach we do have a Beach Buggy which offers food and alcoholic and non- alcoholic beverages. We also have lounge chairs and hammocks on the sand which are complementary. I am sorry you did not enjoy any of or food options, Rusty’s Bistro has an award winning and very talented culinary staff. Yes, there are many options of dining venues in the area and it is always fun to explore. Please realize the break in the main water line was not an issue that was planned. I understand it was an inconvenience. I do hope there were some memorable moment during your visit to our island.

title: Nice Place but has Limitations
review: Went here with my family for Spring Break. My teenagers were apprehensive about coming here but the facilities changed their attitudes. The pool, beach, and playground were amazing. The rooms were clean. The breakfast was a bit expensive so we only ate there once.   My only complaint is that the beach is about 1/4 mile from the hotel. They have a golf cart that will take you over by request, but there is no way to come back so you have to walk. It would be nice if the cart did occasional pickups from the beachside to the resort.    Overall nice hotel.

title: Solid Experience - Nice Place, Great Location
review: Families, there are many treasured memories to be made here on the island of Sand Key. We always appreciate when our guests take the time to share their experience with us so we can continue to improve our service and focus on these areas. Our beaches are beautiful and it is the perfect place to have fun in the sun for any age. Yes the beach is long and wide, which is great storm protection for the hotel. Concerning the walk to the shore, as you noted we now have a 6 person shuttle that will drive you to and from the shore, you will be dropped off at the "beach hut" located by the shore. When you are ready just go to the same hut or call the hotel operator and they will call for your pick-up. For those who enjoy the walk we have added beach wagons that will help you to carry small children or anything needed to enjoy a great day at the beach. I apologize if you were not made aware of these amenities. Now that you know we look forward to that next Spring Break visit.

title: Fantastic in almost every way!
review: This Sheraton was clean and the staff were very nice but it does have some limitations:  Pros: It is away from the noise/chaos from Clearwater Beach.  It is clean, well kept.
