Lots of events going on such as Dixieland Jazz Classic, Clearwater Jazz Holiday and more.  Please stay in touch with us if you're on Facebook.  We love interacting with our guests!  Enjoy your summer... Sincerely.  Darla Napoleon

title: Beautiful hotel, amazing views
review: My wife and I spent a week at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort in April 2016. We enjoyed every aspect of the stay. Clean room, great service from the staff, good food inside the hotel, etc. We enjoyed the pool areas at the hotel and the outdoor fire in the evenings (I know it may seem strange to enjoy a fire in a warm place like Florida, but it felt good after the sun went down).   You can walk directly onto the beach, which was a must for us. Access is to a beautiful beach on the gulf. There are cabanas and jet skis to rent directly behind the hotel. Nice sandy beach.   We tried several nearby restaurants, with the Columbia being our favorite dinner spot. It is a short walk from the hotel.   The hotel was everything we hope for in a place to stay. We will be returning next year.

title: Our first staycation!
review: We live 15 minutes away from this beautiful area!!!  Great hotel, great location!  Talk about having the biggest piece of beach, Sheraton has it!  Prime real estate!  We will be staying again in the near future!

title: Great hotel, great location
review: How nice!  We're so pleased you had that staycation and chose to spend it with us!   We're so glad you came over and enjoyed our beautiful beach and the fabulous Gulf of Mexico.  We live in paradise, don't we!  We'll look forward to having you back with us - and until then, if you're on Facebook - please follow us and stay in touch.  Sincerely,  Darla Napoleon

title: Great hotel, great location
review: We stayed for 2 nights in July. It was wonderful! Top Pool Area with directly access to the beach. Free Parking, very nice, clean and comfortable rooms and great service as well. The Pool Area and Beach was unexpectedly less crowded.

title: Vacation
review: Thank you!   We're delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us this month.  You are among so many guests who appreciate that we have no parking fee (and no resort fee!) and we appreciate your compliments on our beach, rooms and service.  Pleasing our guests and providing them with reasons to leave with great memories is what we're all about.  We do hope you'll be back with us again!  Sincerely,  Darla Napoleon

title: Nice place for traveling with child
review: This was the last stop of our tour of Florida and checked in the four nights having travelled up from Naples.  Most functional hotel of the four we stayed in, perhaps not the best room but we loved this hotel.  Great pool area, just no brollies to keep shaded from the searing Florida sun which we felt was quite strange. You stepped from the pool area right onto the white sands of the Mexican coast great outside snack bar and bar. Got a complimentary cocktail both at outside bar, Slo Joes Turtle Bar, and also at the bar inside, Mainstay Tavern.  Complimentary coffee at Rusty's bistro as well.  Inside there were two great shops selling tea, coffee, bagels, sandwiches, salads, sweets and souvenirs - just what is needed when you need a chocolate fix! Second shop had clothing, shoes…

title: Nice hotel oceanside
review: The staff was just wonderful and helpful.  The room was clean and the bed was comfy.  Room was a bit on the small side and a bit dated but not bad.    Pool area was very nice, with a hot tub, lots of chairs for everyone, sand volleyball and best of all, right there at the beach.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Enjoyable stay.
review: Thanks so much for taking time to write about your stay with us.  We're very pleased that you had a positive experience and thank you so much for the compliments to our staff.  It is a goal here of everyone to ensure our guest experience is superb!  So glad you enjoyed our beautiful beach and resort amenities include the pool and deck area.   Ultimately, we love that you're hoping to stay here again.  Nothing pleases us more than to see our guests return.  Sincerely,  Darla Napoleon

title: Can't fault it
review: We had a nice stay at SSKR. Staff was nice, rooms clean, beach close. Our only gripe was that they close the tiki bar at 8pm!! WHAT!! It's just getting nice out, the sun is setting, they fire up there nice new fire pit, pool is open until 11pm, what a nice set-up, BUT they close the outside bar at 8pm! How does this make sense? Except for that, it was a nice stay. Just poor management of that one area.

title: Fantastic resort, amazing staff
review: We've just returned to UK after spending 6 wonderful nights at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort, and we had a great time.  We had adjoining rooms to maximise the space for us (2 adults + 2 kids), each room was a good size with especially large beds and plenty of room. The wash area and bathroom is small in comparison, as mentioned in other reviews, but it didn't detract at all from our comfort.  Our rooms didn't benefit from a view but it didn't bother us in the end - just added incentive to get out of the room and enjoy the place.  The various on-site restaurants offer a wide variety of choice at reasonable prices with quality to match.  The breakfast buffet is comprehensive and the buffet dinner offered for 2 adults and 2 children for $59 (Mon-Thur) is extremely good value.  The…

title: Really nice hotel
review: Thank you so much!   We're delighted you and your family stayed with us and had a wonderful beach holiday.  We appreciate the comments that you made so that other potential guests can benefit by hearing about our resort amenities, pool, beach, and proximity to other activities on Clearwater Beach.  Hopefully you'll be among so many others who return time and again for more beach memories.   Please join thousands of our visitors who follow us and engage on our Facebook page - we'd love to entice you back!  Sincerely,  Darla Napoleon

title: Great Stay!
review: Had a great stay at the Sheraton Sand Key last week.  The property was beautiful and very well kept.  Staff was friendly and very helpful with the exception of housekeeping, which often didn't get to our room until the evening time, which made things very inconvenient for us.    We also had to call down for extra washcloths a couple times which took over an hour to receive.     We had lunch a couple times at Rusty's Bistro and it was very typical pool food, but it was good and served its purpose nicely.    I loved the location of the property, close to the action, but sort of off to itself which allowed privacy and relaxation.       It was definitely a walk to the beach, it would have been nice if they had a tram or golf cart to help people make it out and back with all of our…

title: Beach Paradise on Sand Key
review: Thank you so much for taking time to let us know about your experience recently.   We're so pleased you ultimately had a fine beach experience.  You're right - it is a bit of a trek across the beach to the shoreline.  Plenty of room for everyone!  Please know that guests comments such as yours on the housekeeping service is taken very seriously and shared with those in top management.  We want every guest to have a 100% positive guest experience and your feedback will help us improve where needed.  We love that you're hoping to come back for more beach fun.  Until then, please stay in touch with us on our Facebook page for photos, news, and deals.  Sincerely,  Darla Napoleon

title: Will return
review: Perfect spot for a family vacation, that's  away from the crowds of Clearwater Beach. Thanks to Peggy and Mila in the club lounge for their amazing service. It's worth the upgrade if you're not a Platinum SPG member.   You can play Volleyball and corn hole right on the beach. Gotta love it!

title: Amazing Property
review: Friendly staff, very nice and clean room, comfy bed. Good location. Can walk a block away for breakfast or dinner. Maggie Maes for breakfast and Backwater for dinner. Can sit outside and enjoy the beautiful bay. Ur stay here won't disappoint.

title: Wonderful experience
review: Sheranton Sandkey  in clear water I have to say that is such an amazing property not only because of its location but also the staff which makes a  huge  difference  during your overall stay.  Every year we end up visiting clear water, and this is the hotel we  choice to stay because is a great property,  the rooms are always very clean, they also offer  a good selection for breakfast, lunch and dinner, and  is not to far  from orlando theme parks or even tampa for those who which to visit Lego Land or any of the other attractions Tampa has that you might want to visit during your stay. Its a  good property to stay no matter if traveling alone, with your family, with friends or even part of a convention. The only downfall is the pool is not that big and it could get a little…

title: Ok hotel
review: A little worn out ....very crowded pool, OK food. Rooms need updating. Just an average hotel with high room rates. Sarasota has more to offer with less expensive hotels that are much nicer with larger less crowded pools!

title: Nice, clean mid-tier hotel in quiet part of beach.
review: Thank you for staying with us and taking time to write.    We appreciate your opinion and comments.   As you can see from many other reviews, we have guests who come here time and again so we're sorry you are not among our many satisfied visitors.  We do hope that wherever you go in Florida, that you will enjoy your next vacation in the sun.  Sincerely,  Darla Napoleon

title: Sun and Sand
review: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It's on Sand Key, which is just over the bridge, 5 minutes from bustling Clearwater Beach. The hotel is sandwiched between a high-rise condo and Sand Key park (lovely park).  You get the sugar white sand of this area (however, it's a walk! the hotel is directly on the beach, but probably 300-400 yards from the water).  Rooms are nice and clean, but when sitting on the 'john' you can see the rust on the door jamb that has been painted over multiple times. Carpets are a bit threadbare in halls and in our room. Room was nice size based on American (as opposed to European) hotel room sizes. Everything was clean and functioned.  They haven't done a major remodel in while, so you still have the airconditioner on the outside wall (but a…

title: Would stay again!
review: Thank you for taking time to review your recent stay with us.    We always appreciate guest feedback so we can continue to improve guest satisfaction, so please be assured your comments are shared with our top management.  You are correct - most guests love our location since it is in a quiet area away from the main part of Clearwater Beach yet easily accessible.  We appreciate your comment on our cleanliness since, of course, that is an important part of the guest experience.  Regarding service issues, we are glad you enjoyed the staff at Rusty's but disappointed to hear about your reservation issue.  Again, this will be addressed.  Indeed, many families do consider us a perfect getaway and many return year after year.   We hope if you plan another beach holiday, you'll look at returning to see us.  Sincerely,  Darla Napoleon

title: Amazing!!
review: I stayed here with a friend and our daughters, it was the perfect location.  The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly.  We headed to the beach each day and were able to easily reserve beach umbrella's and chairs in front of the resort.  A truck came by and offered snacks and drinks so no need to run back and forth from the beach to the hotel.  Late in the afternoon each day we moved to the pool area, there we were able to get drinks from the bar and an afternoon snack from the café.  Things couldn't have been easier.  At night we went into town to shop and have dinner.  It was a quick few minutes drive and parking at both the hotel and town was easy.  I'd definitely come back!

title: Quick weekend getaway, all the way!!!
review: My family and I really enjoyed our quick weekend stay here.  The good:  1. Great location, right on gulf blvd, it is beach front. Also it is near many shops and restaurants, some are walking distance and some are only a 5 min drive away. It's near to downtown clear water , without being in the middle of the hustle and bustle , which I  appreciate greatly.  2. The staff, especially the bellman and the management were extremely courteous and professional. They helped us with our questions and concerns and went  above and beyond to make our stay comfortable and convenient. There is no extra charge for parking which is nice!  3. The drinks at the poolside were refreshing and reasonable priced.   4. Rooms were clean and comfortable  . The first floor rooms have a nice small outside…

title: Family Trip
review: The hotel has amazing amenities but the rooms need a little bit of TLC. The staff was helpful but this being the 4th of July weekend, they could not accommodate for late checkout (2PM) for one of the 3 rooms we booked Also, WiFi was not offered to SPG members until we called them to ask  Overall, this is a great hotel and would recommend going there

title: Beat our expectations!
review: It was our first trip to Clearwater as a family after spending a week in Orlando. Upon arrival our room was not ready but we were quickly checked in and given a pass so we could get pool towels and use the facilities. Todd and Paul at bellhop could not have been more friendly or informative about the area and the amenities on site. We had requested Oceanfront room on the 6 floor and that's exactly what we were given despite the full occupancy of the hotel and only staying one night. The beach is a bit of a walk to get to the ocean but my kids didn't mind as it's a perfectly clean and walkable swimmable ocean for little ones. The shells are abundant up and down the coast. The amenities the hotel offers at the beach or something I have never seen it any other Hotel. There is an…

title: AMAZING stay!
review: Came here for my bachelorette party a couple of weeks ago. Quick and friendly check-in even though the check-in line was long and the hotel was very crowded. On our second day, we walked to the beach in front of the resort and were greeted by the nicest person who truly made our stay memorable. Debbie kept our drinks full and our faces smiling- great service! We still talk about how great Debbie is and how we should invite her to my wedding. She is a great employee and Sheraton Sand Key is very lucky to have her!

title: Couples break
review: Perfect place to relax and have a cocktail by the pool. Also right on a beautiful beach complete with hammocks and beach games. Variety of food venues within the hotel which are all to a high standard. Comfortable room with balcony overlooking the beach, great for watching the sunset. Friendly staff.

title: Sun and Sand
review: Resort offers a enjoyable relaxing spot that is also close to the Clearwater activities.  Best of both worlds - Sun sand and shells or street preformers local artists and beach activities -at an affordable price.  We. Will be returning next summer.

title: One night review
review: Spent one night here and had a wonderful time. Plenty of parking and the staff was very friendly.  The pool area and Tiki bar had great food and drinks.  The we room was clean and we'll maintained. Towels were clean by the pool.  The pool water was warm and clean.  I want to go back and stay longer.

title: So glad we chose here - location, location, location
review: Away from the madness and traffic jams of Clearwater Beach over the July 4th holiday weekend, we were so g;ad we chose here. The location on Sand Key beach is perfect and the ocean view rooms take it all in. The rooms are a little small but you rarely spend time there because you are either at the beach, by the pool or visiting an attraction. The on site gym is excellent - lots of equipment and amazing bayside views. The little shop on site sells most things that you need for snacks etc. Every staff member was super friendly and efficient. It is a little old and tired in places, but definitely the best option in the Clearwater area.

title: 100% Amazing Hotel & Staff
review: we have visited the USA several times but this was our first to Florida.. after picking up the hire car at Orlando Airport we drove the 2.5 hours into Clearwater Beach to the Sheraton...we had a very warm welcome by Brandon on the front desk who was most charming and very helpful and informative.. after learning that we were there for our wedding anniversary the next day we came back to the room to find a card and some chocolate strawberry cakes from Brandon what a truly kind gesture .we were allocated room 802 on the 8th floor what an amazing room ...large with 2 king size beds ,fridge, large flat screen TV wifi, A/C, balcony with amazing views overlooking the beach, basically everything you could possible want... the room was immaculately clean with room service everyday, our…

title: Great stay
review: Thank you!   What a lovely review of your two weeks with us and a brilliant way of capturing the entire experience.  We're so glad you enjoyed all we have here at the resort and, for sure, we'll be passing along your compliments to Brandon, Marta and our team here who all work so hard so each guest enjoys a wonderful experience.  Good suggestion on the smoking by the beach.  Comments like these are shared with upper management so we can continue to improve customer experience.    We also appreciate the compliments to Rusty's Bistro.   Chef Harris will be pleased!  You traveled a long way to visit us and we do hope you'll return again -- we love our repeat guests!  Sincerely,  Darla Napoleon

title: 4th year in a row
review: Used my spg points to stay this year and had a great vacation. Was dissapointed at first when they didn't have a room I requested but got us in early on the first floor. Staff was great and room very clean. Will be back again next year.

title: With private beach; Old Property in 70s I believe but maintained well
review: How wonderful!   There is nothing we like better than seeing our guests return each year, and we're so glad you joined us for more fun in the sun.  Thank you for being a valued SPG member -- and how great you were able to use points for your stay!  We appreciate your comments on the cleanliness, compliments on our staff, and most importantly - your intention to be back next year.  Thanks again!  Darla Napoleon

title: Anniversary stay
review: This hotel was so good looking on photo, but you will notice as soon as you arrived it is not the case as the building was built back in 70s I believe. The main reason for me to stay here is that this hotel comes with a private beach which is the whole point of visiting Clearwater - to watch the sunset.  The less crowded beach, with chair, pool, etc are essentially giving you a relax environment that you don't need to fight for the parking in the public Clearwater beach.

title: Not happy with their service
review: Thank you for taking time to write about your recent stay with us.   We're so pleased you enjoyed all the resort has to offer, especially our relaxing appeal with a more secluded location.   You are correct, we are one of the original resorts on Clearwater Beach and have been a mainstay for several generations of beach goers who return year after year. We love our repeat guests and hope you'll be among them.  If you aren't already following us on Facebook, we invite you to stay in touch with us for news, photos and reasons to come back.  Sincerely,  Darla Napoleon

title: This is the best property in the area
review: This Hotel is in a great location , a short distance from Clearwaters main beech , it has its own beech front ,the swimming pool is a little small if the Hotel is fully booked ,rooms are of a good standard ,staff very helpful ,my only criticism was being charged 20 % tip when 6 of us had breakfast and 4 of us had the help yourself buffett

title: Great Staff and Facility but Missing Something
review: Recently stayed here and immediately the staff was great. They helped us with our bags off the shuttle and guided us into the hotel. The room wasn't ready for nearly 3-4 hours so we went to get a drink outside by the pool. I think they should have given us a complimentary drink because the last thing we want to do after a flight is wait longer.  The beach was alright, nothing entirely special and pool is small. I had a room overlooking the pool and it was okay as well. The staff was awesome. They were very helpful with questions and everything but checking out is where I was disappointed. We had pre-booked the hotel but the credit card on file wasn't reading so I got charged and now we have to figure out the double charge....that'll be time consuming.   The food for this again…

title: Beautiful resort and friendly staff...
review: Our family of 4 stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key for two nights in June 2016.  The facilities (room/pool/restaurants) and setting were beautiful and the staff were incredibly friendly throughout our stay.  The private beach and availability of cabanas without the crowds of Clearwater proper were something we enjoyed very much.  We will definitely be back!

title: Great beach access!
review: We had a great stay at the Sheraton.   We were lucky and got a room with pool and beach view. We had heard the property was old but our rooms were updated and the hotel was in good condition. The pool was simple and kind of small, but nice. We were able to get lounge chairs at the pool and the towel stand  was right there, making it easy to get fresh towels for pool/beach use.  There is a bar on the pool deck however there isn't anyone taking orders at your lounge chairs.  Since we were on vacation I looked forward to simply ordering drinks from our seats/lounge chairs. Also, the bar wasn't one attached the pool (where you could swim up to it).   The beach was pretty. We rented 2 lounge chairs and an umbrella for $25 for the day. They did come down with a cart for drinks, but…

title: Wonderful Stay & Birthday Experience!!!
review: It is gratifying to read that your experience with our associates was very positive. Their concern is for your satisfaction and their attention to detail is obvious and shows that they genuinely care. Their goal is to provide you with an effortless and positive experience. How could you not enjoy the smell of salt water or the gentle roar of the waves?  They all combine to create a sense of peace and calm here on the beaches of Sand Key. I am so pleased to hear you enjoyed some fun in the sun. Ending the day with a breathtaking sunset is something memories are made of. I sincerely apologize for the lapses in service that occurred during your stay.  Rest assured I have passed your comments on to the appropriate managers to look into.  We look forward to welcoming you back!

title: Loved it!
review: We have a tradition to fly yearly to Florida for my mom's birthday! We spent the week at the Sand Key Sheraton resort and from the very start were greeted by a very friendly valet (who remembered us from last year and welcomed us in with a personal touch), then by wonderful staff for check-in! The welcoming atmosphere and friendly staff made the stay relaxed and enjoyable. It was nice to see the surprise Birthday cake for mom's Birthday and personal attention given to her to make sure her day was truly relaxing and enjoyable! The massage staff were great and we were very satisfied with our stay! THANK YOU!!!

title: "Great Staff, Rooms,Restaurants"
review: From the door, to desk to room, excellent property. The bell man took us up was very helpful. The housekeeping made sure we had enough Starbucks room coffee  & shampoo, shower gel & towels. That was Cheryl, the Bell man Todd. The in house restaurants were delicious food from the great buffet to single order Korean Beef  & Chicken Alfredo, fruit salad & regular salad. Great gift shops but the property is not overwhelming big. No waits for elevators. Free Parking. The beach has lots of Sand Bars so you don't get knocked over by waves & great swimming & shells all over. Wear your flip flops to water edge. The pool is good & hot tub. Very nice area. We will  go again. Great for old, young. & in between lots of room to sun  bathe. Hope you enjoy as much as our family.!

title: Love the hotel and facilities
review: We are delighted to hear that you spent quality time relaxing and enjoying doing nothing other than relaxing on the beach, soaking in the hot tub, swimming in the pool and enjoying the sun. Associates like Cheryl and Todd here to ensure their attention to detail is obvious and that you walk away knowing they genuinely care. All you need for the day is flip flops and your bathing suit. This may be a step in the direction of providing some great therapy.

title: Excellent property
review: Enjoyed our stay in March 2016. Hotel was beautiful and the grounds were lovely.   We stayed 3 nights there while waiting to cruise out of Cape Canaveral going to the Bahamas.  I was a little disappointed in the view from our room.  (I booked the best room that boasted ocean views) it was expensive and in my experience,  when paying the high price for the best ocean views, this was not the best view by any means.   Food in hotel good but pricey. One unpleasant night where there had been a wedding reception earlier,  a small crowd of half dozen men hung out at the pool drinking until the wee  hours of the morning. Even though we were on an upper level room, their noise was so loud, not only us, but several folks came out on their balconies to see what was going on.  When I called…

title: Best Sheraton on the gulf!
review: We only stayed for one night due to some adverse weather earlier in the week, but we have previously stayed many times going back over 20 years.  Check in was quick and easy and the lady at check in was even able to accommodate our early arrival. The room is a good size, well decorated and clean. Beds are very comfortable as at most SPG properties.  Our main reason for visiting was, unsurprisingly, the beach! It is a few minutes walk to the ocean but its hardly a chore and well worth it. There are loungers available to rent and even water sports activities can be charged to the room. The pool is a little small for the size of the property but there always seemed to be plenty of loungers available.   We ate at the small snack bar by the pool. To be honest the food is limited and…

title: Returning customer
review: The restaurant having a ocean view would be outstanding. The exceptional service and personal touches that our associates give our guests demonstrate our commitment to turning everyday moments into memorable experiences and it seems that we succeeded. Welcome to our tropical paradise, beautiful beaches and breath taking views make for ultimate relaxation therapy. Thank you for your many stays. It was unfortunate the weather did not cooperate … we do look forward to your next stay.

title: Excellant hotel
review: Stayed at the Sheraton for 4 nights in June 2016 with my husband and 9 year old son. Hotel is situated on a private beach next to Sand Key Park, across the bridge from the bay.  Excellent location, beach is breath taking and you literally step out the pool into the beach.  Quieter than next to Pier 60 which is great.  Hotel's facilities are really good, rooms are clean and well maintained.  We've had a beach view and the harbour view room and both are very nice.  Bathroom is small but for a few nights this did not matter.  Used the restaurant for the buffet breakfast and it had all your basic and typical hotel prices.  Pool is a good size and was never too busy.

title: Great hotel!
review: Welcome to “Our Island” Yes we are always pleased when we are able to share a little of the tranquility we are surrounded by. In some of our lives there are moments when you can choose to pause, life long memories can be revisited and new memories can be made. They are far in-between for most of us, that is why vacations with our family are days cherished. It was gratifying to read your review.

title: Expensive, but First Class All the Way!
review: Just returned from this hotel with my husband & two kids (11 & 9)! What a lovely hotel in a great location. Just far enough from the main bit of Clearwater but near enough you can get to & from the busier bit easily!  Beach was lovely, pool was perfect for the kids to play in, pool bar served great cocktails, & ate in the bistro one night which was good value & decent food! Rooms were a bit on the small side for 4, but not anything that would put me off this hotel - beds were really comfortable!

title: What a fantastic hotel
review: Thank you for your comments, our associates are pleased to provide you with an effortless experience and they are genuinely friendly. They enjoy being here to ensure your stay is the experience you anticipated. Thank you for the kind remarks regarding the cuisine. The Sheraton Sand Key resort is the perfect base, close to many attractions! Clearwater Beach offers plenty of activities to fill your vacation, although you still have the tranquility of “Our Island.” It is a great place to bring the children not so overcrowded that you can lose sight of them. Along with the pool and the beach we supply some fun family games which are perfect for children in that age group. We have Volley Ball, Corn Toss and more. Maybe the next time you could plan on a suite; for the utmost in comfort, we offer 15 suites with private balconies. Boasting spectacular water views in every direction, each suite offers 760 spacious square feet of open space. In addition to a king or two queen-sized Sheraton Sweet Sleeper beds, you’ll find a convenient dining area and a comfortable living area to relax. There is a 65″ flat screen TV with cable access, digital music and movies, a refrigerator and also a sofa with pull-out bed.

title: Great beach but hotel is tired
review: The rates are what they are, but not much in embedded fees. Rooms are VERY clean and comfy. Gift shop, buffet, nice small restaurant, Tiki Bars, and nice snack bar off the pool. Plenty of seating around the pool, and sand (pristine beach area) to have fun on the beach. Make sure you join the Sand Key rewards for points and other amenities. The counter staff, valet staff, and all other staff are helpful and courteous.

title: Very Good Location with Great Service
review: I was at the hotel for a business conference.  The hotel was very neat, clean and the staff quite accommodating.  Everything was convenient from getting in and out of the conference rooms and finding some good food in the hotel restaurants.

title: We will be back
review: We try to ensure that your meetings are impeccably planned and followed up by our experienced Sales Department and that it is done in a warm and comfortable environment. Our associates genuinely care about our guests and enjoy taking care of details that will impact your stay. Our award winning culinary staff truly enjoys wowing our guests with their tasty and creative presentations. We do hope that you might give thought to planning a vacation here at the Sheraton Sand Key next time so you will be able to enjoy “Our Island with no thoughts of business just relaxation ...

title: Terrific hotel
review: Had a relaxing and thoroughly enjoyable stay.  Great hotel that met all our needs. Comfortable room and functional amenities. Nothing fancy but we don't spend time in our room except to sleep.  Lovely view of the harbour so would like a sea and pool view next time but still just fine....who leaves their patio door open anyway in this heat to sit outside? The pool area was good but very overcrowded at times. Pool also a little too warm with so many bodies in it. Families just set up camp for the day around tables and it really looks messy...rather unfortunate for people trying to navigate around the pool area. The hotel might want to think about moving the tables away from pool area.  Maybe make family areas with shade.  We spent a lot of time in the ocean. First time in the…

title: Paradise welcomes you!
review: Welcome to our tropical paradise, beautiful beaches and breath taking views make for ultimate relaxation therapy. Yes this time of the year it is hot and the pool does get crowded. If you are looking for a breeze there is usually one to be found here as we are between the Gulf and Intercostal. Being on an Island inspires the imagination. The long walks take you away from the business of the noise of traffic and everyday life. There is nothing but the Gulf, the sound of the waves crashing onto the sand, the birds and Dolphins at play. That is what you call true relaxation therapy. Riding the trolley and is fun, safe and stress free especially when you have plenty of time to explore. It is gratifying to read that your experience with our associates was very positive. Their concern is for your satisfaction and their attention to detail is obvious and shows that they genuinely care. I have shared your idea about the family area. I have also shared your comment on the musty smell with the Director of Housekeeping, It is being addressed. We do hope you will return soon.

title: Great stay!
review: Great location at the beach in Sand Key.  Staff is very helpful (extra hangers arrived at our room in minutes...)  The building itself is quiet (you don't hear doors shutting, elevators, the AC's are quiet, the dresser drawers close slowly, etc.)  It's outside of the main beach, but have direct access to a great beach. Note: the beach is about a 5 minute walk across the sand from the hotel.

title: Nice Stay
review: We stayed for 2 nights over Memorial Day weekend. Room was nice and clean, and the air worked well despite it being very hot outside. We traveled with 2 young children who both loved the pool area. It also has a toddler pool. The beach is nice, and has a fairly gradual increase in depth as you get further away from the shore. The beach is a bit of a walk from the hotel and pool area, but is manageable. Overall we liked the hotel and would stay again if in the area.

title: Healinghands7
review: Our goal is to provide you with a effortless experience throughout your stay, I am pleased we did so. This is a great place for families; with sandcastles and collecting shells and lots of exploring. It is a place that can defiantly inspire a child's imagination especially if they catch a sighting of the pirate ship or Dolphins at play. Being on the Island of Sand Key our beach is a is large and a walk to the waters edge. It is away from the hotel and the outside world, a place for memories to be made. We hope you will revisit us again ... their is much more in the area to explore and more memories to be made.

title: Small but Fantastic Upgrade
review: The hotel is very comfortable and in a beautiful setting. The concierge staff and front desk staff have gone out of their way to be of assistance to us. There are 3 friends traveling with me and we all recommend using this hotel if you are going to stay in the Clearwater area

title: 4 due to pool is puny for size of hotel (390 rooms)
review: Thank you for visiting “Our Island” uncrowded beaches with breathtaking sun sets and beautiful views. Relaxing on our tranquil island or experiencing activities on Clearwater Beach is always a better experience when shared with friends. Our associate’s favorite part of interacting with our guests is that they have empowerment to take initiative to make decisions that will make our guests stay memorable. It is always a delight to read that they succeed in making your experience just what you anticipated. We are aware how many options there are in the area for lodging so we greatly appreciate your business! We are eager for a return visit.

title: Nice Hotel
review: We stayed at the hotel during a tropical storm as a sold out situation!  We were in room 243 (after booking the cheapest room possible).  It was a small, but fantastic upgrade- thanks Jane! It was a corner room with a balcony and a partial ocean view.  Also, it was next to the not often used stairway that led straight down to the beach and pool area! Antony (bellman) showed us that little tip! Cheryl (housekeeping) was very kind and helpful as well.  Staff and facilities were great--looked like restaurants were always packed, but we ventured out so didn't try them.  Only drawback is that the bathroom and rooms are a bit dated and there was an issue with water pressure.  We throughly enjoyed ourselves and would love to stay again!

title: Family-friendly beach hotel
review: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort for a business conference. We were very impressed with all the meals provided during the conference, along with the fun snack breaks, such as a the strawberry shortcake bar and the ice cream social.   The meeting rooms were beautiful and lovely to stay in all day.   In terms of our room, I was happy with the bed and the overall design/layout. There were some scuffs on the walls, but I think that is expected with this type of hotel.   We got to enjoy the pool and beach, which were both a lot of fun! The biggest takeaway I can share about this hotel is that it's very family friendly. The pool was filled with children all day long.

title: Great Hotel
review: Great experience! Very friendly staff. The pool area is not crowded as it is with other hotels in the area. Very clean also. Outstanding place to host a conference. The smoked salmon salad in the Island Grille was my favorite dish. Will be back soon.

title: Excellent Place to Stay
review: Perfect! We are uniquely qualified to welcome you and make you feel right at home - whether you're staying with us for business or leisure. We're always working on new ways to better care for you. Once you get on the Island of Sand Key you leave all that commercial stuff that clutters life behind and reminds us of the beauty of nature that surrounds us. It is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service. It seem as if we succeeded in ensuring your experience was what you anticipated.

title: as good as the visit the year before
review: This was my first time to Florida and I was not disappointed. The hotel was modern, clean, and well staffed. There were families everywhere, which was indicative of a safe area. The focal point of the hotel is the pool/beach access. I spent most of my time at the beach, which is a short walk from the hotel. The beach was clean and sparsely populated at the time we were there. The hotel is next to a nice park as well.   We came for a conference and were impressed with the facilities. There is a trolley that connects with the city and attractions that comes to the front door of the hotel. I felt like I wasn't missing anything on the night I didn’t venture into town because of the multitude of eating/entertainment options on site.   I would totally recommend this location to anyone…

title: Sheraton Sand Key Resort - First-time stay won't be the last time
review: Everything about this hotel was superb. Clean rooms, friendly staff. Set well  back from the road,  and lovely pool area overlooking the beach. You are given two fresh bottles of water free each day. You do have to pay $1 for a local phone call, but that is nothing to moan about. Our beds had fresh sheets every other day, and the pillowcases were changed each day. Rustys restaurant  had specials on most evenings. We had one and for $15.99 including a glass of wine. It was very good value., and delicious. The service was superb. The only blip was some people were smoking on the loungers on the grass area, by the pool. There were tables by the hedge with ash trays, but no real notice up to say actually where the smoking area was. It just said, "no smoking" around the pool area.…

title: Hotel on the beach
review: Lovely stay.  Great to walk out of the hotel right on to the beach and paddle. Rather a small swimming pool but with the beach so handy its not a problem. We had to ask to change our room as someone had been smoking in it and this was done with the minimum of fuss. Trolley bus stops at the hotel for journeys into the center of Clearwater and it is reasonably priced, especially if you are a Senior Citizen when the cost is US$2.50 for a day ticket!!!   Across the road is a row of shops and restaurants and a deli which are very good and give you many food options. Note:  Free internet is only available in the lobby.

title: Better than I expected
review: It is delightful to read that your experience was all that was what you anticipated. I thank you for your accurate review. Being on the Island of Sand Key our beach is large and a walk to the water’s edge. If you are a beach person this is the perfect place to be; collecting shells, just taking in the view or relaxing. It is away from the Hotel and the outside world and definitely gives you a true Island experience. Happiness can be as simple as a day at the beach.  We do have a no smoking policy, unfortunately some people disregard the rules. I am pleased that we had a room that we could reassign you to. Riding the trolley is stress free, inexpensive and fun to ride.  We do hope you will return for another beach get- away soon.

title: Wonderful Week at the Sheraton
review: Last weekend I stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key with a friend for the weekend. We got a great deal--especially for Clearwater Beach--on the hotel and wanted a hotel that had beach access. We had originally booked the Marriott across the street, but then quickly cancelled once we realized it did not have direct beach access. After we arrived at the Sheraton and saw the Marriott, we were glad we had cancelled it. The Sheraton was much nicer looking and showed less wear and tear on the outside. The rooms were better than I expected, but the bathroom definitely could use an update and retile. In any case, they upgraded our room to a pool view and ocean view, which was better than our parking lot expected view we had booked. (I guess it pays to be a SPG member--this is the second time…

title: Great stay. Great resort
review: It is very satisfying to hear that your expectations were fulfilled during your stay and that we were able to upgrade your room based on your SPG membership. We hope you will have an opportunity to return in the near future!

title: Traveling on crutches ... A breeze at the Sheraton Sand Key!
review: This was such a nice place to stay.  The view from our room was simply beautiful, the on property restaurants were very good, and this hotel has such a friendly staff.  I would make sure to ask for pool side for the best choice for a great view.     Also, the catering for cocktail parties has excellent appetizers and excellent wait staff!

title: Beautiful location - even more beautiful beach!
review: My girlfriend and I booked a two week trip to Florida last year. We were already spending 10 days at a condo in Kissimmee. But the lady wanted to make the most of it and spend 3 days elsewhere. She chose Clearwater and she does make really good choices.  We arrived at the hotel (we rented out a 2016 Ford Mustang Convertible at the airport) and the room we were staying was just lovely. We didn't realise we had booked a twin bedroom, but was fine.  The hotel itself is very swanky and it is ideally located about 200 yards walk from the coast. It has a nice size pool with plenty of loungers to choose from. We took a walk around the area to see what was available. Found somewhere to have breakfast the next day and took a nice long walk along the beachfront. It really is a sandy white…

title: Amazing location - Hotel does not make the most of it
review: Hotel does not make the most of this amazing location  - Bar and Restaurant internal facing - no view of the sea and white beaches. Pool side café and bar shut early Breakfast very poor value for money - go across the road to the Marriott amazing food better service and a good view for the same price.

title: AMAZING!!!!
review: We didn't even leave the facility until the last day. Pool and Ocean view from the balcony! Restaurants were well priced and great food!  Drinks by the pool/sea, amazingly good, priced well and perfect! Very clean, well kept and Very nice people working and visiting!  Will definitely go back again! We now know why others are repeat customers!!!!!

title: 30th Wedding Anniversary.
review: The wife and I celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary at the Sheraton Hotel at Sand Key Resort which was very pleasant. We had spent the previous week in Davenport in a two bedroom condo and did all the parks without the kids. Then we drove to the Sheraton for a relaxing week before returning to the UK. The hotel is small building located between a large block of condo's and the country park. The hotel has it own private beach which had beautiful white sands. Our room overlooked the tennis courts, but had great views of the country park and the sea. The room was small compared to the condo we had the previous week. But the king size bed made up for the room size. Disputes that, the room was well maintained and kept very clean by the staff. The sports bar and snack bars served…

title: Fantastic Anniversary Getaway
review: It is gratifying to read that you chose the Sheraton Sand Key for your 30th anniversary. So pleased your experience was just as you anticipated. Enjoying relaxing days sitting around the pool and enjoying the evenings on tropical beach with stunning sunsets. Our “Sweet Sleeper” beds are comfortable and a perfect way to end a busy day. The exceptional service and personal touches that our associates give our guests demonstrate our commitment to turning everyday moments into memorable experiences. They work efficiently to ensure your time inside to be as comfortable as outside. I am pleased you enjoyed most of our culinary options and apologize that you felt the main dining room was too costly. We do look forward to your next stay.

title: A beautiful hotel
review: The Sheraton Sand Key Resort is beautiful. The views are amazing. The rooms were clean and well maintained. The staff could not have been more helpful.   My only negative is the beach. First of all it is 1/4 mile from the hotel which makes it a little inconvenient. They do have a golf cart which will drive you to the beach. When you want to return, you have to walk to a kiosk and ask them to call and then wait for the cart. The staff was very helpful in this area and did as much as they could to make this painless. Also, the beach is very rocky as well as the walk into to the water.  I did have a wonderful vacation.

title: NIce resort but a long walk to the beach
review: You are correct the views are amazing whether you are looking out upon the Gulf of Mexico with miles of sand, blue skies, birds flying or Dolphins playing. Or you might be in the middle of the Sand Key Bridge looking at the beautiful view of boats and small islands below. Two things determine the size of sand on beaches: the energy (height) of the waves, and the size of the material furnished to the beach. Other things being equal, the higher the average waves on a beach, the coarser the sand. This is because higher waves tend to move the smaller grains of fshore to quieter water. Dune sand is consistently finer grained than the adjacent beaches even though the dune sand is derived from winds blowing across the beach. The difference in size is due to the fact that winds generally only pick up and carry the finer grains of beach sand and leave the heavier, larger sand grains behind. It is rewarding to read that your experience was what was anticipated mostly. We look forward to your next visit.

title: Good for families or conferences
review: We stayed here in late April. Our room overlooked the pool and we could see the sunset from our balcony. The pool area is nice with plenty of lounge chairs. They provide towels and there is a bar and a separate outdoor restaurant if you want a drink or a meal around the pool. The only draw back was the long walk to the beach. Although the hotel is on the gulf there is a long expanse of sand before you get to the water. There are beach chairs, umbrellas and other items available once you get to the beach and the water is usually calm and clear it's just that you have to walk over a desert to get there. They do have a golf cart that goes back and forth but I do not know if they offer guests a ride.

title: A Great Family Hotel on Beautiful Clearwater Beach
review: If you have young children and looking for a good value hotel with pool and beach then the Sheraton in Clearwater is worth considering. Alternatively good for conferences. If you are looking for a restful time lying by the pool then stay clear. It has kids at the pool playing noisily from early morning into early evening. They clearly love the pool here but not great if you don't enjoy that noise or want to be able to enjoy the pool. It is less full of kids and families on the beach, possibly as it is (as other reviewers have noted)  couple of hundred metres walk to the shore - and umbrellas and chairs cost around $25 to hire. Many of the rooms have interconnecting doors to cater for families so also check on that if you want to avoid noise. There are also large conferences here…

title: Clean and Beautiful Hotel
review: We just stayed there one night to visit some friends who live nearby. The reservation was made without very high expectations but we were very pleasantly surprised. From the moment that we were checked at the parking lot entrance to the time that we checked out the following morning, not a single thing went wrong. This is an older hotel which appears to have been recently renovated. While it still has the layout of an older hotel, i.e. small bathrooms, we found it extremely comfortable. The rooms and common areas were tastefully decorated, the beds extremely comfortable with high thread count sheets, nice feather pillows. Raquel from room service happily brought us our steaming hot milk in the morning. The valets were very "can do" in parking and retrieving our car. In short, no…

title: Great sunset
review: We booked a week to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. The room was nice had a good view of the gulf, the staff are very helpful and the hotel has 3 good restaurants and and outside bar. Plenty of sun beds and tables you can also get a ride to the beach. The sunset is worth staying on the beach for.

title: Best Vacation Ever!
review: Girls week!  Beautiful resort, right on the beach, courteous staff, nice pool, hot tub, tiki bar, fire pit.  Beautiful weather all week.  What could be better?  A mustang convertible!  Great time all week long.

title: Resort style hotel, incredible property
review: I cannot imagine having more fun than time spent with a friend on vacation at the beach; driving around in a mustang convertible with the top down looking at the sites. Hanging out at the pool, enjoying the hot tub. Relaxing on the beach and discussing life. Ending a beautiful night under the stars with a friend sitting around the fire pit with a cocktail sharing new memories and planning your next trip. Hurry back!!!

title: Nice hotel, great beach
review: The hotel itself is a bit older, with very traditional (a little dated) rooms, however, the location and the beach are the main event, so much can be forgiven. The staff is friendly and excellent, and there are many amenities and facilities on premises.

title: Totally amazing and unexpected resort
review: The hotel is very nice with comfortable beds.  It's across the street from a strip mall with restaurants and shops including a deli/convenience store with outdoor seating on Clearwater Bay.  It is a hike to get out to the beach like other reviewers have said, but the sand is hard and it's not really a problem.  A drink cart comes along with cocktails and snacks and there are waverunners and kayak rentals right next to the hotels beach area.  Unfortunately, the umbrellas are $25/day but I would say that's the only negative for this property.

title: Nice Getaway
review: We found the hotel very nice, clean, bed was comfy, breakfast buffet met my expectations. Very family friendly so if you're annoyed by children, skip this hotel. I mostly wanted to comment on the walk from the hotel to the beach. I was apprehensive that it would truly be a hike to the beach based on the reviews I had read. I'm astonished about how many reviewers complained about a very easy, brief walk. The only scenario which this short jaunt would be problematic is if you had an injury making walking difficult or for the elderly. Don't let this "harrowing trek" deter you. It's not that far.

title: Relax
review: We loved the Sand Key Resort!  we got there early but we were able to go to the pool to relax.we got the room key before 3:00 pm. Beds are very comfortable! Great beach and pool. Very good food. I can't wait to go back!

title: Sun, Sand, Pool
review: Stayed April 2016 for a week. Good location. Beach was quite a walk from hotel  across sand, so we spent more time at pool.   Liked nearby shopping and especially liked how close the "Columbia" restaurant was - great food n atmosphere there. Hotel food average except for dinner in main dining room Rusty's Bistro at night - great food and presentation.  Average room - we overlooked the tennis courts and far away was the beach. Tennis court view was quiet but at this time of year we missed the sunsets. Sun set a little too far south behind a part of the hotel that was a little closer towards the beach.   Housekeeping did a nice job and when we asked for a few more towels they had them in the room each day. Of course we left a tip each day as we left so I think that helps.  Not…

title: Great location. Bit pricey
review: Big rooms small bathroom great location! I wish the pool area was bigger and the bar there too. The beach is spectacular. The walls are thin as I could hear neighbors and everyone walking down the hall. A little expensive but great spot on the beach with live music at the pool.

title: Its a 4 Star Hotel with 6 Star service!!!!!
review: From the moment we checked in I had a feeling the service was going to shine! From the ladies at the front desk to Jerry the great front desk MGR everyone was onboard the great service train!!!!! The room was ok, the Hotel was a little old and showing some wear, but was still very nice. They had he water of unexpectantly for over an hour but were downstairs handing out free bottled water and apologizing profusely! Everyone from housekeepers to maintenance people would ask you if you were having a good time. The restaruant hosts and the wait staff were fabulous! They had cabanas at the beach and a very nice gal deliverring food and drinks all day. The pool staff from the towel boys to the barenders were fantastic. If you reported a problem or needed something it was taken care of…

title: Clearwater Trip
review: We visited the Sheraton Sand Key with our two 20+ sons. It is a very nice hotel on a beautiful private beach. Pool area is nice with a good sized hot tub. Pool is a little small for the size of the hotel. The people working at the pool are top notch, especially Noah who drove us to the beach to see an amazing sunset. The corn toss and volleyball are great for families with older kids. The fire pit is a relaxing way to end the night. The rooms are clean and the views are great. There is also a great club called Shepards only about a mile away for the 21+ crowd. Only a few negatives-bathrooms are really small but the sink is right outside and allows one person to get ready without the steam from the shower. The Do Not Disturb signs do not stay on the door the hotel should consider…

title: Really nice!
review: Very clean, good location, nice size pool area. Right on the beach. There is a little strip mall close by with nice restaurants for breakfast. Hotel also has restaurants & reasonably priced. Definitely would go back.

title: Exceeded Expectations
review: Thank you for your review. I am pleased you enjoyed the location and the property. Beautiful views, relaxing around the pool and just enjoying time away from the everyday world. There are many great places to dine, shop and enjoy. We look forward to another visit from you in the near future,

title: We met a lovely couple who stayed at hotel every year for over 30 years and i understand why.
review: I was concerned since it was my first trip to the area and didn't really know where to stay. The reviews are mixed but I have to say it was a pleasure. We picked the perfect time of the year. Staff was super friendly & helpful. Rooms are clean & the beds are awesome. Yes the bathroom is small but I'm in the room to sleep & shower not hang out in the bathroom. Two vanities outside the shower made it perfect for 2 people to get ready at the same time. Loved the fire pit in the evening & the beach is awesome. Yes it's a long walk but the staff is eager to give you a ride. I enjoyed the walk & the privacy of it. $25 a day for the chair & umbrella rental. Well worth it to have everything taken care of.  You can come & go & the rental is good until 6:00 pm. Hopped the Jolly Trolley…

title: Ok
review: Staff where lovely and we felt very welcome despite not being American and having a  couple of teenagers-one being in a wheelchair. Very inclusive-staff happily sorted out lift for pool and beach chair.My daughter really enjoyed picking up sea shells after a very rare storm. Wish we could have spent more time in the bar etc as food was lovely and local ale very nice.However we were able to take food upstairs .Sunsets were amazing and used to get a round of applause.Loved the hotel and would happily go back every year just like the lovely American coupe.Just the place to stay after a manic theme park experience.

title: Awesome Hotel
review: This location has everything you need from a private beach to multiple restaurant choices on property.  It's also just minutes away from Clearwater beach and easily accessible via a short trolley ride over the bridge.  The views are great in all directions but if at all possible ask for a room facing the pool/ocean.  Other amenities include a fire pit and multiple outdoor bars.  There is also a beverage vehicle that serves the beach.  My only caution is the walk to the ocean is a couple hundred yards so don't go barefoot!

title: Beautiful Place to Stay
review: So pleased that your stay was successful. Our Island is the perfect place for some relaxation therapy. You certainly can experience Mother Nature at her best; sparkling waters of the Gulf of Mexico, the uncrowded beaches of Sand Key. You can catch a ride to and from the shore just make arrangements with one of our pool attendants. Dolphin sightings, shell collecting or just lounging by the pool. This area truly showcase Florida’s natural beauty! Nesting turtles, eagles in flight, and more than 50 native birds can be found by just taking a few minute walk to Sand Key Park, which also provides perfect running and nature trails. Spending quality time with your friends and family does not have to end as soon as the sun goes down. Enjoy our outdoor fire pit, it is great to prolong outdoor activities into the evening. The Trolley’s let you get around stress free. We want to ensure that we provide a warm and comfortable environment here inside the Sheraton Sand Key also. Our associates genuinely care about our guests and enjoy taking care of details that will impact your stay. We hope you will return soon.

title: A Sure Bet
review: This was our second time staying at Sheraton Sand Key.  We love that they are so close to the ocean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Our room was nice and clean. My only criticism is the bathrooms are so small!  The rooms themselves are very spacious. You would think they would have planned the bathrooms to be larger.  Other than that it is wonderful!  Ask for a room on the gulf side. They may be more expensive, but worth it for the view especially at night when the sun sets.

title: Nice view but..
review: The Sea, once it casts its spell, holds one in its net of wonder forever. You don’t need much to enjoy a day at the beach. Clear skies, warm weather, cool breezes not too many people and liberal amounts of sunscreen – that’s about it. It’s here that you can tune out the world, your worries and your obligations and just reflect. The hotel was built in the 70’s and that was the style of bathrooms at the time. I agree that the design of the bathroom needs to be addressed. We are unable to change the size and lay out of the bathrooms due to losing space in the sleeping area. We are always looking into workable solutions. I hope this is just the start of many visits and we look forward to seeing you again.

title: Nice Stay
review: Typical of a quality hotel.  All accomodations were just fine. Room was as expected.  Great exercise facility.  Breakfast was ordinary for a hotel restaurant.  Nice pool and beach area.  Just be careful at  which time of the year you make a reservation.  We were there in May 2016 and tons and tons of families with kids.  If you have kids that is just a great place.  Nice pool and beach area.  Driving through Clearwater is a nightmare so allow enough time to get to the hotel.

title: Definition of average
review: First and foremost, the rooms were clean.  That's very important, but nothing else special at all about hotel.  No valet, and hard to find parking.    Want to use a beach chair?  It'll cost you about $25/day even if you would like to use it for just an hour.  All in all this is more of a hotel than a resort.   Valet usually isn't a huge issue, but it's a large property and their lot was very full.  They also do not have enough front desk people.  25 min to check in is too long.    Rooms are good but you can tell the building is old.  Pretty loud in the rooms.  You can hear doors closing and your neighbors.

title: Awesome place to stay!
review: We always appreciate when our guests take the time to share their concerns with us so we can continue to improve our service and focus on these issues. I am pleased that you found the hotel to be clean. It is unfortunate that your impression of our resort was not as you had expected nor what we had intended. We have noted your comments regarding your arrival experience to the hotel and would like to apologize for the check-in time. You are correct we do not have Valet Parking although if the occasion arises where there is no place to park the Bellman would be pleased to park your car for you. The hotels in the area charge a nightly resort fee. We do not charge a resort fee and only charge for amenities used such as the Cabanas. The Cabanas do not belong to the hotel they are a concession so we do not set the prices. We do ensure the prices are in line with other cabana concessions in the area. I apologize for the noise we do try to control that without offending our guests. We do want you to have a relaxing stay and I realize that all that noise is a distraction. We will do our  utmost to better meet your expectations next time given a chance.

title: All around, amazing resort
review: We stayed here for 1 week and had a great time. Great friendly staff, nice room and good restaurants on site. Would highly recommend the chicken and bow tie alfrado at the mainstay tavern. Views were nice all around, pool was great and ocean was clear! Will stay here again.

title: Stay here!
review: We are delighted that your stay was a great experience. Rest assure that is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service.  It is gratifying to read that your experience here with us was very positive. The view is beautiful and hopefully you were able to see one of our breathtaking sunsets. The beaches on Sand Key are known to be exceptional; our beach is private, clear skies, warm weather, cool breezes not too many people and liberal amounts of sunscreen. It is a great place to be lost in your own thoughts, read a book or just enjoy the people you are with. Pleased you enjoyed our talented culinary staff. Afterwards gathering around the fire pit sharing old memories and making new ones. We hope you will choose us again for our next beach get-away.

title: Great!
review: My entire stay here was great. Every staff person that I interacted with were kind and knowledgeable. Neither my partner or I had ever been to Florida and everyone was kind in giving ideas for us to visit. They even provided umbrellas to us the one day it rained on our trip. The hotel was also kept really clean. The restaurant was also really great! The food was delicious and the waiters were really friendly.

title: excellent place for families or couples
review: We were very impressed with the hotel and the staff. The room was clean and updated. the pool had plenty of chairs and shade if we wanted it. It was unusual that the beach front was very far from the hotel but this was created by a natural phenomenom out of their control and not all that bad.

title: Love
review: The beach is a bit of a walk; 0.25 miles or around a 5-7 minute walk. Clearwater and Sand Key are known for their exceptional beaches. You get a true Island experience. When the hotel was built the beach was much closer to the hotel, then the Sand Key jetty was built in 1975. Since then sand has been washed in a southerly direction which has caused a wide beach. It is always a delight to read that our associates succeed in making your experience just what you anticipated. Our guests’ satisfaction is our number one priority, and we are happy to hear your expectations were always met. We look forward to a return visit.

title: Small rooms, even smaller bathrooms, and a LONG walk to the actual beach
review: Great service, bell hops, front desk, even towel desk. Very friendly. Love the walk to the beach just outside the pool. Love even more the food kart that drives around. After a day or so they even remember what you like.

title: Comfortable 4 star hotel with great staff
review: Our associate’s goal is to be attentive to your every need and to provide our guests with a memorable and enjoyable experience from start to finish. They truly are genuinely friendly and enjoy assisting you in having the experience you anticipated. Whether you're looking for a peaceful, relaxing vacation or a fun-filled family getaway, we provide the perfect setting; beautiful beaches, breathtaking views, quiet walks along the shore or just napping on the beach.  We will share your comment with Debbie who drives the food kart. We are thrilled your vacation was one to remember and hope to see you again soon!

title: Very nice hotel
review: The pictures looks beautiful!  But I wasn't impressed at all when we got there.  The main lobby is extremely disappointing.  It looked like what you would expect at a very plain cheap hotel.  The main restaurant in the middle of the hotel was like a Denny's.  The pool area was nice but nothing like a resort feel.  And you can't even see the water from the pool!  It was so FAR away and a long, long walk to get there!  I mean we just got back ( May 2, 2016) and it was not hot.  I can't imagine when it's blazing hot how you can walk on that hot sand all the way to the beach.  Once there, if you need to go to the bathroom, or get a drink,expect a long walk back.  I like hotels ON THE BEACH where you can at least see the water from the pool.  So I didn't like it and won't return.  Oh…

title: A great fit for families, couples and groups!
review: When walking through these doors, stress just floats away and the whole relaxed, beach fun vibe takes over. We've been going here for years, sometimes with the kids and their cousins, and sometimes just as a couple. Either way, you can't beat it. The rooms are spacious, nicely decorated and have great views. I love sitting on the balcony and reading while watching what is going on at the beach or pool. There a small strip mall across the street where you can go to shop and eat, or the food at the hotel is fantastic. The pool cafe has great food too. The beach is lovely! Walking in any direction will take you on fun excursions. Staff are wonderful and many have been there for years. There's a whole family feel going on, and I highly recommend it. If you want to leave the beach,…

title: Fantastic
review: An excellent hotel , superb restaurants serving delicious food and great wine  Lovely pool bar , a nice big swimming pool with a kids pool  Leads straight onto a white sand beach and then straight into a clear blue sea  Easy to get out and about , plenty of places to go that are walkable  An ideal holiday venue or a great way to unwind after visiting Disney

title: Close to the clearwater beach
review: Some Staff members were Unpleasant.  bathrooms are very small . pool is very small for such an enormous hotel. Had dinner at the restaurant rusty 30.00 for the worst salmon dinner ever it took an hour to be ready and it was cold breakfast buffet 17.95 per person 5.99 for children 6 and up it was horribly very bland not fresh and again cold first and last time I stay here.

title: A great stay!
review: I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel given some of the mixed feedback I read on here before my stay.  My mom and I just visited for a girls getaway before my baby comes (I'm 7 months pregnant) and we're looking for something nice and relaxing.    No this hotel is not the Ritz but we didn't pay or except that.  I found the hotel to be very nice and clean and rooms were not outdated for a Sheraton.  My husband and I travel a ton and are Starwood members and usually stay in the higher end hotels and I was 100% happy with our choice of the Sheraton.  The staffs service was great, the food pretty good, the beach was very nice and so was the pool area.  We enjoyed the fire pit since nights were cool.  We didn't think the pool area or beach were too crowded and were very happy…

title: This is a long, detailed and honest review. Be prepared.
review: FYI: We traveled with my parents on this trip. It was our One Year anniversary and my parents came with us to visit my in-laws, who live in Clearwater.  When we arrived at the hotel (around 9:30am), we were given a room with a view of the roof and my parents had a view of the parking lot. My husband and I made a trip to the front desk to meet a very unfriendly woman with horrible people/customer service skills. She explained that because I didn't book the room directly thru the hotel, we were given "street views". After much cajoling (as it was our 1 year anniversary), we were going to be moved to be given a view of the tennis courts. She said the rooms would be ready shortly and would we mind waiting, as they were currently cleaning the rooms. I told her it was fine (thinking…

title: 3rd Spring Break Vacation at Sand Key
review: We had a wonderful time on spring break during late March in '14, '15 and '16. Great domestic 4 star facility, wonderful staff, insightful concierge, helpful transport firm, ideal gulf shore location, miles of beach, trolleys running the island and tons of restaurants to explore. It's why we go back. This time we spent time out on the bay, did not use the club room but used on site restaurants. Weather was mid 70's with mild breezes from the gulf. In summer we head north, in fall we head east, but in spring we head south. No need for a condo rental here, it's all good.

title: Disappointed
review: Your loyalty is very important to our resort and to Starwood Hotels, we thank you. It is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service.  It is gratifying to read that your experience with our associates was very positive. Their concern is for your satisfaction and their attention to detail is obvious and shows that they genuinely care. Hopefully you were able to see one of our breathtaking sunsets, enjoy some beach time and maybe enjoy a evening around new fire pit You are correct there is much to explore and it is the perfect place to relax and enjoy the weather and all Mother Nature has to offer..

title: Fantastic
review: We booked this "resort" because of their website, Yelp, and other reviews... Sadly, this so called resort is a disappointment!   When we booked this hotel, the website lead us to believe that there were banana boat rentals, parasailing, jet skis and kayak rentals all on site.    The website lists this:  "Pool & Beach Fun We take beach and poolside vacationing to a whole new level. In fact, you could spend your whole day from your new home base – a comfy chaise lounge on our beachfront pool deck! With scrumptious light fare from our Poolside Café and signature cocktails from our Turtle Bar just steps away, there’s no need to go anywhere else. Spectacular sunset included, free of charge! Beach tennis and volleyball Jet-ski water adventures Parasailing, kayak, and banana boat…

title: Wonderful location, great hotel!
review: It was a great stay!! Everything was good the breakfast buffet was amazing!!! The staff are very helpful. No need to leave the resort. Got engaged there and plan on returning to have my wedding there as well!!!

title: Great location, wonderful beach and pool, rooms need update
review: This is a perfect place for a wedding; we have had many outstanding comments over the years on weddings that have taken place here at the Sheraton Sand Key. Of course your wedding needs to be your vision; it needs to be as unique as you both. Your wedding venue can be an expression of who you are as a couple, it needs to be memorable event. Please accept our Congratulations!!! I am sure Amanda Nowell our wedding coordinator could help you plan that wedding of your dreams. Our associates are commitment to providing you and all our guests with the service levels and recognition you deserve and expect. They are empowered to take initiative to make decisions that will enhance your experience with us. We look forward to years of visits.

title: Busy hotel with a tropical feel and gorgeous quiet beach. A wonderful find and left me wanting to come back.
review: Very impressed at this hotel . I am so glad I decided to avoid the "strip of Clearwater" way too busy for my taste.   This hotel is set in a residential area which is very immaculate and quiet.  Check in was easy , staff was ok but nothing amazing .  I had a premium ocean view of pool and huge sand key beach .Floor six.  Room was clean and the beds were honestly the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. I agree with others that the bathroom is small , but it's workable.  The pool is very busy with a lot of traffic in and out. I think a lot of people use this pool that are not staying at this resort . I over heard a woman saying she was staying at the Marriott across the way , but liked looking at the beach.  (The Marriott from the outside looked dumpy and old. I peeked over…

title: Very poor service, good location, nice beach
review: Thank you for your comments, our associates are pleased to provide you with an effortless experience and they are genuinely friendly. They enjoy being here to ensure your stay is the experience you anticipated. I am so pleased that you enjoyed the view it is so serene it brings a calmness. Tropical views, beautiful sunsets, maybe Dolphins at play or just uninterrupted time with your own thoughts. The Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed is found in each of our guest rooms and is comprised of luxurious sheets, a deluxe duvet, a selection of feather down and hypoallergenic pillows, and a custom mattress. All were chosen with your comfort in mind. It sounds as if this was the experience you anticipated. We're always working on new ways to better care for you, return soon.

title: Perfect
review: 1) we requested a king bed and received two queens (made it tough with a crib) 2) ROOM NOT READY BY PROMISED 3PM!  NONE AVAILABLE FOR REGULAR CHECK-IN.  3) then called a room overlooking roof away from ocean with noisy industrial AC unit a gold upgrade 4) would not offer a late check out 5) waited until almost checkout to share feedback with front desk and manager simply looked at me and said "sorry", nothing else.   I was embarrassed to take my wife here. Headed to St. Petersburg Hilton this morning for a consistent experience.  I'm a SPG gold member and don't need special treatment, just want a hotel to treat me like a welcome guest.   P.S. Please mitigate rust issues in bathroom.

title: Sheraton Sand Key is a gem
review: It was the 4th time that stayed in this hotel and again everything was as expected!👍 this time we had room with ocean view(606 😜)  There is a really good restaurant in the basement it calls Rustys. Breakfast for 25$ and diner changed every evening!

title: A place to rest your head.......
review: We are aware how many options there are in the area for lodging so we greatly appreciate your repeat business! So pleased that your experience was what was anticipated. It is truly paradise when you awaken to a beautiful and peaceful view. Rusty’s Bistro is an award winning restaurant with a very talented culinary staff. We will look for a return visit soon.

title: Good hotel with a few issues
review: We stayed 3 nights at the Sheraton Sand Key in April.  As others have said the bedrooms in this hotel are dated and in need of a major renovation.  Bathrooms are very small.  Having said that the beds were comfortable and everything worked well.  We were given the most awful room in the hotel (309) and asked to change.  We were continually told that no other room was available.  If you are offered this room I would suggest that you refuse it - we had a glorious view of the AC ducts and were unable to use the balcony because of the horrendous noise that it made.  The pool is far too small for the number of people staying in this resort, and they have a significant issue with the reservation of sun beds.  We were in the pool at 9am, first people to actually be swimming and the…

title: Beach WOW!
review: We are constantly renovating to ensure the hotel is kept updated and that you are you are as comfortable as possible. I apologize that there was no upgrade from a harbor view room available to enhance your stay. I am also sure it was a great disappointment not to be able to sit on your balcony and enjoy the peaceful sounds of Mother Nature. There are certain times of the year when we are fully booked and we do our best to upgrade to the best possible room. The months of March and April are our busiest, and the rooms are booked well in advance.  I do know how frustrating it is to have those sunbeds taken so early in the morning. It actually only happens this time of the year and we continue to look for a solution that will please everyone. I do apologize that the concierge was not better informed as there is so much to explore in the area. I am pleased that you enjoyed the culinary talents of our kitchen staff and you  had a positive dining experience. We look forward to your next stay.

title: Great stay at a Great place
review: We stayed at Sheraton Sand Key as the final hotel in out Titan tour, it did not disappoint, clean, comfortable, everything you need available. Did not use pool, busy area as it was Spring Break, enjoyed lovely walks on the fabulous beach. Fire pit looked great, just a bit too chilly while we were there.
