The Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed is found in each of our guest rooms and is comprised of luxurious sheets, a deluxe duvet, a selection of feather down and hypoallergenic pillows, and a custom mattress. I am pleased you enjoyed those cushy pillows. Nothing like a walk on the beach to sooth the soul, just clearing your mind and enjoying the nature that surrounds us. I shared your comment on the food with our Food and Beverage Director to be reviewed. Please come back to check out our renovated rooms.

title: Love this place!
review: Had a fantastic three night stay over the weekend. We stayed in an ocean view room with a king bed and a great balcony, plus club level access. Friday the weather was pleasant, but Saturday and Sunday were very windy and chilly days, not good for the beach or pool. We made the best of it and the staff throughout the hotel really made our stay so wonderful. Did not meet one person who wasn't super friendly and happy to help. Room was kept very clean during our whole stay. Room size is good, balcony size and furniture good. Bathroom is small. All the standard Sheraton features I am used to were there. The location is fantastic! The pool is a little small, but plenty of pool and beachside seating, which it hadn't been so chilly while we are there, but the pool is heated. Pool bar…

title: Decent hotel
review: It is a bit of a walk to the beach but I don't think its much different from other hotels in the area.  Very friendly staff.  Several different food choices and all pretty good.  Pool is fine.  Perhaps the best hotel gym I have seen.  Room was ok but the bathroom was SHOCKINGLY small..

title: Not such a great experience!
review: Thank you for your comments. We are pleased you recognized our associates as they sincerely enjoy assisting our guests. We greatly appreciate your business! We also appreciate the kind remarks regarding the cuisine. I am pleased you enjoyed our Sheraton Fitness area, the view is breathtaking. We have also looked into several options for re-designing the bathroom, however, we have not found a solution that does not take away from the rest of the room.  Rest assured these items are always on our mind and we do hope that someday we will find an improvement. I do hope you enjoyed the location during your stay.

title: Like Being on a Carnival Cruise
review: We spent two nights here as my husband was here for a work related event.  At check in on the first evening, the front desk supervisor had a bit of an attitude.  We were having the discussion regarding the Delta Mileage program and its relationship to the SPG rewards.  Well she didn't know anything about it and she continued to repeat herself that we needed to pay the extra money to access more out of this hotel.  She missed the point, there wouldn't be a discussion if you were aware of the programs your hotel is involved with.  The hotel is a bit dated.  The hallway carpets have this incredibly outrageous green color, bathroom fixtures are rusted and beds are very soft.  Housekeeping isn't perfect either.  But the worst part is the noise at night that goes on to the wee hours. …

title: Wonderful Beach Wedding
review: Please rest assured that we do take your feedback very serious and that we will do our utmost to better meet your expectations next time given a chance. We have noted your comments regarding the person at the front desk, we have forwarded your remarks to our Director of Guest Services in order to counsel those associates and provide additional training to ensure that this occurrence will not take place again. Our hotel has been on the Island of Sand Key since the 70’s. We are constantly renovating on a regular basis to keep the hotel updated and will continue to do so to fix those worn out areas. Please accept our apologies for the dissatisfaction of the bed during your time spent with us. This is certainly not the Sheraton Sand Key experience we aim to provide our guests and I truly apologize for your experience.  The Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed is found in each of our guest rooms and is comprised of luxurious sheets, a deluxe duvet, a selection of feather down and hypoallergenic pillows, and a custom mattress. Studies have shown that it can be hard for people to adjust to vastly different levels of comfort than they experienced at home. Unfortunately we have no control over the music drifting over from across the intercostal waters, the Clearwater Police were informed of the noise issue. I personally understand how lovely sleeping to the waves hitting the shore can be. I am sure you were disappointed.

title: Spacious beach- good conference venue
review: If you like Carnival Cruise Lines, you will probably like the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  Loud music, very small bathrooms, and poor service were the hallmarks of the stay at this "resort".  Facing the beach gave spectacular views, but music from adjacent club (Shephard's) blasted until after 2am.  Even with the balcony door closed, the music was extremely loud in my room.  In fact, the noise level in the room was louder than at any hotel that I have ever stayed at, and I stay in hotels well in excess of 100 days per year.    While being kept awake was bad, the worst part of this experience was the front desk staff.  On check-in, no one knew about the relationship that Starwood has with Delta.  This partnership has existed for years for Diamond medallion customers of Delta, but…

title: Above and beyond service
review: We went to this resort for our honeymoon and could not have been happier with the hotel, food, drinks, service, and peacefulness.  Upon our arrival we were greated and treated with excellent customer service.  Our room was perfect and very clean.  The private beach is the best part, not crowded at all, well maintained and peaceful.  Yes, you have to pay for chairs and umbrellas but you can lay on the beach with your towel and blankets at no charge.   Not a big deal as i have seen people complain about it.  The pool was usually busy but plenty of chairs in the sun to catch some rays and great poolside bar to grab a drink in the sun.  Rusty's bistro is a great restaurant in the hotel and had excellent food.  The seafood was top notch.  I highly recommend this hotel is youre…

title: thank you
review: You certainly can experience Mother Nature at her best; sparkling waters of the Gulf of Mexico, the large quiet Island beaches of Sand Key, dolphin sightings, shell collecting. Our surroundings truly showcase Florida’s natural beauty! It is a romantic place … perfect for a honeymoon. Our associate’s do all they can to ensure you feel welcomed and right at home. Rusty’s Bistro has a very talented culinary staff it is gratifying to hear you enjoyed your dining experience. We thank you for your recommendations.

title: Not a place I would return to...
review: everything was very good this visit , the room was waiting and very clean, the food in the resturants was very good but more important the courses were served at the right temerature very important to me. also it was very nice to see that the one person on your staff that i always ask for, and go out of my way to say hi to, was reconized for her work. as the employee of the year. she always has a smile for all your guests and makes our stay first class. fi we had our business there she would be working for us. her attitude is natural and you can see that she is sincere, and that is something rare and can not be taught. she should be the employee of the decade. i know this is true for us and i am sure that many of your other guests feel the same. i will continue to visit your…

title: great staff older property
review: Our goal is to provide our guests with a memorable and enjoyable experience from start to finish; first impressions are very important and they start as soon as you arrive. Janet truly enjoys the interaction with her guests. She is an asset to the hotel. I am so pleased that you enjoy her upbeat personality, her genuine smile and her efficiency. It was gratifying that your experience was exactly what you anticipated right down to the temperature of your food.  We hope you will continue your visits to see Janet and enjoy the amenities of the Sheraton Sand Key.

title: Unwanted guest in bed
review: We went there in August for our Anniversary. We live close to Clearwater Beach, but had never stayed at the Sheraton. Our first impression was that it was nice until breakfast. I have never seen a breakfast buffet charge for coffee...to the tune of $5.00 for two cups. Never have I heard of anything like that. Not only that, but the breakfast was quite expensive and not that great. I've had much better and for less money. The walk to the beach 400 yards. This hotel is on Clearwater beach. We were dead tired when we got there. No assistance. The bathroom was so small. A normal size adult had a hard time fitting in. We are not large people, but heaven help anyone over 200 lbs. Needless to say, I will never go back and I highly recommend that people avoid this place at all cost. I…

title: Wonderful staff!
review: My husband and I were in a car accident as we were trying to pull into the hotel parking lot to check in.  A patrol car and a tow truck later, I was a frazzled mess! The front desk staff was very concerned and tried to lift our spirits for the beginning of our weekend vacation. They sent up to our room chilled champagne and chocolate strawberries to help brighten our day! They were instrumental in helping us get a rental car, and we had a great time despite the terrible beginning!  I can't thank the wonderful staff enough!

title: The Best Staff EVER!
review: Recently stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key for an extended weekend. Although the room we had was a bit dated it was clean and very comfortable with a great view of the gulf. The property sits on a wide sandy beach and offers a very nice pool with plenty of chairs and tiki-hut bar. It has an expansive ballroom and comfortable lobby area. But I would have to say the greatest feature of the resort were the people who worked there. Everyone we came in contact with seemed to really enjoy what they were doing and were so very pleasant and outgoing. We had a coupon for breakfast on Sunday that we had inadvertently thrown out, the manager at the restaurant was very accommodating and honored it even though we couldn't show it to her. That is true customer service and really meant a lot to…

title: staff
review: We would greatly appreciate your patronage as a loyal guest of the Sheraton Sand Key and would like to make sure we remain your hotel of choice when visiting our area. We are constantly renovating; we have been here on the Island of Sand Key for over 30 years although you did not find luxury you found comfort and true caring. Our associates are commitment to providing you with the service levels and recognition you deserve and expect.  I have shared your comment on the voucher… sometimes it is the little things that count.

title: A 12 out of 10!
review: I think that someone at your resort should hear that you have a person that works at your ft. desk that should be working anywhere where he does not have to speak with customers or coworkers. he is rude, belittles people, talks down to customers with a take it or leave attitude. what is beyond my belief is that I believe he is part of management. he actually putted in while someone else was helping checking me in. he belittled her and was very unprofessional. I was ready to leave and stay elsewhere, until the lady that was helping us to begin with stood up for herself and he went back to take care of the customer he was working with when he elected to but in where he was not needed. this was how our stay began! Janet finished checking us in and kept telling us how sorry she was…

title: Best of clearwater
review: We have noted your comments regarding your arrival experience to the hotel and would like to apologize for not reaching your expectations. Frist impressions are very important. Concerning the rudeness of the associate; I have forwarded your concerns on to the Director of Guest Services to be addressed and that training can be reviewed and improvements can be made. Thank you so much for taking the time to recognize our outstanding associate “Janet.” You are correct she is a star. Your comment was shared with her and she thanks you. Your loyalty is very important to our resort and to Starwood Hotels. Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback; it is truly appreciated.

title: amazing customer service...
review: i recently stayed at the sheraton sand key and my entire experience was amazing.  I loved the hotel itself, but the customer service was what stood out the most for me.   (well, maybe the unbelievably comfortable king size bed was right there also)... From Chris booking my room (who was extremely helpful and very pleasant to talk to ),  to Sasha ( who makes the best bloody mary ever) at the pool bar, to the front desk staff and the bellmen, to the gift shop staff,  to the bar and the restaurants food and staff, to housekeeping,  to the pool boys and the beach staff...everyone was exceptionally pleasant and very accommodating.  I will definitily be referring this hotel and will definitely be back soon!!  SHERATON SAND KEY  will be my new "go to " place when i need a florida…

title: Lots of Potential
review: I have shared your comments with the associates mentioned. They thank you …Our associate are very caring and genuinely friendly. They truly want to ensure that they are part of what makes your stay a memorable experience. Nothing like a great night’s sleep on The Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed which is found in each of our guest rooms and is comprised of luxurious sheets, a deluxe duvet, a selection of feather down and hypoallergenic pillows, and a custom mattress. Then starting a new day surround with nature on our beautiful beach with a Bloody Mary in hand. Then end the day with an awesome sunset and a stroll along the shore. We thank you for the reference and are pleased to have become your new to go to place in Florida …

title: Nicest staff we have ever dealt woth
review: We were very graciously greeted by staff & our room was very clean .... it looked & smelled clean !! The view was looking over the roof @ the entrance & so even tho' we had a small balcony it was not something we used. The room was well equipped & the bedding was pristine & the king sized bed was very comfortable. Unfortunately the faucet in our tub/shower did not work which we did not discover until the AM & as we were checking out that morning there was no opportunity for either a room change or an adjustment in our payment ..... maybe that will come ????

title: Honeymoon retreat
review: We greatly appreciate your patronage as a loyal guest of the Sheraton Sand Key and would like to make sure we remain your hotel of choice when visiting our area. The Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed is found in each of our guest rooms and is comprised of luxurious sheets, a deluxe duvet, a selection of feather down and hypoallergenic pillows, and a custom mattress. All were chosen with your comfort in mind. I sincerely apologize any inconvenience you were caused due to the faucet.  It is our goal to ensure our guests are compensated in a manner that is equitable when something like this occurs.  Please feel free to send an email to us at mail.reservatins@sheratnsandkey.com so that we can better understand your experience.

title: 6th floor rocked!
review: We had two rooms at resort over the weekend.  The hotel is older hotel and they have done a good job updating it.  Hotel is located between some condos and park.  We we on 8th gulf view.  Good view of beach and park beside hotel.  Upon arrival and thru out our stay the staff at this hotel went above and beyond our expectations.   One example we asked where ice machine was located.  They let us know and then went and got the ice for us.  It is the little things like that that make the difference for us.   We were traveling with 14 month old and they went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of: high chairs without asking complimentary swim diapers for the pool and lots of play toys for the beach.  The one thing holding it back from 5 star is the the constant noise…

title: Excellent Hotel Resort
review: Loverly staff at this resort, Checkin was very efficient. The porter was fantastic happy to tell me all about the hotel facilitates as well has transport all our luggage to our room (Thanks Alan). I really can not say anything negative about the hotel/resort.  Pool was a little small but then the hotel/resort is not that large so all in keeping really. Beach was fantastic and lots of beach/water sports available locally. The sports bar staff were really friendly and made our stay very enjoyable. I can't comment on the hotel food as we always ate out, we just prefer that.  The consierge staff were again excellent recommending restaurants, they also told us about the local bus services and reduced rate taxi service again excellent, and on their recommendation we had a fantastic…

title: Amazing hotel
review: I was pleased that our associates treated you with warmth and the comfort of home on the beautiful Island of Sand Key! We're always working on new ways to better care for you. It sounds like you enjoyed your time in the Mainstay Tavern. I have shared your comments with the appropriated managers. Once you get here it reminds you of the beauty of nature. The sounds and views are so peaceful and serene… how can you do anything but relax? I am sure it was just what was needed after two week in Orlando.

title: Relaxing Beach Location
review: We have just got back from 10 days spent at this fantastic resort.very friendly and knowledgable staff{nothing to much trouble)make good use of the resorts Concierge as it is amazing. Rooms spacious and well equipped(Bed amazing never slept so well in a hotel bed,Pillows like clouds)Food very good and good portions.swimming pool although on the small side very clean and relaxing.(beach towels available at pool side a big plus) Sea and beach a very short walk from rear of hotel and the $27 charge for 2 sun loungers with cushions and parasol well worth the investment to watch dolphins and all kinds of different sea birds.If staying here i would recommend you take full advantage of the Jolly Trolley bus service to local attractions,restaurants,bars,supermarket and night life.  i…

title: Great service, great location
review: Our associates are committed to making your stay a success. They sincerely receive satisfaction from assisting you in enjoying your experience here at the Sheraton Sand Key and the area. The Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed is found in each of our guest rooms and is comprised of luxurious sheets, a deluxe duvet, a selection of feather down and hypoallergenic pillows, and a custom mattress. All of which were chosen for your comfort. The nature that surrounds us does supply wonderful entertainment. Dolphins playing, birds swooping and so much more. We hope you will return again and again.

title: Fabulous location and staff were excellent
review: The hotel is on Sand Key, a beautiful strip of beach just over the bridge from Clearwater Beach resort area.  Since we were there off season and during the week, the hotel and beach were very quiet and we felt like we almost had the place to ourselves.  The hotel has a very nice pool and extended beach area with beautiful views.  Since I am an SPG member, we were upgraded to a room with a gulf front view.  I also got a special advance purchase rate of $149 + tax which was really a great deal especially since there is NO 'resort' fee or extra charge for parking.  The staff was extremely friendly and efficient.  When we first arrived, I called down for an extra robe and corkscrew.  They arrived within minutes.  The beds were extremely comfortable and the room was well laid out. …

title: Nice place
review: We went here for my birthday. They hotel is close to Clearwater beach & Pier 60 activities. The hotel room was nice expect for the bathroom. Sooo tiny that you almost have to walk over the hotel to get into the tub. The pool area was nice but I don't understand why the pool is so tiny when they have so much vacant beach area with nothing on it. The walk to the beach was far and painful. Most of the sand is made up of crushed sea shells. Once you get to the beach, it nice soft sand. My overall thought is that if I am coming to Clearwater, I'll stay at a cheaper hotel because the public beaches are better than the ones at the hotel.

title: Nice hotel, good food, clean and friendly.
review: We appreciate that you chose the Sheraton Sand Key to celebrate and I hope it was an enjoyable birthday. It is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service. I apologize that this was not the experience you anticipated.

title: Pretty nice location
review: I came here for a business event and stayed due to a good rate. The staff was friendly and helpful, and was able to accommodate me with a good room even though we were staying at a discount rate. The room itself was clean, the AC worked beautifully, and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom amenities were awesome. They even provided a shower pouf, which worked because I forgot mine.   One thing I liked about the room - lots of plugs. They even had plugs on the side of the dresser and the nightstand. Two people were able to plug in all their stuff. Much appreciated.   We had a room on the 1st floor by the pool. However, the room was always quiet. The noise did not carry in.   The pool was nice. While we didn't use it, it was clean and well kept. They also had a lot of lounge…

title: Only a 4 based on location
review: It is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service.  It is gratifying to hear that you were pleased with your room and the plugs as we added extra plugs to room a few years ago for just the reason you mentioned. Our associates are genuinely friendly and enjoy assisting you throughout the hotel. Being on the Island of Sand Key our beach is large and a walk to the water’s edge. It is away from the hotel and the outside world and definitely gives you an Island experience. You can ask the pool attendant for assistance to the shore if needed. I will share your comment about the price information on the cabanas.  If you and your Mother were in the same room you are correct, you should be able to have three devices connected, I am sorry for the confusion. We want you to feel at home so you can never stay too long or eat too much. I do hope you will not wait for another business trip to bring you back for another visit

title: Loved the hotel but long walk to the beach.
review: We stayed here on our honeymoon, when we arrived at the hotel it was like a swarm of bees coming after us aka the bell hops.  They were over staffed or something because when we pulled up a swarm of them comes running out and opening the door to our car.  It was a little uncomfortable having them all in your face.  After a 12 hour flight they are the last people you really want to deal with.  When we got there are room that we paid for was not ready yet so the nice lady gave us an free upgrade for the week we were staying there.  We did not even pull the honeymoon card to get it.  After we got our room taken care of I went over  to the bell hop area and picked the one guy that was helping a young couple get directions somewhere, so he was not on of the ones that came at us when…

title: One of my favorite hotels
review: I absolutely love this hotel! My second time here and I look forward to a third if I get down that way again. The staff, housekeeping, grounds keepers, pool, hot tub, constantly we'll kept by the workers. My hat is off to all of you!

title: Great stay on the Gulf
review: Thank you for your comments. We are pleased you recognized our associates as they sincerely enjoy assisting our guests. They truly take pride in ensuring they keep the hotel and property in pristine condition. We greatly appreciate your repeat business!

title: Quiet Luxury
review: Clean hotel with very private beach. About a mile away from the frenzy of Clearwater Beach, but close enough to all restaurants and activities. Rooms are smaller, but comfortable.  Only complaint is with the water pressure in the shower.

title: Pessimo - very disappointing esperience
review: You don’t need much to enjoy a day on our beach. Clear skies, nice weather, not too many people and liberal amounts of sunscreen – that’s about it. It’s here that you can tune out the world, your worries and your obligations for a little while and just relax and reflect. You may not know how much you need a vacation like this until you actually get there and come away utterly refreshed. I do apologize for the water pressure.

title: Simply an amazing hotel and amazing place
review: My husband and I stayed for a short anniversary celebration and were happy to indulge ourselves in luxury. We had a beautifully appointed room, with a pool view. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The Sheraton Sand Key stands in a more residential neighborhood, with an adjoining nature park. With that location came the quiet we were looking for. The beach was something of a walk but well worth it. There is a Tiki bar by the pool but there was plenty of room if you were not interested in the bar. There were other restaurant and entertainment just a short drive. The Sheraton Sand Key is a quiet getaway for couples or families.

title: Nothing special
review: My wife and I stayed for our tenth anniversary and were booked for three nights, at check in our room was not ready as we were early, they assured us that they would prioritise it with housekeeping, it was not ready until the guaranteed time although many others checked in and got a room while we waited.  We are SPG Gold but that didn't help.  The staff were not helpful at all.  As others have commented the beach is a long way from hotel and no facilities available.  Room was mediocre at best.  I had contacted the hotel about arranging a special meal for our anniversary and they didn't even know it was our anniversary at check in.  We left after one night and will never return.

title: Clean, comfortable & recommended
review: As a Gold SPG member, your loyalty is very important to our resort and to Starwood hotels. It is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service. For not meeting our goals and your expectations I apologize.

title: 3rd time and it won't be our last!
review: Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms clean, beds comfortable and breakfast in club lounge was good. Peggy (employee in club lounge) was great!   Only irritating thing about stay was that hotel charged for chairs/umbrella on beach ($25 per day).

title: A WONDERFUL place to stay,the staff is FANTASTIC!!
review: Customer care is amongst our highest priorities; I am so pleased you were treated with the warm and caring attitude our associates are known to give. Yes! Peggy is amazing, I shared your comment with Peggy and it was appreciated. The Sheraton Sweet Sleeper beds are designed with comfort in mind, a good night’s sleep helps make you ready to enjoy the day. On the charge for the cabanas; you will find at many resorts charges are included in a nightly resort fee. We have opted not to do that, and only charge for usage should the guest so choose. We will look forward to a return visit.

title: Wonderful hotel for short stay
review: My wife and I have been here 3 times since 2011 and the service and hotel gets better every time. The property is kept in great condition, check in was friendly and fast, it has its own private beach and a nice pool to relax. The location is off of the main strip in Clearwater but its only a bridge ride away. The property is more secluded and not crowded with hotels on each side.  The workers are all truly genuine and friendly as well. A very special thank you to Marilyn, Jamie and Jerry from the front desk. They made our arrival and stay perfect! They also made us feel like they were appreciative for our loyalty to this property.We have received this same treatment each time we have been here and it becomes more noticeable every time.  The hotel was very crowded for a…

title: lovely, just lovely, & a wonderful staff
review: this is a perfectly situated hotel with an absolutely wonderful staff--all of 'em, from doormen, to front desk, to waitstaff, everybody.  They were all professional & as helpful as could be.  Absolutely loved the hotel.

title: Love the location
review: Our guests’ satisfaction is our number one priority, and we are happy to hear your expectations were met. I was pleased that our associated treated you with warmth and the comfort of home on the beautiful Island of Sand Key! We look forward to a return visit.

title: Nice and comfortabe
review: We where a familie with two small children, staying here one night. The rooms are small, but very nice. Love the big beds. The thing that wasn't too great was the fact that we could hear everytime someone flushed the toilet or used a shower somewhere in the hotel. We had the breakfastbuffet and it was good. The outside pool was lovely, great with kids, because it wasn't too big. The beach is also lovely, and so clean. Great stay,would stay again, but would ask for a room where i could not hear the pipes.

title: Great two night getaway
review: I am pleased that for the most part you enjoyed your overnight stay. This is a great place for children. The beach; building sand castles, collecting shells, spotting Dolphins and it is always fun in the pool. If you were here longer Sunset at the Pier is entertaining and of course The Clearwater Aquarium houses some of the stars from Dolphins Tale such as Winter & Hope the Dolphins and Rufus.  Our “Sweet Sleeper” beds are big and comfortable. We have noted your comments regarding the level of disturbance coming from the pipes and would like to apologize for these occurrences. We are working on solutions. We hope you will return and next time you must stay a little longer

title: Don't hesitate, book your room
review: The room was nice and it overlooked the pool - try and get an ocean facing room - much nicer.   The food ordered through room service was very very average. Wouldn't recommend it.    The bar downstairs is quite nice - good to get a few drinks in and not very expensive.   Overall, a comfortable stay but not really "luxurious" from what one would expect from a Sheraton.

title: Perfect from check-in to check-out
review: We were so easily accommodated!  I called in a week in advance to request adjoining rooms.  They called me a couple days from my check-in date to verify my request, and to tell me the difference b/w adjoining rooms vs. connecting rooms.  I wanted connecting rooms. Thank you for knowing what I wanted, thinking ahead, and for saving me some aggravations.  Robert checked us in and gave us great advice.  We were able to use the fitness center's showers even after check-out, which gave us extra-time at the beach and pool!  The waitress at the their restaurant was very helpful, too!  She gave great spots to explore the area.  She directed us to Joe's Pass, which is a hidden gem.   So, talk to the "locals" and discover these hidden gems,away from the tourists traps!  Great staff.  Sure…

title: Nice bedding.
review: Our guests’ satisfaction is our number one priority, and we are happy to hear your expectations were met. I was pleased that someone from our reservations department quick thinking started your stay on a very positive note. Thank you for your comments. We are pleased you recognized our associates as they sincerely enjoy assisting our guests and are genuine in wanting your experience to be more than anticipated. John’s Pass is a favorite place to go. Wandering through the shops, enjoying anything from ice cream to a full dinner. You are correct the locals are in the know. We look forward to your return.

title: Everything we wished for ..... and more !!
review: Okay hotel. Not what I would call a resort. The pool was small. The gym was small. Seemed to be suited much more for business travel the a family vacation. They did have a large beach with beach volleyball courts set up. We ate burgers at the Island Grill and the were okay.  I would recommend if you are coming for a family vacation to stay over the bridge closer to the public beaches and shops so you don't have to driver everywhere. Staff was very friendly.

title: Very nice hotel
review: Whether you're looking for a peaceful, relaxing vacation or a fun-filled family getaway, we want to provide the perfect setting to make new memories. I am pleased you enjoyed the comfort of our “Sweet Sleeper” beds. We love being here on tranquil Sand Key. We are way from hustle and bustle of Clearwater Beach but only 2.0 miles from all the activities it offers. Of course it is nice not to have to drive … it is all up to each individual’s preference. Thank you for recognizing our associates they truly care.

title: Another Great Stay
review: We booked a 3 night stay at the Sheraton Sand key at the end of a 2 week holiday in Orlando, from the moment we checked in to the moment we left, everything was perfect. Oh! and the beds, they are amazing, you really do not want to get up. Nothing was too much trouble, late check out, room request of a high floor with a gulf view, organising tennis, service in the restaurants.  Everything about our stay was pure luxury.  Thank you to all at Sheraton, a perfect end to a perfect holiday. We will definitely be recommending to anyone who will listen and hope to be back one day. We also caught 3 of the most amazing sunsets we've ever seen. Thank you thank you thank you!!

title: Not too Bad
review: Don't get the wrong impression by the three stars.  This is a nice place that I rate down slightly due to the lack of some basic amenities.  This is the first hotel room that I have stayed in in a long time that did not have a room fridge and microwave.  If it had those things I would move it to 4 stars.  The room was big (perhaps bigger than others due to being a handicap room).  The service was very good.  The outside amenities were very nice:  pool, volleyball, beach tennis, and of course the Gulf of Mexico.  There isn't much to do off the resort within walking distance.  One nice restaurant (Columbia), a pizzeria and some small shops.  The shuttle (Jolly Trolley) stops in the parking lot and for a scant $2 each way it will take you to other areas of the island that has more…

title: Excellent service
review: I want to thank you for sharing your comments with us as it is very important for us to hear the voice of our customer. I apologize that you were not informed that you can request a refrigerator at the time of your reservation or at check-in. We are in the process of installing refrigerators in all the rooms we will finish as occupancy allows. I am pleased you enjoyed the beach and the activities we offer. Clearwater Beach is only 2.0 miles away, which ensures you have the best of both worlds and as you said the trolley is convenient.  We do hope the next time you are in the area that you will again stay with us.

title: Awesome.
review: Staff here was super friendly. We used points and were able to secure adjoining rooms, some places won't promise that in advance, but Sand Key did. Everyone we spoke to was very helpful and welcoming, front desk, concierge, pool staff, housekeeping. Nice place to grab a coffee in the morning in the lobby. Only negative is the pool hawks, meaning the families who reserve five pool chairs at 7am by dumping their stuff on it all day despite barely using them. In all, we were VERY happy with our choice of hotel. Breakfast on the roof deck every morning is huge for us, when we stay in other places that don't offer same we notice it...

title: Pleasurable Stay
review: Thank you for your comments. We are pleased you recognized our associates as they sincerely enjoy assisting our guests. We greatly appreciate your business! When the associates are able to do something to enhance your experience it genuinely pleases them as much as it does you. I do apologize that it was difficult to find a lounge chair. Breakfast with a view like that does start the day with a positive note. We look forward to another visit.

title: Loved Our Stay at Sheraton Sand Key Resort!
review: Awesome way to experience Clearwater.  The resort itself is fabulous and the staff was top notch.  Beautiful stretch of white sand beach and it was very peaceful the whole time of our stay.  You are only 5 minutes if that from the more commercialized area of clearwater beach there we rented a car but you could very easily take the trolley or floridafreerides...the trolley was 4.50 for an all day pass.  We loved watching the stars on the beach listening to the waves of the gulf crashing in.

title: Okay, good for families, they get you on the extras big time!
review: Stayed here in April for 4 nights for a friends wedding.  The rooms are the standard hotel room with a hefty price tag.  This I attribute to the beautiful beach on which it is parked.  My beef was with all the extras.  I had 3 gift baskets sent to the bride via ups, for which her room was charged 5$ a box for "processing".  On the wedding day I ordered some balloons and flowers.  I told the reception to call me and I would pick them up from the reception myself so that we would not be charged a 5$ fee, well I later found out that even though I went down to reception, picked up the items and delivered them to the room, the bride was still charged their token 5$ per item.    Internet - How is it that as we drive from the airport to the hotel we pass a bunch of cheaper…

title: 2nd visit with kids this time
review: Thank you for taking the time to write and share feedback from your most recent stay.  Our guest feedback is important to us as there are often times it may pinpoint an area of needed focus and attention. White sand beaches and the azure waters of the Gulf of Mexico greet you at the Sheraton Sand Key. The beach is why many of our guests choose to stay here. I do hope you found time to relax and enjoy “Our Island”. It is a Starwood policy for a fee to be charged per delivery, it is charged per weight. Many of the hotels in the area charge a resort fee. We do not charge a resort fee which usually include the amenities you mentioned we only charge for amenities used. I do hope you enjoyed the wedding and the time spent with friends.

title: Very good service, needs bigger pool.
review: This was our 2nd time to the Sheraton and this time we brought our 4 & 7 yr olds.  We went 1st week of August and as expected it busier than our first trip which was in April.  I highly recommend trying to go during off-season as the hotel gets very crowded during the summer.  Pros:  clean, semi-private beach, free parking, pool activities for kids, clean hotel, clean rooms  Cons:  this time we heard everything with our neighbors (thin walls), crowded pool during peak season  Highly recommend for off-peak season or weekdays.

title: Special Event inside Conference Center was Great
review: I am sure you enjoyed some memorable moments … it is gratifying to look through your children’s eyes and see all the adventure that can be had when along the shore line. Pirate Ships, Dolphins, Sand Castles or just chasing the waves. We have noted your comments regarding the level of disturbance coming from the other rooms and would like to apologies for these occurrences. We know how frustrating and disappointing it can be when you have a few minutes to relax and your expectations are not met. It is a much more tranquil environment September till February and then again after Easter till May. We do hope you will plan a return visit in the future.

title: Beautiful hotel, gorgeous views!
review: We stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort August 9 - 13th. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The resort had lots of guests. The room was clean and had a pretty good view of the beach. Because of the recent storms, the beach had a lot of seaweed, but by day 2 was much clearer. Everything at the hotel was lovely and the breakfast buffet was very good. We went to Clearwater to go to the beach, but anyone with kids knows you have to go to the pool too.  And  the pool is my only complaint. There  are easily 40-50 people in a pool built for less and they are standing because there is no room to swim around. Such a nice resort needs a second and much larger pool but because of all the wonderful things to do in Clearwater, we were able to save pool time for night time when there…

title: Just OK
review: Traveled recently with my husband and an 8 and 10 year old.   Room was very small.   When traveling with kids, you really need a mini-fridge, but there was none in room.  Also, the walk to the beach is very far, approx. 2 football fields long.   On checkout, I mentioned the need for refrigerators and a golf cart or shuttle for the beach and was told those things were available, you simply had to request them.   ????   Those things should've been mentioned at check-in.   The breakfast buffet was great; join starwood rewards at booking to get buffet coupons for the whole family.   Take the trolley to downtown Clearwater to avoid the parking nightmare.   For the price, I expected more.

title: Amazing Stay
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts on your recent stay. I apologize that you were not made aware that those amenities were available. Many of our rooms do have refrigerators and we are in the process of installing refrigerators in all the rooms as occupancy allows. You can request one when reserving your room or at check-in. We are an Island beach and the shore is around 1200 feet from the hotel, it is a bit of a walk with all the items that go with taking two children to the beach. Thank you for becoming a SPG member and we hope you will enjoy the rewards that are associated with that program. Our prices are in line with the other hotels on the beach, you can check our web site for special offers. Clearwater is a small but busy Island, the trolley is a great way to get around and relieve the stress of parking. We do hope you will return.

title: One week stay
review: We went as a quick getaway using Starwood points and were very satisfied with our stay. We had a fantastic view, and the beds were very comfortable. The food in the restaurant was very good, and we look forward to returning in the future.

title: Great Experience, Crowded Pool!
review: It is always delightful to hear that your time spent at the Sheraton Sand Key was the experience you anticipated. The views are fantastic; there is just something so peaceful and relaxing when looking at the water with maybe Sea Gulls and Dolphins making special appearances. A good night sleep on our “Sweet Sleeper” bed  is key to enjoying your stay, waking refreshed and ready to enjoy the day and all it has to offer. We also look forward to your next beach getaway.

title: Amazing View, and Beds!
review: We enjoyed the hotel and location.  We ate at the mainstay restaurant for chips, salsa, soup, and appetizers as well as the bistro for breakfast.  We enjoyed our meals.  They offer a good drink menu!  Prices are high, but the watermelon lemonade drink was INCREDIBLE!  There is a little shop off the lobby that is open 24 hours, and sells donuts, cookies, candy bars, a variety of drinks, and a few other things. Yes, the pool gets crowded, but the beach isn't.  You can find plenty of shells and coral.  Watch out for stingrays and jellyfish.  They were spotted almost daily.   My only complaint are the washers and dryers.  The clothes come out smelling worse than when they went in and the dryer doesn't dry hardly.  A small load was dried twice and was still very wet.   Also, there…

title: Sheraton sand key
review: Sheraton sand  key resort is a very nice property and  the  staff is very friendly. The  resort  has  the mainstay Tavern, Island Grille  which I would recommend and is not expensive for lunch . The  restaurant hours are  from 11:00 am- 5 pm for the Island Grille. Also the Rusty Bistro is another  amazing place  to catch some breakfast ( No reservation required, walk in's  are welcome). The  staff  is  very attentive and  our  server was  Roberta and she was  great. Some of  the other  option this property has is the Slo Joes's Turtle bar and pool side  cafe  which both  are  located  right outside the pool area.  If  you plan to dine outside the hotel I  recommend to check out the clear sky draught haus located  in dunedin  which is not that far  from the  resort and is great…

title: Chillin in Clearwater
review: Thank you for taking the time to write and share feedback from your most recent stay.  Our guest feedback is important to us as often times it may pinpoint an area of needed focus and attention. We greatly appreciate your informative review and recommendation. The exceptional personal touches Roberta brings to the table defiantly makes her our morning star! I have shared your comment and she appreciates it. Yes this time of year the pool does fill up with families … There are many months that our environment changes and becomes more tranquil. We will look forward to a return visit.

title: Great Property,but the service sealed the deal!
review: I stayed at this resort with my 78 year old father and my 20 year old 3rd born son the first week of August 2014, and I am somewhere in the middle, sort of.  The staff is second to none and the ammenities are amazing.  My interactions with Caress who was in reservations was so patient with all my questions while I was making this reservation. We arrived to see everyone cheery and having genuine smiles on their faces. Our room was a 'Gulf View' and was an out of the park homerun.  My father had plenty of places to hang out as he did not want to go to the beach. My son and I took advantage of the beach and "Debbie" who drove the portable bar was a woman after my own heart... you could not have asked for anyone more personable who made sure all the lounge chair lizards could not…

title: Beautiful beach, great location, solid staff, so-so property
review: It is satisfying when we receive a review such as yours. Time spent with family is very precious and memories made will always be with you all. It is hard to please everyone so it is nice when you can find a place that each individual enjoys. When they are enjoying what they are doing it makes it all worth it.  We also appreciate our associates and you are correct they are genuine smiles, they sincerely enjoy the interaction with our guests. Caress and Debbie do set the bar, they truly enjoy being a part of your successful stay.  We hope you will consider staying with us when planning your next stay in area.

title: Would have been "excellent" if...
review: Stayed for 6 nights last month before and during a family wedding weekend. Overall, it's a beautiful property, well maintained, with big, well appointed rooms. We booked a deluxe Ocean View and that's exactly what we got - overlooking the pool with a beautiful view of the Gulf to the front and side from our private balcony. Clean, comfortable beds (I love Sheraton beds), with lots of closet and storage space. We had a chair and a small table in the room, and honestly there was probably room for more furniture. As others have mentioned, the bathrooms are small, but there's plenty of room of the tub and toilet. I personally love having the vanity and sink separate from the enclosed bathroom -- it makes it much easier for two people who are unaccustomed to sharing a bathroom get…

title: HANDS DOWN BEST STAY EVER - TOP NOTCH!
review: I have nothing negative to say, excellent in all areas.  Perfect for relaxation and fun!  Great for families, excellent dining, best drinks in Clearwater, the bistro was amazing, beautiful pool, beautiful beach, and SO much more.  Very professional and kind staff.  Would recommend this hotel to anyone.  Great value for the price.  Offseason rates are cheaper and the area is much quieter if you are looking to relax!  Jetski rental available, also worth trying!  Not related to my trip, I noticed this looks like a great place for corporate events and meetings!  A+++++

title: "Perfect Getaway"
review: Your review should be a paragraph on our brochure!  We pride ourselves on excellent customer service and are so glad you enjoyed the warmth of our associates.  The off season rates are lower, and I agree completely, the area is more quiet and tranquil.  We have the best of both worlds with our large private beach and activities at the pool, yet we are also close to the activities of Clearwater Beach. Our Executive Chef and his culinary team will be delighted to read your comments. They truly are an outstanding team. Our Sales Team and Convention Service Staff have been planning and executing top notch meetings and events for years. We rank very high in meeting planner satisfaction...so yes, with 24,000 square feet of meeting space, 12 acres of private beach for great parties, and a great staff, we are a perfect location for your next meeting, retreat or convention. Thank you.  We look forward to welcoming you back.

title: 'fantastic hotel'
review: We were there for 6 nights.  We arrived a day early, and Jeanne at the front desk checked us in.  She tried very hard to put us in a room like we had reserved, so we wouldn't have to move.  It wasn't possible, but that was fine.  The first room (437) had been recently renovated.  We got the best night's sleep.  The next day we moved to a Gulf front room (626).  The view was outstanding.  Private balcony.  Overlooked the pool.  We sat on the balcony for several hours in the evenings people watching and watching the sunsets - just beautiful. Everyone there is very friendly and knowledgeable.  We asked Jeanne to recommend places where the locals dine.  All of her choices were spot on.  She also gave us a copy of a Sheraton Dining Guide.  Everyone: Todd (checking in bellhop); Jerry…

title: Three Generation Girls trip was perfect!!!
review: The Sheraton Sand Key is uniquely qualified to welcome you and make you feel right at home. We're always working on new ways to better care for you. Once you get on the Island of Sand Key you leave all that commercial stuff that clutters life behind and reminds us of the beauty of nature that surrounds us. The sounds are so peaceful and serene how can you do anything but relax. Our beach is large, yes. As sand erodes from points south it is deposited here due to a jetty that was built back in the 1970's. It is the work of  Mother Nature. We are constantly updating throughout the hotel and housekeeping is very efficient at keeping the hotel clean and spotless.  Thank you for your feedback on the beds.  That is very helpful information for us so we can follow up on the mattresses that were not up to par.  They were all put in last year so they really should all have felt the same. I was so pleased Jeanne was able to take good care of you.  All of our associates are so welcoming and accommodating...thank you for recognizing that. We will look forward to your next stay.

title: Clearwater in July 2014
review: We spent 4 days at the Sheraton Sand Key after a busy week in Orlando.  This has got to be one of the best hotels we have stayed at, 'all staff' are friendly and make you feel welcome, a special mention to Esther in the shop who is lovely. As our sons were celebrating their birthdays a cake awaited us in our room which was delicious! Thank you.  Rooms were spotless and cleaned daily. We were on the 5th floor and had a lovely view overlooking the tennis courts and Gulf of Mexico. Pool area and gardens are clean/tidy with pool towels available. Right on the beach, great location, we loved it.  Well done to everyone at the Sheraton!

title: Awsome....Right on the Beach!!
review: Great stay at this hotel for 4th of July weekend. My kids had a blast. Right on the beach. Traffic is aliitle crazy but it was 4th of July weekend. I will definetly go back on a regular day. Enough said : )

title: Vacation July 2014
review: It was great to read that you had a great 4th of July weekend!  We look forward to your return visit.

title: Don't believe everything you read
review: Wow Mr. Kimball!  You are truly an amazing General Manager.  Your hotel and staff are amazing!  From Adam at the bell hop to the greatest girls at the front desk Jeanne, Laura and Janet always with a smile on their face to Esther, Christos and Judy at the gift shop which started my day off great.... I went in there to buy things all day long because they made you feel at home!  David and Richard in your food areas with their great smile.  Then there was Felippe when your resort had no water  for the few hours he was carrying buckets in and out of the rest rooms all the time having a smile on his face.  I thought it was amazing how you and your staff notified the patrons and were so accommodating to everyone.  On my second to last day I had the privilege of meeting John Harris I…

title: Disappointed
review: Thank you so much for the outstanding review and the amazing comparison to the Ritz Carlton.  It was so lovely to read all the names of the associates you met while staying here.  Our staff is amazing and truly enjoy getting to know our guests.  Thank you for your kind words regarding our emergency repair. As for the culinary team and Chef Harris - yes, they are wonderful! We are excited you will return and be part of our Sheraton Sand Key family.  We have many guests that return year after year and have truly become great friends. We look forward to welcoming you back!

title: Not the best Hotel.
review: So we decided to use some spg points and spend a few days at this hotel for my wife's bday. Typically we go to Marco hilton which is about 3 hours closer but it was sold out. With that said I was hesitant due to some of the reviews but we love the gulf and figured why not. First off, the staff was absolutely wonderful on every level, from the initial booking and upgrading us to a suite, which costed more points but was worth it. I requested flowers in our room for my wife's bday and was greeted with a dozen roses and a bday cake, something a well known vegas hotel could not pull off as rooms are typically assigned until check in. The pool itself is small but the pool area is fine, we had no trouble finding a table and umbrella and/or lawn chairs as we desired. The beach is a bit…

title: A great hotel/resort but let down by the size of swimming pool
review: My wife and I have been visiting this hotel for many years mainly due to its excellent location, right on a big, lovely sandy beach.  It's bedrooms are pleasant, well sized and we always choose the rooms with two (queen sized I think they call them) beds. In the past we have ordered a fridge in our room (at an extra cost) but this year there was one was included in a newly refreshed bedroom (different furniture). I think all rooms have inter connecting doors which does mean that you can hear your neighbours more than you would ideally want to.  The bathroom has to be one of the smallest and is a slight let down but we are happy to live with this. It has the toilet and bath (with a reasonable shower over head) in a room barely big enough to swing a cat. The sink is then out side…

title: Wonderful people and great service
review: Thank you so much for your loyalty to our resort.  We appreciate that you have been visiting for many years and do want to remain your hotel of choice when visiting the Clearwater Beach area. We loved reading your comments on our staff as they truly do enjoy contributing to the success of your stay. Your review was very fair, and we thank you for overlooking the shortcomings.  We do agree that our bathrooms do not match the bathrooms of newer hotels.  We have struggled with ideas for improving the size, but have yet to find a solution that does not take away from the rest of the guest room. I appreciate your comments on the buffet and the rules at the pool.  I will be sure to address these points with the appropriate managers. A bigger pool is on our wish list.  In season the pool can become very crowded.  I agree that it is a more relaxed environment in the off season and do hope you will be returning then.  We look forward to welcoming you back.

title: Good staff, disappointing hotel
review: My husband and I got married here and from the moment we checked in we were made to feel like family by the staff, especially the staff in the Mainstay Tavern Nate, Geoff, Bobby, Christina to name a few. We have stayed there several times since and the service and the greeting remain the same, as though we had never been away. We even ended up being witnesses (not that you need them in the US) for the bellman's (now retired) wedding in St Augustine! Everyone at the Sheraton Sand Key work very hard to ensure that everyone is made to feel welcome and that nothing is too much trouble for them, which is backed up by Carole in guest relations who ensures that everyone has a great time.

title: The place to stay at clearwater beach
review: It is always so heart warming to hear from one of our loyal guests, and it is equally heart warming to read the names of so many of our associates in your review.  Our staff genuinely enjoy getting to know our guests.  We all look forward to seeing the same faces time and time again.  It is so nice to hear that you feel a part of our Sheraton Sand Key family...that makes us very happy!  The associates you named are true stars...and yes, Carole is amongst the brightest. How special that you wed here, vacation here AND stood up for one of our associates.  I will pass you review on to share with all.  We look forward to your return.

title: Great place
review: We travelled with two children aged 14 and 9. We stayed in a room with two double beds. As SPG Gold members, we were offered free wifi, which we took advantage of. The staff were incredibly welcoming from the front desk and concierge, to the bar staff and waiters. Nothing ever seemed too much trouble and we were given lots of helpful advice for our stay. The hotel had tennis courts and provided balls and rackets free of charge. They also provided pool toys and beach toys free of charge, which we thought was fantastic. However, the outdoor pool is absolutely tiny and the private beach is covered in hard, sharp shells; not the beautiful sand to be found across the bridge. The room had the thinnest walls I have ever encountered and we could hear every word spoken next door. The…

title: If only the pool was bigger
review: I really liked staying at this Sheraton.  The walk to the beach isn't as bad as many has wrote about.  The beach was not crowded and clean.  I would not have wanted to stay here if I didn't have children.  But we did and it was great for them.   I loved the gym.  It has been the best hotel gym I have been to. While you ran on the treadmill you had a view of the gulf.  And there were 5 of them along with stationary bikes and elliptical machines.  There were weights and room for jumping rope.  They also had lockers!  If working out during your stay is important then you should definitely come here. The hotel staff were quick and helpful.   What I didn't like - the washing machines were dirty and smelly.  We were in Florida for two weeks and i was definitely NOT expecting the…

title: Disappointed
review: Our fitness center, Sheraton Fitness, definitely has some of the best views in our building!  I am glad you were able to keep in your normal workout routine and found the fitness center accommodating.  I was also glad to read you and your family enjoyed the beach and the volleyball net.  Our beach offers so many options for sports.  I appreciate you sharing your comments on the washers and dryers...I will have those checked immediately.  We do our very best to ensure the pool is for hotels guests only.  Our most recent attempt was putting up a gate that makes the pool accessible only with your room key. I can assure you this is an issue we are very diligent on.  We hope your travels will bring you to the Clearwater area again so that we can welcome you back.

title: Best Place to stay!!!
review: I stayed at the Sheraton in Sand Key Resort as part of a family road trip in Florida. I was expecting it to be great but somehow I felt a bit let down. The room was very spacious and clean, perfect for 4 adults, but nothing else made it special. We had a meal in one of the restaurants one night which was lovely and the waiter did look after us very well. The swimming pool had the most annoying music ever, with a man playing a rather strange instrument. It felt like being stuck on a carrousel in a child theme park, not to mention the screams coming from the swimming pool where the activities for children were taking place.  One day we saw a snake nearby the pool area. We then decided to spend time at the beach which is huge and white sandy, very nice. If I remember well that was…

title: Nice hotel, great views, inadequate service
review: I was quite saddened to read that your stay with us was not memorable.  Our staff prides themselves on going above and beyond for our guests to ensure there stay is an excellent experience.  I will have to research what music was at the pool as it is normally a delightful steel drummer playing great tropical tunes.  I am glad you found the beach to be nice.  We often feel our location is a plus, however, we understand that the "private island" feel isn't for everyone. Thank you for taking the time to share your review.

title: Fantastic!
review: My family and I stayed at this resort from June 13th - 17th. First time staying here and I have to say that we loved it. We didn't want to leave. We probably would havr extended if it wasn't because we had already paid in full our next portion of our vacation at Disney. We cannot wait to return next year. Everything from our check in, staff and resort were great and we had absolutely no complaints.

title: Great place to stay
review: Several choices to eat in house, accommodating staff and great rooms. Very comfortable beds.  I've read where parking was an issue. Unless you got there at 1 in the morning there was always a spot with an easy walk.

title: an average Sheraton
review: Your kind comments are greatly appreciated. Customer care is amongst our highest priorities and it is always gratifying to receive such praise. I am delighted you found our resort to be an oasis from the busy life we lead. After enjoying a full day on the beach and exploring the area, it is a perfect ending to the day when you enjoy the comfort of our “Sweet Sleeper” bed. Thank you for your comment on the parking lot.

title: Fantastic on-the-beah hotel...
review: We have stayed at many Sheratons and this seems to not be up to what I expect of a Sheraton room.  The bathroom was very tiny and the room seemed crowded.  We were on the preferred floor and took advantage of the club lounge.  Breakfast consisted of fruit, oatmeal, bread, rolls, yogurt, cereals, OJ and coffee.  There is always coffee, coke products and water throughout the day.  From 5-7, there are a few appetizers, cheese, beer and sometimes wine. Jerry at the front desk was wonderful in trying to expedite the cleaning of our room.  We did arrive several hours prior to their official check-in.  Steve at the bell captain's desk was so very nice and accommodating   We were here for a convention for 5 days and it was too long to stay here.  We sunburn easily and except for the…

title: Nice visit even for a staycation
review: You are correct we are just a casual beach resort not a luxury hotel. The Island of Sand Key is a place to enjoy the beach and relax, Yes, Clearwater is touristy. Less than half hour away there really is much to do. There is the Salvatore Dali Museum, Chilhuly Museum and Gallery also wonderful 5 star restaurants. Of course being at a conference really does not give you a lot of extra time to explore.  It does sound as if you enjoyed the interaction with several of our associates. Both Jerry and Steve are true examples of our training and both genuinely enjoy being around people. They want to ensure your experience is what you anticipated. Both of them have much knowledge about the area that I am sure they would have enjoyed sharing.

title: New Favorite Place
review: Just loved this hotel. Stayed for a week over 4th of July weekend. The staff was helpful and knowledgeable about the area and never encountered an unfriendly or unhelpful employee. The rooms were comfortable, bed was comfortable, pillows were so great, came home and ordered some on-line. Clean and fresh linens and towels all appearing brand new.  Dined once in the main Dining Room for the Prime Rib Buffet for Dinner. We ordered both a Shrimp Cocktail and dessert from the menu... The Buffet had excellent food and let me tell you, I am NOT a Buffett person, but I did enjoy this one. Again, the Staff was very attentive and nice to visit with. The Shrimp Cocktail, hands down had the best shrimp we ate while on our vacation. They key lime pie was pretty dang good too. Best of all,…

title: First of many visits
review: This was a spur of the moment trip, We live in Orlando and wanted to go to the beach but with two little ones making it a day trip takes a lot from waking up, driving, spending the day and then traveling back, so we decided to stay at the Sheraton Sand Key, The location was great right over the 2nd bridge on the main road, this way your near the Clear water pier and activities, but with out all the craziness of the travelers just going to the beach for the day.  Check in was quick and easy (we did arrive around 5) after check in, The beach is lovely, it is a little walk from the hotel to the actual shore line, especially with little ones. but it was well worth the walk!   We will be back, just the beginning of many family vacations to come! Next time we will need to stay longer!

title: Not what you would expect from a Sheraton
review: I was thrilled that your little get-away was a success. I am sure you enjoyed the time away with the children and memories were made.  Fun times building sandcastles, swimming in the pool, hopefully spotting Dolphins playing. Mom and Dad relaxing with none of the outside interruptions. We look forward to being the place for your family vacations and yes, do please plan a longer stay.

title: A fantastic beach front hotel! An Orlando antidote.
review: The Sheraton Sand Key is part large conference center and part tourist beach hotel. It’s located just over the bridge and south of Clearwater Beach, FL so is ideal for getting away from the city scene. I combined a two week business trip with a mini vacation and brought the family down spend time with me and to enjoy the beach while I was at a client site during the day working.    Hotel rooms are fairly old and small and the bathrooms just big enough to turn around in. As an SPG Platinum I was upgraded to a room on a high floor overlooking the parking lot, which wasn’t exactly my idea of an upgrade! Apparently all rooms are equally as small.  The conference goers during my stay included a large number of FBI agents and uniformed paramilitary police officers most of whom were…

title: Nice beach, but that's about it
review: It is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service. I apologize that we did not meet your expectations and have taken particular note of your comments. I have shared them with the appropriate managers

title: Best Kept Secret in Clearwater!
review: We really enjoyed our week here. The local area isn't great for exploring but we chose it for a week of relaxation by the sea and the Sheraton delivered.   We were poolside every day and arriving at 9am every morning we had our pick of tables and sun loungers. Although, strangely, none of the loungers had any umbrellas - those were all fixed in the tables.   The restaurants within the hotel were friendly and offered a variety of dining choices. The breakfast buffet was excellent, only lacking an omelette station.  We'd go back again - after a week in Orlando it made a change to not have to do anything or go anywhere and just lay in the sun reading and drinking.

title: my fabulous holiday
review: This is as first class hotel in a very beautiful area of "Clearwater Florida" it is situated on the beach ,which is really breathtaking ,it also has two pools one is just for toddlers and an outdoor jacuzzi .there are plenty of sunloungers and tables in the pool area .the rooms we had were family rooms ,with two queen sized beds the views are amazing from the balconies .all the staff are very friendly I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is thinking of going there. .

title: Nice Clean Resort with Minor Problems
review: Whether you're looking for a peaceful, relaxing vacation or a fun-filled family getaway, we provide the perfect setting to make new memories. It is delightful to read that your stay was a success and I hope you will someday return. The views are breathtaking, Mother Nature surrounds you with her beauty and the beach promotes relaxation. I am certain you must have seen a beautiful sunset. Thank you for recognizing our associates.

title: Not the best hotel in the area....Pool crowded and small
review: We stayed at this resort for the third time in July 2014.  We booked a room with a great rate, so we knew it wouldn't have the best view.  Our room faced the street, was situated on the 3rd floor, with the side of the conference roof at eye level.  Once again, we knew this was going to be the case and didn't have a problem with it.  Our room was clean and the two beds were comfortable, which you can't say about a lot of hotels.  Our room was one that had not been recently undated, but was still clean and fairly modern.  We stayed for 5 days and 4 nights.  The beach is a long walk from the hotel, but to be honest, not unmanageable.  The pool is very small and is always packed with every chair and table taken by about 9-10am. The pool is usually packed with kids and teenagers, so…

title: Let the Relaxation begin
review: It is gratifying to read that you enjoyed your stay and it was the experience you anticipated. I do apologize about the parking issue. We are on an island surrounded by water and there is just no place to enlarge that space. The person who gave you that information should have given you a better explanation. That SUV is not personally owned by our General Manager, he does not use it. It is owned by the hotel and is used for many reasons; one being emergencies.  I can assure you they do enforce parking and we are in the process of finding better solutions as we realize it is a problem. We appreciate your loyalty and your feedback.  It is guest comments such as yours that point out where improvement is needed and we very much appreciate that.  We sincerely do hope you will return.

title: A great stay!  We would come back.
review: I have stayed at most of the four star hotels in the area, the best and newest one is The Hyatt (all of the rooms have full kitchens and the facilities are beautiful). The Sheraton is located on Sand Key which is a more quiet area of Clearwater. The hotel is dated, the main areas are lacking in windows and tend to feel crowded and cavernous at the same time. The room was very small with a strange sink set up that was right next to the door.  The hotel staff is very nice and the service is prompt but overall the facility isn't the best and the walk to the beach is a drag. The pool is small and was packed with kids, not relaxing. If you do stay here, go to the Hyatt for the buffet breakfast, its basically the same price and much better with a beautiful atmosphere. One positive…

title: No view!
review: My husband booked this room under government rate. They said we would have a parking lot view, which would have been fine if that's what we would have actually gotten. We stayed in room 313. The only view we got was a brick wall. If you are giving a government rate promising a certain view, you should honor that promise. We tried to change rooms but were refused due to unavailability. However, after checking online, we found several better rooms available. Will we be returning to Clearwater? Yes. Will we be staying here? No.

title: Beware!
review: I apologize that the room view did not meet your expectations. Unfortunately we do have times where we are unable to upgrade from the room type that was booked. The parking lot view rooms are also described as having “no view”.   We have noted your comments regarding the location of the room you requested as well as the rate. Our rates and room types are managed closely and the allotment of the rooms available on the government rate were limited at that time due to others being booked already. I apologize if this was not explained to you.

title: Sheraton Sand Key A+!
review: Sheraton, right! You would think they'd be honest and up front for their rooms. NOT! We booked a room from three choices. GulfView (most expensive), Coastal View(mid range) and Parking lot view. What they don't tell you is that A. The coastal view overlooks they roof of the Conference Center and all of the noisy, loud and unsightly rooftop A/C units. We couldn't even enjoy our balcony due to the noise and the hot air blowing towards us. And B.  the so called Parking Lot view had the best of both with views of the Gulf and Coastal without paying for the upgrade. The beach, is a Gazzilion miles from the resort. Not fun lugging chairs, cooler, toys and children to the water. Oh did I mention a drink at the pool bar was $11.00. BEWARE before you book this place!

title: Beautiful beach!
review: I sincerely apologize as it is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service. Not meeting our goals and your expectations is very concerning. The beach is a bit of a walk; Sand Key and the Clearwater area are known for their exceptional beaches.  Our wide beach is due to the Jetty on the waterway to the north. I am sure it felt like a long walk trying to get chairs, children and all that goes along with a day at the beach. Arrangements can be made if someone needs assistance to the water’s edge. I apologize that the room view did not meet your expectations. Unfortunately, we do have times where we are unable to upgrade from the room type that was booked. We strive to put accurate descriptions such as parking lot view on each of our rooms so the price difference for each different view is easy to see and understand. The drink you had at the Tiki bar is in line with the other beach hotels in the area. Our average Tropical drink is $9.00, specialty drinks can cost $11.00.

title: big private beach
review: My family and I stayed at Sheraton Sand Key resort June 30 to July 5th. We were not allowed to check in until 3pm sharp. After being on the hot road we were a little disappointed we had to wait. We ended up sitting in the lobby which had WiFi and cool air. There was a law enforcement convention going on inside the resort so the parking situation was not good for the first 3 days of our stay. It seems that the police think they don't have to abide by the same laws we do. They parked wherever they wanted even parking near signs stating "no parking by City ordinance ". This was not Sheraton's fault so I will move on. That being said we checked into our room to find our refrigerator had froze up and was not cool. We notified the front desk and the refrigerator was promptly removed…

title: Average Room, Lovely Staff
review: We were here for a week, with an upgrade to 'gulf view' for travelling with Virgin Holidays. Reception staff, Laura in particular, were lovely and the concierge staff. But the hotel is 40 years old with added on air conditioning which is exceptionally loud to the point that it gave you a headache. We asked if we could try another room, but when Laura asked her manager, he said that there was no point as they were all the same, so we accepted it. The room was very small and narrow, The bathroom was so small that you had to back onto the toilet, and once you were seated you could not shut the door because your legs were in the way. The wash basin and coffee machine were outside of the bathroom and the extractor fan made an horrendous noise - age again. The bath was the length of…

title: Outstanding
review: I sincerely apologize as it is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service. Not meeting our goals and your expectations is very concerning. We have noted your comments and they were shared with the Director of Guest Services regarding the location of your room and the comment made by the manager. I apologize that the manager was not clearer with the explanation. Unfortunately, we are unable to change the size of the room. We have also looked into several options for re-designing the bathroom, however, we have not found a solution that does not take away from the rest of the room.  Rest assured these items are always on our mind and we do hope that someday we will find an improvement. I appreciate that you enjoyed the location. We are committed to the quality of our hotel and are constantly renovating on a regular basis to keep it updated. I have shared your comments with Laura; she and the other associates you mentioned truly care … thank you. The Sheraton Sand Key Resort is the perfect base for exploring the area and there is much to see. I agree, the Sunshine Skyway Bridge is quite the experience.

title: would not recommend
review: Excellent service from arrival thru departure.   Beds were amazing!!!!  Beach was pristine and pool was beautiful.  Loved the sand pail beverages! The food was excellent!  Would recommend this property to all

title: We wont be back!
review: It is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service.  It is gratifying to read that your experience here with us was very positive. It seems as if memories were made. I am pleased that you enjoyed the comfort of our Sweet Sleeper beds, our beautiful beach, the pool, the culinary delights prepared by our talented kitchen staff and of course the sand pail beverages. We look forward to your return.

title: Perfect for a short beach getaway
review: I asked if I could upgrade my room and he said there was nothing available, Andre was very rude.  We get up to our room and it was a view of the roof.  I immediately went downstairs and asked if I could be switched because the view was terrible.  I got a different guy this time and he looked on the computer and even went to ask the manager. He looked but all he could find was a room two floors up.  We took it because it was a little better view.  I booked this trip on Priceline and it said and an intercostal view.  If I had known it would have been a view of the roof, dumpsters, and trucks coming early in the morning and workers spraying things down late at night I would have paid more for a better room when booking.  This is a family hotel with a lot of kids.  You can't get in…

title: Excellent Beach and Bed
