review: We were only there for one night. We arrived about 5pm and the chairs and umbrellas that they rent on the beach were already packed up. The walk to the beach might be very difficult on someone older or in poor health, it was a hike in the merciless sun.  Luckily we brought our own chair which had an over hang that provided some shade.  The sun directly on the beach is harsh and I am African America.  The Gulf water was as warm as bath water and we stayed out in the ocean until the sun was completely down.  The bed was amazingly comfortable and the sheets soft.  Liked that the rooms had a balcony.  Bathroom area was small but there was a laundry near the ice maker.  Club breakfast was just bagels and cereal and drinks. Afternoon snacks were great and included mix your own drinks.…

title: Not worth it!!!
review: I am pleased that your experience was pleasant. The Island of Sand Key is known for their exceptional beaches which makes it a bit of a walk.  We do have assistance if needed to take you to the shore. The sun can be harsh.  Luckily, later in the evening there is usually a breeze.  Hopefully memories of a beautiful sunset while relaxing in the Gulf waters will bring you back for a longer stay. The Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed; with luxurious sheets, a deluxe duvet, a selection of feather down and hypoallergenic pillows, and a custom mattress, is found in each of our guest rooms for your comfort. I am pleased you enjoyed cocktail hour in our Sheraton Club. It is a great place to relax or connect with the other guests.

title: Nice property, cordial staff
review: We are a family of four (two adults, a toddler and an infant). We were looking for a nice hotel on the beach. Friend recommended Sheraton Sand Keys resort.   Check in process was horrible! I regret not writing down her name (a day-time front desk supervisor), but she ruined my day! People like her should not be working in hospitality business at all!!!  The room was nicely furnitured and clean. I was a bit disappointed with the view... we had a balcony that was facing a wall and a roof. Also i was surprised that we had to pay for internet access!!!!  I was very happy to see a playground for kids and a nice pool, but ...the hotel is not that close to the beach as i thought!!!! For families with little kids or elderly parents i would recommend to look at the photos online prior to…

title: Good Beach, Rooms, bad pool
review: Customer care is amongst our highest priorities; I sincerely apologize that you were not treated with the warm and caring attitude our associates are known to give when you arrived.  I realize how important first impressions are. I have shared your comment with the Director of Guest Services. I understand your feeling on the internet and the cabanas. You will find at many resorts these charges are included in a nightly resort fee. We have opted not to do that, and only charge for usage should the guest so choose. There is no excuse for having to wait 40 minutes for a drink. If needed arrangements can be made to be taken out to the shore. It is a bit of a walk with two small children. I am pleased you enjoyed the culinary selections from the Island Grille and Rusty’s Bistro.

title: Misleading Photos about beach access
review: The Sheraton Sand Key sits about a mile south of Clearwater Beach.  It offers a respite from the t-shirt shop, fast food, high rises and mom and pop motels to the north.  The Sheraton had a very cordial staff and does a great job for conferences.  Good food.  The bar has plenty of HDTVs, a good selection of beer and wine and good bar-food choices. Rooms are well maintained.   The beach is extremely wide...probably two to three hundred yards from the water's edge.  The pool area is very popular.

title: Happy stay
review: Still enjoying our 6 night stay here. Good location, comfortable bed (agree with previous comment re no refrigerator in room). Lots to do in surrounding area. We booked a club room which included continental breakfast (very good) in the club lounge and drinks and snacks served every evening from 5-7pm. Although alcohol is served, the lounge is used by some families with very young children and so 'a quiet time' is certainly not guaranteed! Full marks to the serving staff for asking that the children be kept under control! Perhaps split the access to families between 5 and 6 and then adult time from 6-7??

title: Don't expect service and night entertainment
review: I was so pleased to hear your experience here at the Sheraton Sand Key is a success. The location is beautiful, the views, the beaches and the environment itself is so relaxing. We do have refrigerators in most of the rooms and will have them in all the rooms as soon as occupancy allows. The Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed is found in each of our guest rooms for your comfort and is comprised of luxurious sheets, a deluxe duvet, a selection of feather down and hypoallergenic pillows, and a custom mattress. I am pleased you enjoyed a comfortable sleep. The Sheraton Club can become very busy and we must allow SPG members to bring their children. Our associates truly care that you enjoy your time spent with us and ensuring the children are under control is very important. I will share your suggestions. I hope you will plan a return visit to “Our Island.”

title: Memorable stay
review: During week, pool tiki bar and cafe close BEFORE sunset even though it says sunset. Don't expect a memorable sunset experience. Staff at restaurants and bar are horrible. Food okay, but spend a little extra (very little) and stay somewhere else on the beach where service is key. Food closes at 11. I asked for take out just before 11 and they said kitchen is closed. All about staff getting out of the place.

title: Great Stay
review: I went along as my friend's +1 for his brothers wedding. I think everyone who was at the wedding stayed there. The wedding was on the beach directly behind the hotel.     I really don't have any complaints except for this. . . .the 3pm check in, has to go!!  I'm used to being able to check in at around noon, but 3 in the afternoon is a bit much!  Our flight got in at almost 7am, so we had an awful lot of time to kill. Normally that would be great, but at that point all we wanted to do was get in our room to relax, and freshen up a bit, before meeting everyone.  Ugh!     The rooms were great, the beds & bedding were great, I loved the soft pillows!!  And room the service was excellent. As for the views I would definitely request something with an ocean view.     The reception was…

title: Hard to beat
review: “Welcome to Our Island” It is the perfect setting for a beach wedding, it makes for a magical evening. We have some breathtaking sunsets and just being near the water is so serene. Memories of the wedding ceremony, the dinner and the time spent at the Mainstay Tavern with family and friends hopefully will be with you for a long time. Grouper is defiantly a Gulf Coast favorite. I will share your comment with the Chef, thank you. Those “Sweet Sleeper” beds are comfortable, I am pleased you enjoyed a good night’s rest.  There are times when the room is not occupied that you are able to check in earlier then 3:00. I do apologize that it was not communicated to you that you could use Sheraton Fitness to freshen up while waiting for your room. We are thrilled your experience here was one to remember and hope to see you again soon!

title: Great stay
review: We had a wonderful stay at the Sheraton.  From the time we got there until we left our trip went smooth.  The staff was great and went out of there way to help.  The room was quite and the bed slept great.  The view was awesome.  We will be coming back!

title: Great...but
review: It is our goal to ensure the comfort of our guests. Our associates truly enjoy being part of the success of your experience. It is always gratifying when our guests truly enjoy their stay. For your comfort the Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed is found in each of our guest rooms and is comprised of luxurious sheets, a deluxe duvet, a selection of feather down and hypoallergenic pillows, and a custom mattress. Waking up to a view of the Gulf is awesome and at night the view of our sunsets can set the sky on fire and amaze us with a variety of colors. We will welcome you back!

title: Started out rocky, but ended up great!
review: This is a beautiful property. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. The hotel is well-kept. It's location right on the beach is ideal so we got a great view from our room. There are several restaurants in the hotel. We loved the hot tub and daily swimming in the ocean. Although this a great place to stay I would not rate it a 3½ star hotel. The room and bathroom are too small for this and they are too basic to be classified at 3½ stars. If they get 3½ stars it is only for the location, I would give the hotel itself maybe 3 stars. If you are looking for a nice clean well-kept place to stay close to the beach then this is it, but if you're looking for upscale elegance then this is not it. One other thing to be aware of is that there is very little to do in the area immediately…

title: great location
review: I am pleased we were able to share the experience of this tropical paradise we call home. Our associates are knowledgeable and delight in sharing their information and assistance with you. A gulf view does give that serene feel. We agree; we are not elegant.  We are a casual beach resort which makes you comfortable walking around in your casual attire after enjoying the beach.  Our tranquil environment and private beach creates a place to relax, reflect and recharge.  A place where you can get your toes in the sand.  Clearwater is only 2.0 miles away and they have many activities going on. Just across the street there are several restaurants for breakfast to dinner offerings. You can take the beach trolley which runs from Tarpon Springs to St Pete Beach and you can get on and off all day for $4.00. We hope you will consider us again for your next beach stay.

title: Reasonable stay
review: When we first arrived, we were put in a room that overlooked the air conditioning units.  It was RIGHT on top of them.  We couldn't even sit out on the balcony and hear each other over the sound.  There was also an empty beer can left out there.  But one thing I've learned when traveling is it never hurts to ask, so I went back down to the front desk and told them we were not happy with our room.  It's not like we were staying one night on a road trip somewhere and just needed a place to sleep.  This was our vacation, and I wanted to enjoy it.  They put my name on a list and called me about 30 minutes later to let me know they had another room for us.  This second room was fantastic!! Beautiful view and lovely balcony.  This made the whole trip better!  We had a fridge in our…

title: Nice resort
review: The check in was quick and easy, the room was really nice. The bar in the lobby was intimate and the service was great. The front desk staff and housekeepers were very friendly and welcoming.   The pool area is lovey. The outdoor bar was pricey but pretty much what you would expect. The pool got crowded in the afternoon but in the morning it was just fine.   We were in town for a conference and the hotel did a really nice job. The conference rooms were nice and in the morning they served a little breakfast that was delicious.   The walk to the beach was very unpleasant. Yes, the hotel is beachfront, but about 300 yards back from the beach. You get to walk through this barren wasteland of sharp, crushed shell sand. If you need a refreshment, to use the bathroom, forgot your…

title: Great Location!
review: I am pleased that with your first impression was a good one and that everything seemed to fall into place. Our wide beach is due to the Jetty on the water way to the north of Sand Key Park. We are an Island beach so it is a bit of a walk and I understand it is a bit of an issue when needing the bathroom. Two things determine the size of sand on beaches: the energy (height) of the waves, and the size of the material furnished to the beach. Other things being equal, the higher the average waves on a beach, the coarser the sand. We do have a beach buggy which serves refreshments right on the beach. It is a private beach so you can leave the large things out there if you plan on returning without worrying about them. I am pleased you enjoyed your conference and that your stay was a good experience. We hope you will return when next planning a beach vacation.

title: not what I expect from a sheraton
review: Great location for a "private" family friendly beach. The rooms were very nice with lovely beds and amenities, but loved the convenience of everything. Within walking distance of restaurants, the beach, and within driving for some more "action". The pool was nice and tons of seating and never really felt too crowded.

title: One of the Resort
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for the positive comments. If you're looking for a peaceful, relaxing vacation or a fun-filled family getaway, we provide the perfect setting to make new memories. It is convenient with shops and restaurants all just right across the street. The pool area is a great place to lounge in the sun; you can just clear your mind of that everyday clutter, read a book or enjoy some quite time with whomever you are with. We hope you will be planning another beach get-away soon.

title: The best-no resort fee, free parking
review: 8 year SPG gold member strong!  Disappointing is how I would sum up my experience. I decided to take my family here for a weekend gateway and blew 10,000 SPG point per night for 3 nights. I should of saved my points, booked a holiday inn and save my points for a worth while SPG location. Location was prime, like the fact that its away from the main Clearwater beach. Upon pulling up to check in, the bell boy and hotel was very welcoming and friendly, good way for a deep impression. However, once we arrived at our room on the top floor, I was shocked by dated the room were, time machine back to the 70's. Not sure if they trying to go for the 70's beach theme, if so, they are succeed. Most disappointment came from the pool!  Barely enough food to maneuver in a 10 feet pool with 100…

title: Nice getaway for Mom
review: I spent 5 days here and it was wonderful. The pool was wonderful. temperature was perfect. Not too busy so not a lot of people in pool which was great. The beach is OK. I have to admit it is quite a walk especially for the elderly. I will be honest..the sand at Clearwater beach is much better then Sand Key. Too many little sharp shells for feet to walk on -wear sandals or water shoes. Suggestion would be a boardwalk even halfway would be nice.  The staff were very friendly especially in the lounge on 9 flr. The rooms are a good size and kept VERY clean. Hats off to the cleaning staff. The restaurants in the hotel are good. The shops have everything you would need and want, including snacks and made up sandwiches..etc.. Florida weather was FANTASTIC. I was there in May and left…

title: 3rd time at this hotel - Love it!
review: I am pleased you enjoyed time spent at the Sheraton Sand Key and that your encounters with our associates were positive. Thank you for recognizing our Housekeeping staff; they are efficient. I have shared your comment with the Director of Housekeeping. The beach is such a relaxing place to be; a place to enjoy your own thoughts undisrupted by the outside world or to just enjoy the people you are with. The smell of salt water, the gentle roar of the waves all combine to create a sense of peace and calm here on the beaches of Sand Key. Beautiful sunsets and awesome views in every direction. You can make arrangements to be taken out to the shore - just speak to the concierge. We have two trolley systems; The Jolly Trolley goes into Clearwater. The Suncoast Trolley goes from Tarpon Springs to St Pete Beach which is 30 miles-48 Km. They have all day passes for $4.50 you can get on and off as many times you care to. The Suncoast Beach Trolley runs every 20 - 30 minutes from 5:05 a.m. to 10:10 p.m., Monday through Thursday and Sunday, including holidays, with service until midnight on Friday and Saturday. Look for special trolley bus stop signs located frequently along the route. In addition to the services along Gulf Boulevard, connector routes run between the coast and downtown St. Petersburg.

title: Great staff!
review: I have stayed at this hotel for a conference for the past 3 years.  I would stay here even it it were not for the conference. I love the friendly and accommodating nature of every employee; from the desk employees to the housekeeper.  The pool area is relaxing and the beach access is huge. There is quite a long walk to get to the beach, but there is a large sand area between the back deck and the beach near the water.  The food and drinks at their restaurant and bar are on the expensive side, but it is normal for this type of hotel/resort. I paid almost $10 for a frozen strawberry daiquiri, which I though was ridiculous and really nothing special.  Either way, if you want it cheaper, then go to an area restaurant or bar as there are hundreds close by.  The seafood in the area is…

title: Rooms need updating!
review: The Sheraton Sand Key resort is the perfect base for many attractions! The surrounding area offers plenty of activities to fill your vacation or free time after the conference. Our associates truly enjoy being part of your vacation by being friendly, efficient and informative. Yes! I must agree there are many great restaurants in the Clearwater area. Our signature restaurant, Rusty’s Bistro, has an award winning culinary staff. Customer care is amongst our highest priorities and it is always gratifying to receive such praise. The cost of our cocktails are consistent with the other area hotel bars on the beach. I do apologize that your strawberry daiquiri was not special. The fresh seafood that comes from the Gulf of Mexico is excellent. Gulf fisheries are some of the most productive in the world. We do hope to have an opportunity to welcoming you back in the not too distant future

title: wonderful trip excellent property
review: We spent 4 days at this hotel at the end of April/start of May for our daughters beach wedding.  Ok the accommodation and public areas are a little dated but this was more than compensated for by the consistently pleasant and courteous service we experienced from all the staff. It rained all day right up to 15 minutes before the wedding when the skies miraculously cleared and at the last minute all the wedding paraphernalia was shifted from a conference room to the beach - no problem at all for the staff who showed remarkable flexibility! We were also given various money- off vouchers for local attractions, beach cabanas etc when we asked for directions or information.   When I was looking for a cup of coffee in the bar before it officially opened, a waiter was happy to oblige. …

title: Nice Vacation
review: This place is amazing. We stayed in the 7th floor overlooking the pool and the beach. Beautiful view. Paying extra is worth it. Everything here was great. The staff was extremely polite. The food was delicious.  The rooms were big and clean. The only thing that kept this from being 5 star was the in room movie service is absolutely horrible. It cuts off off and on.

title: I'll be back!
review: It is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service.  It is gratifying to read that your experience here with us was very positive. The view is beautiful and hopefully you were able to see one of our breathtaking sunsets. I apologize for the movie service. I looked into that issue and it was a Net Work problem not the hotel, it took a few days for them to resolve. We will do our utmost to better meet your expectations next time given a chance.

title: Honeymoon on Sand Key
review: Stayed here for a conference in November 2013.  Hotel was great, rooms were comfortable and clean! Service was great! Enjoyed the great location on the beach!  The location was close to shopping and great restaurants! Really enjoyed my stay and I will be bringing my wife back for a relaxing stay!!

title: Great Location, Beautiful Resort, Exceptional Value For Business Meetings
review: I am delighted that your experience was as anticipated. We are pleased to be able to share “Our Island” with you; beautiful beaches, awesome sunsets and breathtaking views. We will look forward to your next trip to paradise

title: Beach + Staff!
review: My husband and I chose to stay at this resort for the last 3 days of our honeymoon. Overall we had a great stay.  Pros: clean room, friendly staff, easy and quick check in and out, AMAZING bed, pool, private beach access, tiki bar, 4 places to eat at the resort itself,  complimentary Starbucks coffee and one Dasani water inside room.  Cons: The parking lot is CONSTANTLY filled. It is VERY hard to get a decent parking spot here so you wind up having to  walk the whole resort every time you want to leave, the concierge kind of push themselves upon you. I mean it's great to have someone there to help you if you need it, but I also don't want to feel obligated to tip someone to help me do something I can easily do myself. The tiki bar outside closes way too early, we went down to…

title: Had a great stay
review: We had a wonderful time at this Sheraton.  We stayed on points, so it was definitely worth it to us.  Beach was nice, pool was nice, and the customer service was excellent.  It can feel very busy, since it is a very popular hotel for meetings, groups and weddings, but that feeling didn't follow us to the beach.  We were completely relaxed.  Shout out to Pam in reservations, Deb on the beach cart, and Jerry at the front desk for fantastic customer service.

title: Best hotel I've ever stayed in
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to recognize our outstanding associates. They truly enjoy going above and beyond to make your stay special. It is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service. I have shared your comments with the associates named … they are stars. We are thrilled your experience was as anticipated and was one to remember.  The smell of salt water, the gentle roar of the waves all combine to create a sense of peace and calm here on the beaches of Sand Key and we hope it will bring you back when next you need to completely relax.

title: Very Comfortable Stay
review: My wife and I are just starting our journey together in this world and we chose The Sheraton Sand Key Resort to stay at on our honeymoon. We are blue collar middle class people so this hotel is indeed a change from what we are used to. The bell hop took our luggage when we arrived and was extremely nice and courteous. The room was clean, and we were pleased to see free water, wine glasses, and Starbucks coffee waiting on us in the bathroom. The bed was out of this world comfortable and I truly don't think a bed could get much softer. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the pool area and beach is amazing. I recommend this hotel to anybody and will definitely be returning.

title: Better than expected
review: I am delighted that you chose the Sheraton Sand Key to spend such a memorable time in your journey and am pleased your experience was even more then you anticipated. I hope many memories were made while here and you will return over the years to make many more. Long walks on the beach with beautiful sunsets are here waiting for you. The Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed is found in each of our guest rooms and is comprised of luxurious sheets, a deluxe duvet, a selection of feather down and hypoallergenic pillows, and a custom mattress, It was made with your comfort in mind. Our associates are genuinely friendly and caring and personally enjoy making your stay special.  We look forward to serving you again.

title: Update needed badly,room location
review: I stayed here for a long weekend and found the atmosphere very comfortable and accommodating.  The location is perfect and the room was clean and had a nice view.  The staff were polite and helpful when needed.  I loved that I could be there all day and have PLENTY to do, and definitely wouldn't starve!  The food at the restaurants on site is pretty good.  We ate there at least 4 or 5 times.  The pool is nice and appropriate for families and in a gorgeous setting.  The beach is right there!!.  I also had a jaunt in the fitness center and loved using the treadmill with a beautiful view.  Overall, I found it to be a very pleasant stay and will definitely be visiting again!

title: Pretty good for families
review: I was debating with myself, whether it is 3 or 4 stars out of 5.  Really 3.5. First of all, location is quite good, in our opinion.  Not as crazy as Clearwater Beach on another side of the bridge.  Nice beach with short pleasant walk on the sand.  Don't understand the comments of the people who complain it is long walk to the beach.  Don't you want to go for a pleasant walk on your holiday?! Our room of the 6th floor had balcony with a nice view of the Gulf. Rooms are ok at best, dated, and generally worn out.  Bathroom and outside sink are tiny and old. Service is generally good, with friendly, cheerful and professional staff.  There were some "less friendly" people at times at the front desk. This resort definitely lack sophistication and rightfully positions itself as family…

title: Pleasant stay on a beautiful beach
review: I appreciate that you enjoyed the location and our associates. I apologize for the less friendly associates at the front desk.  I will share your comment with the Director of Guest Services. Enjoying the relaxing sounds while on a beach walk is hard to beat with the gentle sound of waves rolling in and breaking against the sand. It’s continual, more or less universal and that is the perfect background noise to think or just enjoy bonding with your family. It is a restful place to come to after enjoying all those kids’ attractions. We are committed to the quality of our hotel and are constantly renovating on a regular basis to keep it updated. We do not charge a resort fee and only charge for amenities used such as the cribs. Through each comment we receive, both positive and negative, we are able to seek knowledge and growth to better serve our guests. Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback, it is truly appreciated. We would like to remain your hotel of choice when visiting our area.

title: perfect holiday
review: This is a nice place on a beautiful beach. We used points to stay here, so I can't speak to the cost/value. Upon arrival, parking was very simple and free. Our room was ready and the property was sold out as it was Mother's Day weekend. We were pretty hungry when we arrived, so we ate at the bar/grill. My husband had a Grilled Grouper sandwich and I had the Cuban. Both were excellent. All rooms have a refrigerator so I was able to take half my sandwich to go and eat later.  Our room was cozy. It was a perfectly good size for an average hotel room. The balcony was very small, but we could stand on it and look outside. The toilet and tub were in one small room, and the sink was in another. I actually like this because it allows one to get ready/brush teeth while another is…

title: third choice hotel
review: The Clearwater Sand Key area offers a seemingly endless supply of entertainment, natural beauty, and outdoor activities both on land and at sea. We have brought beach tennis Pro, Steven Cutler (Coach Rhino) as the Pool and Beach Activities Director to coordinate activities and provide resort guests with beach tennis lessons. Along with beach tennis, Coach Rhino will be providing an array of activities for guests of all ages. He will be coordinating programs such as beach tennis clinics, sand volleyball games, corn hole and other outside activities. Your review of the area amenities was perfect it; certainly informative to anyone planning a stay here, thank you. I do apologize for incorrect information given to you about BYOB… that is not allowed. We are pleased you enjoyed a great night’s sleep on one of our Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Beds which is found in each of our guest rooms.  The bed is comprised of luxurious sheets, a deluxe duvet, a selection of feather down and hypoallergenic pillows, and a custom mattress. I do hope there will be another stay planned in the future

title: Very nice beach hotel
review: We have stayed at this hotel twice and absolutely have the best time.  We had a lovely view from our room, the bathrooms are small but don't be put off as the rooms make up for sheer comfort and convenience,  there is also a fridge in the room.  Laundry facilities are available.  The staff are always on hand to help you.   The beach bar is a welcome addition in the afternoon,  and there is lots of beach activities.  Rustys bistro is great and the food is delicious.  Definitely worth staying at the hotel and we will be back.

title: Stay on this side of the bridge!
review: We decided we needed a break from Mother Nature in the Northeast, so we booked this trip with short notice.  I was concerned about the hotel after reading some reviews, but decided to have an open mind.  Once we arrived, my worries were put to rest. Yes, the hotel is "older", but in very good condition.  The rooms were clean, our room had a small fridge, in room safe and overlooked the pier. I recommend getting a room on the 5th floor or higher, facing the pier, that way you can see downtown and fireworks from your room.  Yes, the pool was busy, but it was 90 degrees and sunny.  There were always chairs or chaise's available.  Pack a cooler for the pool or beach.  The poolside bar is great but can get expensive. The staff were amazing, always there to help. We had 2 situations…

title: Stay if you have to
review: Thank you for taking the time to write and share feedback from your most recent stay.  Our guest feedback is important to us as often times it may pinpoint an area of needed focus and attention such as the poolside tables being saved. We are addressing this by working on a solution that benefits everyone. We are very proud of our associates. They have integrity, are genuinely friendly and caring, and they are efficient. Ken is one of our stars. Thankfully the wallet was returned in a timely manner. We are pleased your husband was not injured by the flying umbrella. Thank you for being open minded and choosing the Sheraton Sand Key for your stay… I am delighted your experience was better than anticipated.

title: New Loyal Customer
review: This property seems quite worn out. We stayed for mother's day weekend. The first night we could not sleep as there was a lot of noise in the hallways. The pool was packed and busy. The beach was ok. The restaurant food was ok. The hotel has a private beach. The staff customer service is very good. I feel they go out of their way to make up for the property's poor state. Generally I would not recommend Clearwater. If you can go to Sarasota. It's only 20 minutes longer from the airport but the beaches are much better and there are several better hotels. Stay at this hotel, only if you have to stay in Clearwater.

title: Average, but good price
review: Thank you for taking the time to write and share feedback from your most recent stay.  Our guest feedback is important to us as often times it may pinpoint an area of needed focus and attention. We are constantly renovating on a regular basis to keep the hotel updated and will continue to do so to fix those worn out areas.  We are in the first phase of putting new furniture in the rooms at this time and will finish when occupancy allows. I apologize for the noise in the hallway. Our associates are genuinely friendly and energetic; many have been loyal to ensuring our guest have the experience they anticipated for over 20 years or more. Sarasota is a beautiful area. There are many different reasons people choose Clearwater such as family, friends, business and many special events. Clearwater was voted the #1 beach town in Florida in 2013. I do hope you will give us an opportunity to better serve you in the future.

title: Extension of Spring Break Week on the Beach
review: My fiancé and I had a wonderful experience at this hotel. It is completely ADA accessible, we had no trouble getting around, finding parking and the bathrooms were ADA compliant also! It was so nice to sit outside on our balcony, or near the pool. I believe that Sand Key is the best kept secret in Clearwater. My fiancé and I just happened to run into the general manager as we were leaving to go to dinner. Great guy and really made our night with a nice gesture! I can't wait to go back and visit. Thank you to the staff for making it such a great stay!!

title: Recommended!!
review: We were looking for a quite gateway for a few days and the location of this place turned out to be ideal - it is located away from the busy Clearwater beach area but not too far, it is next to a park, it has it's own private beach, it is close to multiple restaurants [multiple price ranges], it is close to a grocery store, it is close to the bay and the ocean. Harbor view from the room is nothing spectacular, but it is a view. Room was standard size with the necessary amenities [no refrigerator], but the bathroom was on the smaller side. I do have to state that the bed was very comfortable and relaxing. The pool is not that big and on weekends gets a bit crowded. Although located on the ocean, there is no view from the pool area and the ocean is couple of minutes walk away. The…

title: Lovely beach!
review: We are way from hustle and bustle of Clearwater Beach, yet still close enough. We love being here on tranquil Sand Key.  I am pleased that it was just what you anticipated. The sparkling waters of the Gulf of Mexico, the beaches of Sand Key, dolphin sightings, and shell collecting all truly showcase Florida’s natural beauty! There are even nesting turtles and eagles in flight. More than 50 native birds can be found by just taking a few minute walk to Sand Key Park. We are working on a project and there will be refrigerators in all the rooms by the end of this year. I will share your comment on the service at the pool bar with our Director of Food and Beverage; we apologize. I am pleased you enjoyed our “Sweet Sleeper Beds.” They were put in the rooms with our guests comfort in mind. We do hope you will think of us the next time you are planning a quick get-away.

title: Okay, not terrible nor great
review: This was a spg award stay for two adults and two teenage daughters in a double room  We just finished spending 7 wonderful nights at this property. The rooms are average and the pool was extremely crowded (spring vacation week), but the part we enjoyed the most was the beautiful beach.   I find the sand quality of Sand Key a notch below that of (unnaturally perfect) Clearwater Beach, but the best part of Sheraton's beach is that there is no need to fight for space. No need to rent the $25 cabana.   I found that the staff went out of their way to make your stay pleasant. Our favorite were the folks attending the club lounge.    Any negatives? In addition to what you heard from other reviewers (small bathroom, etc) I found the AC too loud. Not a big deal.   We'll be back next…

title: A Nice Holiday Getaway
review: If you are a beach person this is definitely the place to be … It is an exceptionally large and private Island beach.  The smell of salt water and the gentle roar of the waves combine to create a sense of peace and calm. Two things determine the size of sand on beaches: the energy (height) of the waves, and the size of the material furnished to the beach. Other things being equal, the higher the average waves on a beach, the coarser the sand. The Pier on Clearwater Beach breaks the waves before they reach the shore. I am sure your two teenage daughters enjoyed their experience and hopefully memories were made for you all. I am very pleased that you enjoyed the Sheraton Club lounge and its associates. Thank you so much for taking the time to recognize all our outstanding associates. They truly enjoy going above and beyond to make your stay special. We do thank you for being a SPG member and we appreciate your loyalty. We will look forward to your next visit.

title: Great stay
review: The hotel is a pretty average hotel. The food options weren't many and the quality was okay. The snack area by the pool was pretty bad, only serving limited fast good like burgers, fries and frozen-style pizza. The pool was always crowded and didn't look very enticing. Most disappointing was the beach itself - sand was not soft with little peoples and shells everywhere and the water itself was rough and not clear. Probably would not choose to go to Clearwater or this hotel again

title: I wish I could live here!
review: This property has become a favorite annual destination. Perfect for family travel, business or both. From the minute you arrive to the sad moment you realize that it is time to return home it is hospitality at it's best. The perfect spot to escape the cold, or just get some much needed R&R and sun. While the hotel has a great pool, when you see the huge, manicured sand beach you'll want to spend most of your time on the beach...under the sun...with a blue cabana...relaxing. Be sure to make note of the "Jolly Trolley" which runs about every :30 minutes and is perfect for taking you from the hotel in Clearwater Beach to Clearwater restaurants, shops and more. Hotel restaurant called "Rusty's" has a great prime rib buffet YUM! Rooms are clean and fresh. Beds are AMAZING! Concierge…

title: Not really a resort
review: We are pleased that we are your home away from home… that is such a wonderful compliment.  Thank you; your review was outstanding and there is really nothing more I can add, you covered it all. You sound like a “Give me Sunshine on my Shoulders and Sand Between my Toes” type of person and we look forward to seeing you next year.

title: Worst hotel ever
review: We stayed here for a week with our kids and I guess I was expecting more of a real beach resort.  The rooms were fine and beds comfortable but the bathrooms were tiny.  The sink is in the room with the tub and toilet in what feels like a closet.  We paid extra for a ocean view with balcony but the balcony was so small we didn't sit out there.  The restaurants looked more like school cafeterias and their wasn't anyplace to have lunch outside.  There is a snack bar that has a few lunch options that was really bad.  The beach is pretty but from the hotel to the water it feels like a 1/2 mile walk and when you get to the water they charge you $25 per person per day for lounge chairs, cushions and a cabana.  I have never stayed at a beach resort that then charged you to use their…

title: Hospitality at it's best!
review: Thank you for sharing your comments regarding your recent stay. I understand your feeling on the cabanas. You will find at many resorts these charges are included in a nightly resort fee. We have opted not to do that, and only charge for usage should the guest so choose. The Cabanas do not belong to the hotel they are a concession so we do not set the prices. We do ensure the prices are in line with other cabana concessions in the area. We do not charge for the lounge chairs that are around the pool or the grassy area. The beach is a bit of a walk; Clearwater and Sand Key are known for their exceptional beaches. They give you that “being on an Island feel”. I do hope that your family enjoyed some of the amenities we have to offer. We are pleased you enjoyed the area.

title: Bad customer service at front desk
review: Tiny family rooms. Not suitable for a family requiring space for a travel cot plus luggage. Bathrooms are dire and so small the sink is in the bedroom. Apart from the lobby, the hotel has clearly not been decorated in 20+ years. The staff are miserable (apart from pool guys) Breakfast buffet is wretched and the pool area is mediocre at best. It's a long walk to the ocean too.  Don't waste your money...

title: very helpful staff
review: we had a brilliant time here . The hotel was as expected , reviews had said bathrooms small and it was, but perfectly functional . room huge and with a sea view. I had absolutely nothing to complain about , beds comfy . The staff at reception and conciege must warrant a special mention as they were so so helpful , but all staff very friendly. Perhaps a fridge in the room would have been good. food that we ate in the hotel all fine and not over expensive .Swimming pool a bit smaller than the picture makes it appear . You will need a car if you stay here and the hotel could try and make that aspect a bit smoother to achieve.

title: Solid choice, but not a real resort getaway
review: It was pleasing to hear your experience was as anticipated. A view of the Gulf of Mexico is great to wake to and watching the sunset in the privacy of your own room is wonderful. We are very pleased with our associates; they sincerely want to ensure they are part of your stay. We are in the middle of a project putting refrigerators in every room, we will continue this project as occupancy allows. There is a shuttle service back and forth to the airport. When on property we have two different transit systems with trolleys and inexpensive taxi service. We do not enhance any of our photos I hope you were not too disappointed in the size of the pool.

title: Better then expected!
review: My wife and I went for a get-away weekend without the kids. The staff was friendly and helpful, but the hotel was definitely not a "resort". Room was fine, nothing special. But the pool was certainly not a "resort" pool, at least not what we're used to. And we probably picked a rough week (spring break) as it was crowded with kids and families. The beach is a good walk from the hotel, but they did do a good job of setting up two-person cabanas and provided a drink and food service cart at the beach. But again, not a lot of resort amenities going on here. Never ended up eating at any of the restaurants, as there are so many good places to eat in Tampa (Berns Steakhouse and the Columbia). But I don't think we'd go back if we ever make it here again.

title: Good hotel but with some room for improvement
review: Whether you're looking for a peaceful, relaxing vacation or a fun-filled getaway, we provide the perfect setting to make new memories. Walking along the shore, catching a sunset and so much more. The hotel is a bit of a walk to the shoreline… that is what makes it a private Island Beach. There are many places to find your own little corner of tranquility. We realize that it is a walk to the water’s edge as you said the beach buggy is usually out there with drinks and food for our guests convenience. Yes! there are many great restaurants to choose from. We have many that are casual where all you need is shirt and shoes…. and many fine dining  restaurants where you can dress up. We are disappointed that you will not return and understand you are looking for a better fit.

title: "Resort" is a bit of a stretch
review: This sheraton property is just across the bridge from Clear Water. The staff are very accommodating and helpful. The rooms are typical for Sheraton Chain. The carpets in the room could use some cleaning, but other then that it was perfect. I try to stay in hotels that have window or doors that will open for fresh air. These rooms have a small balcony with views of beach or park. We love the gulf coast and thought this beach was great - not so crowed! A great place to have a quick lunch in the hotel would be the ~Main Stay Tavern~ greatest margaritas  (made best by bartender Nelson).I would not recommend Rusty's  Bistro. Maybe they were having an off night when we were there...but it is a waste of money and time. After ordering it was a long wait to be served. Also you need to…

title: Good location, great beach with outdated hotel rooms and small pool
review: Pros: Great Hotel, location is very nice. Away from the main area of Clearwater. Pool staff is great and tries to be creative and entertaining. Good restaurants and food is reasonable and good.  Cons: You still have to drive through main Clearwater area to reach the hotel. Traffic to reach back can be horrendous. Rooms are small, very small. Hotel tends to get noisy and voice travels since this is old hotel. Pool is extremely small for the size of the hotel. The picture actually makes it bigger than what it is. Beach is almost a mile out from the pool side. So if you have little ones it is a hike. A hotel as big as Sheraton I was amazed they have no beach chairs or umbrella. So if you plan a beach day get ready to shed out $25. Pool side has to be extreme dull area. I was…

title: Service is excellent but disappointing in a few areas.
review: Please accept our apologies for having missed the opportunity to impress you. Through each comment we receive, both positive and negative, we are able to seek knowledge and growth to better serve our guests. Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback; it is truly appreciated and I will be sure to share. In reading through your specific comments I do respect your opinion on fees being applied to items such as a roll-away bed and I am pleased Janet took care of that for you. She will be pleased when I share your comment with her. We do not charge a resort fee and only charge for amenities used such as the internet and roll-away beds. We do have free internet at the Link @ Sheraton Experienced with Microsoft which is located in The Mainstay Tavern. We also have just added several new wireless access points throughout all lobbies. The Cabanas do not belong to the hotel and are a concession so we do not set the prices. We do ensure the prices are in line with other cabana concessions in the area. We have a talented culinary staff and it pleases us that you enjoyed dinning in the hotel restaurants. We do ensure that we cater to our guest’s special dinning needs. The months of March and April are the busiest months due to Spring Break and Easter. I can assure you the Front Desk Agent was not being cavalier when not checking if there was another room to assign you. We have been at full occupancy for the last few months. Again I apologize that your stay was not the experience you anticipated.

title: Lime Gate- bad business decision
review: Our family of 4 stayed in a twin Queen-bedded room on the ground floor for a week this April. We found the room was OK but a very poky bathroom let it down. Being located near the Jacuzzi was not great as it was being used by noisy guests from early in the morning to very late at night - in all weathers! The pool itself was far too small for the size of the resort and was simply overcrowded. The water in both pools was murky and the Jacuzzi had a scum form whenever it was allowed to rest (which admittedly was not often). The staff were excellent and the other facilities were fine.

title: Gorgeous!
review: Whether you're looking for a peaceful, relaxing vacation or a fun-filled family getaway, we provide the perfect setting to make new memories. I am pleased that most of your stay was as anticipated. I can assure you that the upkeep on the pool is daily.  I do understand it being overcrowded and noisy as March and April are our busiest time of the year. There are many other times of the year that we offer a relaxing environment. I agree that the design of the bathroom needs to be addressed. We are unable to change the size and layout of the bathrooms due to losing space in the sleeping area. We are always looking into workable solutions. Please rest assured that we do take your feedback very serious and that we will do our  utmost to better meet your expectations next time given a chance.

title: Great hotel, great food, great service!
review: Nice place.. Great people. Apparently there is a like shortage and the staff loves to tell the drug cartel story.   Bottom line, I'm on vacation and I would like a lime in my drink. Here, however, this week before Easter, the someone made the decision to not give limes, even to those who ask for one with a $12 silver patron on the rocks.  For clarity, over the last 7 days, I was here and down to Naples.  I are at Frenchys, Sand Pearl hotel, palm pavilion, crabby bills and literally 20 other places for lunch or dinner, and NOT ONCE was I regaled with the tale of the drug lord line issues and denied a wedge.. Not once.  But here at the Sheraton, someone who does not understand the variable cost risk of commodities, associated with running a business, was allowed to make a poor…

title: Great Family Hotel and the Best Service
review: This is my 2nd visit with the family and enjoyed it once again because of the amazing service of the staff. As soon as you arrive you are met with excellent service from the concierge and check-in is a breeze. Jeanne was so welcoming and made sure we were set for a relaxing vacation.  I will agree with other views that the bathrooms are very small and difficult for everyone to get ready for the day, but that is only 30 minutes of the day. The view of the beach is unbelievable and the pool staff is ready to help. With elementary age kids, it is so great that they offer sand toys, footballs, and other items to use at the beach or pool area. They just use the honor system that you will return what you borrowed. Nice perk when most folks are flying to this wonderful destination. It…

title: Best beach property and great staff
review: We will look forward to your third visit!  All of our associates are committed to providing you with the service levels and recognition you deserve and expect. I will share your comment with Jeanne; I know she will be pleased. When the children are content it usually enables the adults to relax. I hope some memories were made. There is just something so peaceful about looking out the window and seeing the beauty that surrounds us here we are always happy to be able to share.

title: Enjoyed our stay
review: Went there with my husband and kids for 10 year anniversary vacation. We don't usually rent a car if we're staying by the beach. This was a beautiful beach resort. I found pricing reasonable because it included buffet breakfast for two. They also have a four star restaurant inside and with sun-thurs specials for the dinner buffet for two adults and up to 4 kids for $59 that's quite reasonable. The staff in every occupation from cleaning, check in to pool attendants were so friendly and professional. I would definitely come here again!

title: overpriced for the mediocre experience
review: The smell of salt water, the gentle roar of the waves all combine to create a sense of peace and calm here on the beaches of Sand Key. We do try to keep the prices reasonable and have nightly specials as well as a healthy children’s menu with reasonable prices. I hope you enjoyed our Hand Carved Prime Rib of Beef Buffet family special.  You are correct… that is a deal $9.83 per person.  Children under 5 always eat from our buffet for free. We do have a very talented Executive Chef who ensures that there are choices that everyone will enjoy. Our associates genuinely care and want to ensure they in part are responsible for your positive stay. We will forward to your return visit.

title: Mini vacation
review: Spent five nights staying here and the family enjoyed it. Hotel does a good job trying to promote family activities. It rained one day and they had games, videos and even a wii in one of the banquet rooms for the kids to use. Food is on the high side of cost but not many choices down in Clearwater. Would stay again if we come to Clearwater .

title: We will be back
review: We are Starwood members so trying a new spot in Clearwater we immediately considered the Sheraton and were not disappointed.  We had a suite with an adjoining room so plenty of space for a family of five.  Our visit also included complimentary access to the Starwood lounge where we ate everyday for breakfast - Peggy was great.  The facility is perfect - not too big, nice pool area and huge beach.  My kids became addicted to beach tennis.  We will definitely return to this location.  I would also recommend all of the restaurants in the plaza across the street. The food at the hotel was pretty good, but didn't compete with the spots across the road.  However, if after a long day at the beach you don't want to venture out, the food is very good.

title: Beautiful !!!
review: “Welcome to Our Island.” I am truly pleased your experience was what you anticipated. Vacations go better when planned properly and it seems as if planned perfectly when reserving a suite with an adjoining room. I understand your children’s addiction to beach tennis. Beach tennis merges the sports of tennis and beach volleyball into one action packed sport that originated on the beaches of Ravenna, Italy over 30 years ago … it looks like so much fun. I am pleased you explored the area and dined outside of the hotel. Although we do have a very talented culinary staff, the area also boasts many great restaurants. We will look forward to a return visit sometime in the future.

title: Very disappointed!
review: Picked this Resort without knowing anything about the Clearwater, Florida. I couldn't have made a better choice. The hotel is located away from the hustle & bustle of the downtown Clearwater area. Located on the beach, gave the feeling of being on a private retreat. The restaurants in the hotel are delicious. Mainstay  Tavern  for a quick dinner was wonderful. Loved the Pulled Pork Sandwich. Rusty's Bistro had a delightful breakfast buffet, which catered to all taste buds. Rooms were spotless. Hotel staff and concierge were extremely helpful. Would definitely return to this Clearwater gem.

title: Okay hotel
review: When you're looking for a peaceful, relaxing, vacation we provide the perfect setting to make new memories. We welcome you to “Our Island.” It is paradise.  I am pleased you enjoyed our culinary offerings. Our Housekeeping associates take pride in ensuring the rooms are clean and welcoming for you. All of our associates are delighted to ensure that your stay is the experience you anticipated. We are pleased that you will return when in the Clearwater area and will look forward to that visit.

title: great staff, overall good experience
review: Stay two nights in late March. The hotel, and the service, was not at all what I have come to expect at a Sheraton… particularly when I'm paying $300+ per night.   The room was not ready when we checked in (after 3:00p, as directed). When we finally made it to the room, I discovered that it was situated next to the rooftop HVAC system — making for an awful view and a good deal of noise. Upon discussing this with the property manager, we were given another room… right across from the elevator! I gave up at that point.  The hotel feels a bit "old"… it's clean, but scruffy. And despite having the hotel guest parking decal prominently positioned (as directed) on the vehicle windshield, we were stopped every time we entered the parking lot and questioned extensively about whether or…

title: Nice beach hotel
review: We liked it, the room, the breakfast, everything, Nice and clean, Great staff. They give you free parking and its right on the beach, just small walk on the sand. We would defiantly come back here again.

title: We enjoyed this hotel
review: It is very satisfying to hear that your expectations were fulfilled and your experience was a success. Our associates truly care and do their best to ensure that you enjoy your time with us. Here on the Island of Sand Key you certainly can experience Mother Nature at her best; sparkling waters of the Gulf of Mexico, the beaches of Sand Key, dolphin sightings, shell collecting. It all truly showcases Florida’s natural beauty! “Welcome to Our Island” and yes, please do come back.

title: Great time
review: We stayed March 26-31.  We enjoyed the hotel and found it to be a clean and friendly hotel.  Pros: - very comfortable queen beds.  I usually find the beds in hotels give me a   backache and very little sleep, not these beds!  - nice heated pool and hot tub with lots of towels and chairs - friendly and responsive staff - beautiful, clean beach, yes a longer walk but an easy stroll - very hot showers - very clean rooms - lots of free computers with printer that works in lobby area - free parking, not sure if most hotels charge or not - nice tennis courts and decent tennis rackets - Starbucks coffee in room - nice view from balcony - nice flat screen tv in room - great margaritas from the pool bar Cons: - no fridge or microwave in room - no wireless in room unless you pay for it…

title: Sheraton Sand Key ....Had a great time
review: I was delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay. Sitting in the hot tub relaxing with a margarita and then finishing the evening on “The Sheraton Sweet Sleeper”TM Bed … sounds great. The beds are in each of our guest rooms and are comprised of luxurious sheets, a deluxe duvet, a selection of feather down and hypoallergenic pillows, and a custom mattress…prefect for a great night’s sleep.  We always appreciate when our guests take the time to share their concerns with us so we can continue to improve our service. We are in the middle of a project at this time to put refrigerators in all rooms and will finish when occupancy allows.  Coffee is being provided complimentary in the rooms for our guests.  I concur that the internet is something most all guests require nowadays. It is one of our standards to have a fee in place, however, just recently we have modified this in a small way and all internet in the lobby and The Link @ Sheraton experienced by Microsoft (located in our Mainstay Tavern) is provided free of charge.  This may be a step in the direction of providing it complimentary in all guestrooms, but for now it remains as a fee based service.  If you like tennis you must come back as we are putting in beach tennis courts and we now have a tennis pro who is teaching and creating challenges for our guests during their stay

title: Bad 1st impression
review: My daughter and my wife was amazed with the different types of activities the hotel has, we had friends that also came over to visit and they also liked the pool,the beach,the bathroom was to small but at least was spotless real clean I would recommend.

title: Perfect beach location
review: My husband and I stayed 5 nights and had a lovely beachfront room from March 21st to the 26th. Had I known that our trip was planned during Spring Break, we may have booked during a different time but it really didn't impact us except for traffic. There was also a national lacrosse tournament going on so there were probably a lot more teens around the hotel than usual. It was only noticeable walking through the lobby, otherwise, the rooms were quiet. The room was super clean and I felt very comfortable walking barefoot; sometimes I get the icks just putting my head on the pillow but not there. Hotel restaurants were great; we had breakfast there twice, ordered lunch once at the pool and had dinner once at Rusty's and once at Island Grille. The only hiccup was that the only day…

title: carefree on Clearwater Beach
review: Welcome to Our Island.” We do hope you will plan another visit. Spring Break is a very different environment. It is more about families and children and we do enjoy having them here also. If you would like a more tranquil stay, after Easter is usually a very relaxing time. I will share your comments on the cleanliness with our Housekeeping department.  I am pleased you felt so comfortable putting your head on the Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed which is found in each of our guest rooms and is comprised of luxurious sheets, a deluxe duvet, a selection of feather down and hypoallergenic pillows, and a custom mattress. We appreciate your comments on the hotel’s restaurants. Through each comment we receive, both positive and negative, we are able to seek knowledge and growth to better serve our guests.  Again, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. It is truly appreciated and I will be sure to share your comment about the sign with the person who owns the cabana concession.

title: Good stay at The Sand Key
review: My husband and I enjoyed a relaxing, lazy 5-day vacation here.  Our handicap accessible room on the 8th floor was perfect for us.  We were comfortable and especially loved our balcony with views of the intracoastal waterway.  If we stood at the corner of the balcony we could see the sunset over the Gulf of Mexico.  With mobility issues, we look for fully-appointed resorts which we found here.  Restaurants, pool, spa, fitness center (on the 9th floor) and sandy beach all easily accessible.  The pool staff provided us with a special wheelchair for the beach that had super huge tires.  Parking is free.  The Suncoast Trolley (totally wheelchair accessible) stops right at the front of the hotel, and travels a loop from Clearwater Beach to St. Pete Beach, with many stops along the…

title: Totally Low Rent!
review: I am thrilled with your review. Insuring we are following ADA accessibility guide lines and making sure you are comfortable is one of our goals. It sounds as if your experience was just what you anticipated … relaxation. I am pleased you enjoyed the beach wheel chair.  I hope you got to the shoreline as the sand is packed and the chair moves smoothly. The Sun coast trolley is not just transportation… it takes you on a great sightseeing tour of the area and as you said, you can get on and off to shop or dine. Our associates are not only efficient but warm and caring. They enjoy the personal interaction with our guests. We will look forward to another visit in the future.

title: Great vacation spot! Great service/hotel! Great Travel Agent!
review: recently enjoyed a 2 week stay at the hotel, Staff helpful and friendly, special mention to Andre on reception who facilitated a room change for and was most helpful during our stay, rooms comfortable, great location, right on the beach which you walk down for miles, Could also walk into Clearwater (10 - 15 minutes over bridge) Service good in all 3 restaurants and not overpriced. one minor grumble pool is a little on the small side. other than that had a great stay at the hotel

title: Disappointed
review: For $$$$$ the price I was very disappointed. The room smelled of mold and dust covered the lamps and nightstand and other flat surfaces. The front desk was not friendly and one employee talked personal talk with someone while we stood holding all of our heavy bags. When someone did come to assist us her mouth was filled with candy and we couldn't understand what she was saying. The view from pool was a beautiful sight of the beach which was the only plus side.

title: wedding renewal of vows on the beach
review: I sincerely apologize as it is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service. Not meeting our goals and your expectations is very concerning. We have noted your comments on the cleanliness and I have forward your remarks to our Director of Housekeeping in order to counsel the associate who cleaned your room and provide additional training to ensure that this occurrence will not take place again. I realize that the Front Desk Agent is the first person you usually make contact with and that is where your first impression is formed.  The lack of a warm, comforting and professional greeting is definitely not the genuine service we strive to deliver. I have shared your comments with the Director of Guest Services.  I appreciate that you enjoyed the location.

title: Nice location, good service and eclectic crowd
review: the rooms were clean.  The beach was a long distance from the hotel.  The pool was warm.  The poolside bar was convenient.  Rusty's had delicious food and choices.  The hotel was centrally located near Clearwater beach, beautiful sunsets.  There was a free shuttle service to local bars, to avoid drinking and driving.

title: Great Location and Customer Service
review: Congratulations! Beautiful sunsets, the views and our private Island beach is a great setting for your renewal of vows. Dinner in Rusty’s Bistro with professional servers and a talented culinary staff can be delightful. Send a picture for Sheraton Sand Key Facebook. The area promotes sun and fun so we must ensure you are taken care of while doing so. Those shuttles are to keep you safe.  Our turtle bar is convenient… you, a lounge chair, and a cool beverage.

title: Room location
review: This hotel has something for most everyone looking for a relaxing holiday.  There were lots of families with kids of all ages, there was a political rally in one of their conference rooms and companies were hosting "off sites".  In other words, it is a big place with lots of rooms and all types of guests.  Mostly, however, it felt like a families with kids (mostly teens and younger) place.  We were told by other guests that it can get crowded but that wasn't our experience.  We were three in a room with two queens.  The view from the room was beautiful and we enjoyed sunsets from the small deck in the evening.  Even when we slept in a little the cleaning staff came in to tidy up after we left.  The bathroom was a little worn but the beds were very comfortable.  The hotel had…

title: Relaxing afternoon at the pool
review: Stopped by to see family staying at this resort. It is in the quiet section of Clearwater, FL called Sand Key. Located right off of the clean, white sand beach. The pool was refreshing and the pool bar even more so. Completed the day with an Italian dinner in one of the resort's restaurants. Plan to stay at this resort on next trip.

title: Like Going Home
review: We do have a corner of Paradise, beautiful beaches caring associates, sand pails full of your favorite libation. We are so pleased that you enjoyed your visit with your family. Those Italian dinners you mentioned are something new at the Island Grille, we enjoyed your feedback. We will look forward to your stay.

title: GREAT TIMES MAN!
review: We have stayed at this hotel for the last three years in the Spring and have always found the staff to be warm and accommodating.  Our hotel room was very clean and the beds very comfortable.  Both the Mainstay Pub and Rusty's Restaurant in the hotel served very good food and the wait staff were very friendly.  The outside pool area next to the beach was immaculate and had a nice outside bar.  The fitness room had Life Fitness cardio and weight machines and a great view of the bay and Gulf.  While not a new hotel, we found everything to be clean and well maintained.  We will definitely return next year.

title: Nice spot near Clearwater Beach
review: It is always a pleasure to read that your expatiations were met. After three years you have probably formed a bond with several of our associates, they are genuinely efficient, warm and caring. “Our Sweet Sleeper Beds” are made with your comfort in mind, I am pleased you slept comfortably. It sounds as if your trip was a success, hopefully your team won. I will share your comments on to housekeeping, grounds men, servers, and the other departments mentioned. We will forward to next year’s visit.

title: Very Nice Location
review: Dude, I FOUND myself at your hotel, man!! Like, I don't know, it was just such a spiritually enlightening trip. I am so blessed by god. The dining was like... woah. The bed was like... YES. A few problems: The t.v. channels stunk... No disney?!? I thought we were in the home of disney.. FLORIDA?!? Anyway... overall GREAT experience, with good beaches and great service. Solid trip. More on the service, my favorite server I had was Roberta, a nice women who I had much in common with. What a nice, kind, spiritual server. Seriously in touch with her inner self and the world. I also enjoyed one of the Room service men that gave me Creme Brule... but I don't remember his name. Thank you so much Shereton for amenities, and FABULOUS servers. I feel blessed. xo.

title: Average older Sheraton hotel, exceptional location
review: We just left after a 4-night stay at the Sheraton Sand Key in March 2014. We were in Clearwater for spring training, to see the Philadelphia Phillies. This Sheraton hotel is really just average; the lobby, common areas and rooms seem quite a bit outdated, but they are clean. Our room, on the second floor facing the parking lot and tennis courts, was very small but clean. The sink is outside the bathroom, which is odd, and the bathroom itself was positively tiny.  The beach is very nice, but quite a walk from the hotel. The pool was surprisingly small for a "resort" hotel, as was the hot tub. I found the heated pool too cool to use on a 75-degree sunny day. The hot tub was so crowded there was often no room in it! There are no lounge chairs on the beach, unless you want to pay…

title: Fantastic Hotel on a Gorgeous Beach!!!
review: Your feedback is important to us as we strive to improve our products, services, and overall customer experience. The internet is something most all guests require nowadays.  It is one of our standards to have a fee in place, however, just recently we have modified this in a small way and all internet in the lobby or The Mainstay Tavern at The  Link @ Sheraton Experienced with Microsoft (the Link) is provided free of charge.  This may be a step in the direction of providing it complimentary in all guestrooms, but for now it remains as a fee based service.  We are constantly renovating on a regular basis to keep the hotel updated and will continue to do so to fix those worn out areas.  We are in the first phase of putting new refrigerators in the rooms at this time and will finish when occupancy allows. The lobby was just refurbished completely in 2013. The Cabanas do not belong to the hotel and are a concession so we do not set the prices. We do ensure the prices are in line with other cabana concessions in the area. We do have lounge chairs for the beach but they can only be taken as far as the end of the volleyball court. We are a resort and most of the resorts in this area charge a resort fee; we have chosen not to have that charge and only charge for the amenities used. I am pleased that you enjoyed the location and hopefully the weather was good and your team won. You are correct, we are not a luxury resort we are a beach resort. Perhaps you will consider giving us another opportunity to serve you when you are in a planning a beach get-away.

title: Great Hotel but Handicapped rooms are not wheelchair friendly
review: This is the best resort combo I have stayed at in some time. I had a king room which was spacious, clean and met my needs in every way. I even got a view of the Gulf. But the real treat was the bed which is as comfortable as any I have ever slept on in a hotel. As a matter of fact, it may be the best I've ever slept on and that's saying a lot.  The meals were excellent and although all of the meals were prepared for a large group setting, the quality and taste and service were equal to a private meal at any restaurant.  Even though there were other groups staying at the hotel at the same time, I believe we were still made to feel special and that we were getting all of the hotel's attention.  Very helpful and professional staff was the cherry on top. I've attended other business…

title: Away from touristy area, yet close if you seek it.
review: I am pleased that we succeeded in making your experience memorable. The meeting space at Sheraton Sand Key was designed with you and the other attendees in mind. I want to thank you for sharing your comments with us as it is very important for us to hear the voice of our customer. Our culinary staff takes pride in what they prepare whether it be for a table of one or a group of 200.  The exceptional service and personal touches our associates give our guest are because you are a VIP and you deserve to be treated as so. Our “Sweet Sleeper Beds” are made with your comfort in mind. Our beach is beautiful and I hope you enjoyed a breathtaking sunset or two. We hope one day you will return for a relaxing vacation.

title: Just lovely!
review: It is an older hotel..but I wanted to advise ya'll that the bathroom sinks are not lowered and set in too far and out of reach for a wheelchair. The room doors are not automatic, you need the repair man to alter the door so you can get a wheelchair in the room BUT the hallway into the room is not wide enough for a wheelchair. This hotels has the majority of handicapped rooms with King beds which renders the room fit for for one person, there isn't enough space to have 2  people in this room.  The washroom is large and the roll in showers don't drain properly and you end up with 2" puddles outside of the shower.

title: Very relaxing trip
review: We chose Sand Key to get away from the hustle and bustle or Clearwater beach.  We showed up not really knowing what to expect.  We found numerous activities for our 10 & 12 year old children.  The staff was very friendly, the food and drinks were great and the amenities were top notch.  The only problem I found was the price we paid and the size of the room.  I realize it is a beach side resort at the beginning of peak season (spring break) but our room was very small.  Otherwise everything was great.  Stefan C Colorado

title: Great Spring Break (Sand Key Island) jsmo
review: It is very satisfying to hear that your expectations were fulfilled during your stay. We do promote relaxation and we are surrounded with nature’s soothing sights and sounds which assist us in doing just that. The beach is a great place to connect with your family with no outside intrusions.  Our associates truly care and do their best to ensure that you enjoy your time with us.  It sounds as if was a great family vacation. Please trust that these room rates are very competitive compared to the other hotels in the area. We do often run special rates at other times of the year.  We hope to see you again.

title: Staff is wonderful!
review: Our family had a very good spring break at Sheraton Sand Key for 5 days/4 nights enjoying professional staff, combo gulf/bay facilities and surrounding Sand Key Island. High points were resort 10 acre beach, multiple hotel restaurants, club room breakfast / beverage / evenings, either rooftop or poolside sunset/sunrise settings, local island gulf versus bay jet-ski / parasail / sailing / fishing / excursions and local island shops. There were no crowds south of Sand Key Park and Sand Key Bridge (south of a very crowded Clearwater Beach). Sheraton staff were always helpful from check in/out, to club service, to pool & beach service, along with good concierge advice about gulf versus bay thru the island. The gulf is 300' west, while bay is 300' east. The hotel was built in 1975,…

title: Amazing Location!!!
review: We strive to provide our guests with a superior experience through our product and services. Insight such as yours will only aid us in attaining our goals and for this I thank you. I enjoyed reading your review you had a very accurate description of the hotel, our area and the amenities both offer. I was delighted that you and your family enjoyed Spring Break here; we truly look forward to your next visit.  We are pleased you recognized our associates as they sincerely enjoy assisting our guests. Being away from all the activity of Clearwater Beach area provides us with a tranquil atmosphere. The trolley is a good way to travel stress free and everyone can enjoy the sites and avoid parking issues.

title: Awesome customer service
review: Stayed at teh Sheraton Sand Key in Nov. 2013 for a girls trip  The staff is nothing short of amazing! From guest services, to the restaurants, the managers, and the turtle bar- everyone was so nice and helpful.    The pool is clean and nice- a little small but that was okay since the beach is just a short walk away.  The chairs at the beach by the water are for renting only- they wanted to charge I believe 25 dollars a day for a cabana.  We were laying just on the sand/towels for awhile but asked for just chairs and they let us rent them for $5 each for the day- not a bad deal at that price- we didnt need the cabana anyways.  We got up and left and someone came by and took our chairs though when we went up to the hotel.  The turle bar by the pool is great- they have awesome sand…

title: Enjoyable Stay on the Beach
review: Just got done with a stay at Sand Key, March 3 through 8th.  We enjoyed our stay.  There were 5 of us and they provided a roll-a-way for $10 a night.  Made the room a little tight but that was okay.  Beds were very comfortable, slept very well.  A larger bathroom would have helped.  Didn't need much "service" but all staff we encountered were friendly and helpful.  One annoying situation was trying to get the 24-hour Wi-Fi service (in-room, up to three devices, lobby is free) for $9.95 on multiple devices but it kept charging us double each time.  Was removed on request though immediately.  Stayed on points and had a parking lot view but could see the harbor.  7th floor room and found the elevators very responsive, not any long waits at all.  Awesome workout room on the top…

title: Wedding and Get-Away...or not!
review: I hope many fun memories were made while staying at the Sheraton Sand Key and in those close quarters. I want to thank you for sharing your comments with us as it is very important for us to hear the voice of our customer.  I can assure you your comments will be shared with our Systems Manager so that improvements can be made on our Wi-Fi service. Our “Sheraton Sweet Sleeper” beds and roll – away beds are made with your comfort in mind. I am glad you had a great night’s sleep. The view in the Sheraton Fitness is panoramic. We just added a tennis pro to our staff so the next time you come the courts will be more active.

title: Wonderful staff and beautiful property
review: For a wedding venue, the Sheraton Sand Key Resort at Clearwater, Florida is wonderful. The menus served were delicious.  Although we did check out as quickly as possible as this resort is totally a quality for Spring Break! Every door opens to the exterior/on to the balcony... The decor is definitely 1990's! Desperately in need of a every guest room receiving an overhaul.

title: Felt like the Caribbean
review: I was very pleased that your wedding was a success and memories were made, it is a very special day, wishing you many years of happiness ...  It is our goal to effectively meet the expectations of our guests and provide excellent customer service.  For not meeting our goals and your expectations I apologize. Although we are a casual beach resort; we are constantly renovating on a regular basis to keep the hotel updated and will continue to do so to fix those worn out areas.  We are in the first phase of putting new furniture in the rooms at this time and will finish when occupancy allows. Every bed has been replaced with a new “Sheraton Sweet Sleeper” bed which allows our guests a great night’s sleep.

title: Great Stay
