As this was during spring break, the hotel was full, but the man at the desk found us a harbor king on the 6th floor. Well, there is a view of the harbor, but not before the entire roof of the first floor of the hotel with all of its noisy air conditioning and venting…

title: Fantastic Views, Fantastic Stay!
review: I recently returned from this resort (March18-22). We had a total of 7 travelers (4 adults and three children ages 11, 11, and 8).  This resort lived up to all of our expectations: room was clean, pool area was lively, and location was excellent. Every person that we encountered at this resort couldn't do enough to help make our trip special: Magda, Klaus and Grant at the pool, and the bartenders in the Lobby Bar an Pool Bar, went above and beyond to provide great service and great conversation. I did not find the breakfast prices or drink prices to be expensive, it was typical for what you would expect to pay at a resort.  While we were at this hotel, there were several conferences going on, but the resort never seemed overwhelmingly crowded.  Sand Key Beach was beautiful, and…

title: Vacation
review: Yes! That is what we like to hear. We love making you comfortable. Our associates really do care and truly want to be part of you having a successful stay. We are pleased you and the children enjoyed being here. You must return sometime when it is a bit warmer so you can really enjoy the beach.

title: Thin Walls, Ill-fitting Doors, Noisy but an Excellent Location
review: Excellent place to stay...staff extremely friendly, only complaint was when my friend had the "do not disturb sign" on the door, but house keeping still went in anyhow, and after leaving, did not latch the door fully...spoke to manager, who did make it right immediately, sent maintenance up, fixed the door, and gave us dinner for 2 at Rusty's for their Prime Rib buffet.  Which is fantastic.  Food is awesome!  Not just at Rusty's but at all locations.  Every employee from, maintenance, to housekeeping, to managers are extremely friendly.  Would go back in a heart beat!!!  Extremely relaxing.

title: Crappy service and value.
review: We are pleased that you enjoyed your time spent with us. I must agree the beaches are so relaxing.  Thank you for recognizing our associates they enjoy making our guests stay memorable. I am glad you enjoyed your experience at Rusty’s Bistro, we do have a very talented culinary staff. We will look forward to your next visit

title: Location great, hotel just okay!
review: Spent 4 nights here for a conference. Expensive even at the conference rate. Staff could only suggest towels to block out the noise from the corridor as well as the rooms across it as we had rather loud neighbours! The hotel itself appeared very shoddily built - our door had a gap underneath it ranging from 1.5" to 1" and the shower flooded the whole bathroom if used for longer than 5 minutes. A request for a room change was ignored - it appears membership of the SPG is worthless so will probably transfer mine to Airline miles with Delta or Virgin Atlantic. As a rule I find most Sheraton's better than this. If I return it will be to a different hotel. Having said that the food was good, service excellent in the Ocean Grille if a little patchy in the main dining room. Whoever…

title: Ok
review: Too pricey at 289 per night. But a very clean hotel and very accommodating . Would stay here again... Little far from areas with restaurants and bars, etc., but very nice hotel. Nice beach, bathroom small.... No wifi unless you pay:( that's a rip off.... But overall, good place.

title: A little Better
review: We truly want you to enjoy your experience when staying at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort. We are pleased you enjoyed the beach; it is a great place to relax, reflect and recharge. That is part of the charm of being on Sand Key, you are away from the noise and traffic, close enough to Florida’s recently voted # one beach town Clearwater Beach and all of the amenities.. We do have The Link powered by Microsoft which is free internet and it is located in our Mainstay Tavern. We do not charge a resort fee which most hotels do, we only charge for amenities used such as the internet in your room. We do hope you will return.

title: An outstanding place with great service
review: The hotel staff seemed a little better than last visit. I did not have any issue with bar staff - they actually stayed a little late to let us finish watching the game - so that was great service. The hotel continues to be an average facility. There is just nothing that makes it a special hotel. The gym was very nice with great views of the ocean and bay. The internet speed was good- almost fast enough for streaming video - but not quite. The facility was sold out - but never seemed crowded. I like the hotel - but could not find a feature that made the facility special. The price was very high due to high demand time of year.  We encountered ESPN outage in the rooms as well as a false fire alarm during the stay.  The bathrooms do need a renovation- shower heads are really low.

title: Great location and awesome beach
review: I am genuinely pleased to hear that the associates gave you the warm, efficient service that you deserve when staying here at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort. We are in the process of renovating the hotel. We greatly appreciate your comments and look forward to your return visit.

title: Will never stay here again
review: Me and my husband stayed here for our honeymoon. I can not speak highly enough of this hotel and service we received. Everybody was so nice and helpful. We will never forget that Janet (lady from reception) sent us a card, chocolate strawberries and a bottle of champagne to celebrate our honeymoon. It was an amazing suprise which we will cherish all of our lifes. We went to the hot tub in the evening met lovely people there. It was a relaxed and very friendly  atmosphere. Hotel has great access to the beach. It's so beautiful. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to everyone. Our room was overlooking the sea. We were lucky to see a sunset. It was a truly unforgettable experience! Absolutely loved it!

title: Not so impressed
review: Location:   The hotel is right on the beach but there is a LOT of sand between the hotel and the water.  Not sure how it happened but it's like they cut down the dunes and just made a really really large sand area.  The other condos in the area are closer to the water.   The Marriott is across the street on the bayside.   A few restaurants and shops a block or two away.   You are a drive (over a bridge) from the Clearwater Beach action.   Check In:  It was okay.   A little bit of attitude.    Room:  Well it was also just okay.  Not really impressed and the bathroom was really small.  I had a balcony but the way the hotel was designed there was a large dark wall outside the sliding door.  The room was very dark and the semi-ocean view was really semi.     The lobby is sterile and…

title: Warm, friendly staff in a very clean, convenient location.
review: I sincerely apologize for the off brand attitude at check in; that certainly is not what we expect from or associates.  I can assure you this will be addressed. The beach was all nature’s doing.  Our beach is so large due to the inlet and the jetty of rocks over at Sand Key Park. The State put in the jetty to protect the pass from filling from erosion.  The result is that the sand builds up on our beach and the park’s beach instead of washing out into the Clearwater Pass. Our lobby was just renovated; it might seem a little sterile as it was designed to look clean and sleek to make the tourist and business traveler both comfortable. One of the reasons it was designed that way was for our guests comfort.  Being on the beach guest bring in with them water & sand and carpets can intimidate them. We do hope you enjoyed some of the amenities the Sheraton Sand Key and our area have to offer.

title: Location is perfect!
review: My husband and I along with our two year old stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort for four nights starting March 12th.   The desk staff was very welcoming and pleasant throughout our stay. One gentleman even offered an ice cream voucher for our daughter a little after our arrival.    The room was very clean and although not filled with modern gadgetries, I didn't find it terribly outdated. The room was not large but I wasn't looking for a suite since I was not planning on spending much time in the room except for sleeping, showering and getting dressed. The bedding and towels were clean and in good condition. It was easy to hear sounds from the hallway and guests in their bathrooms and see the light from the gap under the door, but it didn't bother me enough to complain or…

title: What a view !!!!
review: I genuinely enjoyed your review; we are pleased you enjoyed our associates.  They do sincerely care. I am pleased you were relaxed; I feel this is definitely the area to do that. It is unfortunate that the weather did not cooperate for a dip in the pool. The area does have so much to offer in arts, entertainment and sports. Maybe next year when it is time to recharge you and your family will visit us again.

title: One of Many
review: We were repeat visitors to the Sheraton Sand Key.  Love the location----over the bridge away from the Clearwater beach craziness.  This is a very quiet, family friendly location.  The pool is beautiful, the rooms are large and clean, and the beach is truly beautiful.  No free chairs on the beach---cabanas and 2 chairs are $25 for the day.   We enjoyed our entire day at the beach, but don't know if we would return again.  The price for a room if pretty hefty.  It's not that the room is that outrageously wonderful for the price.  You pay for the location.

title: Upscale and beachy!
review: We stayed at the Sheraton because the Marriott across the street was full.  We were pleased staying at the Sheraton and enjoyed our time there.  It was nice having a Gulf view as we were there for a sailing regatta that our son participated in.  The restaurant is good.  The bar is pleasant.  And, if you are getting a good rate, which we were from the regatta, I would definitely stay again.

title: Nice Hotel -Excellent Beach
review: We were pleased you enjoyed your experience here at the Sheraton Sand Key and hope that next time you are planning a stay in this area you choose to stay with us again.

title: A Nice Property but....
review: The hotel was very nice but the bathroom was very small for the room price. The beach and pool areas are beautiful. The restaurant had a great prime rib buffet. When I asked the bellman if there was coffee in the lobby he said "yes, of course" and led me to the restaurant. This was not a great way to handle the fact that there was no coffee in the lobby.

title: Can't wait to return
review: Thank you for sharing your thoughts. It makes us genuinely pleased that you enjoyed the beach and pool area. Our Prime Rib buffet does offer some nice choices. We do have several options for coffee, you are correct none are in the lobby.

title: Excellent Staff
review: I stayed at this resort for three days in early March.  This place has many, many positive features.  First, the location is excellent, being the first hotel on Sand Key, away from the commotion of Clearwater Beach and adjacent to the park.  The beach is outstanding.  The staff are friendly and helpful.  There are many amenities, including a nice pool with cafe and bar and free parking.  Our bed was comfortable and and afforded a good night's sleep.  It was vewry clean. However, there are a few things that need improved.  First, This is obviously an older property because the room was somewhat small.  There was no refrigerator or microwave which is expected at a resort these days.  Then there are other issues. The door on our room seemed not to fit correctly.  There was light…

title: Great place but needs updating
review: We liked the Sheraton Sand Key. It was spotlessly clean and the staff were unfailingly friendly. The staff never failed to engage you in conversation,to ask what you were intending to to do,or to recommend somewhere. They had obviously been well schooled by the management. However, being English it does take some getting used to,at times we almost wanted to say leave us alone.  That aside and picking up on previous reviews I agree the hotel is in need of updating,the electrics were antiquated, the washbasin in the bedroom is bizarre to have to use the toilet and come out to wash your hands is not nice. The comments about the gap round the doors is valid it is so large you have to beware of limbo dancers!  On a serious level if fire broke out smoke would be a real issue.  We were…

title: Sheraton Clearwater, FL
review: Thank you for recognizing our associates, they do go through on going training. There is a sincere effort to please; it is something that comes naturally to some. They enjoy people and ensuring that our guests experience here is memorable. Part of their training is to know how to read people and to be professional and pleasant, yet not intrusive. We are constantly renovating the hotel. Reducing the noise level is on our priority list. I promise to keep all limbo dancers out of the hallways but we will look into the gap. The beaches are lovely and if you are a nature lover there is plenty to enjoy. Please keep us in mind when planning your next adventure to America.

title: Very Nice Hotel
review: Beautiful location on the sandy beach--best internet café for guests that I have seen in a hotel. The staff was most helpful.  Even though we were there in a rainy day, the staff did what they could to make us comfortable--loaning us umbrellas--getting us to a wonderful restaurant on Valentine's day.

title: Nice hotel on the beach
review: We were so pleased that you enjoyed our miles of beautiful beaches; they are lovely, a place to relax, refresh and reflect. I am very pleased you enjoyed The Link by Microsoft it is a wonderful addition to our hotel. It was thoughtful of you to mention our associates they genuinely enjoy making you feel as special as you are.

title: Great Location, Friendly Service
review: We stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort for 5 nights, March 1-6, 2013. This was our first time to Clearwater and we were very impressed with how beautiful this area is.  The Sheraton Sand Key Resort was a lovely hotel overlooking the Gulf.  We were celebrating our anniversary, and within minutes of reaching our room, we were presented with a chilled bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries.  Very nice touch!  Rooms were nice and beds very comfortable.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  There was plenty of parking, a nice fitness center with views of the Gulf and Bay; a plus was no added parking or fitness center fees.  They have an internet cafe near the bar area with free wifi and a decent number of computer stations.  The hotel is in a great location and within…

title: One of My Favorite Places!
review: I attend a conference here every year, and LOVE everything about it.  Rooms are clean, front desk staff is very friendly & helpful.  I always stay a few days after the conference, and the beach-side service is fantastic.  Sort of a long trek to the beach, but comfortable beach chairs and large umbrellas.  Three restaurants within the resort, so really you wouldn't even need a car.  A couple of things around within walking distance.  If you do have a car there though, TONS of places for shopping, food, and activities are just a short drive away.

title: Why leave? This place has it all.
review: What a nice way to start a day, such a pleasant review. Thank you for recognizing our associates and the amenities The Sheraton Sand Key and the area have to offer. We will look forward to your next conference and a visit from you.

title: Not a romantic getaway spot
review: From the moment our family arrived to the moment we left, all of the staff did an amazing job of making our stay a memorable one. They put us next the rest of our group in amazing gulf view rooms and had supplied allergy free linen as requested. We cautiously tried the restaurant on the first night and from there on didn't even consider eating out. The service, food and atmosphere were excellent considering the large conferences being held. Not once did it feel as if the conferences detracted from holidaying guests. Every need was catered for. The staff were so kind to our young boys, giving them gifts at the dinner table to keep them occupied. The concierge was very helpful as were the rest of the staff.  Yes, the rooms are getting dated, but that comes to us all! All in all, a…

title: Great hotel but overpriced and why charge for WiFi?
review: Thank you for the wonderful review. Our associates genuinely care that each and every guests know how much we appreciate them by paying attention to details and their needs. We are very pleased that with all the choices of places to dine in the area you enjoyed our restaurant with meals prepared by our award winning culinary staff and served by attentive servers. We do hope you will return in the future

title: Relaxing place on Sand Key
review: Another older hotel that offers little in the way of amenities.  The room was clean but poorly laid out and very noisy, with aging furnishings and a very small bathroom.  The property is big, with a nice pool and beach access, but it feels more like a convention center then a warm and welcoming place to stay.  The staff was cordial, but not engaging and certainly not helpful, especially in the Mainsail restaurant.  We would not return.

title: Great relaxing vacation
review: I usually dont write reviews but thought it was a good idea since the previous ones did help me.  I just got back from 4 days at this hotel.  I will say that it was everything i expected it to be. It was clean, close to the beach and had very friendly and helpful staff.  It was exactly what you would expect from a sheraton  The restaurants had a nice selection and the food was very good.  The beds very comfortable and the views so beautiful  The reviews picking things apart i dont understand because if you want to pick close enough you can always find something wrong.  The only one point i will agree with that is negative is that you have to rent your chairs and cabana at the beach for $25 a day. I found out it is a lease with the hotel but i do think they could come up with…

title: Walls must be made of cardboard"
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review. I am truly pleased you enjoyed the sweet sleeper beds , our restaurants  and your entire stay . It was a pleasure to hear you appreciated all the area has to offer.  All of our  associates put their heart into making our  guests stays memorable ; thank you so much for recognizing that. We  do  hope that  you have an opportunity to return and visit us again.

title: Wow!!!!!
review: My stay was for 2 nights on the first floor.  The walls are in the hotel are quite thin such that there was much noise from hallway and lobby......more than any hotel than I have ever stayed.  In addition I could hear the guest next door snoring (and other activities).  The staff at the hotel seemed somewhat apologetic but did make any offers to address the issue.  I would not recommend this hotel to anyone as it is certainly not worth what is paid for the location on the beach.

title: Overall good experience
review: We appreciate that you took the time to write a review. It is our goal to ensure the comfort of our guests; I apologize that we did not succeed in doing so for your stay. We continually are looking for ways to rectify this issue.

title: A nice alternative to the busier clearwater beach area
review: First let me say this was a reward stay and I was treated great by everyone in the hotel....Upgraded due to the platinum status and was allowed a late check-out...Club Floor was beautifully set up....Had a meal downstairs with my kids and I would say it was one of the best we ever had....Pool area was clean and lots of room..Will return to tis hotel...

title: Just ok for the money
review: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon tour of the south. This hotel was the most expensive of all 7 we stayed in, and to our surprise it had the least to offer. The room was pretty nice, although it could have used a little updating. There was no mini-fridge and no microwave - the only hotel of our trip that did not have those amenities. Our "bay view" was partially blocked by the large conference rooms at that end of the building, so when we looked out our window or sat on the very small balcony we looked at a roof and air conditioning units before we saw water on the other side of the street. We were lucky enough to be on the 5th floor so we at least saw the water. The poor couple we met who were on the 3rd floor saw nothing but the walls. If we…

title: Great staff!  Hotel needs updating.
review: Congratulations! May you have many happy years together. Thank you for your review. I am sorry you were uncomfortable due to the conferences. We are a very family oriented hotel with many leisure guests. Perhaps you may call ahead when planning your next trip to the Clearwater area to check to see how many scheduled conferences we have. To address the amenities, most hotels charge a resort fee which covers the cost of all amenities.  We just charge for the amenities used. We are very pleased that you enjoyed your dinner in Rusty’s Bistro; we do have an award winning culinary staff.

title: Beautiful Beach
review: This was my 3rd time at this hotel over the past 5 years.  All 3 times were for work/conference meetings. The staff has always been nice, except for one bellman that lacked sensitivity.  Friendly, welcoming...never once a sense that I was a bother. The hotel itself feels dated.  The rooms have a bathroom that includes a toilet and tub-shower.  The sink is outside the bathroom, and I have never liked this arrangement. I would like better offerings at the poolside snack bar. On the up-side, the beach location is beautiful and very relaxing.

title: Ho hum
review: Yes the beach is beautiful and relaxing and we are pleased you enjoyed that part of your experience. All our associates are trained to be warm, comforting and  connected. I can assure your needs are never a bother.  I will pass your comments on to our Bell Captain, and will review your suggestion with our executive Chef.

title: Right on the beach.
review: I was at the Sheraton Sand Keys for a sales meeting.  The hotel was nice, rooms were clean and service was actually pretty good.  They responded immediately to any issue or question you had.  I have to say the beach is the biggest beach I think I have seen in Florida and it was very nice.    A couple of things I wasn't crazy about was that they charged you $25 for chair/cabana rentals.  Very steep for a Sheraton.  I also was not crazy about the bar area.  Although the servers were great, I did not like the atmosphere in the bar.  It was very cafeteria like.  The lights were bright and the decor was lacking.  Not some place I wanted to hang out after the meeting.  The bar outside was closed so there were no other alternatives except to venture out.  The food was good for the…

title: beautiful setting, welcoming staff
review: The staff was extremely friendly from the moment we walked in the door.  From the front desk staff to housekeeping, the staff was welcoming and helpful. The beds were super comfy, and the rooms were clean.  The pool is a modest size, but lovely, and there is a deck off the pool where you can just look straight to the ocean.  Sand key is right next door, so I don't think you could get a better setting.  We did not visit the fitness center, so I really can't comment on that.  Saturday morning, we went to  Rusty's.  Although we didn't plan on doing the brunch, it turned out to be reasonably priced.  They had 2 options--continental breakfast brunch for about $10 and hot brunch for $13, and the brunch included coffee and orange juice.  I wouldn't call the hotel elegant, but it is a…

title: Literally On The Beach
review: Thank you! We appreciate that you enjoyed our associates; we truly enjoy ensuring that your journey while here is memorable. We are also pleased that you found our Sweet Sleeper beds comfortable. Thank you for the comments and we hope to see you again.

title: Very nice hotel
review: I love love the fact that the beach is right there, you don't have to walk across a street or a sidewalk it is all sand. The staff was super nice, no complaints. You do have to pay extra per day for a fridge in your room, believe it was 10 or 20 dollars. You also have to pay 28 dollars a day everytime you want their chairs and unbrella on the beach. To fix this problem bring your own unbrella or go to the walgreens up the street and buy one for 20 bucks. The room is standard, bathroom is tight but overall good. They refresh your water supply everyday so dont waste money buying some for your room. Pool is big well bigger compared to the other hotels, kinda packed but good. Beds are nice. We are going back again this year! FYI food their is terrible and way way overpriced strongly…

title: Sheraton Sand Key Resort was Very Good
review: If you love the beach you certainly did come to the right area. The sunsets are breath taking and the days are relaxing; sunshine and water. We do not charge a resort fee so you only have to pay for the amenities needed such as your refrigerator and the chairs for the beach. I am sorry you did not enjoy the food in Rusty’s Bistro; when you order from our menu there you have an award winning culinary staff preparing the food. We keep our menus in all outlets updated often. When you come back this year please let a manger know your concerns on the food. We truly care about your feed back.

title: Mainstay Tavern
review: I stayed two nights for business and was quite happy with the service and friendly staff.  Positives:  nice location, comfortable room, decent price, adequate restaurants on-site., attentive staff. Negatives: very thin walls (could hear conversations in the next room), pretty limited menus at the hotel restaurants.

title: Top Notch!
review: Beautiful location and grounds, OUTSTANDING service, and such a comfortable bed in our room!  From the moment we drove up, we were immediately greeted by pleasant and attentive staff.  The gentleman helping with our luggage actually gave us a quick tour of the hotel!  I'm glad to report that each employee interaction was just as nice for the duration of our stay.  Our room was on the 6th floor and had a great view of the pool area and beach.  It had a decent sized balcony with two chairs and a small table.  The room itself was nice and well maintained.  While in the room, we didn't notice any noise from neighbors or the hallway.  While on site, I highly recommend having dinner at Rusty's Bistro.

title: Great location!  Give it a try, enjoy the beach and relax!
review: Wow! Thanks for the wonderful review. That view from the 6th floor is outstanding.  It makes us all very pleased that our goal of ensuring a memorable stay was met; we hope you will return soon.

title: Beautiful location, small flaws
review: This hotel has provided great consistent service for several decades, and has numerous repeat customers.  The staff are so friendly, professional, helpful, and genuinely care about the guests.  Most have been there many years, which tells you something.  Thanks to all, and to manager Todd for making our stay wonderful! Stop by the pool and let David fill you in on the weather and share a tale.  His enthusiasm is contagious! The grounds are relaxing and a genuine beauty paradise.  The beachfront is expansive.  Cabana rentals are available and I suggest it for further relaxation.  Clearwater beach is a mile away when you wish to tour, but I recommend staying here to avoid the crowds and chaos generally associated with Clearwater beach area. The fitness room on the 9th floor is…

title: If you want a hotel on the beach, this is it
review: We are genuinely so very pleased with your review. Thank you for recognizing what we continue to strive for; effectively meeting the expectations of our guests, and providing excellent customer service. Many of our return guests have become part of our Sheraton Sand Key family; it sounds as if you have become one of them.

title: Nice Location, Great Staff
review: We were just there for a conference, and enjoyed our stay.  No problems with noise as others have complained about, but we were in an end unit (loved that).  Superlatives:  Location, pool area, the beds (as comfortable as we have ever slept in), the friendly service.  Negatives:  Small bathroom area, no fridge in the room (c'mon).  Neutral:  The restaurants.  Although I may do a separate review, Rusty's Bistro was very good for dinner, and to be avoided for breakfast.  If you don't want the breakfast buffet, you can expect slow service and to be an afterthought - they want you to eat at the buffet, period.  Still, we had a good time, and the staff is especially to be commended.  Nice, welcoming folks, including the ladies who make up the rooms.  Management can step it up on the…

title: Just what a Sheraton should be...
review: You probably have read the other reviews about the hot and cold aspects of this hotel. We only saw the consistent quality of a well run hotel. We checked in late and the hotel still held our requested upgrade for us, a definite plus.  And there was a well prepared fruit and cheese plate as well. Room was clean and spacious as we would expect. To be picky, there were downsides. There was a faint background noise that others have complained about but it did not interrupt our sleep. Unlike other Sheratons, the complimentary breakfast was a light buffet with bagels, fresh fruit, yogart, and coffee from those automatic machines and not the full breakfast we have had in other Sheratons, but the quality was excellent. Unlike a lot of other hotels, the temperature of the rooms are user…

title: First Class Hotel
review: We appreciate your review and thank you for sharing your thoughts. The views are breathtaking, and we are so pleased that you took pleasure in enjoying them.  My favorite view is when you come over the Sand Key bridge. We do apologize for overlooking that there should have been two robes and enough toiletries for two. A call to the front desk would have rectified that; we do want to thank you for letting us know. We also hope when you return to this area you will join us again at the Sheraton Sand Key.

title: Experienced luxury hoteliers' objective report...
review: Stayed Christmas & Easter, with Family, and we totally enjoyed our stay. Rooms were clean,  food was excellent,  service was what You would expect from a FIRST CLASS hotel.  Location, Location, Location.  Pool is located with an ocean view and the kids loved it.

We appreciate that you took the time to write such a thoughtful review and thank you for the lovely compliment. We are pleased that you and your family have enjoyed several holidays with us, may there be many more. The beach and view here are breathtaking, hope you plan another visit soon

title: Beautiful location
review: As the title states, I am an experienced hotelier in the luxury beach resort business. This review is an objective one, simply the truth as I see it.   I rate this "resort" a three for a number of reasons, as they should really market it as a limited service resort.   Check-in was pleasant enough. Right off the bat though I can tell this employee isn't polished. I arrived at night and entered my second floor room. Went straight for the balcony door, only there wasn't one. I am surprised to find a large sliding window that allows me access to the roof of the first floor? The view is of another large part of the building. Ok. Step onto the roof for a cigarette and take a look at the balcony next to my room, I am shocked to notice that the 80's style vinyl strap furniture is…

title: Wonderful hotel
review: The hotel was in a great location.  The staff was very accommodating (I needed to microwave some pizza and since there wasn't a microwave in the rooms, I was told who could help me with this request.)  The rooms were clean and large, although the bathroom area in the King bed room was a little small.  The fitness center was on the top floor with a great view, very nice equipment and a contracted person on duty.  The only negative comment was that the noise from doors closing, water running, showers, and toilet flushing in the rooms near us could be heard loudly in our room.

title: Nice, but.................
review: My wife and I attend a conference at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort in January, 2013.  I am a Travel Agent and identified myself as such at check-in.  I opted to pay for the Club Level Room for $40 more. The Club Level rooms are on floors 7 and 8 and include access to the Club Level Room and free WIFI (normally $10).  Breakfast and evening snacks were available in the Club Room along with a large screen TV and a computer/printer.  The food was OK and a free bar was available from 5-7 pm.  Since I was not interested in getting drunk every night, the Club Room was not really worth the cost.  The grounds were attractive and clean, as well as the lobby and meeting rooms.  The guest room were somewhat disappointing.  The bed was too hard, the pillows were too soft, and the bedding…

title: Excellent Location and Awesome Staff, But Indoor Noise Is an Issue
review: I have stayed at this resort twice now within the last month (January 2013), once alone and once with my husband and college age daughter. I would definitely stay there again. The staff is wonderful -- extremely friendly and efficient. The location is directly on the Gulf of Mexico and the resort has a very nice beach, heated pool, hot tub, and tennis courts, with fabulous views of the sunset. Parking is free or valet, your choice. The pool area is tropically landscaped with views of the beach, and it is not accessible to the general public. When we were there the pool was heated to a comfortable 85 degrees F. There is also a sunning area on bermuda grass with wonderful views of the beach.The rooms are older and both of my rooms were somewhat tired, but they were very clean and…

title: "Lacking Something "
review: We are sincerely pleased that you enjoyed both visits to the Sheraton Sand Key Resort and are glad that you are planning to return. We appreciate that you chose to experience dining in Rusty’s Bistro.  We are very proud of the dishes prepared by our award wining Chefs. Our Associates throughout the Sheraton Sand Key pride themselves on efficient, friendly service; your compliments are valued and will be passed on. We welcome your feedback as it helps us to improve our property and services.

title: What a ''honeymoon'' experience
review: I really wanted to Like this Hotel. Really, I did. It just didn't happen. I went there for a Night by Myself, in Jan. 2013. The Grounds are Nice. It's a little Walk to the Water, but no Problem and I'm a Senior. The Staff, was Super Nice. It's the Hotel itself. When You Look down the Halls, it's just Blah. Not a Picture on the Wall, a Pot of Flowers, nothing. The Bar, reminded Me of a " High School Lunchroom " I never had any " Noise " Issues, as Others have Stated. I Stayed, left, the next Day, but it was not " Memorable "

title: First Class All the Way
review: My friends and I spent 6 nights here in January to celebrate my birthday. I've slept in nicer rooms and beds, before. However, for the overall experience, I can easily say this was the best place I've ever stayed. The staff were very frielndly and helpful; very homey. I recommend eating at Rusty's Bistro, specifically the Steak and Cake. The dining experience was exactly that, an experience. The food was succulent and the wait staff excellent. My favorite part of the resort was the Tiki bar and the hot tub. Couldn't beat sipping on a Mai Tai while sitting in the hot tub. Because it was off-season, neither were very croweded, either. The private beach was enjoyable, as was the heated pool. The room itself was cozy, and I enjoyed the in-room single-cup coffee maker and…

title: Not up to Standards
review: With all the choices of hotels here in the Clearwater area we are very pleased that you enjoyed your stay here at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  We thank you for your valued comments and do hope that you will return soon.

title: Best Meeting Facility for our Workshop
review: My wife and I stayed 4 days at the Sheraton for a business trip in Jan. Although I would rank the staff very high for their professionalism, friendliness and positive attitudes, I have never stayed at a resort that was so noisy. It was very difficult to get a good nights rest. The walls were paper thin and you could hear every door that opened and closed all night long, including room doors and the sliding doors on the balconies as well.  There was a 2" gap under the door that we actually stuffed a towel under to keep the light and the noise level down. The foos at the main dining area of the hotel was typical hotel food and the service was at best, fair. Not up to the standards that we are used to for a resort of this size and stature.

title: Best Hotel in Area
review: We appreciate that you took time to write a review. Thank you for the positive comments addressing our associates. I apologize that the experience was not what was expected and will certainly share your feedback so that we can work on improving these areas of concern.

title: Excellent business trip
review: Last weekend the Friends of Florida State Parks, Inc. held their annual workshop for our all volunteer citizen support organizations to gather and learn new leadership skills.  The workshop took place over a three day period.    Much of our success was due to the fabulous service offered by the hotel team.  Every department from front desk to events to food and beverage did an outstanding job for us.  We felt welcome and cared for.  As the meeting planner for this event, the staff at the hotel made my life easier over this three day period and in the time it took to plan and prepare the event.  I highly recommend this hotel for your group event,

title: Great Location
review: Always a good place to stay.  Stayed at this location several times. Great location, beautiful beach, nice pool and good rooms. There are plenty of shops and restaurants near by. Can hop on the trolley system for low fare and travel up and down the shore.  Would recommend this location and stay here again.

title: Nice pool and beach area
review: Thank you for being a loyal guest and we hope to continue to be your choice when you are thinking of staying in the Clearwater Beach area.

title: Welcome Respite
review: The price seemed a bit expensive for what you get, but likely most of the hotels are in this price range. It's nice that parking is free, but the lot is not large, so if you are visiting during the summer, it might be tough to find a spot.  We drove down to Pier 60 to watch the sunset and felt that we might have been better off at the Pier 60 hotel, which was our 2nd choice.  We opted against it because it wasn't on the beach, but it was close enough now that we saw it.  The beach seemed nicer down in that area as well.  The sand was softer and had less shells.  At the Sheraton, the room was clean and service was friendly and the pool was very nice.  It was also fairly isolated, so if you are looking to be away from the crowds, it is a good option.

title: Lovely end to our honeymoon
review: Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us your feedback is appreciated.

title: Birthday celebration and wedding anniversary!
review: Stayed here a few years ago and enjoyed it for a second time.  Free parking, fast check in.  Large, Tommy Bahama style rooms.  Right on the beach. Good pool area.  Numerous restaurants a few minutes drive away.  Conference center. 9 story hotel.  Bar on ground floor. Use of PCs for free.   Not luxury or a full service resort, but pleasant for basic family vacation or business meeting.

title: Excellent
review: We stayed New Years Eve it wasn't crowded the pool Is great and the beach is a short walk away. Food was excellent   Our room was beautiful still smelled new so can't complain there. All in all I would recommend to anyone

title: Average
review: Stayed over New Years, hotel undergoing lobby renovations. Not notified about construction in advance or at booking. Not offered a discount or any other amenities as a result. We also had to pay 9.99/day for internet service in our room/device. The connecting rooms resulted in noise from neighboring rooms and you can hear televisons and conversations. The outdoor pool was small but nice for children and heated. The rooms have been renovated and beds are comfortable. Housekeeping, bell staff are very friendly and courteous. The walk to the beach is fine if you are ambular, however, for elderly people or people with mobility issues the walk could be considered lengthy (think a couple of football fields in length to ocean).

title: Simply amazing.
review: My husband and I were for two days for an anniversary getaway. I had informed them of this prior to my visit. Upon checkin, they had surprised us with Champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries and a card in the room. It was very thoughtful and sincerely appreciated. We had the parking lot facing view but because we were on the SPG floor, we did get a great skyline view as we were on the 7th floor.  Location - this hotel is definitely on the quieter side of the beach area, it is minutes away from the other area that was filled with hotels/motels/inns/etc etc.  Room - the hotel does have really thin walls and often times you are able to hear your neighbors. If you are sensitive to noise, this could potentially be an issue however we were not bothered by this as our neighbors…

title: Mediocre, not awful, but not what you'd expect from a resort property
review: Not one of Sheraton's better properties, to say the least.  First off, they were remodeling the lobby while we were there.  Serious noise and they routed us through the pool area to get from our room to the restaurant and lobby.  Not sure why they chose the week of New Years for a major construction project.  Worse still, they didn't notify us in advance even though we made the reservation less than a week before visiting.  Walls are thin, bathroom small, carpets worn, pool just ok. Not what you'd expect from a Sheraton "resort" property.  On the plus side, service and location were both good and our room had a pretty Gulf view.

title: Loved our trip, don't be scared off by reviews!
review: I stayed here with my family (mom, dad, 19 and 23 yr old girls) over New Years' and we loved it!  I was disappointed to read some of the other reviews - they seemed really harsh, and I would consider myself to be a pretty tough critic.  It's extremely family-friendly, even though our family is a little bit older.    I travel frequently for work, and am a loyal Starwood member; the Sheraton Sand Key treated Starwood members better than ANY other property I have stayed at.  The University of Michigan band, cheerleaders, dance team, and random fans were staying at the the same time to attend the Outback bowl.  The hotel staff anticipated overcrowding in the Club Lounge due to the completely booked hotel, and instead of hoping it would work itself out, we were given vouchers for the…

title: the  noisiest hotel on the planet
review: i'll start by saying this hotel is in a good location, its just over the bridge from clearwater island so it doesn't have all the comotion of the town yet close enough to all the surrounding area attractions and restaurants. the beach is very nice and big and its downhill from here. Paper thin walls (lots of loud people and their louder children, i happened to be there when the Michigan football team and marching band was there, do you know how to spell NOISE!!!!!!.) Also, just a little tidbit, the shower head is great for someone about five feet tall no taller and the water doesn't rinse off soap or shampoo so be preparred for a 30 minute shower (this is probably for all hotels in the area). not enough time to go on and on but i would stay away. no atmosphere (which is fine for…

title: Mixed Feelings!
review: This is my first visit to Clearwater. The weather was mixed but it is December. You must always remember a review is one persons opinion. It can also be written in the heat of the moment. I always try to be honest.   As some others reviewed there is definitely an issue with noise, especially from your room. Adjoining rooms have thin walls. You can hear people clearly wether raised voices, laughing or normal dialogue. Key entry by card and agree it sometimes sounds if someone is entering your room even from accross the lobby. The air conditioner unit was also a bit of a rattler. Rooms clean and comfortable. Housekeeping in all areas were very good.   The pool is small but clean and there is a decent outside jacuzzi.  Easy access to beach and not a long walk as previous reviewer…

title: WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY
review: Me and my husband are in our late 20's so we aren't to picky when it comes to resorts however I was so unhappy with this hotel and spot I chose I wanted to leave early! I pre paid the whole trip on orbitz so we ended up only leaving one day early haha but when I got there looked cool but overly Crowded but being Clearwater (which isn't ritzy at all) was expected.     Crowded hotel pools are smaller than the pictures. It was so loud and unreal zing out entire stay (in mid may) my vacation was hell! So many kids and old people I was annoyed most of the time. Food is over priced and not tasty, also all 3 restaurants there were similar just nasty!  The beach was almost 1 mile from the hotel I had to walk sooooo far from the pool to the beach my legs were sore n I'm not a big woman…

title: Clean but very noisy.
review: This seems more like a conference center than a resort, lots going on downstairs with a spread out layout. We were here just 2 nights and did not use any amenities so I cannot comment on that. The hotel is older, but rooms are clean and beds comfortable. The only issue we had was a lot of noise, thin walls through which we could hear everything from every direction. Drawers being open, babies crying, people watching tv, multiple conversations, vacuum etc.  when people in rooms nearby used their keys to open their door it felt like they were coming into yours! perhaps it's better if you stay here at a quieter time, we stayed over Christmas, and the hotel is very busy. Overall, we were underwhelmed.

title: Great hotel in quieter end of Clearwater Beach
review: My son and I stayed here for one night.   The hotel is right on the beach (advantage over Marriott Sand Key), and the pool area is very nice.  We walked across the street to the Marriott for dinner, and ended up eating at one of the several restaurants that are adjacent to the Marriott.  In walking through the Marriott though, we noticed the pool area was hopping in the evening, and the pool Tiki bar was crowded and fun.   Plenty of free parking at the Sheraton.   I booked a Club Level room, and although the room is not on the same floor as the club room, we enjoyed a nice display at Happy Hour and Breakfast.   Public Computer was also helpful within the club room.   While in Clearwater Beach, we also stayed at the Hilton, and even though they're only 2 miles apart, the Sheraton…

title: hotel went the extra mile during rennovations
review: We stayed at The Sheraton Sand Key, Clearwater Florida in mid- December. The hotel was in the midst of renovating the main lobby and Rusty's Restaurant. For the inconvenience of the noise in the lobby and the main restaurant being closed, the hotel upgraded us to the club level, which enabled us to enjoy the complimentary breakfast and evening cocktails and hors d'oeuvres. Additionally, they provided free internet access in our room. Additionally, they offered for a future stay a complimentary first night and each night after being 50% off the rate. The staff was very helpful not only in the hotel, but also in the pool and beach areas. Very friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

title: One of my favorite hotels
review: Because of the staff....  GREAT service throughout the resort.  Let me start by saying I am an associate of Starwood and have a great benefit of good rates staying at our properties. After saying that, we're often given not so special treatment and given the room overlooking the parking lot. Not so at this property. From the moment we entered we felt welcomed.  Our Check in went smoothly and were given a room overlooking the pool / ocean. We walked the beach daily collecting some great shells. People complain of the walk to the beach but we timed it and actually takes 3 min. Really?? Enjoy it...  Nate in the bar is an asset to this property. Very good at what he does.. Thanks also to Sasha on his day off.. The food is delicious!! We ate here every night and enjoyed every meal. …

title: Go for the beach, not the hotel
review: The private beach area was most enjoyable. I didn’t particularly care for the long walk to the ocean, but it wasn’t too bad. The outdoor pool areas were always kept  very clean and the hotel offered complimentary pool toys to the kids, sand buckets, etc. There seemed to be an abundance of sea weed that littered the beach and was annoyingly present in the ocean. I’m not sure if it was time of year I visited or if it’s always like that. The hotel lobby paints an inaccurate portrait of the hotel’s rooms. During my visit I stayed in three different rooms because of availability issues and each room had several discomforting things about them. One had an awful smell that housekeeping was unable to rid. Don’t expect to have a marvelous view of the ocean. I was told by the staff “our…

title: Great location; great beach
review: This is the spot to enjoy the nice Clearwater beach The location is perfect; not right in the middle but close enough that you can walk around/bike or take short drives The beach is amazing; in our last stay you can see dolphins from the beach  The service at the hotel was good; only issue is the kitchen by the pool is not good at all; it is not a kitchen just a small area to prepare hotdogs...this management needs to improve Overall a great stay...we'll come back for sure

title: Missing amenities
review: This is a nice, uncluttered decor/design, clean & "green" hotel. It also happens to be an older hotel and by that I mean that the walls are thin. The other "old" element that cant go unnoticed is the size of the bathroom. The only room we saw was ours so I dont know if this is the case in all rooms but the toilet was situated facing the door with the shower to the right. The door to the bathroom just cleared the toilet bowl. If you were to walk in on your spouse or child you would most certainly whack their knees. If you have small children and need to help bathing them, this would be a most difficult/impossible bathroom for you to work in.  Our biggest complaint was that several amenities that we have become accustom to and consider basic were missing. There wasn't a…

title: Excellent location
review: The hotel is located in a private and quiet area. The beach was very good and not crowded. Check in was fast and staff was very courteous and friendly. This was our second stay here and we enjoyed both times. Breakfast was good. Only negative is corridors look like a university dorm and in need of updating.

title: Very nice and relaxing! Will be back
review: We just spent 2 nights here and fell in love. The hotel is situated next to sand key park and it is very private. This was a big deal for us as we wanted to be away from the hustle and bustle of clearwater. Check in was smooth and my only complaint about that was we couldn't use the luggage cart without a bell boy which meant a 10 minute wait for him plus a tip. I would rather do it on my own.   We stayed in a double queen club level oceanfront room. The room was nice and had a beautiful view from the deck. The only thing was the bathroom was kind of small, but that is minor.   Everyone was extremely friendly. The pool area was gorgeous. We enjoyed the beach as well, most of the time by ourselves. The kids found lots of shells and had a blast.   The club level drinks and nightly…

title: Relaxed and casual
review: We have just come back from a two week trip to Florida, with one of these weeks spent here at the Sand Key Sheraton. This was our second stay at this hotel which goes to show what we think of this hotel. Now the location is stunning, the staff are lovely and friendly. The place seems to be undergoing a bit of a makeover including new carpets in the rooms. We had to ask for an in room fridge, which one might expected to have been in a room in a hotel of this standard. The pool area was lovely and relaxed and of course the cocktail bar was in an ideal place near the pool. The food served by poolside cafe however is worth missing. Sadly this hotel seems to be mainly aimed at the business user. The refit or refurb seems a bit bland and boring. The bar is stark and again bland…

title: Nailed it on hospitality
review: We just returned from our 5 day stay at this property.  It really has to be one of the friendliest and most accomodating properties we have ever stayed in. We were not lacking for anything.   We were on the club level and the food was great every morning.  Plus having the extra area to relax and read or just look at the views was fantastic.  The bed was very comfortable and we felt the property was very clean.  The only reason I did not give it an excellent is because I would have to agree that our room could use some updating but the homey atmosphere really made up for it.  We would definitely go back.

title: Wonderful Property
review: I was there for one night preceding the   2012 Susan G Komen 3-day walk for the Cure. This was my second stay and both times..everyone was more than friendly and showed great support for those of us that were walking. The room was very nice and I had a view of the beach. I had dinner in the lounge and the soup and sandwich I had were very flavorful and Florida. Very nice area too

title: Friendly and welcoming but in need of refurbishment
review: We were also fortunately at the Sand Key at the time of the Suncoast Jazz Festival which was great. The firemens' convention preceding it, less so. I can only endorse previous reviewers comments as to the friendliness of the staff. We felt welcomed by everyone, without exception. Jerry at the front desk was extremely helpful, and nothing was too much trouble. The pool staff are terrific, particularly Dave, who is a real asset to the Hotel. He seems to be fighting a continual battle with "poolcrashers" who can easily access the pool area from the car park, pay for a drink at the pool bar, then feel entitled to a free day using the pool, hot tub and beach. The Hotel Management should really sort this out. On a less positive note, the Hotel seems really "tired" and in need of some…

title: Fine Setting for Great Music
review: Also at the Sheraton for the terrific jazz festival earlier this month, we found it to be a great place to stay and enjoy such an event. The facilities were very good, and the staff were consistently friendly, professional, and helpful.   Among the latter, I have to single out Mr. Jerry Walters who checked us in on our arrival. I don’t know what combination of our early reservation, our early arrival, our borderline SPG membership, seeing my wife enter with a rollator/walker, and/or my- let’s say- unorthodox answer to his question about whether either of us smoked did it; but he most graciously gave us an accessible, large, 5th floor bedroom and bathroom with a beautiful view of the pool area and Gulf with me hardly having to ask.  Yes, the nearby ice machine and other room…

title: Suncoast Dixieland Jazz Festival is Great!
review: We stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort in conjunction with their hosting the Suncoast Dixieland Jazz Festival.  The Sheraton did a wonderful job in supporting the festival and the festival itself was fabulous.  The Sheraton provided an extra area to supply food and drinks for the festival goers, who wanted to grab something between concerts, besides the regular restaurants in the hotel.  They also allowed the festival organizers to set up a hospitality suite to provide food for the musicians, sponsors and benefactors.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Our room was a king and very nicely appointed, with easy chair, desk, bed, complimentary robe and luggage racks.  Next year at the festival, we will not hesitate to stay at the Sheraton.

title: Hotel Great, Location Great, Check In Person Not So Great
review: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. The lady who checked us in was not very pleasant. She gave us the impression she had something better to do. The air conditioner in our room was so loud we had to put pillows over our head to try and sleep. Upon checkout we were asked if we called maintenance like it was our problem to fix.

title: perfect spot to relax
review: We stayed four nights while attending a conference. Our room was large and clean with a comfy king bed.  The reading chair was also comfortable.  there was plenty of closet space.  Robes were provided.  Check in was prompt.  The front desk staff and maids were attentive and pleasant.  the conference room downstairs was nice, too.  the beach is nice and I enjoyed being in a quieter location on Sand Key.  The main part of Clearwater beach just over the bridge is busier.  consider this spot if you want a low key, relaxed atmosphere.

title: We stayed there for the SunCoast Jazz Classic
review: This Sheraton is expertly run.  The staff members are very helpful, friendly and accomodating.  Our room on the third floor overlooked the pool and the gulf.  It was well appointed and quiet.  The bedding was fresh smelling and very comfortable.  Restaurant prices were expensive but the food was excellent.  I have no reservations in recommending this hotel to anyone.  The hotel is immediately next to a well maintained small wetland which hosts wading and small migrating birds; a bonus to this birder.

title: beautiful beach, great pool, nice room
review: Location: The hotel is located south of the main tourist location of Clearwater beach. This is perfect because you get peace and quiet on a secluded beach and then when you want the night life/actiivity the trolley stop will take you there for cheap ($4.50 unlimited all day, or $2.00/one way). The trolley stop is in the front of hotel, and it dropped us off at the door on the way home. From tampa airport it was a 30-40 minute easy drive. Also, bar and restaurants in walking distance from hotel.  Rooms: The front desk upgraded us to a newly remodeled room on the seventh floor at check-in (we had reserved a lower level room for cheaper). They were in the process of remodeling all rooms throughout  it looked like. They weren't very noisy with it while working in the room next door.…

title: Super service
review: My stay at this hotel for almost a full week was a great experience. Location, facilities, food quality, all being excellent, and the staff very friendly and helpful at all occasions. I was there for a conference, and the only complaint for the conference rooms was that the air condition was set at a too low temperature. I could observe several delegates having big coats on while listening to presentations. Some people asked the staff to have the temperature raised, but it never happened. So my rating of service does not include the conference area. But one could warm up outside in the sun, with a very nice pool area, and the wonderful white beach just outside the hotel. The rooms are comfortable and clean and service good. The bar is a popular place, but very noisy. OK, bars…

title: OK, but not great
review: Been staying here for a number of years for a regular business meeting.  The biggest thing this hotel has going for it is the location....it is right on a huge beach.  Do for a beach holiday, it is great.  Not so good for business purposes.  Meeting rooms are nothing special.  The executive lounge on the top floor has a great view, but only minimal breakfast supplies.  The whole place seems tired.  As someone else mentioned, the soundproofing is non-existent.  Not too bad if you're priority is a place on the beach, but other than location, I would give this one a pass.

title: WOW !!!!!!!!! Awesome Place
review: From the moment we arrived until the moment we departed we were treated like royalty. The staff at this hotel are more then accomadating. They go out of thier way to make your stay WONDERFUL. The entire place is spotless,cheery and bright. They make your stay a true happy wonderful experiance. Th ebeds were so comfortable, breakfast was delicious and the best part is it is located right on the Gulf Of Mexico and the water is pristine. Just loved swimming there.

title: Resort itself just ok
review: Had a great time on my 3 day escape.  Rooms, meh.  Restaurants here...meh.  But I must say the staff and employees were unparalleled!  Made it worth it.  Overpriced but enjoyed it.  Location great, short walk to cute little strip mall and Columbia restaurant, don't miss this if you're in the area.  Sitting on the dock, overlooking the bay, with the best Bloody Mary I've ever had, absolutely fantastic wait staff and a very yummy cup of gazpacho...it's the little things, you know.

title: Great stay!
review: I stayed at this hotel last weekend when my husband and I went to Clearwater for a wedding.  The room had a beautiful view of the beach.  The bed was comfortable and the air conditioning worked well.  The room was a bit run down but no major problems. The cleaning staff did a great job and left extra towels.  The pool was very busy and had a lot of families around it.    I really enjoyed the convenience store in the lobby that was open really late at night.    The cost for this hotel was on the high end of hotels in Clearwater.  There were cabanas at the beach costing $25/day.  We didn't get one because we didn't have much time to enjoy there.  It would have been nice for the hotel to offer beach cabana discounts for hotel patrons because the price is pretty high for the rooms. …

title: Poor sleep quality
review: This place is truly lovely but there are a couple things to be aware of. The sleep quality was very low. The rooms are very poorly soundproofed and my roommate and I were awakened a number of times by our neighbors showering, talking, coughing, etc. If anyone talked in the hallway it reverberated in our room.   The beach is very far away, very. It's definitely worth the walk but be aware you'll be sand walking for at least five minutes.   The staff for the most part was very accommodating and a pleasure.

title: Snorkeling
review: I am at the Sheraton sand key for a meeting.  I brought my snorkeling gear, having read that there may be some snorkeling at the adjacent Sand Key state park.  I walked up there to check it out.  The snorkeling area is about a 15 minute walk.  I decided not to bother.  The water is murky and (in November) cold.  The snorkeling area is small and in my opinion, not worth the trouble.  I have been spoiled by Cozumel and Cayman.  The hotel is only OK.  The rooms are clean and I love the pillows.  But, the bathroom, even on the Club floor is tiny, the bathtub is not meant for a long relaxing soak, and the area around the hotel is isolated.  You'd have to drive to get anywhere.  The club lounge is brightly lit.  The tv dominates the lounge, and the computer in the lounge is right near…

title: Nice Hotel right on the beach!
review: Beautiful hotel with friendly staff.  Don't forget to try out the Seafood Buffet on the weekend!  Great place to get away for the weekend.  The beach is huge and the Beach Bar makes awesome tropical concoctions.

title: Very relaxing end to a hectic holiday :)
review: Beautiful hotel and surroundings. Stayed for the third week after two weeks in Orlando, doing the parks and so on. Food and facilities were great, apart from the expensive wi-fi, but the free use of the computers in the bar compensated for that. Staff were lovely. Only complaint is the doors and walls allow every bit of sound into the room, what made it worse was our room was next to the washing machines, dryers and ice machines, which were very noisy when in use. Apart from that a nice hotel.

title: Great Location, Beach, Restaurant Options
review: We stayed recently at the Sheraton on Sand Key to attend a wedding.  The hotel was clean, staff was attentive, pricing was as expected for beach front property.  However, we did experience difficulty with noise.  The hotel is well appointed with tile flooring.  With housekeeping carts, luggage carts, and heels - a very bad combination.  We stayed in room #516 very near the elevators, ice makers, housekeeping closets, etc.  Had friends in #512 who had the same experience.  When asked for another room - we were transferred to reservations and then back to the front desk.  Upon our departure, we discovered we were charged for this call.  Needless to say, we were not able to move due to occupancy.  I would recommend this hotel, however, I advise that you may want to research the…

title: A little bit of paradise
review: My husband and I stayed here recently and just loved it. This was our 2nd time at this hotel, we were married there, and decided to return for our anniversary. Our room was on the 7th floor, and what a view, the sunsets were fantastic. Unknown to me my husband had e-mailed the hotel explaining it was our anniversary, and my birthday, and they sent wine, strawberries and a card to the room, what a surprise!! They just can't do enough for you here. The room was spacious and light, spotlessly clean as well.   We ate at Rustys most evenings, the food was delicious, butternut sqash bisque is a must, as is the creme brulee, the chef actually came to the tables in the restaurant one evening to ask if we were enjoying the meal. Impeccable service provided by Martin, Ken and Brett. These…

title: What an awesome place to attend a conference!
review: I attended a conference recently at this hotel. All I can say is wow, what an awesome spot!  The rooms were clean, the bed comfortable. The pillows were so great that I immediately looked up the website and ordered some for my own bed at home!  The pool area was nice and clean. The hotel sits right on a really nice stretch of white sand beach, although there is a bit of a walk on the sand to actually reach the water's edge. Saw a wedding taking place on the beach on the property on an awesome weather evening.  The conference rooms were nice. The food was pretty good.

title: Amazing!!!!!!!
review: Hard to believe it when you arrive at night. You just drive and drive and see only hotels, buildings and parking, but when you wake up in the morning and you have an upper level room with a view on the beach, what you see is unreal! Hundreds of meter of beach with white sand only. It is white, pure, looks like snow, and the water has that beautiful color that makes you think that after all this is not real and you are just sleeping. If it was not t for the light  making your eyes blinks, you would just believe that you are having that wonderful dream that you are facing some kind of heaven on hearth. Besides this, the service was not really what i was expected, maybe because it was Spring Breaks and the staff was over booked, but i found the room service inefficient. Just make…

title: I "might" go back.
review: Our stay was "just ok." We were there for my husband's birthday, so we were inquired about a room upgrade.  The young man who checked us in said that there were conferences being held at the hotel. My husband said, "Are you sure? We booked well in advance and requested a great view and it's my birthday."  His response:  "I can't make extra rooms."  While this is true, I do believe a more professional response would have been a bit more acceptable. After see our tiny little room with a view of a tennis court/dumpster, we called back downstairs and were told by this same young man, that a room had opened. We jumped on it, only to learn that we were stuck with an adjoining room, where we could hear EVERY SINGLE WORD coming from the couple next door, including their forks hitting…

title: Absolutely !
review: My husband and I always rate our experience with a restaurant or hotel afterwards by asking ourselves the question-  Would we go back ?  Sometimes we agree , sometimes we don't , sometimes we have qualifiers . With the Sheraton Sand Key Resort ,  our unanimous answer is Absolutely ! The location is so convenient- a straight shot from the airport .  We did hit rush hour traffic and an accident on the way in, which doubled our travel time to an hour. It only took us about a half hour going back to the airport. There is a gas station on the way back to the airport , just past the Christmas Store , for those wishing to fill up their rental cars before returning. The resort is immaculate and beautifully maintained. Indoors and out . Every employee we encountered was welcoming and…

title: Nice Stay
review: My family stayed here for two nights in September.  We loved the pool area.  It was never crowded.  We always found a chair.  There is a outside bar and snack shop.  There is a small walk to the beach but not too far.  The rooms are average.  They really should be updated.  The only complaint I have about this hotel is the noise levels.  It so hard to sleep at night because the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything.  The ate at Frenchy's Rockaway Grill both nights on their patio and watched the sun set.  Hotel has free parking.

title: Great location
review: Been here multiple times for business conferences and it is great for couples or families too. It's away from the main crowds of clearwater beach because it is on more exclusive Sand Key. This hotel is convenient because it is first hotel off bridge to sand key. it has a nice private beach area and is close to many restaurants on sand key. Plus unlike other hotels here it does not  charge for parking... I will be back.

title: What a GREAT place to enjoy Fall Break!
review: My husband and I just returned from a FABULOUS Fall Break at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  We had such a great time on our third trip to this great little getaway!  Our favorite thing about the Sheraton Sand Key is the people who work there.  From reservations to front desk to fitness room to pool crew to concierge services to restaurant staffs to housekeeping to store ladies to the Turtle Express ... nothing but smiles, courtesy and professionalism!  It's so much fun to return to a place where you're remembered each time you visit ... Bet that doesn't happen in very many resorts!  We already have our next vacation to Sand Key on the calendar ... YAY!!!

title: The private beach almost makes it worth the price.
review: You won't find many hotels in Clearwater Beach with their own private beach and that's what makes the Sheraton Sand Key such a great experience.   Don't expect the fake sandy beaches that are next to the Hyatt and Hilton.  Next to the Sheraton, the sand is much more compact but lounging, dipping in the ocean and listening to the waves are the primary reason I love beach hotels so it didn't bother me that much.  The Sheraton's beach also offers a golf cart service that drives around with mixed drinks and food that you can purchase which is not allowed on the public beaches at the other major hotels. I would definitely recommend an ocean view if you can afford it.  Even the partial ocean view is terrific because the next door condos are beautiful as well.  The hotel is clean and…

title: Perfection
review: I loved it here.  Sadly we only had a 2 night stay on our Fly Drive but, next time it will be longer!  Our welcome at the front desk was great, very friendly.  The rooms was lovely, bed was extremely comfortable, the only complaint I have is that the bathroom sink is outside the bathroom and not very much room to store your toiletries, a minor complaint.  Other than that no negatives I can leave on the room.  The pool area was lovely, no complaints there.  The beach was absolutely stunning, some people have complained about the walk, we didnt find it a problem at all.  Just make sure you take supplies with you from the shop!  We had a really lovely stay and wouldnt hesitate to stay here again.

title: Great beds, busy hotel
review: The most common criticism of the hotel is the distance to the beach and the size of the pool.  While the pool is certainly not huge, it is big enough.  The walk to the beach is a 1-2 minute walk along what looks like a sand runway from the pool area to the beach.  Certainly not convenient, but hardly a burden either.  The beach itself is beautiful, great for walking. The service at the hotel is great, the staff is very professional and friendly. There was a convention in the hotel which makes it pretty busy and does not make it feel much like a resort at times. The food at the hotel is fine.  There is a mall across the street with some other choices. Overall, an affordable beach vacation.

title: Nice place but beware of internet fees
review: While I don't have a problem paying for internet service, and at $9.95/24 hours the Sheraton's fee is better than some, I do expect that fee to be per room and not per device as I later found out while perusing my bill. If your family is anything like mine we each have a phone and there may be a laptop or ipad in the mix which we use to watch movies or browse the web at the end of the day. The hotel does offer free wifi in their downstairs bar area, but I would much rather enjoy a late night movie in the comfort of their great beds...so be warned!  Otherwise the hotel is very clean and  the staff very helpful - especially at the pool.They offer a buffet breakfast for $14.95, but our family of 3 had a very nice breakfast ordering a la carte for under $30. We also had breakfast at…

title: Great rooms, nice beds...beautiful beach!
review: Thank you for sharing your comments reagarding your recent stay.  We are pleased you enjoyed the resort, the area and found the beds comfortable!  We appreciate you sharing your feedback on the internet fees as we do address issues such as this and try to find the best solution for our guests and the hotel. We hope to see you again in the future!

title: Glad I Stayed Here!
review: I stayed here and found that the resort was clean, the staff was fantastic and the restaurants were very good. Overall this is a great place to stay! Minor issues are the pool is a bit small and while the sand for the beach is right there the water is a good walk. I would stay here again!

title: Another Great Weekend at The Shearton Sand Key
review: Thank you for your review on the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your experience with us and look forward to welcoming you back in the future!

title: So far, not impressed with the accommodations
review: Once again, we just had a wonderfule time over here. The staff was great (we especially love Matt at the towel hut - he is great with us and all the guests). We slept like babies in those comfy beds. Had great cheeseburgers at the Mainstay Tavern. Loved the salad bar at the Island Grille. Snorkeled, paddleboarded, and fished on the beach. Took the Jolley Trolley to the pier (buy the all day tickets in the convenience store). Walked to Columbia for dinner as well. We come here often and love it every time. Great location, staff, and accomodations.

title: Great Location
review: Thank you for your review on our property!  With all of the choices in the Clearwater Beach area we are so pleased to hear you enjoy returning to our resort.  How wonderful you were able to enjoy the Jolley Trolley and so many other features of the area. We look forward to your next stay with us!

title: Nice hotel with a great beach
review: We just checked in for business after spending a few days at a Holiday Inn Express in Largo. So far, all I can say is for twice the price of the HIE, I expected more. There is no mini fridge in the room, you have to rent one. There is no free wi-fi, because you have to pay for that too. It is on the beach, but you have to walk almost two blocks through sand to get there and they don't offer a sand shuttle. The bathroom is tiny, and there isn't enough counter space for all of our toiletries.  There isn't a complimentary breakfast. In the room they have two bottles of water, one small and one large. If you look carefully, you will discover that the small one is free but the large one costs $3.25. You can tell the hotel is older because there are some out of date aspects to it,…

title: Nice location
review: The location of the Sand key is great mostly because of the quiet area away from the Pier and a very easy walk to the beach.  Most reviews say the walk is too far, but really the beach is right on the property and takes 2 minutes to walk. If you are an elderly person and have difficulty walking they will drive you to the shore with their little buggies...but for those that like a short walk, its' really not a big deal. The sand is white and soft and the walk is enjoyable. Volleyball by the beach is available.  The pool is too small and gets to crowded. For the size of the property it really should be bigger. The negatives are the size of the bathrooms in this hotel. I needed to walk into the bathroom and then close the bathroom door.  Thankfully the sink was on the outside of…

title: Whitesand beach with daily dolphin sighting
review: We spent a week in this family-friendly hotel, where the kids could daily play at their amazing white sand beach with a thousand birds and whenever we went out with our friend's jetski, we saw wild dolphins swimming right next to us, something our kids will never forget. Very friendly staff, good priced hotel restaurant with great breakfast buffet. If you want to try something different in the evening, try going to Colombia Restaurant, right next to the Marriot which lays across the street from the Sandkey Sheraton. Reservations are needed, as it's a very popular place for locals as well.

title: Great Room Service - Good Beach
review: This is the second time we visit this hotel. Mainly because of the service/staff and its location (beach front). We went back to Sheraton Sand Key for my birthday and also to relax. We decided to upgrade this time to Club Level. The first day we thought it wasn't worth it, but after attending the cocktail happy hours and that magnificent view from the lounge made it worth while the upgrade.  Negatives: - No small fridge: We usually like to keep cold bottle of water near by. - No Drink Cart On the Beach: Apparently they shut it down during the low season, but, it is my opinion that people who visit this resort want a drink cart and want to feel pampered all the time. Also, the closest bar is quite a walk from the beach. I just think this would keep guests happy all year round. …

title: Helpful staff
