review: Thank you for taking the time to write a detailed review on our property.  With all of the resort choices in the Clearwater Beach area we are truly grateful for your return visit!  Your kind remarks regarding room service will be passed along to our director of food and beverage.  We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your time of relaxation on the beach!  Our apologies about your disappointment of no fridge.  We can place one in your guestroom for a charge of $5 per day.  We look very forward to welcoming you back to the Sheraton Sand Key in the future!

title: Small rooms-small pool
review: We had a nice room, the view wasn't fantastic however, they did not have any ocean view available. The bell service man was very helpful with tips for restaurants. There wasn't much of an option for lunch, only the pool snack bar. We would definitely stay again.

title: Best beach vacation ever! Wonderful experience!
review: My fiance and I stayed last week for two nights.  We both work in customer service and hospitality but I have to say both of us were completely blown away by the level of customer service and general all round friendiness of the staff.  I'm very fussy about cleaniness and I'm always impossible to please but I have to say the room was spotless as well as the hotel common areas, pool area and beach front.    The beach is beautiful and yes it's a bit of a walk but honestly isn't that the beauty of it..you enjoy the stroll and your far enough away from the pool area that it's serene and close enough to go back to the pool bar for drinks.   If you do anything during your stay, please go eat at Rusty's.  We ate breakfast and dinner there both days of our stay and we have to say we ate…

title: Never Disappoints/Best Beach
review: We have stayed at this property many times and it is always a good experience. We had a super view of the pool and Gulf. The beach at this place is GREAT. Pristine, huge and pretty much all your own. Rooms nice with a small table/chairs to put all your stuff on.  The cleanliness is unparalleled. They are vacuuming the rooms and hallways every day, important when you drag sand into the building every day. The food is exceptional and the distance to Clearwater Beach is short, and you can take the Trolley. The 24 hour store was a plus. Free parking. Can’t wait to return.

title: Nice hotel, pricey restaurants, nothing nearby
review: I visited the Shearton Sand Key for a conference.  The conferencing facilities were great.  The staff were all very friendly and the hotel was smart and stylish.  The pool was good, although somewhat small.  There are a couple of shops in the hotel which sell snacks, coffee and beach accessories, plus souvenirs and postcards.  There are also 3 restaurants.  I found these to be quite pricey although the food was nice and again the service was really good.  The only downside of the hotel is it's out of the main resort of Clearwater or Clearwater Beach, so there isn't much within walking distance nearby.

title: So disappointed...
review: We found this hotel to be over priced and better placed to cater for conferences than a family holiday. The staff on reception were rude and in general the staff everywhere seemed unhappy. The food was exceptionally good but there was absolutely no atmosphere or ambience at this hotel so we ate off site. The greatest disappointment was the small,murky swimming pool which we didn't use at all. We were so disappointed and would never return to this hotel although we will return to clearwater.

title: Lovely Hotel. Great Location. Will be back soon.
review: Stayed here for a three night stop over instead of Clearwater beach because it’s quieter. Warm greeting upon arrival and found staff very helpful.  Our room was spacious and spotless just what you expect from the Sheraton. Beds were comfy and room had everything you expect including, TV,  safe, hairdryer, iron & board, alarm clock, hairdryer, and of course the full length mirror for the ladies. There is a charge for wireless and believe it or not they charge if you want a fridge! ($15 per day). The bathroom is adequate but not enough room to put anything anywhere. For instance one area is taken up by coffee making equipment, when it really should be used for all your toiletries. Our room had a beautiful balcony overlooking  the sea. Truly lovely watching the sunsets with a…

title: Great location
review: Stayed at this hotel for three nights in August.  The hotel is right on the beach, and what a beautiful beach it was, only a 2 or 3 minute walk from the pool to the sea, perfect for us.  Although the pool is quite small it has a section that is 8ft deep - great fun for our children to jump in!  They had a few beach games and body boards which you could take down to the sea, lots of sunbeds and a nice pool bar.  Perfect for a few lazy days in the sun.  We had a fantastic view of the pool and beach from our room.  There was a small shop, a bar near reception which also served food as well as the main restaurant.  We had the breakfast buffet, which was fine.  You can also walk to a couple of excellent restaurants from the hotel - 3 or 4 minutes and you are in Backwaters or…

title: Great Hotel, Front Desk Insult!
review: I don't know why, but the last 2 hotels I've booked had issues with their Front desk. The Resort was beautiful and great for the family. I booked a Standard with balcony. The Front desk gives me the key to our room.  I get to our room and it doesn't have a balcony and it has a horrible view of the roof!  I go back downstairs to advise the Front desk it's not what I paid for and she doesn't give me any issues to change it, but tells me:"Out of our 300 something rooms there are 3 rooms that don't have a balcony."  Why even bother telling me that???  Basically you're telling me yeah, let me give you our most crappiest view rooms. How did I become so lucky? Other than that, place was beautiful and clean. We have stayed at plenty of places on the beach. I understand that they hold…

title: Beach Getaway
review: Very nice property situated on Clearwater Beach. Room was a typical oversized hotel rooms with sitting area. Numerous, attentive employees on site kept property clean and guests well cared-for. Plenty to keep you occupied - pool, beach, watersports, gym, shops, restaurants, bars, tennis. Took advantage of the upgrade to Sheraton Club Level - Continental breakfast in morning, drinks and appetizers in early evening. Several restaurants in walking distance (notably the Columbia) meant that we did not have to drive anywhere once we checked in.

title: Amazing!
review: This hotel was by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in.  We stayed here during the second part of our trip back in March.  We stayed in Orlando the first part, and were less than pleased.  However, upon arriving here it was like a breath of fresh air.  The property is extremely clean.  We were greeted by an amazing concierge, who not only helped us with our bags, but also gave us a brief history of the area.  (AWESOME!)  The room was cheery and clean, our shower head wasn't working on arrival, so we called the desk.  Someone was up to fix it within 5 minutes, was fixed just as quick, and we were then offered free breakfast for our trouble!  We stayed for a week and I will say, I was sad to leave.  The pool was awesome (they have a handicap lift for those with disabilities),…

title: Potential is within reach!
review: To be fair this is an older property, we asked and were told 40+ years old. The beach was wonderful and was the reason we chose this hotel for this weekend. Janet at the frnt desk was cheery and kind, we arrived early and our room was ready (w just wanted a parking pass) due to the early our. No worries had room keys and unpacked by 1115hrs. Very nice surprise and very nice check in experience. The room smelled of a beach hotel, like an old damp washcloth albeit it was clean, we figured it was the very old carpet. We accepted that as we spend little time in the room anyway and put on the air which helped. Later i the evening the bathrom drain plug was stuck down, we needed ths fixed as it was stubborn, we mentioned on the wy out to dinner and arrive backto the sink being fixed…

title: Mostly Nice Stay at Sheraton Sand Key
review: Mostly a nice stay. We tried to check in a little early but were told our room would not be ready until after about 3:30pm. The check out time is early - 11:00 am . As a Starwood Preferred Gold Guest I was anticipating that we would get a late check out since we have always received this benefit at other Starwood properties. Not here. The young lady who checked us in told us this Starwood benefit does not apply to their hotel since they are a "resort" and she could not extend our check out past 11:00 am (on a Sunday). So that was disappointing but I do understand as they certainly were busy. Our room was fine, nothing spectacular as you might expect for a "resort". Average size, but clean and comfortable bed. But we had a great view of the water from the small balcony. Balcony…

title: One of the better locations in Clearwater
review: The hotel is well situated on one of the better beaches in Pinellas County.  I do not understand those who claim the walk to the beach is too long as the hotel is on the beach.  With free parking and numerous good food options, this is a hotel that ranks with the  best in the area.   The only negative note is the rooms facing the intercoastal waterway have to contend with massive noisy room mounted airconditioners below one's balcony.  The place is clearly family friendly, but the noise from kids was not a beyond the ordinary.

title: sand key
review: This is a nice hotel on the beach. The bar has good frozen drinks and a pool table. The bed was very cozy and comfortable.  some rooms have balcony large enough for 2 to 3 people to sit with chairs. First floor rooms have patio. Nice pool area.  Had a club sandwich which was good.

title: Quiet Gulf getaway.
review: We stayed here over Labor Day weekend and it was a lovely stay. Beach is beautiful but as mentioned before, long walk to water because it is a very big beach - however, it doesn't feel at all crowded because of its size.  Pool area is a combo of chairs around pool (which are hard to get) and a shady, grassy area with a steel drummer and bar.  Our kids (15, 13 and 10 were a little bored so we took them to Surf Style for indoor surfing and miniature golfing all nearby over the small bridge to Clearwater beach.

title: Great hotel!
review: Stayed with my mom and 2 children in July 2012.  Our room had a beautiful view of the water (overlooked the tennis courts).  The food in the restaurant was very good, we had breakfast there most mornings and dinner there on our last night.  The walk to the beach does not seem very far from the hotel.  The beach is beautiful, we spent the mornings knee deep in the water collecting beautiful shells.  It is convienent to everything, yet off the beaten path so there is a feeling of a private beach.  The staff was wonderful, they remembered my name after meeting me once, and they seems to really care whether or not I was enjoying my vacation.  I will definitely return, the sooner the better!

title: Great Beach
review: Rooms are average. View more than makes up for it - if you get a room with a view. Be nice at check-in and clerk may give you internet access code - hate that obnoxious internet fee at upscale resorts. Service spotty but food excellent at restaurant. Very nice, uncrowded beach. I use to live 3 miles south - this may be the best hotel beach in Clearwater.

title: Amazing!!!
review: We stayed in August 2012, me 42, husband 42 and two daughters of 19 and 15 amazing hotel, staff so helpful, excellent location, nice and quiet and not to busy food was to die for, we ate in the hotel most nights in the bar watching the olympics which were on in the main bar, very reasonable prices on par with orlando eatories (try the ribs!!). Beach was lovely and clean and not far to walk down to the sea... was nice to strech the legs before lying down all day :) only downside was the cost of the loungers and umbrellas as for a familly of 4 it would have been £50 dollars a day, which is silly prices they would get more custom and revenue if they dropped to £15. luckily we know from other reviews that it was expensive so we took a couple of blow up inflatables to use. Tennis…

title: AMAZING!
review: We were hesitant to stay here due to some of the reviews on Trip Advisor but I'm not sure why people gave it such low ratings?  Sure, the pool area is always packed with kids cuz that's what kids like! We spent all of our time on the beach. Yes it is a walk from the hotel (900 feet) and you can thank Mother Nature for that and yes you have to pay $25 for two chairs and an umbrella. How do you think they keep the beach so clean?  Look around at the other places. They're no where near as clean! The rooms were a bit small but the spectacular view from our balcony made up for it.   The people at the front desk were amazingly helpful and answered any of our questions.  As far as eats....we ate a couple of times at the mainstay which was good. Rustys was a bit pricey for us but we…

title: Loved the Sheraton Sand Key Resort!
review: I recently booked a vacation through Southwest Vacations, and chose the Sheraton Sand Key Resort (SSKR) based upon reviews here and elsewhere. All the reviews raved about the service, and they were right. The service was awesome, and given the chance, I would return. For a hotel built in 1975, the property is in great shape.  The downsides? Free wifi is only offered downstairs in The Link, and charged $9.99 per day on your room. The bathrooms are tiny, so if there are more than 2 people in the room, good luck. The pool can get over crowded, but the beach is right there. People complained about the "long walk " but it really isn't that bugs deal. The Marriott across the road doesn't even have a beach, they have to use the Sunset Key Park next door to the SSKR.  So relax and enjoy…

title: Nice Place, But Smokers Everywhere !
review: Rooms were nice and clean. They have their own semi-private beach area which makes it a fairly long walk to the Gulf. This Hotel is NOT on Clearwater beach. You can see Clearwater beach about 1/2 mile across the water. Don't try to swim there! The currents under the bridge are swift. A trolly is available to carry you into Clearwater for $4.50 / day per person. Don't bother going to downtown Clearwater (about 3 miles away), it's a dead downtown and those Christian Scientists are roaming everywhere kind of like zombies in uniforms.   Must have been the timing, but there was a crowd of elderly people. They ALL smoked up a storm. They must have been out on balcony's smoking too because I smelled smoke more than once up on the fifth floor. Choke, choke,  (Lol)  choke . Amazing how…

title: Nice Resort but...
review: Yes the resort was very nice, I was there for Ladies Auxiliary VFW's yearly school of instruction but I will tell ya they are extremely anti-smoking. No smoking on room balconies, none by the pool. I know us smokers have become second hand citizens but this annoys me. I am outside my room on a balcony and I can't smoke. Another problem was the beds, very uncomfortable and we had no refrigerator in our room. I can say the bartender and front desk personnel were very friendly. The gulf is quite the walk, beautiful sand. At night the bugs outside where you had to smoke were eating us up alive.

title: A Truly Relaxing Place
review: Had a Suite here w/two balconies - Super size room w/large kitchen & bath.  The service is outstanding - the restaurant/bar are great - private beach with pool and hot tub for 14 people. Has bikes for your use to ride around in. Will come back again for sure.

title: Relaxing hotel
review: We travelled to the Sheraton after a week at the Peabody in Orlando. We were slightly disappointed by the size of our room and the size of the swimming pool but I think that we had been spoilt in the Peabody. The air con unit made quite a lot of noise during the night. It is, however, a very relaxing hotel on the beach. There was plenty for the children to do as the pool staff organised games several times through the day. There were also volleyball nets and corn toss set up on the beach. The restaurants at the hotel were very good with very good service. The main bar did good value easy meals and the restaurant was slightly more expensive but excellent food. There was a pool table, which we frequented to escape the sun and in the evening. We could see gorgeous sunsets from our…

title: Great Location for Relaxing/Family
review: Stayed here for the third consecutive year.  Each year I've redeemed some of my "star points" and upgraded to a suite, so I can't speak to the size of the standard rooms.  The suites are GREAT.  They are a nice size and are nicely appointed.  Though it's called a suite, it really is just one large room (double a standard room size?) with a large bathroom.  The large open room area is divided into sections by furniture placement.  There's a living area, a dining area and a sleeping area.  There's also a large (in length, not depth) balcony with two chairs and a side table.  (It would be nice if the suites had more than just the two chairs and side table on the balcony.)    Overall the hotel is away from the noise and congestion of the main part of Clearwater beach, which is nice.…

title: Far away, not spectatular, lots of additional fees
review: My husband and I booked this place for our 'babymoon' but ended up checking out after two days.  We were quite bored!  This hotel is simply average, not a resort as we expected.  The pool was small with very few shaded areas to sit, the beach was quite a walk to get to the water, and then you had to pay either $15 for a half day or $25 for a full day to rent two chairs and an umbrella.  They didn't charge for parking but it was tough to find a spot I think due to the convention going on.   They do not have a mini-fridge in the room but you could request one for $5/day.   The room was fine, but nothing spectacular.  Just wasn't worth spending 10K points/night for this.  We happened to get wireless internet for free, the staff were overall nice, but it just wasn't what we were…

title: Really a "Convention Only" Resort
review: We stayed on an ULTRA busy weekend for Conventions and was not pleased with the noise level while in the rooms - constant banging of room doors did not allow for trying to sleep in (and some of that was from the cleaning staff.) Certainly if you are there for a convention it would be very convenient but otherwise I would steer clear. Be sure to ask how many conventions are booked during your anticipated stay! A Harbor view is really a roof top view of the Convention Center with the Harbor off across the road! The walk to the Ocean will tire out the most fit member of your party - and if a storm comes in quickly you have quite a problem getting back in before the lightening comes (we were there on a stormy weekend and basically stayed by the pool because we knew we couldn't run…

title: Nice Quite Resort
review: I spent a week here with my husband to celebrate our anniversary.  If you are looking for something in the middle of the action you should go elsewhere, but this is a perfect location for a relaxing vacation.  We rented a beach wheelchair and then discovered that the resort would take us to the beach (which is quite a walk).  The rooms are not updated but the staff is first-rate.  Everyone went out of their way to make sure that we had everything that we needed and since we were celebrating they even gave us a nice surprise the first night.  The walk to the beach is less than 3 minutes and it is across nice powder soft sand.  It is a wonderful place to play, there were volleyball games going on everytime we passed. While swimming in the ocean we also saw dolphins playing.  I…

title: Great, quiet location.
review: I wasn't thrilled initially, as there were several events that weekend, and the hotel was packed. When Monday arrived, and everyone left, the place became great. The beach is fantastic and quiet. The staff was prompt with all requests. I decided to stay here instead of the usual Sheraton Suites in Tampa since the weather was going to be nice that weekend, and I didn't want to have to drive to the beach.  The room was better than I expected, as I was figuring it to be a bit dated, but I was on an SPG floor. I would stay here again.

title: Average Hotel/Nice Location
review: I recently stayed here with my husband and wasn't blown away by the hotel. Our room was a typical mid-range hotel room but it had a strange smell to it and the AC ran so loud that it kept us up most of the night. The hotel grounds are nice and clean but nothing special. There is a small pool outside with a pool bar but be prepared to deal with a crowd! It seems like a lot of guests hang out at the pool rather than walking all the way down to the beach and back everytime they want a beer. The location is nice but I will stay elsewhere during my next trip.

title: Perfection !!!!
review: I would really like to say that this place was amazing. The staff, the cleanliness, the location, the service was just perfect. The walk to the beach is 2.5 minutes and NOT 15 minutes (like some people said on their review). Not far at ALL. I highly reccomend this place, I would definitely stay there again.

title: Better than expected
review: Had read reviews about being dated, but we had a nice fresh room (Starwood Preferred apparently). It wasn't huge, but not small either. Hotel overall good value, nothing super expensive and a relaxed attitude to brining in food/coolers, etc. Rusty's restaurant the best in hotel food I have had in ages. I would recommend to families, Sandkey is more upscale/relaxed than clearwater beach.

title: It was a nice stay.....
review: We got a really good deal through South west vacations, so we decided to go.  We paid for an upgraded room on the package to have an ocean view.  Since we are SPG members, we were located on the 7th floor.  Besided having to wait for our room well after 3:pm, everyone was really nice.  Nothing special about the room.  Small, even smaller bathroom, but clean.  I agree that it is becoming a dated facility.  Check in is nice, but the rest of the resort needs upgraded.  Carpet, hallways etc are run down.  We stayed for 5 days and cant complain.  We had nice buffets in the morning and at night when we didnt want to leave the hotel.  Always had great service.  The pool is smaller than what it looks like online, but it worked for us.  We have a 17 month old and he loved playing in the…

title: Good location-needs remodeling!
review: The good.  This hotel is on the beach so the location and view are good.  The gym has a really nice view and the equipment is updated.  The bellmen are a great asset.  they were extremely helpful and knowledgeable.   The bad. the rooms were not made-we had to ask for this. Although the hotel is on the beach-there is a bit of a walk. the ugly.  the hotel is not very clean.  the carpets are wrinkled.  The wall paper is coming off.  The front desk was worthless..  They seemed irritated that we were stying there.  Anytime I asked a question they told me to ask the bellmen.  I had an issue with my Starwood preferred status and they could have cared less.

title: Expected more from a resort
review: I stayed here for a conference. It was an acceptable resort, but could use a little updating, especially carpeting in halls and rooms. While there are signs posted that shirts and shoes are required in the lobby area, I saw a number of guests strolling around just in bathing suits, which was rather disgusting. The resort nickels-and-dimes guests to an extent, with expensive wifi charges, $15 or so to use a beach chair, and daily charges for refrigerators.

title: Needs updating, rooms small
review: I did not think it was worth the money... Rooms were so small. Pool nice and beach nice. Everything was very outdated and I would not stay there again! The walls were dirty. I guess I just expected more

title: Nice...but getting dated
review: Our family stayed here in early August for the second year in a row.  The resort is beautifully located on Sand Key and its biggest asset is clearly the beach where we spent the vast majority of our time.  In my opinion, the pool is too small and gets crowded very easily; the water temperature was also a bit warm.  The resort decor is a bit dated and needs a bit of a makeover; the basic guest rooms are on the small side, especially the bathroom area.  On the plus side, the staff is quite friendly and helpful, particularly at the pool.  Overall, we did enjoy our stay and would recommend as a god choice to stay in the Clearwater area.

title: Fabulous hotel
review: Clean, great facilities, friendly staff and reasonably prices food! The shops in the resort were usefully stocked and sensibly priced- great location slightly away, but in easy reach of the main clearwater resort area. The rooms were beautifully clean. We liked the expansive beach and feeling of space, pool not to busy- can't wait to return!

title: Far from beach
review: We recently stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  The hotel is nice and clean, however it is quite a walk to get to the beach.  You can see the beach from some of the room balconies, but not from the pool area.  Restaurant prices were reasonable and the food was good.  Staff was ok.  My biggest complaint is that I asked on several occasions for a late check out (instead of 11 I asked for 12) and was told every time that I could not get one.  I feel I should mention this because others we knew did receive a late check out.

title: Nice Resort Beautiful Beach Great Service
review: The resort is in a nice location. The beach is beautiful.  The service was excellent, from the moment we arrived to check-in the staff was great. Everyone was very friendly and helpful.  We tried to make coffee the first night and the coffee maker did not work, I called the front desk and in 10 mins housekeeping brought a new one.   We tried room service, the food is not that great, but it was fast and convinient.  The pool is rather small, but we still enjoyed it.   One thing to know is that the walk to the beach is quite far.  For a family with small children and maybe a person with difficulty walking or elderly it can be exhausting. We recommend a cart if you plan to take your own chairs, umbrella or cooler.  Overall we give it 2 thumbs up and plan to return in the future!

title: Excellent, less crowded beach area
review: We stayed at this hotel July 24-28 & were very pleased with the accomodations.  The restaurant Rusty's had a nice breakfast buffet, pretty affordable.  Hotel also had a small carryout area that was ideal for a quick breakfast, with bagels, muffins, donuts, fruit, yogurts, etc. Also ate at their Island Grill, this wasn't very good, food tasted kind of bland.  In a pinch it's ok, but I would skip it. Hotel Room - Had a room with 2 queen size beds, very comfortable. Nice balcony overlooking the beach area.  TINY, TINY bathroom area with very little counter space.  Ended up having to double decker our toiletry bags to get everything to fit.  Bathroom had a pull out clothes line for hanging up wet swim suits - came in very handy.  They have super soft water here or treated hard water…

title: An absolute Gem
review: Stayed here with the family July 2012 and absolutely was blown away with the staff. Wonderful people. Felt like we were at a 4 seasons! Room was very clean and comfortable, pool area was well managed. Tiki bars were convenient and tenders were very eager to meet our needs. I'd highly recommend. Can not beat the place for the price anywhere we've stayed in Florida.

title: Nice Hotel and Friendly Staff
review: When we arrived our room was not ready yet. The front desk staff were very nice and offered to hold our bags and told us we could use the facilities. Once our room was ready someone called our cell phone to tell us. Everyone we encountered was very nice. From the restaurant, front desk to housekeeping. My only complaint about the hotel is the pool is way to small. It was the middle of the summer and the pool was completely packed. Once you got in the pool you couldn't move, never mind swim.  Great hotel and a great weekend.

title: Nicely Updated Hotel
review: We used SPG points + cash for our two day stay.  Our room was nicely updated with two queen beds and a flat screen TV.  It had a view of the parking lot.  This did not effect our stay since we weren't planning on being in the room except to sleep.  If we had paid for the room this may have been a different story.  I will mention that a refrigerator or in-room internet are additional charges.  The updated bathtub and toilet are enclosed in a small area with the sink and mirror outside.  This did cause some difficulties due to the fact that I am an early riser that woke up the sleepyheads as I was getting ready for my early morning walk on the beach.   The hotel is not in the tourist area of Clearwater.  It has more of a family vibe to it.  We did not eat any meals at the hotel. …

title: FACA 2012 Coaches Clinic
review: Great time!.  Close to the beach, has nice restaurant, Grille, gift shop and store.  Pool area nice but small.  Beach; water was about 400 yds from the hotel, calm, flat with a sandbar about halfway between the beach and the ship lanes.

title: Clearwater Beach Escape 4 Stars
review: We were at Clearwater Beach from July 23 through July 27 2012.  It was our first time and we both thought it was so beautiful and clean.  We stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key, which is just off Clearwater Beach in an area called Sand Key-seems part of Clearwater Beach.  Hotel is on the beach.  It could use another pool as it was very crowded with kids.  Staff was good, hotel was clean, good maid service.  We did not eat there.  They have a beautiful work out room overlooking the beach.  It was easy to get from the hotel, pool and beach-where we rented chairs and an umbrella.  We loved walking the "strip" and driving down to St. Petes Beach where we passed all sorts of beach towns.  Clearwater Beach is very lively and fun.  You must eat at the Beachcomber-great Grouper-Frenchy…

title: Attentive Staff
review: We travelled to the resort June 7-10.  I had been at this resort 17 years prior and they have updated it a little bit  but the resort is fine.  The staff is very attentive.  The guys at the pool shack handing out towels and moving chairs were awesome!!  They were so on top of the chairs that you had to make sure you left an article on your chair or you might find the towel gone when you return.  The bellmen were so friendly and fun!!  The resort sits about 350 yards from the water so it is quite a long walk but so pretty and there are volleyball courts if you feel inclined.  The resort is across the bridge on Sand Key so you do have to drive to Clearwater Beach downtown...but it is kind of nice to be able to drive 3 minutes and get away from the craziness!!!  Cons...they all…

title: Going down hill
review: I have been coming to this resort couple times during the summer for many years and at first it was great but this summer has been terrible visited twice and both times same story i booked this stay months prior and requestes a high floor and got the lowest punishing me for checking in early ? Not sure but got a lovley view a wall to enjoy.there charing an 18 percent auto gratuity on everything they charge and then want another tip on top of that the walk to the beach is brutal at least a qaurter of a mile feels like whole mile when it full rain water.full of thorns and splinters no effort on their part remedy simple drain trench system would be suffcient and extra charges that iam disputing not returnin not worth the tons of money you pay for stay at the hilton or the hyatt

title: Awesome
review: We loved this hotel.  The location was great, food - great, service - great.  Now, first, the hotel is on the beach, but the way the beach is set up, its a good walk, over lots of pebbles and shells to get to the sandy beach (wear flip-flops). We use to go to the beach every day - if not to swim, for a beautiful night stroll as the sun set.  Also liked that the hotel is NOT directly in Clear Water.  Its just over the bridge in Sand Key, which again, is nice (you aren't in tourist central, but can go there, even walk...  yes, its a hike, or bus... if you want).  The hotel room IS a hotel room.  But loved the balcony over-looking the Gulf.   The staff was awesome.  From the time we walked in, until we walked out, they were nothing but kind and helpful.  Especially the manager, who…

title: Some Good, Some Bad...
review: We stayed here 5 nights in July.  To start off, the property is ok, the pictures are a little incorrect as it makes it appear the gulf is closer than what it really is.  It is pretty dated in decor and is showing it age.  In one of the dining areas, the chairs where ripped and frayed and the carpet is aged.  Also, the pictures makes it appear as it is right on the beach...actually It is quite a little walk from the pool area to the actual beach but it's not too far.  Pool area is nice, the pool is a little small. They have a cafe outside as well as a bar. The bar is VERY expensive as are the rest of the dining options on property.  I think the breakfast buffet was $10-14 per person...and the food was avg.  Service was very slow and getting drink refills and paying bill was a…

title: Average - nothing terrible but nothing special
review: I'm a platinum member with Starwood and spent close to 90 nights in 4-5 months at starwood properties. I needed a short holiday,  - and picked this place because it was in Starwood and close enough to travel to from anywhere on East Coast of North America. The website photos looked amazing!  In hindsight I regret not going for somewhere else. It wasnt that there was anything particular that upset me - but I didnt feel it was worth it in the end. I found the facilities very basic (pool, eating options, room and bathroom) and looking back on the experience the high points from my time in clear water had nothing to do with the hotel - it was more to do with the area (the beach is amazing, as is the sea/sunsets etc)  The stay was very average and I didnt feel that anyone went out of…

title: Customer Service A+
review: Just returned from a week long stay at this beautiful resort. The atmosphere was welcoming. From the moment we checked in the staff made every effort to make us feel welcomed there. We had an issue with our air conditioner on our 2nd night. The staff was quick to respond, handle the issue and then we received a call from the front desk. They offered to comp our breakfast the next morning to compensate for the inconvenience. Very unexpected and greatly appreciated! We had  an ocean view balcony overlooking the pol. Beautiful, well kept grounds. Excellent beach on the Gulf! The beach vehicle manned by "Debbie" was a great source of libations by the waters edge:) She was so personable and wanted to treat you truly as a guest.  Rented comfortable lounge chairs and umbrella for a few…

title: Beautiful!
review: This hotel is so beautiful!   Everything from the hotel to the decor to the setting, it was the best Florida hotel I have ever stayed at.  The staff was fantastic and the food was perfect.   The hotel is located on this wide beach and it is very private.  The pool was beautiful and the staff at the pool we as friendly.   I was here with family and the whole family enjoyed our vacation.  Thank you to the Sheraton sand key!

title: We Loved Everything About This Resort
review: The property is beautiful, well-maintained, and situated on a well-groomed beach on the Gulf.  We rented very nice chairs and umbrellas on the beach/Gulf to avoid the hassle of setting up/dismantling/carrying same on our own - well worth it.  A Resort vehicle visits the beach offering drinks and snacks for purchase.  We enjoyed looking for shells in the early a.m.  Volley ball is an option.   The well-designed pool looks out on the beach and Gulf.  It's casual food and smoothie bars are very convenient.  We ordered food 'to-go' from inside the Resort and ate pool side a couple of times.  Live mellow, instrumental music in the mid-afternoon.  Pool games for the kids.   Very hospitable staff.  We loved our room and balcony with a view of the pool, well-groomed beach, and Gulf…

title: Best Easter Sunday EVER!
review: On Easter Sunday morning, all of the children were gathered in a ballroom for an Easter surprise. I don't want to give it all away, but it was the coolest Easter morning I have ever experienced. They kicked it off with free donuts, milk, juice, and coffee. It ended with gasps of delight! Here's the kicker. We were supposed to check out on Saturday. I'm so glad they had the space to allow us one more day. Totally worth it!!! The hotel's location is wonderful. We were right on the trolley route (to take you into Clearwater) and less than a block from great shopping and restaurants on Sand Key. The hotel's beach required a bit of a stroll (just don't do it barefoot), but once you got there the hotel offered cabanas for rent. A food cart came around regularly too. I can't complain…

title: Sheraton Snd Key
review: The hotel itself was very nice.  But you had a 1/4 mile walk in the sand just to get to the beach.  Great pool area for those not wanting to walk.

title: Great location in Sand Key
review: The staff, location, beach, reasonably priced food for a hotel, and quickness of service were fantastic.  Stayed 4 nights and had little to no issues and the little ones were corrected immediately.  People complain that it was a hike to the beach however "ALL" the area has the same equal distant walk. It might have been once upon a time when these establishments were regulated to build where they now stand.  For the walk, the Sheraton constantly has the HUGE sand area racked beautifully.  Well worth the 3-5 min. walk from the pool to the actually beach.  No biggy but for little ones after a few hours in the sun it may be it bit much for them.  Other than that, take a small cooler for yourself and enjoy the natural beauty of the area.  Another nice thing is that your close enough…

title: 5* Trip
review: One of my favourite hotels in the world, superb location & fantastic beach with Sheraton quality.

title: Nice hotel, long way to beach
review: Stayed for two nights as a family using SPG points.  For what you get, you to use a LOT of points to stay at this hotel.  Rooms and service were adequate, though the Club was really not that nice.  It was adequate for snacks and breakfast but not the kind of Club that you want to spend time in.  The beach was quite a hike across hot sand, and the umbrellas and chairs were for rent only.  Given that the hotel is a resort, and having been at resorts around the world, it is strange that the Sheraton cannot provide umbrellas and chairs for guests who want to use the beach.  As a result, most people spend their time around the very crowded pools, which provide shade (trees) and chairs for relaxation.  After several of these types of Sheratons, we are no longer going to risk a…

title: Excellent vacation
review: I love this resort quiet, clean, and very hospitable.  Will keep going for years to come...

title: Good Birthday Stay
review: We checked in for a few days; My wife and I (in our 40s), my brother and friend (30s,50s) and my mom (80s)... Check in was easy, but we were on different floors, which worked out fine. The rooms were good size and clean. Very comfortable bed; we had a tennis court/gulf view. The pool area was nicely manicured with plenty of chairs, but it was a small pool for the number of rooms at the hotel. There was a good walk to the beach area (a manned golf cart was available), the beach was beautiful. 25$ for 2 chairs and an umbrella which might explain why the pool area was crowded. All in all a nice stay; close drive to shops and off site sights.

title: Excellent family-friendly resort, minor negatives
review: Overall the hotel, rooms, amenities and staff were excellent, but a few negatives prevent me from giving the Sheraton Sand Key five stars.  Minor complaints included... - Requesting a mini-fridge was an extra cost ($5/day) - Wifi was extra $10/day - Bathroom sink counter area was very small - Air conditioning was a little loud (not terrible, but noticeable) - Location is not good if you want to have restaurants/entertainment within walking distance (parking at Clearwater Beach and surrounding area is a HUGE pain) I consider all of these fairly minor, especially the refrigerator and wifi costs since we knew ahead of time that requesting either would be an additional cost.  Also, you should be aware of the Hotel's location before you book it, so it's hard to blame the hotel for…

title: Wow- Terrible experience.  Shame on you Starwood!
review: I think that as long as the weather is good you'll enjoy your stay however we were stuck inside and forced to use the hotel amenities and things were pretty bad.  The staff is very friendly but that's as good as it gets.  The rooms are small and not very clean.  The pool wasn't very warm and the pool staff was unfriendly.    The property caters to small 'conventions' and when these are in 'session' (days and evening 'events') they dominate the hotel because they really have no 'separate area' to entertain these folks, which gets annoying.  One afternoon the bar/restaurant would not serve me because they were 'preparing for the meeting/convention guests'.  It was raining and I needed to make some calls to shuffle some travel arrangements.  I just wanted a comfortable place to…

title: With a very nice pool overlooking the beach, the resort is friendly, clean, and conveniently located close to good eateries and
review: I've stayed here many times and the hotel is consistent in always providing a good experience. The beach is just beyond the pool, the meeting facilities are nice, the staff, from the doormen to housekeeping, is friendly and accommodating. The hotel is well maintained and clean with all the amenities. Guest laundry, restaurants, bars, tennis and volleyball courts, etc.

title: Very nice
review: Lovely hotel in a nice setting. Relaxing holiday beautiful beach friendly staff great food.

title: Nice Stay
review: Nice overall hotel with a few minor issues.Balcony sliding doors were loud which became annoying when trying to sleep. We were charged $5 a night for a mini-refrigerator which is usually included in the room rate. The walk to the beach was rather long. Pool area was loud even after pool was closed. But the rooms were Very clean and comfortable. There were 7 computers with free internet available for free use 24/7. Fitness center was top notch!

title: GREAT stay!
review: We just returned from our stay at the Sheraton. The hotel has been kept very nice and clean. There were a few minor maintenance issues-balcony sliding doors were loud and the tub lever was hard to pull up and down to get shower on, and the shower valve was leaking. None of that bothered me, but it would annoy some people. Our room had a gulf view and it was amazing! Fitness Center was really nice and had views of the bay.We didn't use the pool because it got really busy. I did see activities in the pool area for the kids. Most of the staff was really great. Front desk clerk(Yiannis) made a suggestion to have lunch across the street at Backwaters and Columbia. Both were really good! We sat outside next to the water, which was really nice! We even saw a baby shark. At Columbia we…

title: Great Family Getaway
review: Nice hotel for as old as it is. It was very clean and they staff is super friendly. Location is beautiful and the beach is wonderful. It is quite a walk from the hotel to the beach though. The pool was shut down for chemical treatment so we didn't get to swim in it. We only stayed two days and housekeeping did a wonderful job keeping our room clean and the facitlies clean. The common areas were very well maintained. Steve the bellman was very polite and personable. He was great help in recommending area attractions. The down fall was no free internet in the rooms and no refrig in the rooms. Over all, we enjoyed our stay and will be back.

title: Nice Hotel
review: The Sheraton Sand Key was very nice.  Room was clean and nice.  Staff was helpful.  I liked the 24 hour shop with drinks and snacks.  The pool and beach are beautiful. I was disappointed there was no spa, but it's not a deal breaker.

title: Good hotel with nice beach
review: I spent a weekend at the Sheraton a week ago and enjoyed my stay.  The hotel is located right on a nice sandy stretch of white beach, although it takes a few minutes to walk to the water.  It was a great place to watch the sunset in the evening.  Also, being away from the crowdedness of Clearwater Bay was nice.  I also thoroughly enjoyed Rusty's Bistro which had excellent quality of good and great service, but at a reasonable price.  On the negative, the walls are extremely thin and our room had a door to the adjoining room -- I could hear every word of our neighbours conversatoin and their screaming kids.  However, after calling the front desk, they quickly gave us another room which was much better.

title: Wonderful week !!!
review: Just returned from a glorious week at the Sand Key Sheraton, staff was super friendly and efficient and food was delicious and not over priced. Walk to the beach was not a big deal and definitely worth it, huge clean beach with white sand ! Pool is a little small, but beach certainly makes up for it. We have two teenage girls and hotel was very family friendly for kids if all ages, lots of pool & beach toys provided by the hotel. Definitely check out the Salt Lake Grill (about 7miles down n Gulf Blvd) really delicious and make reservations- gets crowded.

title: Another great stay
review: This is our second time to the Sheraton Sand Key.  It really is a wonderful place.  The staff are all friendly and helpful - actually some of the best we have ever encountered in a hotel.  When we had any issues with our room, they were prompt to try and fix and even gave us a $15 credit for the inconvenience.  The beach is lovely, although a little bit of a walk out to it.  The pool is nice.  We find it a bit small given the size of the hotel especially when the hotel is full, which it was most of our stay.  This is definitely a family hotel and conference hotel as well.  I'm not sure I would recommend it as a romantic destination as it is very busy and not a quiet hotel.  Overall, we really do love the location and all that is available nearby.  Great place to stay!

title: Poor Location Matched with Poor Amenities
review: With a new baby in tow (4 months), my wife and I knew we probably couldn't go on our usual European vacation and thus decided to try something close. Based on recommendations of friends we picked Clearwater (as oppose to South Beach) and based on some of the reviews online, we picked this Sheraton hotel. Needless to say, we didn't enjoy our trip, and the blame mostly falls on the hotel's location and provided servies. I'll explain below.   To be fair and clearly explain my reasoning for this review, I am going to break it down into 3 categories: hotel staff, hotel location, and hotel amenities.   Hotel Staff: I will be the first to say the staff at this Sheraton hotel are great. They are very accommodating and pleasant to deal with.  There isn't a single staff member that…

title: Nah...
review: OK first off, I'm just a regular dude.  Not some guy who goes out all the time spending $300.00 on a night for a  resort room on the beach.  In fact, this is the first time I've done such a thing.  I bought a night at this "resort" for my lady's birthday, and because we both needed to kinda get away from it all.  This is NOT a place for you to take your lady to get away from it all... The website would have you believe that there is some magical "club level" thing which costs a whole bunch more money,  and that the view from all sides of this place is amazing.  Even when I checked in, the guy at the front desk said, "oh, you've got room 724, with a great evening view of the city lights at night!"  Well, I really had a terrific view of part of the roof and parking lot, which…

title: Nice place to stay - reasonably priced
review: Me and my wife spent three days at the Sheraton Sand Key.  The property is well maintained and quite clean; our room (Harbor King) was comfortable.  There is plenty of free parking, and plenty of chairs and space surrounding the pool and surrounding areas.  Although set further back from the beach than other resorts in the area, the walk was not as bad as some reviewers make it out to be.    The staff is also friendly and accommodating; in fact, the doorman offered his recommendations for local dining fare.    My only complaint is the room did not include a small refrigerator (although the front desk offered a unit for an additional charge).  Come on now, room refrigerators are as common of an appliance as a hairdryer and television.  There's really no need to nickel and dime…

title: Well worth it....especially if you're an SPG  member.
review: What a location. What great views. Just spent a weekend get away with my wife here. If you're a gold SPG member don't forget to ask for your room upgrade, glad we did. Walk to beach was easy, water isnt right on top of hotel but isnt a bad walk either. Rustys restaurant was to our liking as will. Don't have a single complaint. We will be back for sure.

title: Best Vacation in a long time.
review: My wife and I stayed here the week before Memorial weekend and had one of the most restful enjoyable vacations ever. The beach and chairs and umbrellas are a great way to spend the day.  If you don't want to be on the beach the pool area is also very relaxing and enjoyable. This is a family hotel.  Service was excellent everywhere on the property. The room was spacious. The bathroom was small but how much time do you spend in the bathroom.

title: Perfect Wedding Destination - November 2011
review: This hotel is lovely and the views are just amazing. We got married on the beach at this hotel and the whole thing was perfect and the hotel staff are very friendly and Super efficient. I had my wedding dress steam ironed and returned the same day. We had chocolate dipped strawberries and champagne on arrival to our sea view room. The wedding co-ordinator with Virgin - Jan, was simply brilliant, we loved her so much. Food in the bar was very nice and not too bad prices - didnt eat in Rustys but this appeared more expensive. There are plenty of places to eat nearby that are better priced. Rooms were ok - not too impressed with our room given that we were getting married there and this was the beginning of our honeymoon - but my mum who is disabled had a fantastic room which was…

title: Good location on Sand Key
review: The hotel actually sits back from the gulf quite a bit, but has sand all the way to the beach. Since there's a lot of space between the hotel and the beach, there is room for sand volleyball and other sand activities between the hotel and the ocean. It's a nice hotel, with comfortable rooms. There was a conference going on for part of the time we were there, but everyone was very nice, and except for the dinner by the pool the last day, the conference didn't really interfere with our stay. I would stay here again.

title: A nice hotel on the beach
review: I attended a conference at this hotel and stayed there for 3 nights in June 2012.  Overall, this is a good hotel -- very suitable for families in particular, although the facilities are a bit old. Biggest negative was that the room walls provided very poor barrier to sound and with children in rooms around, I could hear their voices and noises made by them all the time. The other negative thing was that the bathroom, at least in the room that I stayed in, was very small, accommodating a shallow tub and the toilet tightly next to each other. The basin and the mirror were in an area just outside of the bathroom.   Everything else about the hotel was good to excellent. The room and the bath room were clean. As an SPG Platinum member, my room was upgraded without having to ask and…

title: Wedding location
review: We had our wedding here booked through Virgin Holidays. For the actual event I used the hotel's staff who added lots of little details on to our special day. We had to pay for the extra's however it was absolutely perfect. We had our own special area set up behind the pool bar and we were provided with our own waitress who kept my guests topped up with drinks. We also had a little food station with wraps and fresh fruit. All my guests commented on how fantastic a spread and we enjoyed every minute of the day.

title: Our Favorite Hotel!
review: My husband and I traveled to Clearwater/Largo, Florida to visit family friends in August 2008 as well as October 2008. We stayed for about 10 days with both trips combined. The service here was top notch. The staff was super friendly and helpful, including housekeeping! We would leave for a meal and come back to a remade bed, fresh towels, etc. The room was beyond clean, and very comfortable to stay in. On our second trip I became very ill and the staff was excellent, always asking if there was anything they could get me or do to help. The staff and service was well beyond anything I'd ever experienced in any other location. Also, on our arrival, we were brought a plate of the most amazingly delicious choclate dipped strawberries. The beach was a little bit of a walk from the…

title: Nice, but not 4-Star
review: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key on Memorial Day weekend. We are from Tampa, so it was just quick 3 night getaway. We had decided on the Sheraton because we wanted to get away from the craziness of Clearwater Beach during the holiday. Sand Key was still crowded, but much more manageable. The hotel as well as the beach (which is a good hike from the actual hotel) were clean. We stayed in an ocean-front room on the preferred level, which had great refreshments in the evening in the hospitality suite. My husband and I travel a lot and there are several reasons I would say this is more of a 3.5 star resort. For starters, we pulled up to discover there was no valet parking - we are perfectly capable of walking, but we did have to park pretty far as it was a holiday…

title: Great Location and staff
review: Quick check-in, nice staff. Good condition of room, small restroom. Not a major complaint, but the restroom was really small. Internet was fast, and had HD channels on the TV.   Great location for beach access. Volleyball courts, and cornhole… Also have an “alcohol” buggy that sells drinks on the beach -  which can be paid for by your room key – loved this option!   All the staff we encountered were great. The lounge has a few offerings in the AM and one hot option in the evening with FREE beer, wine and spirits.   I would stay here again.

title: Great Beach and Location - Value is par for the area
review: We spend 3 nights at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort in Oct 2011 as part of a wedding party.  Very nice property overall and the beach and pool area was great.  The service set this property apart from others we've stayed at.   The Bell Desk was excellent with regard to handling bags and request.  They remembered us and called us by name during our stay which doesn't happen much any more.  Front desk staff did a great job of providing information and assisting with our requests.  The rooms were clean and up to date, but  small which is why the value is par, but not great.  The room views vary greatly.  We had a view of the parking lot, which is what we paid for.  On the other side of the hotel the views are excellent.    Worth a mention is the bar and the bar staff.  They were…

title: Great hotel and location
review: We chose this hotel by the great beach location and were not disappointed.  The front desk staff were very helpful and provided us with a list of local restaurants, shops and beaches.   A nice surprise to receive a hand written note and chocolate dipped strawberries after we told the staff we had experienced a problem getting the hire car sorted at the airport.  The bar, restaurant and shop assistants were also very helpful and nice.  Concierges couldn't do enough for you if you had a query and always a cheery word when you arrived back at the hotel.  Excellent service from the hotel maids, always replenished the coffee and milk used daily.  I found the bed uncomfortable which was surprising after reading previous Trip Advisor reviews.  We had a room overlooking the Gulf and the…

title: Pleasant resort but need soundproofing
review: We stayed at Sand Key for a few days with two children under the age of five. The hotel is very clean and the staff is wonderful. The rooms are average in size; the beds were very comfortable; the in-room coffee was "Starbucks"(that was a surprise!); the towels were plentiful; but...the walls have little insulation. We could hear all the conversations in the hallway as well as in the rooms adjacent to ours. ( I 'm sure that the caucaphony from our two little one's was easily heard as well).  One other suggestion would be to add a small refrigerator to the guest rooms just for the convenience of families traveling with kids. I would reccomend this resort.

title: Very nice hotel - Business travel
review: I stayed at this hotel because I attended a training for work, which was held at this hotel.  My department paid for the room, which was discounted since the training was there, but I would not have paid the price they wanted at full price.  The rooms were very nice and quiet.  My only complaint with my room is there was no mini fridge or microwave.  A must if you want to bring food back to the room from anywhere.  We had a room that overlooked the tennis courts and could see the beach, which was nice.  The beach offered several nights of beautiful sunsets.  Since I was at the hotel for work, I was not able to actually enjoy the pool or beach during the day, but they nice.  The pool was small though.  There was an outside bar/restraurant by the pool, but never really saw it…

title: A good long weekend option
review: My wife and I took a short trip over Memorial day 2012. It was a very good two nights stay. Reading reviews prior to arrival partially it helped us to adjust our expectations as the somewhat small size of the pool, thin walls and $25 chair/umbrella offer on the beach were not a surprise and didn't disappoint us. Our room was looking over parking lot and away from the elevator which helped solve "thin wall" problem. We have not tried to use the pool but rather wend directly to the actual beach. You don't have to buy chair/umbrella but rather take free towel by the pool before heading to the beach. The ocean option is a lot better:) As for the hotel itself - it was clean and the service was great although we didn't spend much time during the day in the hotel itself.  Room: Our…

title: Great service
review: Enjoyable service, management and facilities! Family orientated.

title: We liked it.
review: My wife and I just got back from a Memorial Day weekend stay at the Sand Key.  We read the reviews on here about the hotel and many of them are accurate but some are a little off base.  Let's start with the positives.  First, location location location.  You can't beat it.  It's right off the beach and about a 30-45 minute drive from the Tampa airport.  For those who gripe about the 5 minute walk to the beach I have one question; are you serious?  I can only imagine that you are the ones who drive around the Walmart parking lot for an hour looking for the closest parking space when you could have been parked and in the store and home.  Honestly, it's a nice walk across the sand to the beach.  It's what you expect AT the beach!    We loved the fact that the hotel provided the…

title: Consistent, Excellent Property
review: Spent a long weekend over Memorial Day Holiday at this hotel which is one of our favorites.  Requested early check in, they were at capacity, and got in at noon when we arrived.  Preferred floors and the Club on the 9th floor were very nice...afternoon drinks and a  nice variety of hot and colds snacks, and continental breakfast in the morning work well.  The Island Grille for lunch serves a nice selection of excellent food at very reasonable prices, and is great for a quick in and out.  Beach is huge, clean, well maintained together with convenient chair umbrella rentals.  Had our anniversary dinner at Rusty's Restaurant in the hotel, and all was really great from excellent Cosmos to complimentary anniversary dessert.  We live in Florida, and come here for weekend get aways. …

title: Not bad, but didn't quite make it to "very good"
review: This hotel has a very good location and has plenty of free parking.  The views from ocean facing rooms are great.  The rooms have nice decks that you can sit out on and enjoy the view.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.    Now for the bad.  The rooms service food was crappy.  Our room had problems with those tiny little "sweet ants."  The pool is rather small and the beach is not as close as the photo on their website shows (please see the photo I took from the water's edge facing the hotel).  So, the  bottom line is that if you have to stay here, you won't be miserable but it's not the best place you will ever stay at.

title: Great family friendly resort
review: This was the second time we stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort. It's a perfect place for a weekend get away with the family. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and well maintained. The pool may be a little small but adequate. It's a little bit of a walk to the gulf but not unreasonable. This is a family resort so if you’re looking for a quite romantic stay this may not be the place for you. If you have young kids, you will love it. The sundry shop stocks has a great selection of items should you forget something. The resort is located a very short drive from the heart of Clearwater beach with lots of restaurants and activity. We had a great experience both times we have stayed.

title: Great Property on the Oceanfront
review: I stayed here with my girlfriend for only one night on a 5 day vacation to Florida. (we hotel hop alot and ventured other hotels). This is an excellent place to stay right by the beach. It has a pool that was pretty crowded when we got there. I honestly wouldnt say this is the best place for "couples", more like a married couple with 2 kids or so.  We went to the Turtle Bar right by the pool and had a few drinks the bartender was pretty cool and talkative. We then walked down to the beach as we waited for the hotel to get our room (being that we checked in around 11:30am, we got our room by 12:30 or so). When we went to our room, lets just say we got "walked in on" after a couple knocks, and i was pretty pissed but then laughed it off later, but i HATE when hotels just walk in…

title: not as good as i expected
review: we have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel.The pool is a lot smaller than it looks in the pictures on their website, the rooms are tired looking and need an update, one particular night was very noisy after we had gone to bed as there was a wedding party, the hotel has conference facilites and I felt that it lost its holiday feel because of this. The loction is brilliant and beach right out the back of the hotel, it was $25 a day for sunbeds with umbrella which i thought was a lot of money especially if you were there for a week,the hotel is in a great location for exploring the area.Had a continental breakfast, that was fine.

title: Pleasant stay on the beach
review: My husband and I just got back from a 3 night trip at this hotel.  It was a pleasant stay.  The hotel has the best location for relaxation!  The beach is beautiful and I love that it is quiet.  The pool was beautiful as well.  It is a bit small and I can see how during busy season how it could get crowded, but we did not have that problem.  My kids didn't come with us, but I did notice a nice playground and toys at the pool and beach to borrow.  All of the staff I countered was very friendly and pleasant.  I forgot my contact case and was pleasantly surprised the store at the resort carried it!  I found the rooms to be on the smaller side, but they were comfortable and I only spent the evenings in it so who cares.  There wasn't much space in the bathroom, but the towels were…

title: Great spot and such a nice staff!
review: We just got back from this spot and found the staff there to be the best bunch we have come across in some time. Special thank you to Cassie at the front desk who went out of her way to make our stay special for us! From the doormen at the front entrance when we arrived and the duration of our stay,everyone was wonderful! The staff at Rusty's was great too!And the breakfast buffet...you have to try it!! The beach out back is beautiful..we rented the lounge chairs and umbrella for the day and had lunch delivered to our chairs! Cant beat it! Would definately stay again.

title: Relaxing Stay at an Oceanside Oasis
review: My wife had noticed this property on a visit to the Sand Key public beach several years ago. We found an incredible deal on Southwest Vacations that included this hotel so we quickly jumped on it. We were not disappointed!  From the time we pulled up to the main entrance, the staff including the bell desk, registration, pool side staff and housekeeping shone brightly. Just one example of the hospitality is one of the pool attendants (Matthew I think) had one of the restaurants provide us with a cake as we were there on our anniversary. It was such a sweet gesture. Housekeeping went out of their way to service our room in between our daughter’s naps. The staff is a highlight of the hotel. We had no complaints about the room itself. The hallways are quite dated and drab but do not…

title: Great place to stay!
review: It's huge. The rooms are great.  We had a balcony overlooking the pool, which was clean and really ideal for sitting out. The beach was just off the pool deck, and directly in front of the hotel there were loungers and sunshades you could rent for the day for a reasonable cost.  The food was great, the stores had everything I needed--convenient store-type items, and souvenirs.  No complaints about anything, and I kinda miss being there.  I visited in the first week of December, and had ideal weather but the beach was reasonably empty.

title: Disappointed by uncomfortable bed
review: My husband and I had stayed at this Sheraton back in February and we really enjoyed our stay, so when planning this trip, we booked this Sheraton again.  This time, however, we ended up checking out early and switching hotels.  We arrived to check in early, around 10am, and we were pleasantly surprised to find that our room was ready.  We headed to the beach, which, as other reviewers have mentioned, is a bit of a hike, but wasn't too bad.  We enjoyed our time at the beach and then returned to our room to clean up.  The bathroom was rather small, but clean.  That night, we both slept horribly.  The bed was not comfortable at all.  It was bouncy and the sheets were rough and pilled.  I ended up getting up at 6am (had planned on enjoying being able to sleep in) and we decided to…

title: Great Location
review: The hotel is right on the beach, no streets to cross. The pool area is very clean and had all kinds of entertainment for the kids. We stayed Easter weekend, so the poolside games were 'Easter" themed. There were a couple of different resturants to choose from within the hotel, not badly priced. The staff was very friendly and very helpful and knowledgeable of the area. Whenever we asked for a dining or shopping or entertainment outside of the hotel we were not stared wrong. The beach was very clean and so was the water in front of the resort. It was a few blocks from the "BUSY" section of town, but just a short cab ride or drive (a few blocks or so). I booked this resort using my SPG rewards, and it definitly did not disappoint. Extrememly kids and family friendly, even had  2…

title: Pleasant Stay
review: My wife & I stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key in March 2012 for 3 days.  We decided to stay at this hotel during our quick getaway to experience spring training.  I was a bit concerned about some of the negative reviews prior to our trip. The service & location was perfect for our long weekend.  Brighthouse Field (Phillies spring training facility) was about 20 minutes away.  The majority of the travel time was getting around some of the traffic getting off the key.  The hotel is also a straight drive from Tampa Int'l Airport making it an easier & convenient ride.    Only con: Yes, the room door need to be heavier & closer to the floor to minimize hall noise.  This would be my only gripe, but we didn't notice it too often.   Overall: I definately recommmend.

title: Wonderful!
review: Our family of 4 stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in late April/early May.  Although most of the reviews I had read were very good, some were a little mixed, so I really wasn't sure what kind of experience we would have.  It couldn't have been better!  The rooms are not large and the bathroom area is small, but who cares!  Beds are comfy, balcony was great - ocean view from our 3rd floor room was spectacular.  We ate at the bar/restaurant on site twice and the food was very good and surprisingly, very affordable.  The bar by the pool was great, and just added to the wonderful atmosphere.  Pool wasn't too crowded, but with the ocean there, we preferred to spend most of our time at the beach.  When it was too late to go to the beach, the pool was almost empty so it was perfect.  I…

title: So much just right, so much not quite
review: Thank you for such a wonderful review on our property.  We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed our pool and beach, along with our Mainstay Tavern.  Your compliments will be passed along to our director of food and beverage services.  We look very forward to your return visit!

title: Beautiful location
review: The location of the hotel was very good. It is on a narrow part of the island and traffic isn't so heavy there.  The Jolley Trolley that goes around the beach area  stops at their door, and the area bus that goes to St. Pete beach stops on the street just outside their door.  It is so easy to get around without having to drive your car.  There are restaurants withing walking distance for variety.  Their is an extensive beach on the back of the hotel, albeit a long walk to get to the water.  The pool area was nice.  The  breakfast buffet was typical for many hotels, and not very appealing; but the a la carte menu was also available and had items we found very appealing.  The dish of berries was a large portion of mixed very fresh and tasty berries at a reasonable price. Poached…

title: Peace !
review: Beautiful hotel , very romantic , great rooms , the beach is awesome , very peaceful , I simple love it and enjoy it !

title: Beautiful setting for a wedding & Friendly staff
review: We are so pleased to hear that you had such a relaxing and enjoyable experience with us.  We agree the beach is very beautiful!  We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back to the Sheraton Sand Key Resort, and thank you for taking the time to write a review on our property.

title: Very nice stay
review: We got Married here in Oct 2010, I was very impressed from the start! We got it late after a huge delay and a 10 hour flight & 3 hour drive in rush hour.  From the moment we stepped into the hotel I knew ot was something special very clean & eco friendly. As we were getting married there we go a Gulf room view over looking the beach & pool. The room was the cleanest room I have ever seen and spacious. Added bonus of StarBucks coffee machine. They have two bins for plasics and paper for recycling.   We delighted when we discovered the special touches - we were given a bottle of champagne & strawberries on Ice. The only thing was missing there was no fridge you have to rent it on a daily basis.  The staff could not do enough for us and made our day very special. The food was great…

title: Great Beach vacation
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review on our property.  How wonderful that you were able to celebrate your wedding with us and we are so pleased to hear that your special day was a great success.  Thank you for your kind remarks regarding the cleanliness of your room…that will be passed along to our director of housekeeping.  We hope to welcome you back to the Sheraton Sand Key Resort in the future - perhaps for an anniversary getaway!

title: Sand key Resort
review: Nice private beach...away from all the busy commotion on Clearwater Beach.   Although it beachfront, you have to walk a little ways to the actually water.   Restaurants were great and very accomodating to our children.  Waiters and waitresses were outgoing and cheerful. Hotel room was clean and comfortable.  A little pricey though.

title: Very average place
review: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March as part of a convention. Some issues:  paper thin walls and doors, few rooms with a view to speak of and beach so far away that it feels like going out on an expedition. The only special thing was the restaurant (Rustys) which serves you very good value for the price (although it caters more to couples than families).

title: Great for families !
review: Pros:   - 4 on site restaurants excellent food - Great staff service  - Great/clean beach.  - Great location. Close to shops but not too close.   Cons:   - Pool is somewhat crowdey.

title: Great location/service and overall awesome vacation
review: What a great place! A friend and I traveled with 3 fifteen year olds for a girls vacation. The hotel grounds were well maintained, pretty and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The pool area and beach were wonderful. The walk down to the Gulf water's edge was a little long, as said in other reviews, but we enjoyed it. I can see where people with small kids wouldn't want to trudge everything back and forth, esp. when the sun and sand are very hot. The area around the hotel is mainly residential condos and a small strip mall area with a few good restaurants (Maggie Mae's and Pizza place) and a Dunkin Donuts, which we loved. I went on numerous runs and walks down Gulf Ave. and I felt safe and all residents were friendly. The trolley was the perfect mode of…

title: Great for families
review: Pros:  4 onside restaurants with decent food/price Great staff service Swim diapers at the pool if you forget yours Self parking so you don't have to wait on valet Great/clean beach. They keep it well groomed Rooms are as pictured Swim activities for kids Great location. Close to shops but not too close.   Cons: Pool is somewhat small. No adults only pool. So hot tub and pool have a bunch of kids.  You have to pay $25 per day for pair beach lounge chairs and umbrellas. Not sure if this was standard everywhere in Clearwater.  You can hear hallway noise  This was a couples trip for my husband and me. We have little kids so will bring them next time. I do not recommend for honeymooners or people with no patience for kids.

title: Nice Hotel
review: I stayed for one night during the spring break or it was a bit crowded. However, the hotel staff handled it very well - I go the key to my room at about 1pm. Room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The rest room was a bit tight but clean. The beach looks very nice in the picture but the water was not clean and had lots of seaweeds. The pool was nice and the hotel staffs had organized activities for kids at the pool. All in all, it was a good stay and I may come back in the future.

title: Wonderful surprise!!
review: It all boils down to the superior treatment we got from Katie at the front desk.  My wife and some friends stayed Friday night with a girlfriend celebrating her birthday at another nearby hotel(they weren't happy) I called and spoke to Katie and from that moment, she 'made' the girls' weekend!!  She was accomodating, courteous, friendly and went out of her way to make what looked like a bad weekend into a positively memorable weekend!  For her efforts, I would kindly ask that not only the manager but also the general manager know that Katie was a true asset to your hotel.    Whenever someone asks where to stay on the beach, we WILL recommend they go to the Sheraton Sand Key in Clearwater!!!  Thank you!

title: Quick getaway
review: Love the hotel and food is good.  The staff is wonderful and accommodating.  My only problem is not having wifi access unless you pay a fee.  The front desk said that all public areas had free wifi.  She's was wrong.  Only their Internet room has wifi access.   With today's iPads, macs and other travel technology, at the very least wifi should be available to their guests.

title: Pictures online are much better than the reality ...
review: There was nothing wrong with this hotel... But it just didnt have the wow factor the Sheraton website photos do. We had club lounge access and the club had a nice view with a good selection of drinks in the evening and breakfast in the morning. All the staff we met were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and spacious with coffee maker and small terrace. So nothing wrong but nothing outstanding either

title: Our 5th trip here, time to tell you how great it is.
review: For the past five years my husband and I have stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key.  It is without a doubt one of our favorite yearly trips.  The staff is very attentive, the rooms are clean and comfortable, the pool and beach are very, very nice.  We've enjoyed the pool-side bar, and the tavern with music, TV, and pool table.  All our meals there have also been very good.  There is shopping within easy walking distance, and the little shop in the hotel is also very nice, and I always find something pretty to bring home.  There are all kinds of beach activities for all ages to enjoy.  One thing that did happen while we were there this spring is that we were trying to Fed-Ex a package from the hotel, and after returning home, we found out that the package was never delivered.  When my…

title: Great Location
review: We had a club room on the 6th floor with a wonderful view of the pool and gulf. The room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was small. I did not like the fact that the sink was separate from the tub and toilet and open to the rest of the room. The rooms do not have good sound insulation. We did awake to a crying baby the first night but found that turning on the fan at night helped muffle sounds from other rooms. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The best thing about this hotel is the beach. It was peaceful and beautiful. There is a bit of a walk from the hotel to the beach but really not that bad at all. We will definitely be back!

title: Really nice hotel in great area
review: My husband and I with our 2 kids ages 9 and 13 stayed here April 12th thru April 16th.  Loved everything about the Sheraton Sand Key.
