Stayed in a pool view room which acutally had a partial gulf view.  The property is really clean and manicured. Even the parking lot was really clean.   Every morning really early the pool deck was washed and chairs arranged.  The set up was really nice.  Pool bar and pool cafe were really good with great service albeit a bit pricey - but that is with any hotel on the beach.  Our room was very clean.  The hotel was at capacity, but I never felt crowded.  We had dinner one night at the Tavern which was pub style food.  Very good and good service and also reasonably priced.  Breakfast at Rustys was good but a bit expensive.  Across the street and…

title: Great location, Good food, Great Service
review: I recently held a 3-day meeting at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort and all of the attendees had nothing but positive things to say about the hotel.  First off, the sales and banquet staff made it very easy for me to setup this meeting and were quick to respond with some last minute changes that I needed once I got onsite.  All of the staff that we interacted with throughout the week were excellent and always went out of their way to help us and make sure we had everything we needed.    The food at the hotel was quite good.  We ate at Rusty's for breakfast several times and enjoyed the buffet, which consisted of eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, oatmeal, and usually either pancakes or french toast.  They also had cereals, fruit, breads, and sweets.  The staff was very attentive to our…

title: Great place to stay
review: Rooms are small but clean and work for family of four.  The pool is great except it can be a bit crowded.  The beach is awesome.  Great location.

title: A nice hotel, very well maintained and spotlessly clean.
review: For a hotel that obviously sees a lot of family traffic, it is in excellent condition.   The rooms were spotlessly cleaned.  This shows an attention to detail on behalf of the management.  The rooms were nice and the decor was better than average for a hotel at this level.  This is definitely family friendly so be prepared for kids, but most of the activity was kept away from the beach which was very peaceful and enjoyable.  The sound factor was pretty shocking.  It sounded like the couple next door were in our room.  It wasn't just that we could hear them, but we could hear every word like they were standing next to us.

title: Nice but nothing Fantastic!
review: Stayed overnight again just to visit "Winter" at the Marine Aquarium with our grandchildren.  They loved the beach and the shopping nearby.  Room was clean and had nice furniture and a nice view of the ocean to our left of the balcony!  Bathroom small and a small sink area, but the bedroom area is adequate. Typical Sheraton that needs to update their mattresses to the "heavenly bed" as at the Westin's, which is part of their holdings now.  Visited here last year for one night and would probably stay again if in the area.  Staff was very helpful and ready to assist if needed.

title: Excellent Spring Vacation with Family
review: Stayed here April 3 - 6.  All I can say is this place is first rate all around.  The rooms are clean, nothing fancy, housekeeping was great getting anything we needed.  The guys at the pool had activities going for the kids during the day.  The walk to the beach is nice, across a grand expanse of beautiful white sand.  As others have mentioned, if you want chairs and umbrella down at the water you can rent them for the day at a reasonable price.  Great area for the kids to swim, it is shallow quite a ways out.  Do be careful of the stingrays!  Even though I was shuffling, I still managed to step on one, luckily he just swam away.  The buffet in the morning is quite sufficient with lots of fresh fruit.  All staff was kind and helpful, we got in late and the bellman actually…

title: Great location, good hotel
review: The hotel is in a great location, near the ocean and also within walking distance to restaurants / shops. The rooms are fairly small, but very clean. They have a somewhat awkward layout, with the closets right by the bed and a very small sink area. The walls are VERY thin and I could hear the man in the next room snore, sneeze, cough, etc.  I did like that there were some more affordable restaurants onsite and that the pool food was reasonably priced.   Overall, the hotel was nice, and convenient location.

title: Nice place but unique
review: We stayed here over the holidays and found it to be nice but a little different.  We typically stay at the Hilton on Clearwater Beach, but other family members were staying here so we decided to also.  The weather was terrible when we stayed, not the hotel's fault!  The lobby is nice and we enjoyed the hotel bar, cozy and fun but not loud.  The rooms were good but we were there when it was super windy and it was pretty bad to even walk from your room to the elevator, you have to wlak outside.  The work out room was nice and good space.  The pool area seemed nice but due to the weather we really didn't enjoy it.  Not on the beach so the kids didn't like it as much.

title: Nice for the kids but...
review: I experienced most of what everyone else mentioned on this site...some good and some bad.  The bad, we had to change rooms.  The desk clerk sold it as a "beautiful harbor view" it was more like 3rd floor view of the top of the conference center, back kitchen area and dumpster.  The noise was terrible, the view even worse. We were there over spring break, so it was packed, but they moved us to the same side but a higher floor. It helped, but there was still no option of sitting on the small patio, having a relaxing drink and enjoying the view.  The rooms left a little to be desired for the price, but overall, we personally didn't spend too much time in the room, so it worked.   The good...it's great for the kids, we have two 12-year-olds and they loved the pool and the beach. …

title: Again a great stay.
review: This was our third time staying at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  Again the service was wonderful, rooms clean, beach not crowded and free parking.  Friends of our stayed at the Hilton,  a very nice hotel too but the beach was very crowded not only with hotel guests and there is a parking fee per night.  We are looking forward to a fourth stay in the very near future!

title: Great "Spring Break" at Sheraton Sand Key
review: Just returned from girl trip. 4 Middle Age women.   We had a great time!  The ocean and beach are beautiful which is what we went for.  You never have to leave the beach. You do have to rent Umbrella/Chairs for $25 day (for 2 people), but that is no different than other hotels I have stayed at that charge a daily Resort Fee.   They have the Turtle Express that drives down the beach selling you  Mixed drinks, Beer, sandwhiches, salads, Candy, snacks etc..  (It is a very long walk to the restrooms by pool because the beach is very Wide) The only meal we ate in the hotel was breakfast which was good.  We went out every night for dinner. ("Frenchy's on the Beach" and "Guppy's" and "Johns Pass" were good) Loved the location-quiet and away from younger party crowd in Clearwater and…

title: Nice place but disappointed in their politics
review: The Sheraton Hotel has nice amenities but their selection of TV channels says a lot about their political persuasion. There were 2 Fox channels which takes the Republican point of view but no MSNBC channel which leans more to the Democratic side.  It would seem to me that this sort of a political slant has no place in a national hotel chain. Anothre thing I don't like about this hotel is thta if you want to go anywhere to see the attractions in the area, you have to fight horrendous traffic.

title: Convenient Location Away from the Ocean
review: We have stayed at this hotel 3 or 4 times over the years beginning around 1990. Our latest stay was in March during the Spring Break and Spring Training high season. As others have said, it is a little bit of a hike from the ocean back to the hotel. On this latest stay, which was an award stay in the SPG program, we were upgraded to a seventh floor room overlooking the pool. I would say that any room overlooking the pool is going to be noisy. The sliding doors should be double paned and that may be due to the property's age.  What would have been nicer would be on the opposite side of the hallway overlooking the tennis court and adjacent State Park. The next time we are offered an upgrade at this hotel, we'll try to remember to ask for that. We agree with what others have said…

title: Customer service at its finest!
review: My family and I just returned back home after a one week stay at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort. It was so hard to leave on our last day, not just because the resort was so lovely but because the employees made us feel so at home!  The warmth and hospitality of the Sheraton employees is to be commended.  I want to especially acknowledge the following people:  Roberta at Rusty's was the friendliest waitress!  She greeted us every morning with her warm smile and delightful personality.  Our three children commented every day about how "nice Roberta is".  They are still talking about the awesome hot chocolate she made for them!  Roberta also provided us with great suggestions on surrounding restaurants.  She was so nice to our family.  I feel like we made a friend that we would love…

title: Wonderful Time at Sand Key
review: After visiting Disney World, Sand Key was a wonderful place for some needed relaxation, and it didn't disappoint.  First, the rooms are not huge but VERY comfortable.  I do wish there had have been a mini fridge. The pool is small....AND it was spring break.  Most of the chairs were already taken at 7:00 AM, and we watched one lady reserve three poolside tables and at least 10 chairs.  In the afternoon, they had games for the kids which my boys (8 and 5) really enjoyed.  They also had a playground and lots of chairs on the lawn area.  The beach is a hike but was very nice and not crowded unlike Clearwater which was wall to wall with people.  I don't really suggest eating at the hotel; the food was not very good.  They have a mini-mart but it's WAY overpriced.  There is no…

title: Lovely Location!
review: Just spent 4 nights at the Sheraton.  A quieter end of Clearwater, which at this time of year, is a good thing. The hotel is a little dated, but it was clean and the facilities they offered were good.   Compared to the hotel we stayed in Orlando, the prices for meals & drinks were so much more reasonable. And I really liked the 24hour shop, which was stocked with everything you could think of!

title: Great beach resort
review: Huge beach front resort and pool area for a family vacation. Great area of Clearwater.

title: Perfect Vacation Spot!
review: Visited the Sheraton Sand Key Resort in March 2012.  Everything from the view to the service was top notch!  We had a perfect view from our room.  The beaches were pristine.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  My husband and I will certainly be back next year.......but for a longer stay!

title: Mediocre at best for an oceanview resort!
review: My family was very disappointed about our stay at the Sheraton Sand Key over Spring Break. We booked because my Husband as been coming to Clearwater for over 30 years and loves the gulf coast beaches over the East. We choose the Sand Key because we wanted to stay away from the busy clearwater beaches and were swayed by all the amazing reviews on tripadviser. When we arrived the check in experience was fine but were disappointed by the run down and small rooms sans a refirgerator. We were told there was a long wait list to rent one. The pictures online show a magnificent beachfront property only problem is it is at least 21/2 footballs fields walking distance to get to that beach. The pool for the size of the resort is ridiculously small and we had to put out a towel at 7:30 am…

title: no complaints lovely hotel lovely location
review: we stayed here for 4 nights after doing 11 days in orlando after visiting busch gardens we headed on down and checked in for some chilling, loved the location, beach was quiet and sand key park next door, just across the causeway to bustling clearwater beach, great shelling on the beach nice relaxed pool area and food we ate was tasty and reasonable, rooms were comfortable and balcony great for sitting out on in the evening, loved the gym and just soaked in the surrounding before returning home, refreshed but sad, only gripe i can make it the bed covers rustle unbelievably loudly we had to kick them off every night and what is about florida about door with enormous gaps under them, my towel has never been so busy keeping noise and light out from the hall, but we loved it anyway!

title: Super nice facility, amazing staff!
review: We booked this using SPG points as a quick getaway convenient to friends nearby and were pleasantly surprised. The best features: beautiful facility that is kept in tiptop condition; friendly staff who were so helpful and who clearly love their jobs (three of them told us unsolicited that they love working there); and the beach is pristine--snow white sand they groom constantly.    Unlike most hotel shops, this one has very good products and prices! On a whim, I bought an adorable beach coverup ($34) and beach bag ($24) and later saw the exact same ones for 1/3 more at a nearby boutique.  The food was very good and the prices seemed very reasonable to us, even at the poolside cafe.  They even have a cart that travels up and down the beach serving drinks and lunch.  They provide…

title: Away from the crowds...
review: This resort is away from the crowds of Clearwater beach and has its own stretch of sand. Cabanas and lounges rent for 25 per day or 15 for the afternoon and it's money we'll spent. If u want a spot near the small pool be sure to get a spot by 7AM. Leave a personal item on the lounge and no one will mess with it until at least 10:00. I will definitely return!

title: Best hotel in Clearwater
review: My family goes here a couple times a year and love it. Best location in Clearwater. Awesome access to beach and a lot of fun stuff in the area.

title: Breathtaking
review: Beautiful surroundings,top knotch staff, and nice rooms.

title: Wonderful holiday At Sheraton Sand Key Resort
review: We booked the Sheraton Sand Key Resort as part of a Delta Vacations package. The hotel is lovely- right on the beach. We upgraded to an ocean view room on the 8th floor and the view was beautiful. We tried Rusty's dining room for breakfast (ordered off the menu, even though there is an extensive breakfast buffet), the Island Grill for lunch and the 24 hour mini-mart for fresh muffins and coffee and all were very good. The hotel is very clean and the staff is very friendly. The pool and grounds are immaculate. The hotel is situated in a residential area surrounded by large condos and over a small causeway away from the crowds of Clearwater Beach. Another great feature is the Sand Key nature preserve right next door to the hotel. We walked the trails one morning and it was …

title: Nice beach front hotel
review: I really enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Sand Key hotel.  Check in was very easy and everyone made sure we knew our way around the resort.  All employees were very helpful, especially Dave at the pool.    The rooms were a little small (as are most) but ours had a great view over the pool and beach area.  The rooms were also very clean and I am extremely (check my mattress with a flashlight kind of picky) fussy about a clean room!  Noise was a bit of an issue but I read that ahead of time on Trip Advisor and brought a mini fan that solved the problem.  Noise comes in under the doors and from the pool.  The pool was great for the kids (they had games to play) and the beach was HUGE!  We could play volleyball or just run on the sand.  The beach was clean and there was plenty of…

title: Great place
review: I stayed in this hotel a few months back and the location is just perfect. The white sand beach is just beautiful. The room is pleasant, beds are very comfortable i love that you can control the AC unit temp.  The food in their restaurant is highly recommended. Pleasant staff. Will definitely come back .. Oh i have to mention they serve great strawberry daquiri in the pool bar :) just lovely

title: Pleasant Beach Resort
review: Unlike a number of resorts and motels in the area with "beach" in their names, this resort *is* on the beach, albeit a bit of a walk from the Gulf. This was one of the locations used for the Phillies Spring Training Packages, and is about a half hour drive (in normal traffic) from the ball bark. it's location on Sand Key, just over a bridge from Clearwater Beach makes it a bit quieter, and the parking is far easier. Our room had a nice balcony view of the bay, but was not that large. This was not a big problem as we did not spend much time in the room anyway, as there was plenty to do. Though the location appeared to be pretty full due to spring break, spring training, and convention business, it did not feel crowded. The pool area was quite nice (though the pool side cafe was…

title: Still a Great Family Value
review: This great old hotel has been around for decades, but has been wonderfully maintained.  The grounds are excellent and the place is exceptionally family-friendly.  My hometown, I first stayed here as a guest in the 70's.  The beach is still gorgeous, even if the landscape around the hotel has seen encroaching development.  One caveat: for some reason, my food experience was...disappointing.  Ordered a fried grouper sandwich in the bar (the single best thing to eat in Tampa Bay) and it was terrible--don't know who's you ruin a grouper sandwich, but they did.  Dinner the next night at an event was completely forgettable, as was I apparently the next morning at breakfast.  Waited forever for someone to take my order.  No one came & I walked out without eating.  It's a great…

title: Overall Pleasant stay
review: This is our third time visiting the Sheraton Sand Key. We come back because we know what we are going to get - a great location (on the beach away from all the Clearwater beach craziness during spring break), beautiful beach, reliable and friendly service and above average amenities.  No - this is not a posh resort. The rooms are small and could use some upgrading and if you get a loud neighbor the walls do not offer much in soundproofing.  But our stay is always pleasant and comfortable.

title: Wonderful
review: I spent my 70th birthday here. Absolutely lovely place. Superb Hotel, fabulous beaches, and easy wall into Clearwater. Staff were excellent and having the free use of ahotel computer was a nice touch. The only downside is their "Rusty's resteraunt  Sad and needs updating. We ate a Caesars (15 mind walk) Fab food and attentive staff. Also at The Shephards Hotel, just along from Caesars. Super cheap breakfast and a fab evening buffet (though noisy when busy). Hotel Highly recommended

title: Excellent Hotel
review: My wife and I just returned from celebrating our anniversary here at the Sheraton. I prefer reading reviews on TripAdvisor before going on any trips. I will tell you this hotel is excellent. The entire staff was extremely helpful and very courteous..The restaurants located in the hotel serve breakfast, lunch and dinners with a touch of class. It is located on the beach and is just minutes away from Clearwater Beach and all its activities.,The Jolly Trolley stops through out the day at the entrance so you can travel around without having to drive. If you reading reviews to make up your mind where to stay like I do, stop because this hotel offers everything you need for a wonderful time..

title: Stable management translates to great attitudes and service
review: During my recent stay, the property was fully booked.  It was spring break, but the vast majority of guests were at small conventions being held at the resort or part of teams playng the women's lacrosse tournament.  The place was noisy from about 6am until 2am.  All the comments from previous posts are generally true, so won't repeat those points. The overriding element that created a pleasant stay was the competent, positive and genuinely hospitable treatment by all staff.  Many of these people have been at their jobs for well over 10 years.  Management is always visibly in attendance, so things run smoothly and one feels welcome at the hotel.  This is in contrast to the impersonal "cookie cutter" approach one often finds and hotels catering to business convention at tourist…

title: Good Hotel, Great Location
review: Overall this hotel is a good place to stay when visiting the Clearwater Beach Area.  As other travelers have mentioned, the hotel is not a resort or have 4 star ameneties (the pool is very small).  However, the location is just great, right on the beach in the nice sand key area and a quick 5 minute drive to clearwater beach with attractions.  In addition, the staff were great and always willing to make sure the stay was pleasant.  If you are looking for big rooms with big pools then do not stay here.  If you are looking for a nice clean room with a fun beach atmosphere right on the beach with attentive staff- this is the place for you.

title: Pleasant Location, Helpful Staff, Some Suggestions
review: This Sheraton is on a great beach, and has rooms with lovely views. Staff were helpful and friendly. We had a "suite", which we assumed meant a private bedroom and a common shared space, but which turned out to just be a much larger room. Ask before you book if you are a party that requires some separate space, or just book two rooms. Very busy hotel, but seemed to handle it well, although the bar was pretty frenetic at times. Typical of Sheratons, they have yet to discover that wireless should be free in rooms - when the Super8 we stayed in on the way to Florida can offer free internet in rooms, the ongoing decision of the Sheraton chain to charge for access seems neanderthal. It has led me to book elsewhere when I have a choice. The fitness room was adequate, but not up to…

title: Best Starwood property for Customer Svc
review: In addition to being Starwood members, we winter in central Fla. We take a short 'vacation' mid way thru our stay.  We have stayed at Sand Key  several times and it tops our favorite hotel list.  Last year we stayed in Key West at the Westin Marina.  The best about that was the location.  The service at the Sand Key Sheraton blow's away any thing in any hotel we have stayed at including any Starwood property from California to Arizona to NYC to Fla.  The pool is clean and the sunsets are awesome. The fitness center has the best vistas and the bartender's are the best. We will make this our mid winter 'vacation' spot each year.

title: FANTASTIC HOTEL-GREAT LOCATION
review: My husband & I and some friends just returned from Spring training for the Philadelphia Phillies in Clearwater. We stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key resort which is about 30 minutes shuttle to Bright House Field.   The hotel sits on the beach which is a very long walk to the waters edge. you can rent 2 chairs and either an umbrella or canbana for $25.00. Of course they don't tell you that 1/2 day after 1pm it is only $15.00 and if you just want 1 chair it is $8.00 for the day.   Our room faced the Gulf which was pciture perfect. The room was a nice size but found the bathroom a bit small.  We did not rent a car since I knew the traffic to Clearwater is horrible and coming back into Sand Key is just as bad. I knew this and was not concerned I just wanted to be in a nice beach…

title: Nice location, friendly service
review: Everyone from the front desk to the cleaning staff were friendly and helpful, even though it was spring break and the hotel was packed with people. Great beach location that wasn't crowded and much quieter than Clearwater beach further north. The room was a decent size and our view of the beach to the west and north was very nice. Even though we were using SPG points to stay here and the hotel must have been sold out, they still managed to get us a room with a good view.

title: "Nice hotel, lack of control"
review: Thank you for your kind remarks regarding our associates and resort.  We are so pleased that you enjoyed your room accommodations and view.  We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back to the Sheraton Sand Key Resort in the future, and thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts!

title: This is an Average Hotel
review: My wife and I arrived 2 hours early to check in, so we sat in the snackbar next to the pool. As we were checking in a heavy storm was advancing. As I was walking to the car in the hotels parking lot, I noticed many, many people getting into their cars and leave. At first I thought nothing of this; but the next day in the early evening I realized what was going on when I saw people going back to their cars changing in the parking lot and driving off. The Sheraton monitors NO cars coming in and out of its property. What I witnessed was 2 things: (1) Non paying indiviguals were using the pool for free throughout the day, (2) There is a public beach next door and that parking lot has parking meters with very little cars because the Sheraton is being used to the public. Good luck…

title: Old hotel
review: Our stay was less than satisfactory.  The rooms are small, worn and poorly maintained.  The outlets are so worn that the prongs on all of our chargers had to be bent to make good contact.  Water cycled hot/cold continuously.  Far too much noise coming from the hallway due to the 1.5 inch gap under the door.  The rooms were moderately clean-acceptable.  The pool area chase lounges are worn and the pool itself seems tired.  The balcony view is good, the balcony itself is tiny.  The walk to the beach by the third day was tiresome-too far.  Hotel location is fine.  Staff were very good-friendly and professional.

title: Nice location, average hotel
review: Thank you for your review on our property.  We are deeply disappointed to hear that you did not enjoy your stay with us more.  While our hotel is not brand new we are constantly undergoing renovations to keep it up to date.  We apologize that you did not feel that way.  Thank you for your kind remarks regarding our associates and for taking the time to pass along your feedback.

title: Hidden gem!
review: Nice beach and pool areas.  Rooms were clean and comfortable, but rather worn. TV was fine.  Do not get a connecting room, you can hear everything in the other room, even with a towel stuffed under the door.  Hotel was quite full during our five night stay and with several different neighbors I wish I had asked for a non connecting room early on. We suffered through.  Despite gold status could not get a late checkout for our 7 pm flight.  Otherwise nice stay.

title: Private island gem!
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review on the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  We are disappointed to hear you weren’t overly impressed during your stay with us.  Thank you for the kind remarks regarding the clean rooms, and the beautiful pool and beach area.  We greatly appreciate all of your repeat business with us, and the fact that you are a gold member of the Starwood Preferred Guest program.  Unfortunately when the resort is sold out it can be impossible for us to grant a late checkout.  We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back to our property once again.

title: Average
review: Just spent 6 days here. The location is perfect. The rooms were very nice and clean.The pool area is great and wonderfully kept. The staff is SOOOO  nice and happy. Everyone at the hotel was so accommodating all around. Plenty to do for kids and adults. The beach is beautiful. The choices for eating was very good. We ate at the hotel most of the time. The breakfasts and dinners were very tasty. Would definitely come back to the Sheraton.

title: Wonderful
review: Stayed here last October and loved it after reading some reviews I was a bit worried but no need it was perfect my only negative was rooms a bit on small side but fine for two we were sharing with our young teenagers I never write reviews bit after reading reviews for my next vacation at Dominican republic I am thinking people only ever complain on trip adviser and to be honest it has and can ruin looking forward to your vacation - well if I was booked to go here again I would be VERY excited, it's lovely. I will go back again . The lady in the hotel shop is lovely as are all the staff. What can I say apart from lucky you  and just in case your thinking what do I compare this with well I always choose 4 /5/6 star hotels and expect high standards.

title: Sheraton Sand Key Rocks
review: John Agliano and his staff are amazing. Everyone is very friendly and helpful. The property is well maintained and is more like a resort than a hotel. Things to do for the kids and different options for dining and drinks-you can get both inside and outside at the pool. We have stayed at this resort four times and each experience has been great. Fantastic restaurants nearby include the Columbian, Keegans and Guppys. We cant wait to return. John Prewasnicak, Rochester NY.

title: Excellent srvc by friendly staff
review: Every member of staff was friendly and helpful. From the maint man who fixed our safe to the front desk to the maids to all who worked in the restaurant, Rusty's, was pleasant, helpful, courteous, ... Beginning to sound like a pack of cub scouts.. But they all were that.... And more. A very pleasant stay at an excellent location. Enjoyed walking the beach every morning with plenty to do in the area in the afternoon.  We will be back!

title: Spectacular
review: Service, food, room, lounge, bar, pool and terrace were all excellent. The best part of the stay was the service from the staff. They went the extra mile ever time. I am going back to Florida later this year and will if nothing else happily return for a meal and a drink in the bar.

title: Slightly disappointed couple....but probably good for families
review: We booked here for a long winter weekend on the beach after finding ourselves in St. Pete’s on business.  We chose this hotel because it has no resort fee, has free self-parking, and is away from the main strip of Clearwater with direct access to the beach. We just wanted a simple beach weekend without all the Florida vacation bells and whistles. Just the two of us, we were slightly disappointed.  We reserved a room on the southwest side with a “great view” of the ocean and “private” balcony. Initially, they showed as a room tucked back in the corner on the 4th floor overlooking the rather noisy pool. It was dark and there was a window from a meeting room that looked out directly onto our “private” balcony. We asked for a different room and were “upgraded”? to the eighth floor…

title: Nice, pleasant
review: There are a few things I look at in hotels: bed comfort and water pressure are two important ones.  The Sheraton Sand Key gets high marks for both.  I love strong water pressure, and this is the first hotel shower where I had to fight to stay standing.  And that's a good thing.  The grounds are lovely and there's a nice vast beach behind the hotel with sand that's fine as flour.  The rooms are pleasant and there was a little balcony too (emphasis on "little")  The rooms are a bit smaller than I expected, but pleasant nonetheless....... just not very memorable.  The small convenience store in the hotel lobby is open 24 hours and we used it often.  We loved the hot tub at the edge of the property, with a great view of the sunset.  A few random comments:  there are large gaps under…

title: Great pool area for kids
review: Thank you for your review on the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us.  How wonderful that you were able to enjoy the beautiful views from the hot tub.  Our fitness center area does close at 9 pm because there are guest rooms below and we don’t want there to be any noise disturbance.  We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back to our property in the future.

title: I love love love this place!!
review: Stayed here with friends and family and had a great time. The pool area is the winner for the hotel. Excellently maintained by the staff with a cafe and bar serving all your needs and well priced too.  My daughter met lots of friends and played with all the toys provided by the hotel, what mor can you ask for as a parent.  Overall a great hotel, but be aware this is a conference hotel. There was a function on and the pool area got taken over on the saturday. To eat I would recommend the Columbia for evening meal and Maggie maes for breakfast both of which are across the road.

title: Very nice with oustanding beach
review: We are so pleased to hear that you had such an enjoyable time at our pool!  Our associates at the pool sincerely enjoy having activities and games for the kids to enjoy!  Thank you for your review on our property, and we hope to welcome you back to the Sheraton Sand Key Resort in the future.

title: Wait staff remembered us after two years
review: I know the word resort is in their name, and that is a bit deceiving to people who are used to a "typical resort" with lots of pools, clubs, etc. This really is not that sort of place. If you are looking for a beautiful hotel on a gorgeous beach with unbelievable service, this IS the place. The restaurants have great food, the beds are amazing....I have been staying at this hotel since 2001 and the employees I met back then- from the bellman, front desk staff, to the bartenders STILL remember my name.  Yes, the walk from the property to the gulf is a bit of a walk (and who doesn't need it these days!!). The property is right on the beach, but to get to the water itself will require that you put on your sand shoes and walk to it! What's great is, Sand Key is extremely close to…

title: Very nice place and friendly personnel
review: This a top resort destination on the barrier islands of Clearwater Beach. It's right next to the Sand Key State park and in a prime location. The rooms were clean and cleaned daily. All the room ammenities were replaced without asking. Free coffees and teas in the room with complimentary bottles of water.  At the bar they served me a delicious half pound Kobe beef burger with more fries that I could eat in a sitting. The main restaurant has a nice breakfast buffet in the AM and turns into a top notch resaurant in the evening. I recommend it.

title: The Staff Make the Difference
review: First...yes, this property is more hotel than resort, and yes, this property is in need of a make-over...but....the staff will make you feel like you made the right choice.  Without exception we ran into nothing but the most accomodating people who work here.  If we called for something to be fixed in the room, someone was knocking on our door within minutes...usually someone like my dad who came in, asked how you are doing, where are you from...there you go, all fixed!  Have a nice day.  Service can mean more than location and facitilities most times.  BTW, prices in the restaurants...quite good. One more tip...book a meal at the nearby ISLAND WAY GRILL for one of the best dinners you will ever have.

title: The Real Deal says - An OK Hotel Definately NOT a Resort!
review: I had a bad experience all around at this hotel - not a resort as they named it - but want to be specific so you can choose.  I went there to relax on the beach at a resort.  Here are a few things I consider that make a hotel a resort; Several Big Pools for different styles - not here, a waterfall - nope, a slide - nope, lush vegetation - nope, a grotto - not here, a beautiful location on the sand - nope, quiet luxury - nope, an upgrade floor - not here, big room, uh uh, sun filled room, nope again, balconies to enjoy the sun on – not here. I could go on and on describing expectations and they are not in this Resort.  What do you get?  A single medium size pool where because of positioning and other surrounding buildings gets little sun shine and with loungers that fill up fast…

title: Beauty on the Gulf
review: Beautiful location on the gulf in a beautiful setting.  Hotel staff was very accommodating; rooms were nice, beds very comfortable and every thing was clean.  The adult beverages at the cabana by the pool were a little pricey but considering the ambiance it was worth it.  Food was good, enjoyed the breakfasts in the main restaurant.  Brought the family on a business trip, no regrets.

title: Nice but could use a few improvements.
review: We stayed at the Sheraton a few years ago and returned this year to attend a conference.  The positive aspects include excellent service, free parking, no resort fees, a very nice pool area, easy access to the beach, a park next door for additional walking opportunities and a very good beakfast buffet.  The hall and room carpets need to be replaced, the bathrooms are small and the bed mattresses are hard.

title: Paradise
review: The hotel is situated right on the beach, with the pool looking right out over the white sands. The setting could not be any more ideal.  The restaurants and bar of the hotel are very good, there are also many restaurants in the local area.  The rooms are very clean and of adequate size, with amenities of a high standard.  Such a relaxing place.

title: Exceptional Service Ethic and Staff
review: I've stayed at a lot of the world's top hotels and resorts and usually in the US, the Sheraton brand is somewhat average. However, this hotel blew me away with their service ethic from the moment I arrived and Bob the Bellman helped me with my luggage and gave me a tour. Every encounter with every staff member throughout the resort (front desk, restaurants, retail, 9th floor lounge, pool and beach) was top notch as if I was at a Four Seasons.   I will return here just because it was such a great experience, even though my friend's house is nearby and physically a bit nicer than the hotel!

title: Excellent hotel!
review: We just came back from the Sheraton Sand Key resort and it was wonderful!  The service is impeccable!  We especially enjoyed our breakfast each day with Roberta.  She is fabulous!  in fact ... Roberta.. a  message for you... .. Go Giants!!!!! lol  good luck to your Pats...  I stayed at this hotel last year for a conference and liked it so much that I decided to bring my husband back here this year for a nice getaway out of the Upstate NY cold.. We were not disappointed at all.  The view from our room was terrific!  we will try to visit again soon!  the Beach is beautiful!

title: Nice hotel
review: I attended a conference at the hotel and stayed for a few nights. The rooms were spacious and clean.  The conference provided breakfast and lunch via the hotel's catering and the food was good every time.  The pool and beach area looked very nice and the beach is quite large. Due to some return flight issues, we had to change our departure plans a couple of times and the hotel was very accommodating.  If you are in the area, give this hotel a try.

title: Absolutely fabulous!
review: My fiancé and I stayed here in October 2010. My fiancé is confined to a wheelchair and we have to say that from the moment we arrived at the hotel the staff literally could not have helped us any more than they did. They were absolutely fantastic! We arrived quite late at night to check in so the following morning we took a walk around the hotel by the pool and towards the beach and without me even having to ask about a beach wheelchair, a young guy who was working at the towel hut came over to us and told me that there was a beach wheelchair available for us to use whenever we wanted! He even took it right up to our room door on the fifth floor for us! I also have to give Debbie (from the mainstay restaurant) 5* for her customer service! We really couldn't applaud the Sheraton…

title: Super special staff. Hotel ticked all our boxes.
review: Stayed 5 nights via Virgin Holidays -  Sheraton did not disappoint. All staff exceptionally warm and helpful but Mark and Scott (concierges) were outstanding. Great internet section - installed successfully in part of the Mainstay Bar and Restaurant. The atmosphere in Mainstay was really happy with live musicans/singers most nights. Maggie Mae - a few mins pleasant walk from the hotel was THE best place for breakfast ( and other meals)   - overlooking the water - good prices.We were sad to leave!! Only downside was the huge hotel or condo tower next door which overwhelmed the attractive Sheraton building and blotted out the sun greatly on the swimming pool.

title: Pleasant stay in a beautiful area
review: Just returned from a five night stay at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort (business and pleasure). While the hotel is not new, it has a nice layout and has been well kept. The public spaces are pleasant and the rooms are average-sized with comfortable beds. (As others have noted, the bathroom is pretty small with a small vanity/sink outside, but that didn't bother me as I'd rather have the space in the room.) We had a very nice view of the pool/beach from our 5th floor room and balcony (loved having a balcony with chairs/table). The hot tub was very nice...and staff kept it well maintained. My sons enjoyed the tennis courts also. Friendly staff in all areas.  It's a beautiful area to walk the beach...and we also enjoyed some neighboring restaurants...recommend Maggie Mae's for…

title: Great hotel
review: This hotel is great but the pool is way too small for the amount of people! The rooms are a good size and very clean. The hotel is right on the beach so if the over crowded pool isn't for you then it's just a short walk to the white sand and very warm sea!  We stayed here as guests for a wedding on the beach. If you are thinking of getting married here then my advice would be to stop thinking about it and to book it!  Great hotel, great food, excellent location! :)

title: Good hotel but slight room for improvement
review: I have attended the annual Arbors Jazz Party for the last three years and can stay that I have always enjoyed my stays at the hotel. The staff are some of the best I have come across anywhere. Always friendly and very helpful. A number of hours were spent in the Mainstay Lounge where the service was excellent and certainly the food can be recommended although as a Brit I found the beer rather too cold - ice on the rim of the glass! Why cannot Americans realise that below a reasonable temperature beer loses it's real taste! Breakfast buffet was was good and filling. My only gripe is about the rooms which lack facilities. WiFi only available at an additional charge and no in room fridge except at $5 per day extra. Bathrooms are also rather small with washbasin outside. Walls did…

title: It was just OK
review: I expected more from the hotel's website reviews. My room was simply a small,plebian, boring room with two quite uncomfortable beds. Being a Platinum Starwoods member, I guess I am spoiled and used to better accommodations. There was very little to speak of in the Club Lounge, especially at breakfast. Unless you want wheat-filled carbohydrates, you are left with only less-than-ripe fruit. Peggy, the hostess in the club room is the only shining light about that experience. She was awesome. Fitness room is very nice. Pool is of good size since not a lot of people were in it at night. It could have been kept warmer tho as it was quite chilly. The whirlpool is very large and nice. Of course the beach is pretty.. it is Clearwater, after all! But be prepared to walk a bit to get to…

title: PARADISE ON THE SHORES OF FLORIDA
review: I recently spent five nights at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.....the entire experience was wonderful. The food was great- the service was impeccable, and the beaches were pristine, and the water clear. The pool was wonderful and the hot tub was fantastic. I very much appreciate the meticulous attention to each and every detail that the waiters and waitresses bestowed on us. Even the weather cooperated with clear sunny skies. And the " Jolly Trolly  " was an added extra as it stopped right in front of the hotel to take us to do some shopping downtown. Special thanks to the personnel at Rusty's and of course to all those who assisted with responding to our questions ! A wonderful time was had by all !

title: Just beautiful
review: Thank you so much for all of your positive remarks, and for taking the time to write a review on our property!  We are truly pleased to hear that you enjoyed everything at our resort from the award winning cuisine to the treatment received from all associates.  We hope to have the opportunity to serve you once again in the future.

title: Fun in the sun!
review: We went last May to get married here, had the most beautiful room, fabulous view, great service. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. The wedding co-ordinator was really easy going and nothing was too much trouble for her, everything ran really smoothly, had our photo's back the next morning, cake and flowers all delivered to the hotel etc

title: Amazing experience
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review on our property.  We are so pleased that you chose to celebrate such an important and special event here at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  Thank you for the kind remarks regarding the associates going above and beyond.  If your travels bring you back to the Clearwater area we hope that you will return to our resort!

title: We love this place!
review: I have been at this Sheraton about 7 times in the past 25 years but twice since I have been married with kids. I always enjoy going here. I think one thing that makes us come back is the service. This is the most kid friendly place I have ever been at. We checked in the 28th and stayed until the 2nd. Right off the bat Dan the bellman was great. Finete the housemaid had a sixth sense. Whenever we stepped out in the morning for a bit she would make the room spotless. Nate the bartender is always a pleasure meeting up with him.  One interesting note, the Michigan St. band and cheerleaders stayed whle we were there which was fun. 400 kids and I did not see one of them smoking or drinking! Amazing!  One tiny incident. On New Years eve around 2am. The room next to us had a little…

title: Beautiful Resort
review: We stayed here for one night after a busy vacation at Disney.  This is a beautiful resort.  We were upgraded to a corner unit facing the beach and pool.  The view from our room was lovely.  It was a very relaxing and enjoyable stay.  Staff was very friendly.  December is a slow tourist season.  The town was dead at 7:00pm.  Wish to return again and spend more time in the summer.

title: Mainstay Tavern Nice Cozy place for Drinks and Food
review: Thank you for your kind words regarding your stay with us!  Parts of December are slower in the area, which can provide for some nice relaxation time…especially after a busy week at Disney!  We are excited to welcome you back to our property in the summer months!

title: Great Christmas vacation!
review: This review is about the Mainstay in the Sheraton Sand Key Resort not the Resort itself.  We stopped in the Mainstay Tavern for some drinks and a bite to eat.  The service was good, prompt and friendly.  The chicken tenders, fries and Caesar salad were good.  There are televisions in the tavern that were playing the NBA games.  The atmosphere is cozy; the place was very busy but didn’t have to wait for a refill or our food for very long.   This is a great place to enjoy some food, drinks and watch sports on TV and enjoy the company your with.

title: Relaxing and lovely
review: Thank you for writing a review on our Mainstay Tavern.  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed the environment.  At the Mainstay Tavern we try to provide guests with the feel of an upscale sports bar, and are thrilled that you found the atmosphere to be comfortable and the food enjoyable.

title: Good, not great.  No complaints but no real compliments either
review: I traveled during Chrismtas week.  Sheraton Sand Key is not located in the central part of Clearwater, where it is more crowded and busy, with more restaurants and stores.  It is actually located further south, on Sand Key, across the bridge.  It is within walking distance, probably a 15 minute walk to the busy area.  I didn't mind the quieter location, don't like crowds.  We experienced friendly, helpful service at the hotel from the front desk to concierge, to David who works at the pool, and also house cleaning, etc.  On Christmas day, we ate their Christmas buffet, which was pretty good.  A few things that stick out about this hotel - no resort or parking fee (rare these days at 4 star hotels), nice business center with huge computer screens (more computers than many other…

title: Pure Bliss
review: A little late on writing my review, but we had a great time here this past May.  The resort is top notch, clean, and is just a beautiful place inside and out.  Especially out.  In a few minutes a trolley can have you up to Peir 60 at Clearwater Beach.  This beach is just about as beautiful as you can get from North America. If you want nicer you will have to go to an island in the caribbean. But, the hotel lacks nothing.  There is always something going on, and a very nice breakfast served each morning almost reminds you of a cruise ship.  We will definitely be going back.

title: Great stay great service
review: Thank you for your positive remarks on the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed our breakfast buffet, and our beautiful beach area.  We look very forward to welcoming you back to our property in the future!

title: I have just checked out and I will come back
review: We stayed here at a conference so got a great rate. The service here is unbelievable. The staff is excellent. We needed special food for my picky son not a problem. The staff remembered our names. The food was great and well prepared. The hotel had good service even under full capacity. At the conference rate we got free wifi. The hotel is clean and modern design. The pool and jacuzzi are great. The beach is wonderful but we did not get out there to the sand.the beach is wide and long. The beds are extremely comfortable and well equipped. The tv has input ports hdmi and RCA type so we could hook up our equipment. And the ports are accessible easily. It's a nice large flat screen tv. There was Starbucks coffee or razor tea free I. The room too. Well equipped with nice iron and…

title: Would not stay here again
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review on our property.  We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time with us.  We are happy to hear that everyone enjoyed the cuisine, even your son!  Hopefully you will have the chance to return to our property and possibly explore the beach!

title: If you have to stay at Sheraton this should be the one...
review: This was my second time in this hotel. I live the location , hotel and the stuff. They are very professional and helpful. The room , bed and view were great. Very nice gym with the wOnderfull view. The hotel is on the beach but you walk pretty long to reach the ocean on the sand. There is a park next to hotel for a nice walk from the beach. Restaurant at first floor. No grocery store in a walking distance. Hotel was Very silent at night. Comfortable bed, nice Tv. You can ask for a fridge in your room. if you are looking for party it is at the other side Of the bridge (not far).

title: good, not great
review: overall this is an OK mid level resort, it's an odd amalgam of updated furniture, cheap tile, and such. the pool is small for a family resort. in the middle of the afternoon there were workers sanding down some gazebo, only feet away from guests on lounge chairs, noise and wood shavings freely floating around guests. The sound is an issue in the rooms, as one can hear the neighbors pretty well. The staff was mostly friendly. The wifi is charged per room/per device...I never heard of this before and had to complain to someone for 10 minutes so that I can use my iPad in addition to my laptop for the same charge and not pay double...ridiculous.

title: Nice location-but there are issues
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review on the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  We take great pride in our hotel and are disappointed to hear that your stay with us did not meet your expectations.  We apologize that the work we were doing was intrusive, and also that we did not handle your complaint more efficiently. We take our guest comments to heart and have shared your experiences with our staff.   We do hope that your visit to Clearwater was enjoyable and that you will visit us again in the future.

title: Very Pleased
review: Nice location but the rooms are not sound proof--You can hear the neighbors--the bellman are pushy and grab your bags and are pushy for tips.----had to call for a newspaper- NO frig/mirco -would have been nice--room faced the tennis court and the bright lights stayed on late at night.    If this was not a work conferance would never stay here.  Parking was limited.  Breakfast Dinning room service was the worst. Sat for hour w/o coffee when the coffee finally arrived it was not greatest-The ladies I was w/had the buffet-then when I was ready to leave giving a check for over $3 for one little coffee no refill.    I was told there was busniess center but always full--not big enough for the size of the hotel.... would not recomand.

title: P*** poor
review: We are sincerely sorry to hear that your stay with us did not meet your expectations.  We apologize that you were not pleased with your experience in Rusty’s or with the bell service.  We take guest service complaints very seriously, so know that these issues will be promptly addressed with our management team so that they do not reoccur.  We appreciate you taking the time to pass along your experience so that we may make improvements.

title: Great location
review: I stayed at this hotel with family and friends on the second week of our two week trip to Florida.  I was very pleased with the hotel.  The hotel is on the beach, the walk to the sea shore takes approximately 5 minutes.  The pool area was clean and tidy and there was always at least one member of staff on duty handing out fresh towels.  The hot tub was a delight and the pool was very warm.  Ate in the hotel restaurant once and found the food and service to be good.  The rooms were spacious and there was a bathrobe and plenty of toiletries and coffee/milk.  A lovely arrangement of fresh fruit was delivered to our room within hours of checking in.  The Sheraton is approximately 15 minute walk into the main Clearwater Beach area, accessed over a high bridge, but there is a trolley…

title: Above & Beyond!
review: I've stayed at this property three times this year for both business & pleasure. Not only because I love the location, but also because their staff really does go above & beyond to make you feel welcome & does whatever necessary to keep guests happy! My most recent stay was for business and I mistakenly booked my reservation for the following week. I was told that there were only a handful of few rooms left for my two night stay, which would certainly be the worst rooms available (two queens, parking lot/rooftop view, handicap accessible)! Seeing that I goofed on my own reservation I was ready to take whatever was left; However, the front desk supervisor who assisted me worked for about 20 min to shuffle some other reservations around and get me a upper floor, corner room with a…

title: fabulous location
review: Thank you for your kind words regarding your stay with us.  We are so pleased that we were able to help sort out the reservation issue for you and make everything right!  Our guest satisfaction is truly our number one priority, therefore we are thrilled to hear you have always been satisfied during your stays with us. We appreciate your loyalty to our hotel as well as all Starwood hotels and look forward to your next stay with us!

title: Good hotel for families and couples alike
review: stayed here for one week in october .  rooms were big and comfortable and plenty of facilities.  the beach is beautiful and the hotel is right next door to a nature reserve wich is well worth having a walk around . there is a small selection of shops and bars a short walk away , maggie mays is brilliant for breakfast and lunch we sat outside and watched the dolphins in the bay.  just up from there is the backwater bar and resteraunt good food and a good atmosphere.  if you dont have transport, downtown clearwater is a short walk over the bridge well worth going over it for the view.  you can catch a trolley bus right outside the hotel wich will take you all the way to st petes you can jump on and off wherever you like , just take a jumper with you on the bus  the aircon is…

title: Location, location, location
review: We are pleased to hear that all of your expectations were met during your stay with us.  The nature preserve next to us is part of the Sand Key Park.  We are we are very fortunate to have just a minute walk away so that our guests can explore the serene and natural area.  We agree the Jolley Trolley is a convenient service that allows you to easily roam the different beaches in the area – glad to hear you enjoyed exploring!  We sincerely hope your future travels bring you back to our area and back to the Sheraton Sand Key Resort!

title: Conference and Beach fun
review: We stayed at the hotel for 7 days and cant complain.  The rooms were very nice and the hotel staff always very happy to help.  For useful info ref getting around and where to eat etc the staff at the towel hut near the pool are a fantastic source of info and happy to share that with you.  If walking on the beach, beware of type of painful sticky bud type object.  Stuck in the bottom of crocks, flip flops etc and only knew when walked them into the room and then stood on them barefoot!! painful.  That is nothing to do with the hotel mind, just a word of warning.  Ideal spot to explore from.  Would definately return.  Ate at Rustys twice and food was really good. Seafood extravaganza a must!!!!!  Overall, no complaints.  Lots of conferences seem to take place there but they dont…

title: Nice place small poll
review: We just returned from the Sheraton Sand Key resort and it was nice, the food was very good at Rusty's Bistro (despite the name) and the hotel was clean, the staff was great and very accommodating. The Mainstay staff was really confused when it came to a large crowed in the bar and the bartender (or waitress) gave everyone incorrect tabs but it was all figured out before we left. For the price we paid for the room I thought the beach was a long walk from the property and the pool was really small. I would return but I may try the Marriott across the street next time. One more thing.... the beds were WONDERFUL! I would give the sleep quality a 5 rating excellent rating but the walls are so thin we could hear people coming and going all night.

title: Nice rooms, good service, large family hotel
review: Thank you for writing a review on our property.  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed the cuisine at Rusty’s; your compliments will be passed along to our award winning culinary team.  We are also happy to hear you found our Sheraton sweet sleeper beds so comfortable!  Our apologies for the mix up in the Mainstay, hopefully it was sorted out in a timely fashion.  Thanks again for your review.

title: Fab friendly hotel in great location. Can't wait to go back!
review: The sheraton was nice, rooms were decorated decent. I would not say anything bad about this hotel, it is just not my style. It is a large family oriented hotel. There were lots of kids packed in the pool all day making it loud and crowded. The staff were generally very good. The rooms were updated, clean. My opinion is that the hotel just lacks any character but its a nice place to stay if that is what you are interested in. The beach area at the hotel is good but chairs are not provided by the hotel you will have to pay a seperate provide $25 for the day.

title: Great facility
review: We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay and that you received good service.  It is nice to hear the overall stay met your expectations. There are certain times of the year the resort does get busier with large amounts of families, and we apologize if the was not exactly what you had in mind for your stay.  There are many other times where the resort is more oriented towards conventions, and perhaps that time would suit you more.  Please feel free to give us a call and discuss various dates you may be interested in so we can let you know how busy we expect to be.  We would love the opportunity to help you plan the best time so that you have a rewarding stay with us.

title: Good Hotel, Beautiful Beach
review: I first stayed at the Sand Key resort in 2007 with my now-husband's family. So when we decided to honeymoon in Florida, we didn't even consider booking anywhere else for a relaxing beach week after 2 hectic ones in Orlando.  I love everything about this hotel: the rooms are great (although they have refurbed since our first visit and I'm sure the bathroom was bigger then!), the bar food/ breakfast buffet is sensational, the pool area is clean and well maintained even out of season (we stayed in Dec) and the staff are so friendly and professional. Free parking, plus you couldn't get much closer to the beach! There are a couple of great restaurants in the area and plenty to do even if the weather's not up to much. I would not hesitate to recommend the Sand Key and am hoping…

title: Excellent customer service
review: This was my first trip to the Tampa area and stayed at the Sand Key Resort for a conference.  What was remarkable and somewhat surprising was the A+ customer service attitude by all the hotel staff - the bellman, receptionist, waitresses, and room service personnel.  I ordered room service dinner on two nights, and the meal was not only tasty, but was very professionally presented when brought to the room.  The rooms were very clean, and the bed was comfortable, with 4 pillows to each bed.  A nice large flat screen TV was certainly welcome.  In this day and age when even the cheapest hotels offer you free internet, I think a charge of $12 a day for internet access is indeed a negative point.

title: A very good stay at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort
review: We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  Thank you for your kind words regarding our associates and their positive attitudes.  We are also happy to hear that you found our Sheraton sweet sleeper beds to be comfortable!  We apologize that you were not pleased for the separate internet charge; our reasoning for this is we do not charge a resort fee because we want our guests to only pay for the amenities they will be using.  We hope that if you return to the Tampa area for a second time we will have the opportunity to serve you once again.

title: allways wow!
review: Just came back from the Sheraton Sand Key and I have nothing really bad to say about the property.  It was an easy drive from the airport and I enjoyed not having to pay for parking of my rental car, which they upgraded for free, thanks Dollar Rent A Car.  Check in was a breeze and I was able to get a room on the eighth floor overlooking the Sand Key State Park.  A nice quiet view from my room.  The room was large and well appointed.  There was some older furniture but it was in good shape.  Also a new flat screen TV was in the room, but no refrigerator.  There was a balcony with a table and two chairs.  The bathroom was average sized, but the shower was hot and drained well (a pet peeve of mine).  I am a SPG and enjoyed the small appointments as free bottled water and…

title: RETURN VISIT
review: We are pleased to hear that your expectations were met regarding your stay with us.  Thank you for your compliments regarding your catered lunches - those kind words will be passed along to our chef.  It is also nice to know your expectations as an SPG member were met too. We thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback, and do hope that if your travels should bring you back to the Clearwater Beach area we will have the opportunity to serve you again.

title: Perfect for a weekend getaway
review: have been there as a single and 3times with my family (every4years) it was allways outstanding everytime better! just one thing was allways the same: the friendly,personal and perfect service! we allways felt home and enjoyed ourself there anytime! Thank you! last but not least a message to the manager: Mr.Kimball your staff is doing a great job!Keep on going! regards from Fam.Platzer -zillertal Tirol/Austria

title: Beautiful hotel, nice staff
review: My family of 5 had brief stay over the Columbus Day weekend for a mini staycation. The hotel is beautiful, the staff was nice. The beach is very pretty, but there were alot of shells. Ouch! Once you got into the water, it was better but the walk was a little challenging. It was also a short hike. Definitely workable, but if you're not aware of it or if you have difficulty walking (particularly in sand) it may be a task. The hotel rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. The bathrooms were small however and there was a small gap between the room door and floor so you could hear voices and doors shutting.  We had a room at the farthest end so it was not a big issue, but that would have been irritating. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but it seemed busy and smelled really good…

title: Nice location, great beach
review: Thank you for writing a review on our property.  Here at the Sheraton Sand Key our guests’ satisfaction is our number one priority and we are so pleased that your expectations were met.  We are situated on ten acres of beautiful beach, so there is a walk to the waters edge, hopefully the weather was nice and this walk was enjoyable.  We hope that if your travels bring you back to the Clearwater area you will return to our resort, and maybe try out some of our award winning cuisine.

title: Top notch for a category 4 Starwood property
review: I travel to this hotel frequently for business and find the rooms to be comfortable with decent mix of amenities.  It's a little out of the way on Sand Key, but you can hop in your car or take the trolley to get to Clearwater Beach.  One thing I do not like about this hotel is the extra charge for internet service.  You can get free WiFi in the bar off the lobby, but in this day and age I expect free internet service in a hotel.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  These days I only stay here if they are running some sort of special because the hotel is pricey for what you get.

title: Overall a nice stay in a beautiful location
review: Thank you for writing a review on the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  Also thank you for your repeat business!  We are pleased that you find our guest rooms to be comfortable and accommodating.  We apologize that you do not like the separate charge for internet.  Our reasoning for charging for internet is because we do not charge a resort fee due to the fact that we only want our guests to be paying for the extra amenities they use.  We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back to our property in the near future!

title: Beautiful location, Good Value, and Nice service
review: Other than a little bit of a rough start, our 5 day stay was awesome.  Just about everything was perfect, and we'll definitely keep this on our short list of places to re-visit in Florida.  Now for the long version:    As a Platinum member, we received a room upgrade to a pool view (which also has a great view of the gulf).  When we got to our room, it was clean except for the balcony, which the maids forgot to clean.  There were cigarette butts and food from previous guests.  When I went down and let the front desk know, they were very apologetic and moved us to a suite (which is HUGE) two floors up.  This more than made up for the  inconvenience of having to move rooms.  The last day we had an incorrect breakfast charge, but that was taken care of quickly.  Exceptional Service…

title: Not a 4 star hotel!
review: The hotel is beautiful and maintained very well..........however, the halls are a bit outdated, the bathrooms are those that I remember as a kid, when I could fit!  The staff very pleasant but I just do not feel this hotel deserves a 4 star rating, more like a 2 or low 3.  If it were not situated on the beach it would probably be downgraded.  Being an SPG member have stayed at many Sheraton's, Westin and other Sheraton properties and believe me this is not a prestige property.

title: Just perfect
review: Thank you for writing a review on the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed some aspects of our property, such as the cleanliness, and the hardworking staff.  With our property being over 30 years old we are constantly trying to renovate to keep it current.  Our current projects do include the hallways as well as the fitness center to the new Sheraton Fitness, and the club lounge.  We hope with our new updates you will give us another chance to impress you!

title: Lovely Stay
review: I’ve just returned from this hotel and it was great, we had looked on trip advisor before we left and some of the comments I now feel were a bit harsh. The hotel is very clean and staff were extremely helpful, we needed guest service to our room 3 times within minuets of arriving and the service was fantastic, they were there in a flash. The pool was very clean and towels were always available. Breakfast was good and had the added bonus that that kids eat free if they were under 6. The staff at Rusty’s were attentive apart from one morning when in was very clear they were sort staffed and the service did fall, but we all have our off days. Roberta was great and had plenty of time for the kids and always managed to find them stickers, which they loved. The rooms were cleaned to a…

title: Great Vacation
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review on our property.  We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us, your kind words will be passed along to our associates, so that they know all of their hard work is paying off!  We hope to have the chance to serve you again in the future!

title: Just OK
review: Stayed here from Sep 22-27. Throughout the entire stay, the quality of service was excellent. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, and we were always greeted in a way that made you feel right at home. The hotel is in a great location, clean, and one that we would definitely come back to.

title: Almost a complete pleasure
review: This was exceptional in so many ways.  We were on honeymoon and without prompting we were offered a free cocktail and bowl of fruit delivered to our room.  A fantastic welcome and the young girl on the front desk offered us a bamboozlingly detailed appraisal of where to go and how to get there.  The room was brilliant (no 531), views over the pool and our own balcony (though a little disappointing it had no small external light given it is partly boxed in).    Air conditioning worked perfectly as it needs to.  The room was serviced meticulously every day - but - on some days when it rained and we needed the use of the room it wouldn't be serviced until late afternoon, and the day we wanted (and needed) a lie in we were woken up around 9am.  That was an irritation to say the…

title: Fantastic Weekend
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review on your stay with us here at the Sheraton Sand Key. Congratulations on your recent marriage! We are so thrilled to have played a role in this important time in your lives!  It is so pleasing to hear that you had positive encounters with our front office staff as we work very hard to ensure that our level of guest service is as good as it can possibly be.  We apologize for the level of the noise that you experienced while with us and have passed those comments on to our staff.  We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future, and once again congratulations!

title: Stress Releiver
review: Enjoyed the clean room, exceptional service, and gorgeous grounds of this resort. Great recommendation for dinner at Guppy's from the front desk staff. Will definitely come to Sand Key again. Everyone was so friendly and helpful.

title: Wonderful Resort
review: Thank you for sharing your experience here at the Sheraton Sand Key!  We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay.  The Clearwater Beach area has a lot of great cuisine to choose from, and Guppy’s is definitely one of the locals’ favorites.  We look forward to welcoming you back to our property in the future!

title: Been here twice
review: The facility and location are excellent.  I did not want to rent a car because I wanted a stress-free vacation; I didn't want not want to think about anything except eating and going to the beach.  Cabs were usually parked at the resort, the drivers were knowledgeable about the city, and economical.  Our room included a balcony that faced the beach so we were able to enjoy coffee or a nightcap with a beautiful sunset.  All of the dining facilities of the hotel were excellent; I have really missed the freshly squeezed orange juice we had each morning.  Across the street are the Sand Key shops and restaurants that contain excellent local eateries.  Great place to relax.  We are planning to return next year and bring friends.

title: Okay hotel, lovely beach
review: This Sheraton is above your average, mid-range sheraton, but by no means a luxury hotel. Lower your expecations, and you will have a great stay.  The main drag is the pretty beach. Hate that you have to pay for a chair at the beach, though. Why not include this in the rate?  Room was okay, but nohting special. A bit worn.  Did have some noise issues related to people (and housekeeping) coming and going and slamming their doors. A really great hotel would install dampeners on the doors. Plus, the light from the gap between the door and the hall was annoying.  We stayed at the club level and had access to the lounge. Very crowded at the afternoon snack time. Had to stand! People were eating the hour deuvres like it was dinner time, really stocking up. Very tacky. At breakfast,…

title: Go For the Beach!
review: Thank you for your comments regarding your stay with us.  We are fortunate to be situated on a gorgeous beach, and we are so pleased that you were able to relax and enjoy it!  We apologize that you found it unpleasant to pay separately for the lounge chairs.   We do not include the price of them in our rate because not every guest uses them so we do not want to charge for something that will not be accessed by every guest.  It was also nice to read that you enjoyed the breakfast in the club lounge. The club lounge has become very popular with our guests and we are in the midst of potentially expanding its size a little.  Thank you for your comments as it does help us improve our facilities and service.  We hope that you will return to our property in the future and so that we will have another opportunity to serve you.

title: Not Responsive to Complaints About Neighbors
review: Honestly, the Sheraton Sand Key's actual resort is nothing to write home about. Yes, it is nice and clean, and the staff is friendly.  But I am guessing like most people, if you come here, you are coming here for the beautiful site on which this resort sits. It is definitely a million dollar location. One of the cleanest, powder-white sand private beaches I have been to in Florida, full of palm trees and crystal blue waters. It's no wonder that people from all over the world (literally) come here to experience the beach. Loved the Clearwater Beach area as well. Lots of shopping, restaurants and stores. But, the beach at Sheraton Sand Key steals the show. Utterly relaxing and beautiful. Did not want to go home!!

title: Great Hotel - Great Staff - Good Beach - Good Food - Quiet But Near Night Life
review: Our 10 acre private beach is definitely one of our most appealing attributes.  We are so pleased that you enjoyed the beach so much!  Also thank you for noticing the fact that our hotel is clean, and we have a very helpful and friendly staff.  If your travels bring you back to the Clearwater Beach area we hope that you will return to our property.  Once again thank you for your kind remarks.

title: perfect hotel due to perfect staff
review: Our first three nights were fine, however on Sat night, we were kept awake all night by several different people going in and out of the room next door.  What caused us to wake up every 30-45 minutes or so, was the fact that the doors are so heavy, they slam loudly when shut.  We finally called reception around 4 am, and they said they would "try" to do something about the activity next door!  Well, no one came up to investigate, because people continued to go in and out until around 6 am.  We finally gave up on sleeping and left for the airport.  We don't know what was going on next door, perhaps drugs or prostitution?  We never heard any loud music and voices were kept low once they were in the room.  We will never stay at this hotel again.

title: Family-oriented Hotel
review: I went with my wife for Memorial Day weekend.  We flew in Friday night from NYC so we didn't get to the hotel until 11PM.  It's quite a drive from the airport and thankfully we had GPS on our iphone.  The parking  lot was pretty full and there were no available upgrade rooms.  But our room was perfectly fine (despite it overlooking the parking lot) and we got a good night's sleep before heading for the beach the next morning.  The beach is indeed very massive (takes about 5 minutes to walk from the hotel to the water), but not a big deal.  You have to reserve and pay for the chairs out there, which we didn't realize until the attendant told us.  A bit of a shock as many resorts don't charge for chairs.  Nevertheless the water was warm and perfect.   By the time we walked back to…

title: Don't be fooled by the professionally colored hotel photos
review: I'll start off by saying that this is probably one of the best hotels in the Clearwater Beach area.  We got a very "Jersey Shore" type feel from the whole Clearwater Beach area-not something that appeals to us.  The Sherator Sand Key Resort is situated away from all the hustle and bustle of that "Jersey Shore" type feel-where all the other hotels are.  The hotel is right on the beach-but you have to walk through about 10 minutes of sand to get to the ocean.  The rooms were weird-with the sink in the room-just to the left of when you walk in the room (the front room door hits the sink countertop).  Sheets had stains on them two of the four nights we stayed here.  You don't stay here for the room or service.  You stay here for the location.  The hotel pool was closed two of the…

title: We LOVE LOVE LOVE this place, we come several times a year
review: Thank you for your comments on your stay with us.  Our Guest’s satisfaction is our number one priority.
