We are pleased that you enjoyed our beautiful location, but some other things about your stay did not meet the expectations we uphold.  We do pride ourselves to have hard-working associates whom provide outstanding service, and I am sorry that you experienced otherwise.  The comment about the sheets will be passed along to our housekeeping manager so that this problem does not arise again, and I do apologize that we had portions of the pool closed for tree trimming during your stay.  We thank you for taking the time to comment on our property and if you would like to contact us personally to discuss these issues we would greatly appreciate that.  We hope that you will give us an opportunity to serve you again in the future.

title: Great beach, average service, rooms a bit outdated
review: My husband and I live in Orlando and we come here for the weekend every few months.  We come alone, we bring friends, we bring family and this hotel is great for everyone.  The walk to the beach takes a few minutes but we don't mind it at all, we do it several times a day.  The kids love the playground, the pool can get crowded but they handle it well.  The bartenders at the pool are very friendly and always remember us.  The restaurants are good we always have dinner in there or go across the street to Columbia.  Room service is great too, we love ordering breakfast from them.  The rooms are comfy and we love the beds, the bathrooms are small but that is not an issue to us.  Great hotel, great location, we will continue to come here for years to come.

title: User Friendly Hotel Good for Young Kids
review: Thank you for the kind words, and for your loyalty to the Sheraton Sand Key! It is great to hear that you always enjoy your time with us.  Although the pool area does get crowded during our busy season we feel fortunate to have our 10 acre private beach.   We are pleased that you have had the chance to interact with some of our associates; it is a nice personal feeling when we get to know our loyal, repeat guests.  Thank you again for your comments on our resort.  We look forward to welcoming you back!

title: Located on the beach.  Great deal for a free Starwood stay.
review: Hotel on the beach.  Beach is wide.  Five minute walk on the beach to water.  Stayed here using Starwood points.  Thought the property was a great deal.  The rooms seemed to have been renovated.  The carpets look worn.  The rooms are small. The counter space around the sink in the bathroom will fit one toothbrush.  Flat screyen t.v.  Avoid "bay" view rooms.  Ask for a tennis court view or a pool view.  To see the ocean, you have to listen to the air conditioning units on top of the ballrooms.  The first room we got was on the sixth floor and we could hear the roar/hum of the air conditioning.

title: Four Day Get Away --Was Perfect
review: Thank you for taking the time to comment on our property.  Our guests’ satisfaction is our number one priority.  The views in the hotel do differ; we have several views in the hotel that offer a beautiful, calming feel, and we hope that you were happy with your view.  The private beach area our resort is situated on is very large, and is a nice, relaxing setting if the pool area gets too crowded.  We hope that in the future if your travels bring you back to Clearwater we will have the opportunity to impress you with our level of service.

title: PERFECT PLACE TO STAY
review: From the moment we arrived we knew we made the right choice for a get away.  From the Front Desk to the Restuarants the Hotel staff made us feel welcome.  The Pool area was kept very clean and neat and the Gulf beach area was perfect.  We needed a chance to unwind and we found it.  The people at Sheraton are doing it right.

title: Paying for the view and location-though it's a real good one
review: Thank you for your kind words on your stay with us.  It is great to hear that you had positive interaction with all of our staff.  Our pool staff works very hard to maintain the pool and keep it in the condition that you saw.  Your kind words will be passed along to the appropriate department so that they know their hard work is recognized.  The beach is the perfect place for a chance to unwind, and we are so pleased that you were able to do that while staying at our property.  We hope to have the chance to welcome you back to our property in the future!

title: Love it and will go back
review: Family vacation last 8 days of July 2011, in 8 days we had NOT ONE negative experience, the check in was smooth and quick, our room on the 7th floor very end corner of hotel, over looked the pool to the left and the sand and the gulf to the right, beautiful!!!! the room was immaculately clean, yes the bathroom is small BUT its was as big as we needed to shower and ......., heard zero noise in the hallway, no neighboring room noise (keep in mind we were the very end room of the building) EVERY "employee" we would pass in the hallway or lobby, spoke and smiled, very friendly staff! Each day we would go to breakfast across the Gulf Blvd to Maggie Maes (highly recommend for "moms" home cooked breakfast, NOT fast food, good food, very friendly servers) and when we came back from…

title: Just okay. Best for groups.
review: The room itself was a tad average for Sheraton, including linens. The sink was outside the bathroom, which if you're staying with several people to a room makes it difficult not to wake the others in your room if you're the first up. There was ample closet space, mirrrors, and electrical outlets however.  The pool was overcrowded, and the beach was busy as well.  Beach chairs are not included in the nightly rate, and at $25 per pair can get a little pricey for multiple days. Pool and beach towels were too small, and the staff was not supposed to give more than one per customer.  I would not call this hotel a resort. It is a conference center.  I recommend it for large groups, but absolutely not for couples or anyone in need of a quiet, relaxing beach vacation.

title: A Lovely Place to Stay
review: Thank you for your comments on our property.  We are sorry that you found flaws with your stay.  We do cater to a variety of different clientele including business conferences’, families, and couples traveling.  We apologize that the pool was overcrowded, this does sometimes happen during our busy season, which is why we feel grateful to have our 10 acre private beach.  We sincerely appreciate your opinion on our property, and your comments will be passed onto the proper departments.  Thank you again for taking the time to write a review.

title: Overall a decent hotel but I probably won't stay here again.
review: Both the location of Clearwater Beach Florida and the venue, Sheraton Sand Key Resort represent idylic destinations. This is especially the case if your focus is a beach vacation for a couple or family.  The location of the hotel within Clearwater Beach is not central and to our minds this is a benefit. The private beach is extensive and offers plenty of space and activities. If you like the crowds by all means take a very short ride to the city center but be prepared for a very different type of atmosphere.  The onsite restaurants are excellent and the wine list is good. A special note about the wine list is the prices are very reasonable. If your preference is to go offsite to dine there is a strip mall in walking distance that offered Greek and Italian food. Although we did…

title: We loved it and we'll be back
review: Thank you for your comments on your stay with us.  We are thrilled that you enjoyed your stay with us so much.  We agree with you about our wonderful location, we consider it to having the best of both worlds, because we are not in the middle of the busy Clearwater Beach scene, but still a very short distance away.  I will pass on your positive comments to our food and beverage department.  Rusty’s’ has won several prestigious awards, and that is great that you noticed the high level of our cuisine.  Thank you again for your kind words, and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

title: Pretty average
review: I was a little nervous about staying here after reading the reviews but it was fine.  We were only here 3 days after spending a week at Disney/Universal in Orlando so we got the relaxation we were looking for.  The ocean is pretty far away, in fact, you can barely see it from the pool & the pool is VERY small for the size of the hotel.  But overall the place was ok.  We rented a cabana with 3 chairs ($33) one day at the beach but decided that the  poolside cafe & Turtle bar made the poolside experience better.    We ate off-site for dinner all 3 evenings & were quite pleased with our choices.  Backwaters, Columbia & Salt Rock Grill in Indian Shores (the best of them all). I did like that this hotel was away from the congestion of Clearwater.  There was a day that our room was…

title: girl's long weekend
review: this place was the greatest...wonderful view from our room....good breakfast buffet...staff were all very helpful...the beach is wide and you gotta walk a little, but beautiful and white sand...we rented the umbrellas one day, that was fun...pool area gets busy, but everyone was having a great time, tiki bar serves up frozen drinks in a little sand bucket, a better deal than individual drinks, and we shared them...lots of great places to eat locally and within.

title: Wouldn't Stay here again
review: We are so pleased to hear that you had such an enjoyable time at our property.  Our guests satisfaction is so important to us, therefore it is rewarding when all of our hard work pays off!  That is great that you enjoyed our beach and pool area, as well as the restaurants.  Your compliments will be passed on to the chef.  Thank you again for taking the time to post your opinion of our property, and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

title: Best Hotel out of the five we stayed at in Florida
review: I read multiple reviews before booking my trip and was a little skeptical of staying here, but I read that the rooms were renovated and I knew going in that it would be quite a walk to the beach and the pool area was very small so that didn't surprise me. I thought this hotel was a cheaper alternative to the Sand Pearl and in a better location ... but I was wrong.   My boyfriend and I stayed here from July 16- July 22 and we were disappointed in the room they gave us. We didn't have an ocean view and we were on the first floor, we would have asked to change but we had sooo many things planned  - our days were booked solid and I didn't feel like packing up everything and moving rooms so we made the most of it.  We only really spent the first day in the hotel and traveled to…

title: Worst place ever!!!
review: Thank you for your comments on our property.  We are happy to hear that you and your boyfriend enjoyed your stay, but we apologize we didn’t provide you with the experience to want to return.  We apologize that you were not completely satisfied with the view in your room.  We do have a lovely beach, and we are pleased that you enjoyed our beach area, also happy to hear that you enjoyed the walk to the beach.  If there were any concerns about our property that you had an issue with feel free to contact us directly.  Thank you again for your review of our resort.

title: Nice hotel for business conferences..
review: I think Americans expect far more from their Hotels than us Brits going by some of the reviews here. We found the room size to be more than adequate. There was a large wardrobe and chest of drawers for clothes storage, something we didn't get in other hotels. The Hotel was low level which was nice, unlike the tower blocks next door. The bathroom was small but adequate for our needs.  The walk to the sea across the beach was quite long, but well worth it, it was much cooler and the sea was lovely. The sun loungers and parasols were a bit expensive but worth it. However the first day we paid in cash and didn't get charged any tax, made us wonder if the man in charge just pocketed our money. The only downside on the beach was the cart that came with the refreshments. The lady…

title: Lame to lovely in one trip
review: Check in was easy. Autumn was friendly and helpful, and advised us that good parking spots were rare, so if we found one to make sure we kept it. Our first room was awful. I had emailed the hotel a week before with a request for a quiet location away from elevators, noise, and preferably with a king bed. Autumn said she didn't know if they had received the email, as there were no notes on our profile. Pity. It turns out that our room was directly by the elevators, with queen beds, and a view of the roof of the building and the vents from their kitchen. What a bummer at the price we paid. Fortunately Autumn promised she could move us the following morning to a king room on a higher floor. We were so pleased to hear that. In fact she offered to have our luggage moved for us if we…

title: Will never go back to this Sheraton
review: This is a horrible Sheraton. The rooms are outdated and needs a facelift. The entire hotel is filled with families and kids - definitely not a getaway for couples. We would wake up each morning with kids running and screaming in the hallways. Our room also smelled liked smoke (and it's a non-smoking facility). The fitness center doesn't open until 8am on the weekends and they charge guests to use it. Next time, we'll pay a little more and stay at the Sandpearl.

title: Great Hotel for family environment
review: The hotel was clean.  I was a great family environment, and great location in Clearwater...beachfront hotel.  Not able to tell you what the food was like, we ate out somewhere different everyday!  The only complaint to mention is my rooms were on the 3rd floor next to elevators & the maintenance office.  Other than a little bing, bing, bang in the morning and after maintenance met up for coffee and conversation every morning by my room.....it was great.  I would advise any one to visit, just request a different floor.

title: would go again
review: A friend of mine and I decided to do a girls get away weekend and got a good deal on airfare and hotel through Priceline, which is why we stayed here sight unseen. The hotel staff is very friendly, the rooms are clean and the breakfast buffet is wonderful.  The beach rentals for chairs and umbrellas is a little steep and it's a long walk to get the water, but its a beautiful beach and worth the walk.  The pool is a little small and filled with kids on the weekends.  The place across the street called The Columbia has GREAT food and awsome mojitos all enjoyed with a view of the intercoastal waterway.  We did not eat dinner at the hotel, but heard from other guests that it was good.

title: Best hotel EVER
review: From the moment we arrived the hotel was amazing. We were welcomed by bell hops, who took our luggage and helped us check in. One really friendly bell hop showed us to our room on the 6th floor. We had a view of the pool and of the gulf and it was absolutely stunning. We were on our honeymoon and they gave us chocolate covered strawberries and champagne, as well as a free breakfast the next morning and 4 free cocktails! They also helped us find an optician or "eye doctor" the next day - as I was having problems with a contact lens! Breakfast was delicious and there was a great variety of hot and cold, not to mention plentiful Florida orange juice... As said before, our room was amazing. We had a MASSIVE king bed, which was lovely and comfortable, as well as a comfy lounger where…

title: absolutely perfect
review: Our goal for this trip was to do as little as possible and lounge on the beach as much as possible. Mission accomplished. The Sheraton Sand Key Resort met and exceeded all of my expectations. Upon arrival we were greeted promptly despite the busy holiday weekend crowd. The whole check in process took less than five minutes. Our room was spacious and clean. We had to pay $5/day for a mini fridge but when the temp is pushing 100 degrees farenheit it was worth every penny to have cold drinks and ice cream in the room. The gulf view from our balcony was completely unobstructed. We could even enjoy the view while lying in bed in the mornings thanks to the layout of the room. My only issue with the room was the small size of the bathroom. You can barely step out of the tub without…

title: service and food was great
review: Great service. Everyone was very attentive and pleasant.  The food at Rusty was great and room service food was decent.   Everything was closeby.  The Rooms were clean but the carpet needs to be updated.   the pool was small.  They should have two pools as the pool was mostly used by the kids.  Great place to stay!

title: Very Nice Family Hotel
review: We rented 2 attached rooms for our family of 5.  They were SO prompt with any requests - pillows, roll aways, etc.  At one point our TV didn't get HBO, they went someone right up with a new tv, and a $20 room credit!  They also give $100 room credit per room, to use at the shops and dining facilites, which was great too.  The only draw back is the VERY long walk to the beach, and no facilites at the water (no bathrooms, snacks, etc.).  They should have a little beach shack or something because it is a LONG, HOT walk to and from the water. Also, the pool is WAY too small - they need a pool just for adults since all day there were "games" for the kids at the pool and the adults could not swmi. Overall, it was nice for the kids and us.

title: Great Independence Day Stay!
review: Just stayed at this property for 2 nights over the July 4th weekend and it was a great experience!  Have read quite a few reviews about the subpar service but, personally, experienced the friendliest and most attentive service at a hotel in a long time.  From the 2 bellmen (can't recall their names but one used to work at the Atlanta Hyatt Regency) who immediately greeted us upon pulling up to the front door of the hotel and took care of our bags to the front desk staff to the poolside cafe staff, beach towel guy and maintenance staff - EVERYONE was EXCEPTIONAL!  It is true that the walk to the beach is very long.  The front desk quickly arranged for maintenance staff to provide a ride to and from the beach since I have respiratory problems that a long walk would have…

title: Will never go back
review: This was our honeymoon and we booked a high floor king sized bed furnished room. When we got there we got "upgraded" to a 2 queen size bed unfurnished 7th floor "gulf view" which ment the tennis courts and if we leaned all the way over the balcony to the point of falling off you could see the ocean. The beds where the WORST beds i have ever slept on we actually tried to cancel and where going to spend the money to go else where but they told us our orignal room was not able to be canceled we would not have gotten a refund. we got no sleep on our honeymoon which made for a cranky car ride home. The gaps between the door and the floor are as bad as people say you can hear everything, the maids took a number 2 in our bathroom more than once and left the whole room smelling…

title: Great spot on the Gulf!
review: We just spent 4 days/ 3 nights at Sheraton Sand Key Resort this weekend, to unwind after 5 days at WDW.  Weeks back, I had booked a double queen room through Expedia and thought it was standard "street view", but turned out to be on a 4th floor sw corner where our balcony overlooked the beautiful courtyard & pool area to the AND had a clear view of the beach. I am OCD about clean rooms and "bug" issues but my mind was quickly at ease when I saw how clean the rooms were kept. Beds were very comfortable, but walls were somewhat thin compared to WDW's resorts where you hear nothing. Interior hallways were just a bit noisy on our floor (families, small kids & babies)  Being on Sand Key was peaceful, yet it was a very quick & easy drive over to the Clearwater Beach area to check out…

title: Great service at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort
review: Just returned from a week long stay at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.   CHECK-IN: Fast, informative with very friendly service. We had booked a club room with harbour view but were upgraded to a Gulf view.  ROOM: Very much what you would expect from being in a large hotel chain - perfectly adequate but fairly generic. Large comfy bed, standard size room, the bathroom/sink area was a bit small but good shower, balcony, safe, desk, chairs etc. The room was cleaned daily and turned down in the evening.  FOOD: As we booked a club room we received a complimentary continental breakfast each day, served in their top floor lounge which has very nice views across the harbour. Obviously, it does depend on the other guests but I found it to be quiet, bright and a nice relaxed start to the…

title: I have reservations about this place...literally
review: My husband have a Son who works for the starwood resorts so we took advantage of the family discount. I would not ever pay full price. The pool is way too small for the size of this hotel. The walk to the beach is very far. Our food was half price. We still spent over 150 for two days of food. You need to ask for a fridge in the room which is a 6$ charge. The resort charges for wifi daily. Only one choice in hotel for lunch. Dinner was excellent in Rustys Bistro. Had the prime Rib Buffet which is normally 19.95$. I was very worried about the little ones in pool because of the horse play by older kids that are playing in this small pool. They really need to make the pool bigger.If i was paying full price I doubt Id stay there again. The only good thing is Sand Key State park is…

title: Expected better for the money!
review: We stayed here for 4 nights following 14 nights at the Four Points by Sheraton in Orlando. On arrival we were very impressed with the overall look of the hotel, however we were extremely disappointed when we reached our room. Having booked an 'Ocean View' room we were not happy to discover our room had a view of the car park & tennis courts. After phoning Reception, this was rectified & we were shown to a more suitable room (although still not worth the 'Ocean View' supplement charge). The pool area at the hotel was lovely & relaxing although there is very little shade -  a few more umbrellas would be very welcome. The food at the pool cafe was ok & the cocktails from The Turtle Bar were delicious :) We ordered room service one night & it was truly appalling! The pizza was…

title: Great location, fun yet relaxing--Perfect for familes
review: We have a three-year old, and we all had a fantastic time. The location is perfect--I highly recommend upgrading to a gulf-side room and asking for a fridge in your room. As our daughter was sleeping, we could sit out on the balcony and enjoy the view with some wine. The staff was very nice, and it was lovely to be able to walk right out onto the beach. It's a bit of a hike to the water's edge, and our daughter preferred to be carried, but I really liked the little walk on the sand. The waters of the gulf were so calm and it was very relaxing. Lots of opportunities for shell collecting. We've vacationed in Cape Cod in the past, and while wonderful, the ocean-side surf was a little rough for little ones, but this beach was great for little kids. It was everything we wanted in a…

title: We won't be back
review: We've stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key a number of times in the past and have always enjoyed the hotel. Our latest trip was a  unfortunately a disppointment. We booked a quite expensive 'Bay View' room. Whilst the bay was visible it was some distance away and our room immediately overlooked the outlets of the intervening air conditioning and kitchen exhaust fans. The balcony was not a favourite spot during our stay! We ate at Rusty's twice. The food was mediocre both times and the sevice at dinner was haphazard. The hotel is in a good location and the pool and surrounding area is well maintained. Staff are generally very friendly and helpful.

title: Jackson Browne really missed a great time!
review: Wow ! This place was fun ! Lots to enjoy ; I only wish we had more time to do so... Well, there's the totally AWESOME suite with sooo much breathing room, I almost started hyperventilating ! And , of course there was the beach ! A really cool pool area...did I mention THE BEACH !! It seemed so secluded, I was expecting Gilligan and the Professor to come strolling by at any second (or pull up in The Minnow) Reeaallly niiicccceee....

title: Very nice place!
review: I was surprised on my visit. The staff was great, beaches were great. Rooms were nice. I look forward on returning. While I was there I rented a car and took fam to Busch Gardens. Hotel does not offer a shuttle service to/from airport and Its ideal to rent a car unless u want to stay at resort. There is a shopping plaza walking distance, Colombia restaurant was good. Food at resort was good too.

title: From Business Conference to Return Trip for R&R...
review: My company and I have been extremely pleased with the Sheraton Sand Key for several business conferences - the staff (top notch sales team), the food, the service, the layout -so much so that I took the time to take a trip back to relax for a few days and specifically chose the Sand Key. It's just quiet enough, plenty of parking, easy trip into town, the views are spectacular for sunsets and they are located right on the beach.  Couldn't ask for more. I have found the staff very friendly and helpful everytime. Things to do: Pier 60 for sunsets; the Marine Aquarium; a concert at Ruth Eckerd Hall and a short drive to St. Petersburg to visit the Museums - the Dali and Morean Arts Center.

title: Nice Resort
review: My family and I have stayed here three times for business conferences. The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are nice and the main restaurant has very good food. Most of the staff are long time employees and they remember returning guests. They have a nice outdoor pool and bar with plenty of sunbathing space. Something different here is the walk to access the beach. It's a little over a thousand steps walking on white sand when leaving the pool area to get to the actual beach and water.  Apparently a nearby jetty that was built some years ago did what it was designed to do...protect the existing beach. Actually it may have worked too well because of the greatly extended distance to walk to the water.   We have stayed in the suites, standard and upgraded rooms. Try to get…

title: Alway enjoy this property
review: I have stayed other Clearwater beach hotels, but always seem to place this one as my favorite. It is just over the bridge from Clearwater, but in a nice quiet location.  They keep the facility very nice.  Most beach hotels tend to be a bit dirty, but have never found that here.  They have a nice beach and since it is a bit of a walk even have a cart lady that offers refreshements.  Rooms are very clean.  The person checking us in was a male and the lead person on staff.  He was not friendly, but the rest of the staff was very nice.  My kids enjoyed the beach, pool and tennis.  Plenty of free parking which is very nice also.  Have a nice tiki hut for drinks and a place to eat lunch by the pool which is reasonably priced for a beach hotel.

title: Loved the resort and hope to be back!
review: Everyone at the resort was so friendly and helpful. We took advantage of the "sunsational special" where we stayed 3 nights and 4th night was free. A full buffet breakfast was included and we were given an upgrade to our room at check-in. Our room was facing the gulf with a balcony so we were able to sit on the balcony every evening and watch the most beautiful sunsets! Our only criticism was the small bathroom but really it was not that big of a problem. What we enjoyed most was the beautiful beach. Yes, it was quite expansive as others have commented, but it was a pleasant walk from the hotel. It is a much quieter beach than Clearwater! Going to Clearwater Beach one evening for the sunset and dinner convinced us that Sand Key was a much better option for a more peaceful…

title: Great place.   Great beach.  We keep co In b  We keep comin' back . . .
review: Great service.   Beautiful beach.  Great place for a conference.   Just get up at the crack of dawn to put towels on your chairs if you want to be anywhere near the pool.

title: Sheraton Sand Key & the Phillies -- what a combination!
review: For two years, we've chosen the Sheraton Sand Key as our 'base' when coming to Clearwater for Phillies' spring training games.  (And it coincides with NCAA "March Madness".)  The hotel is great (accommodations, pool, beach, personnel, food); the location (on one of the best beaches in the country) is superb; and the bar is great fun (friendly bartenders, multiple tvs, and lots of interaction between the guests).  The concierge and the front desk folks are very, very welcoming and helpful! I felt as if I were coming 'home' this year....after staying there last year!  Can't wait until next March!  The Blue Airport Shuttle is a problem; the Sheraton Sand Key is often the last stop on a very long and circuitous route......it took me 95 minutes in the middle of the night to get from…

title: Lovely stay
review: Only stayed for one night but this is a nice hotel on the beach. Clearwater is beautiful

title: Worthwhile stay - quick to the point review!
review: First time family vacation. Travelling with toddlers.  Lobby: very classy and large...did not realize had multiple conference rooms.  Staff: friendly, no complaints.  Food: had breakfast buffet there every morning, very good food and service.  Room: tennis view, thin walls for sure.  Hallways:  needs updating, very dated.  Pool: small but overall no complaints.  Beach: nice location, no complaints on distance except if you had kids that need to use the restroom or if you forgot something in your room.  Overall:  great value for for the rate I paid for it (under $175/night)

title: A good time
review: Stayed for 2 nights in may and really enjoyed it. The reception staff were reasonable without being too friendly but the room and other accommodation was good. The beds and pillows were fantastic and the tv was flatscreen and a decent size. I wouldn't return to Rusty's and didn't rate the buffet breakfast. I had a much nicer experience at Maggie Mae's over the road and it was much cheaper. The pool area was nice and the Tikil bar cocktails were terrific I would come again

title: Brilliant Stay
review: I looked at the reviews of the hotel before we travelled and thought omg.  I am pleased to say that we were pleasantly surprised.    From the time we arrived at the front desk, we were upgraded and had a wonderful room on the 6th floor with views overlooking the pool and the gulf, we took some amazing photographs.  The hotel is situated on the beach front and the staff around the pool and the bar were polite.  I could not understand from other reviews about not being enough sunbeds, there was plenty.  Okay the pool was not the biggest and perhaps people like to sunbath beside this, but personally I used the sunbeds beside the beach and could walk down to the sea.  Our stay was wonderful, yes there are a few good restaurants across the road from the hotel which we did use, but…

title: Great Get-a-way Weekend!
review: My wife had stayed here last year for her high school reunion, and insisted we come back for a weekend getaway, and so we did. We were greeted warmly by the concierge / doorman, Dennis, who took a special interest in us all weekend long - from recommending and making reservations for dinner on Friday night, to just checking on us and making sure all our needs were being taken care of.   The front desk was equally helpful, including the manager. When he asked if I had a laptop, he provided us with a free access code for the weekend. We stayed on the 6th floor, the very last room (#626) facing out to the pool and beach. The room was adequate with a lovely balcony and two chairs and a table.  One small issue was that we had to settle for a room with two queen beds as all the rooms…

title: Horrible Hotel
review: My husband and I entered into the Sheraton Sand Key Resort  and the word resort was laughable.  We walked in and were not greeted one time. We spoke to the representative at the front desk and I verified that we were getting the ocean view that I was told on the phone that we were getting. To our displeasure, we were told that all the rooms were booked and that we were getting the view of the tennis courts!  The representative was not accomodating and would not change the rooms. My husband and I were shocked and decided before we actually checked in, that we would need to see the room.  We walked down the hallway to the smell of a cheap fragrance overpowering the halls to the room with a large gap between the door and the floor.  When we walked into the room, the room smelled…

title: Good hotel
review: Stayed at this hotel for 2 days to attend a beach wedding.  Majority of staff were very nice but did encounter some snotty persons at the front desk and at the cash register in the Island Grille restaurant.  Layout of hotel is great -- everything is easy to reach and beach is very close by.  Rusty's Bistro in the hotel had great service and food.  Would also recommend Jimmy's Fish House & Iguana Bar in Clearwater.  Be careful what you say in the bathroom of the hotel rooms, though, as the walls are very thin.  I could very clearly hear what the couple in the next room were saying to each other...including that the bottle with the top open was the shampoo and that she left the shower running for him.

title: Hidden Fees!
review: Hotel requires you to pay extra for usual included amenities: refrigerator use, internet, and even the fitness center! I will not be returning here.

title: Nice family hotel
review: Friendly and helpful pool attendant; ok poolside cafe; very good high end restaurant.  Location was interesting.  You could either love or hate being way out this far out.  Right on beach, though, which was great.

title: Absolute Paradise !
review: Stayed here for 2 weeks over easter,inc son's 7th birthday and anniversary. After long 9hour flight from UK then 2 hour drive to the beach it was wonderful to find a surprise birthday present for my son and champagne & strawberries on ice for us ! We hadn't paid for a gulf view room but had a ground floor room with a terrace overlooking the pool/beach and gulf of mexico. Hotel staff couldn't be nicer, very kind gentleman on reception gave my 2 children a free ice cream coupon on our first day which they still talk about and the most amazing easter egg hunt i've ever seen put on by the hotel with free coffee and donuts for adults!!! Set right on the beach, beautiful sunset photos and walks along the beach to local shops and restaurants (great nearby breakfast cafe Maggie Mae's)…

title: Good hotel at a Great location
review: I have never submitted a hotel review before. But as I chose this hotel after consulting trip advisor I thought it only fair to report my thoughts. Overall a really good hotel in a great location. I am glad we chose this hotel for a relaxing second week of our vacation after a busy first week doing the parks in Orlando.  The positives - Beach location, Staff, Pool seating area, Pool bar, Cleanliness, View from our gulf view room (plus many others )  The negatives - Pool is quite small, Bathrooms are small, Lack of good poolside outdoor eating.  I liked being on Sand key as it is quieter than Clearwater beach which is easily accessible.  In conclusion this is a good 4 star hotel in a great location.

title: Would DEFINITELY book again!!
review: Beach access? YES!  Friendly staff? YES!  Rusty's breakfast? Good food! EXCELLENT STAFF!!!! Hotel quality? EXCELLENT! The only negative was the older man at the pool who thought he was King Zeus!  He honestly thought he owned the pool!  He made a lady get up so he could push her chair back about a foot, (and I witnessed her husband get the manager to report his disgust!), and he told my child that if she didn't get away from the rope of the pool, she would have a time out (which I found out a day later)! Other than this man, we were soooo pleased and highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to be treated well, have direct beach access, and wants to get away from the busy area.  This is definitely for families who want to relax with any age children!  Can't wait to go…

title: Nice, old hotel
review: Great location, easy beach access. Room was a little on small side especially bath, but we made do. Balcony is nice touch. Hotel was very neat and clean and staff friendly as at any Starwood property.  Pool was a lot smaller than it looks in pictures on website. Ancillary costs are a little prohibitive. The breakfast buffet did not include coffee - which was charged at $2.50 a glass or orange juice at $3.50 a glass. Restaurant was good though.

title: Would go back in a minute!!
review: We stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key on the recommendation of friends who have stayed there and it turned out to be the best resort vacation we have had.   The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful.   The facilities very clean and well maintained.  The hotel is right on the beach with miles of white sand to walk and watersports available.  We rented ski doos on the beach in front of the hotel and had a great time on the water.   The hotel is within easy walking distance to shops, restaurants and downtown Clearwater beach which is a "happening spot" with outdoor entertainment.  We were there over Easter and the hotel organized an egg hunt for the children - again very well done.   The bar area was family/kid friendly and a great gathering place to meet other tourists.  I…

title: I wouldn't recommend staying here.
review: The first impression sticks! We pulled up  to sit in a line of cars waiting to be helped. The uninterested bell man was standing looking at us all. He finally asked if we needed help as I held the baby and my husband took out the luggage. We took our own luggage up to our room. At dinner, I asked for meatballs  for the toddler.  When the meatballs arrived with no sauce, I requested sauce. The waiter replied, "NO". For the amount of money to stay here I thought service was not polite nor accomodating and the hotel lacked value. I do want to say the woman at the desk was nice.

title: Relaxing and away from the masses!
review: Stayed at the Sheraton Clearwater the beginning of April towards the end of spring break. Had a great stay! Paid for the upgrade to the beach front room and it was well worth it! SPG floor was fairly quiet. Walls are thin it's true but people were considerate. We were glad the sink was outside of the bathroom so one could get ready and the other could shower.   Pool is on the smaller side for the number of guestrooms but we didn't go down there one day..... the gulf was calling our name! 1:00 p.m. we'd go down and rent 2 chairs and an umbrella for $15 (instead of the full day price of $25). The beach is lovely and lots of shells. I had seen info about sting rays and jelly fish but we didn't see either and swam in the ocean everyday we were at the beach.   The lunch cafe had…

title: Great beach, friendly staff
review: We just got back from a girls spring break getaway. Our requirements for our trip were: sun, pool & beach. The Sheraton sand key fit the bill. The staff was extremely nice (minus one bad server at rusty's for breakfast...BAD service ) other than that experience all staff was friendly & accomidating. It was spring break so the pool was FULL of kids. So we rented an umbrella at the beach & it was super quiet & relaxing. It was just like that corona commercial on the beach.  There isn't much of party scene so finding things to do was kind of difficult.  For a relaxing getaway & a beautiful beach I recommend sand key.

title: Excellent family resort in a great location
review: Prior to booking this hotel, I did more research than I care to admit. Using Trip Advisor and variouus other sites, I was hoping to find a great vacation at a great price. Sometimes, the reviews confused me because after reading several great reviews, I would see some that were not flattering at all. I wondered how there could be that much of a difference in reviews on the same resort. After considering about 25 resorts on the gulf coast, we decided to try the Sheraton and I am happy to say we were not disappointed. It was not all good but the good outweighed the bad significantly.  First the location: Clearwater is one of ther cleanest and well kept resort cities I have been to. It has a lot of things to do at a reasonable cost. The hotel is oceanfront with a private beach. The…

title: Lovely experience
review: I am writing this review partly in response to the previous poster - what were you expecting during spring break?  Half the kids in America are off from school, and this resort is less than 90 minutes from Disney.  Seriously, if you wanted rest and relaxation during EASTER WEEK, which is the second busiest travel week next to Christmas, you should have gone to an adults-only resort.  I have been here with my family all week and all seven of us, parents included, love the resort.  The staff is top-notch, the beach is gorgeous and we have rooms with beautiful views.  A perfect, low-key vacation for all.

title: Too bad I paid in full in advance! Want to run!!!
review: Am spending the week in the Clearwater area visiting friends, thought I might need a day of peace and quiet poolside/beachside solo. Rather than staying in Clearwater I opted for a more understated/low key Sand Key. The beach is pretty but there is nothing to walk to or drive to unless you drive back over the bridge. I checked in early at 2 and headed to the pool. There wasn't a single lounge chair free. The shrieking, ball playing and water oozies...were out of control. The pool was TINY and there wasn't an empty spot in it. The towel guy also had free swim diapers-- I can only imagine what was IN the pool.  The rinky dink walk up bar was a pathetic gazebo with a long line due to the fact that there was only 1 slow moving bartender. Couldn't read, got soaked (iphone wet too) by…

title: Great location, very clean, friendly and helpful staff--highly recommended!
review: We recently stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key and had a wonderful experience.  The staff was very friendly, especially the pool attendants.  Towels were provided (must show room key) for pool or beach use.  There were also noodles for use in the pool.  Chairs are first come first serve so get out there early.  There are chairs with cushions ($8 each) and umbrella/cabana rentals available ($25 for the entire setup) on the beach, which is a short walk down from the pool.  There is a food and beverage cart that comes out to the beach so you can have lunch and cocktails.  The entire property is clean, they power wash the pool deck every morning.  There was a place to get snacks, coffee, and donuts in the hotel, and the pool cafe is convenient.  The Island Grille is a great place for…

title: What a rip off!
review: My husband and I decided to get away for a night for our anniversary.   I paid extra for a "bay view", expecting that I would be able to enjoy a quiet cup of coffee on the patio in the morning.  I didn't realize (because the website mentions NOTHING about it) that I would be a few feet away from the air conditioners for the lobby and restaurants.  It was so noisy, my husband and I couldn't even go out there!  My bay view was a view of a dirty roof and part of the parking lot.   I asked the front desk about this, and they informed me that I was in the right room.  The manager rudely informed me that there was nothing that could be done, as there were few rooms left, and they had similar views.  I paid $300 dollars/ night for this room (Spring Break) and it was not worth a third…

title: Very chillaxing
review: I'm sorry to hear the Sheraton Sand Key Resort did not meet your expectations.  We truly do strive to exceed our guests' expectations, so comments such as yours are very humbling.  If you would ever like to discuss the matter further, please don't hesitate to contact us directly.  Your experience with us was not at all up to our standards and we would appreciate the opportunity to speak directly with you about it.

title: Not great
review: I was a bit worried about the Sheraton having read a few reviews and we got off to a worrying start.  Upon arrival they made us an very good offer to stay at another hotel for one night due to overbooking. When we said no there was no issue at all-this was accepted and off to our room.  THE ROOM  The room is fine. It had a balcony with a partial bay view. The bed was huge and very comfortable. There was a large 32" LCD television with a good selection of channels. What was interesting is that you could order a few cinema movies direct to the TV. Depending on the movie this ranged in price but was still slightly cheaper than going to the cinema.   The bathroom was small but as one person said, how much time do you really spend in there. At first having the sink outside was…

title: Great experience - will go back again!!
review: The hotel is well kept, but there are a few things to watch out for.  The beach - for a place called "Clearwater", the water isn't clear at all.  I didn't expect crystal clear, but I didn't expect to be swimming in murky waters, either.   The sand isn't as white as other places along the gulf coast, and it is quite gritty and full of shells that make it uncomfortable to walk without shoes.  You can rent cabanas for $25 / day, which may be a good move if you burn easily.  The pool - too small and overrun with screaming kids.  Better there than on the beach, I suppose.  The food - we were only there 4 nights, so we didn't get bored with it.  Their buffet, while priced reasonably, fails to offer enough variety from night to night.  We did find a place called "Columbia" across the…

title: Disappointed and will stay across the street next time.
review: Oh my!  I can not imagine what was going on that the water was murky unless it was the week where we had several storms.  That is truly not a comment we hear. The spring time is a very popular time for families to visit our resort.  It is our hope that with the pool, beach and area activities, the pool and beach don’t get too over crowded. However, there are many times during the year when the weather is beautiful and the resort isn’t as full.  I am glad you found our hotel clean and well maintained, and we hope that you will visit again.

title: Awesome service, Too many kids, Chairs on beach 25$$$$$$ at a sheraton really.
review: Again everyone was so happy and helpful on the staff. Too small of a pool no repsect from many kids and parents. Sometimes service at pool sometime no..... thin walls. I was told there would be entertainment and there was not....... To pay 25 a day for a chair on the beach when we were paying 225.00 a night is sad, very disappointed.

title: I would not stay here again
review: Thank you for your comments on our staff.  We truly do care about taking care of our guests.  I am terribly sorry to hear we misinformed you in regards to entertainment and that our service at the pool was inconsistent.  We do have a separate concession running the beach chairs and there is a charge for them.  We do this in lieu of charging a resort fee.  I know this can sometimes be a disappointment, but we only want our guests to pay for the extra amenities that they choose to use.  I hope you understand our philosophy on this, and that you will return to our resort and give us an opportunity to serve you again in the future.

title: Away Just enough from Clearwater To Have 5 stars
review: I stayed here with my family over Spring break and payed 262$ a night for a room with 2 queen beds and a view of the parking lot. All I kept on thinking was, "I can't believe this room cost this much!" The bathroom is so tiny and space around sink so limited that we had to keep our toiletries in our suitcase. There is no fridge or microwave. The furniture on our balcony was rusty and the bathroom was not clean (I hate having to say that because I know maids work so hard!) There were 3 conferences going on here and I think this would be a great place to stay if on business! Of course we were surrounded by college age sping breakers and heard them all night. One of our comforters was dirty but quickly changed. We were even given free breakfast vouchers. The pool was too crowded to…

title: Good location, comfortable beds!
review: Excellent food at the resturant great place to watch a sporting event Nice Rooms. The Best Staff Of any Sheraton by far. Told them on the Phone this was a Special weekend for my wife and I the had Chocolate covered strawberries waiting it are room when we returned from the pool. What a class act I did not get that at the Ritz. When I asked to Have the Name of the General Manager to Thank him on departure Sunday afternoon. He was Actually at the Hotel. This place should be rated as a number one pick. We have been back and tell people about the beautiful Beach. NOt to mention The fries I had at the pool side resturant were cooked in a special machine the were unreal You need to stay here

title: Sea View rooms are great
review: Stayed at this hotel for one night after returning from a cruise.  The location was nice, although it was a little far removed from the shops/restaurants of Clearwater Beach.  You needed to drive to most locations.  There was a huge beach outside of the hotel, and some restaurants within the hotel, which were decent.  The beds were SO comfortable.  Everything was clean, and service was fine!

title: Not much needed to get a 5/5
review: After reading the reviews, I was a bit skeptical about booking the Sheraton. Especially going during Spring Break. While it is true that the walls are thin and that you hear everyone walking/talking in the corridor, since it is away from the Clearwater Beach, you dont get the party crowd the other hotels might get. We could hear music/bass coming from what must have been the Shepards on the other side of the bridge, but it wasnt loud enough to bother us. The bed was very comfy, the room service was excellent. Yes there is a large gap under the door, but as my wife said, it acts as a night light. We didnt care about the sink being outside the bathroom, nor its size. We've seen worse.   The beach is amazing. We did rent a cabana with 2 chairs for 25$ for the day.  We left for 90…

title: Great Place
review: I had read some really negative reviews about this hotel, but it turns out I was very happy.  Staff were great, from Patrick who helped us with our bags, and talked hockey, to everyone we crossed paths with, reception, maintenance etc. Hotel is very clean, rooms are nice and comfortable. I had no issues with noise.  I read in a few places people complaining about a gap in the door, not sure what the deal is with that and I saw no issue.  The bathroom, so the sink is on the outside, I found it practical as we weren,t walking over each other. Parking is included, it is in a quieter location from Clearwater beach, but a quick walk over the bridge and you will be in all the action. I liked the tranquility of the Sand Key area, long beach walks, and clean , not crowded.  I read…

title: Very nice place to stay
review: Arrived on Thursday left on Monday. Wife and two kids 12 and 8 excellent resort. Nice room, good service, great white sand beach. Nice pool.

title: Great hotel, wonderful staff
review: We are so pleased the entire family enjoyed their stay.  We appreciate your comments and are grateful you chose the Sheraton Sand Key Resort for your family vacation.  We hope you will return soon!

title: nice beach,but noisey rooms
review: Great location and beautiful wide beach.  Pool and club lounge seem undersized for a hotel this size, that said they were very nice.  Staff is wonderful, so genuinely helpful.  Rusty's restaurant has a great buffet and is kid friendly. Rooms are a good size.  The walls seem thin, hear noise and big gap under entry door makes it worse.  We enjoyed out stay here and do recommend the hotel.

title: Great place, if this is what you're looking for
review: My wife and I both enjoyed our stay here! We are low maintenance people, so we didn't make much use of the service here, but everyone we chatted with was extremely helpful.  Room was very clean, nice bed and sufficient for our needs, although a mini-fridge would have been nice to have. We had a partial-view room w/ a balcony and enjoyed the view of the gulf looking across the nature area to the "upper" portion of Clearwater Beach. I felt the price was reasonable/comparable to other hotel/resorts in the area.  As others have noted, this resort is not w/n easy access of the "boardwalk" area of Clearwater Beach. There is a trolly available, but we didn't have any problems driving into the boardwalk area and finding parking in the evenings.    As others have noted, the walk to the…

title: Very dissapointing and overpriced
review: Your words truly describe our location and help others understand the tranquility of Sand Key!  We often feel like we have "the best of both worlds"...a peaceful location easily accessible to the action of Clearwater Beach.   Our pool can be a challenge when we are very busy, and we try to find a middle ground to making everyone happy - admittedly, not always accomplished.  I am glad the beach was an alluring alternative for you.  I have made it a point to share your food comments with our Chef.  Rusty's Bistro has won several awards, and I am very sad to hear your dining experience was anything less than fantastic.  Your experience in the Bistro should have been one of the highlights of your stay.  Thank you for your comment in regards to the upgrades in your room.  We do take pride in our resort and make every attempt to keep it in excellent condition. I do know first hand that the guest room corridors are scheduled to be redone this year!    A sincere thank you for taking the time to share your experience with others, and we certainly hope your future vacation plans include a return to the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.

title: All I can say is wow!
review: If I was at a Days Inn paying ½ as much per night, I would have no complaints.  However, that is not the case.  The point is that for as much as the Sheraton charges, this hotel is simply not acceptable.  I will say the staff was friendly but pretty much everything else was a disappointment.  See other reviews: they charge you for absolutely everything extra!  If you are going to charge me what Sheraton charges, it is just plain tacky to charge your guests for wifi in the rooms and to use the average workout facilities.  I am surprised they didn’t charge me for towels at the pool.  The pool was small and lacking seating.  I don’t feel that for several hundred dollars a night, I should have to fight for a spot at the pool.  If you don’t have your towel on a chair by 9:00 am your…

title: Nice beach!
review: Do not understand the previous bad reviews, as: -this place was spotless, and I mean spotless -SO roomy, clean, spacious -room with view of the tennis courts/park/beach -the bathrooms looked entirely redone, and while the shower and toilet were separated from the sink by a door, we had not problem with this layout -comfy king bed -ample parking, nice pool scene, very nice beach scene  Some minor inconveniences: -watered down and way to expensive Mojitos & Corona at the bar -called from the room to extend our stay and were told that there were no avail. rooms; called their toll free # and extended our stay without a problem; I beg your pardon? -25$/day beach umbrella/chair rental -10$/day internet fee -$$$$ breakfast - kind of a small pool, but hey, we went for the beach …

title: Nicest, quietest stretch of beach; great for seashell collecting.
review: We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, and are honored to be your new vacation spot!  My apologies on the hotel staff not being able to accomodate your request to extend your stay.  There was either a mix up in our availablity, or it was an error on the part of our staff.  We have taken steps to ensure everyone is on the same page and apologize for the extra steps you had to take.    We do share all of our comments received with our staff.  Rest assured we will look into those mojitos!

title: excellent holiday
review: we have just spent 3 weeks here, the service was extremely good and all the staff were very friendly, we had a lovely room  but did however feel the bathrooms were too small and dated.the beach was superb with wonderful walks, the main problem was last week although it was spring break  the pool area was very overcrowded and this was exacerbated  by people  coming in from outside using the free car park and all the facilities of the pool.this area should be for residents only and  it really irritated us to see everyone just walking in unchallenged and enjoying the pool etc.

title: Nice Hotel
review: Thank you so much for choosing the Sheraton Sand Key Resort for your extended vacation!  We are truly glad you enjoyed your stay, and appreciate your comments about the service.  There are a few months out of the year where the size of our pool can be a challenge, and I can completely understand your frustration with non-hotel guests using the facilities.  We do have security on the parking lot, but we did not start that until the beginning of March.  I will certainly have your comments noted so we begin security a bit earlier next year. I can appreciate your comment on the size of the bathrooms, and it is an area that we intend to focus on in the upcoming year.  I hope that your future travels bring you back to the Clearwater Beach area, and that you will give us another opportunity to serve you.

title: Nice and Great Views
review: Lovely hotel, spotlessly clean.  Staff at checking in were very polite & helpful.  Room was a bit small but nice & clean.  Plenty of sunbeds to choose from only negative ting i would say is there wasn't much variety in poolside snack-bar.

title: Nothing shatters your privacy like hearing your neighbors.
review: The room could be a little quieter, but overall - Wonderful staff, nice rooms,  beautiful views. Definitely will return.

title: Not a good value...an average hotel at best. Very misleading website
review: The doors in this hotel are in need of an upgrade to close the notable gap under the door.  In standard rooms, the bathroom sink is only a couple feet by the front door, which means you may hear people walk down the hall while brushing your teeth.  The adjourning door in the room seems to be paper thin as well, and conversations next door can easily be heard.    Although rated 3.5 stars on expedia, without updating the doors and aging hallways, this hotel is a solid 3 stars.  While vacationing here, I switched from a 3rd floor no-view room to the 8th (top) floor ocean-view room.  This made a big difference in the brightness of the room.  The windows in the no-view room opens to constant shade and electric lighting is required even in the day time.  The ocean-view room offered a…

title: Not a friendly atmosphere
review: We stayed over during Christmas time. The staff (starting with the fron desk) were not very friendly and had an attitude. I even had instances where staff at the gym were rude. Not a welcoming and friendly atmosphere. And they charge for everything thing (internet is $10/day)

title: Beds are very uncomfortable & bathroom needs serious help!
review: I do apologize for the negative introduction you had to our resort. We try to instill into our guests the highest level of customer service and genuine concern for our guests. You obviously did not receive the type of treatment that we would expect our guests to receive. We take customer service issues very seriously and we thank you for informing us of the bad experience you had.   As for your concerns about charging for services, please allow me to explain further. We do no believe in charging our guests a nightly resort fee. We feel by doing this we essentially charge our guests for services they may not have a desire to use. We therefore only charge our guests for the services they choose to utilize. I hope this sheds some light on that concern.  Thank you for your comments about our resort and staff. We invite you to return to Sheraton on your return visit to Clearwater Beach so that we may be able to live up to your expectations of a resort hotel.

title: Like retuning to an old friend
review: When we come to the Clearwater area we try and on or near Clearwater Beach.  This time we decided to stay at the Sheraton since it was a good rate.  Our stay was for 4 nights and after the first night I wanted to go to a different hotel.  The room is way too small for 4 people and the bathroom is quite dysfunctional to say the least.  I went online and read other reviews since we have been back and the bathroom seems to be an issue with a lot of visitors but what strikes me is that the hotel says they don't know what to do - are you kidding me??? My 13 year old could give you a design within a minute!  The beds are extremely uncomfortable unless you like the hard as a rock type.  The carpets need to either be replaced or cleaned - my brand new white socks were filthy from just…

title: Great customer service at this hotel
review: It does not sound as if you had a positive stay with us, which is disappointing. The cleanliness concern you have brought to light is definitely an issue that is disturbing and by no means up to Sheraton standards.  You are right - we can do better than that and we should be 100% of the time.  We strive to clean our rooms thoroughly so that each guest arrives to a room that shows no signs of a previous guest. We have contacted the appropriate manager to ensure that this issue is corrected immediately. Our beds are the signature Sheraton Sweet Sleeper beds which were designed by the Sheraton brand with guest comfort in mind.  We understand that it may not be equally comfortable to all our guests and for that we are sincerely sorry.  As for the room size, our rooms are indeed standard size hotel rooms.  We agree that when compared to newer, more spacious hotel rooms, they can seem small.  We truly wish your stay with us had been more comfortable.    We are pleased there were some aspects of your stay that were positive. We hope this will not be your last trip to the area as all resorts in Clearwater truly believe this is a one of a kind destination. We would be honored if you would choose Sheraton again upon your return so that we may be able to live up to your expectations. If you choose not to we appreciate your business and we are sorry we could not make a positive lasting impression on you.

title: Enjoyed our Stay!
review: This was my 4th visit ,last there sep 2008 and 2 visits in the early 90s.I just love this place.The sheraton has 2 main strenths, location and the outstanding customer service from all of the staff.The staff have a wonderful way of making you feel special but in a friendly sincere way.The gulf view rooms are excellent and there is lots to do in the surrounding area.I have read some reviews complaining about the distance to the ocean ,i just dont understand this,if the ocean was any nearer you would have to swim out of your room.My advice go "sample the island life" you will love it",i have over the last 20 years.

title: Nice, but not overly nice.
review: The Sheraton Sand Key is nice, but we were not overly impressive.  The hallways leading to the rooms look a bit dated, the rooms are a nice size for two people with balconies, but the bathrooms are very small.  Definitely not room for two people.  The pool area is nice with a decent bar near the pool. We tried the hotel bar and restaurant for breakfast and dinner; both were good but a bit pricey (as most hotels are with food).  The gym is nice but there is a $7/day fee to use it. The Jolly Trolly picks up at the Sheraton and runs throughout Clearwater, which is a great way to get around.  It is $2/person each trip, or you can buy a daily pass for $4/person.  There is nothing overly great to say about this hotel, but we had a nice stay.

title: If there is one place to stay in Clearwater, It is the Sheraton Sand Key Resort
review: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. I’m sorry you were not “WOWed” by your stay as that is what we strive for at our resort. To comment on a couple of your concerns: our in room bathrooms are definitely one of our biggest weaknesses.  Our challenge is how to expand our restrooms without taking away from the living space in the room. While we are constantly trying to find new ways to more efficiently use the available space, the challenges have proven difficult to overcome.  Our pool and beach are, with out a doubt, our most valuable assets. It does not surprise me that you found this area nice, as this is a frequent comment from our guests. The pool bar does have several tasty beverages, and sometimes they’re just what you need to make a nice day of laying in the sun perfect. I am glad to hear you enjoyed our fitness center. While most hotels include the gym fee in a resort fee, we are of a different philosophy that you should only pay for the services you wish to receive, hence our fee to use the gym. The Jolly Trolley is an excellent service provided by the City of Clearwater and most guests find it much more convenient than driving in Clearwater Beach and finding it difficult to park.  Thank you very much for your comments.  We encourage feedback from our guests and appreciate you taking the time to share your experience.  I hope you’ll consider our resort again if you choose to visit Clearwater Beach in the future.

title: Perfect hotel for families
review: I have yet to stay in a place that is so friendly, so comfortable, and yet so luxurious.  We had the time of our lives at Sheraton Sand Key, and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a great get away.

title: Wonderful Weekend Escape
review: Thank you for the kind words. It is always heartwarming to hear that we have done everything right to leave a lasting impression with a guest. It is our goal each and every day. We hope you’ll pass along the great experience you had and we hope to see you on our beautiful shores again sooner rather than later.

title: Nice Hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel with our 1 1/2 year old in July of this year.  When we checked in we noticed that this was a very family oriented destination, which was perfect for us.  We were given our room, and the staff quickly provided us with a crib.  The room was nice and we had a great view.   I loved that we could just walk out to the beach in the morning and there always seemed to be enough beach chairs and umbrellas, unfortunately, it was quite pricey to reserve them.  The pool was a mob scene and it was pretty much impossible to find a chair near the pool, so it made the price of the beach chairs/umbrella worth it.  They definitely need an additional pool and/or more chairs.  We ordered room service one night from the nicer restaurant and the food was great.  I also liked…

title: Great hotel if visiting Clearwater Beach
review: I thank my lucky stars, I stayed at this beach front hotel instead of one of the ones actually on Clearwater Beach, because it was a holiday and boy was Clearwater Beach overcrowded.    The hotel was very nice and the room was very clean and recently updated.  Their private beach was great and very relaxing (note: using their fancy beach chairs was over $20 cash).  The pool area and its bar were also nice.  Staff was also excellent.  Didn't eat at the restaurants so no comment there.  A tip: if you want to go to the downtown Clearwater area for sunset at the pier or dinner, take the trolley; it's cheap and relieves you of parking woes.

title: Perfect Long Weekend Retreat
review: Thank you for expressing what we feel to be the best features of our resort!  We believe our serene grounds and location offer a peaceful retreat, yet for those times when you desire a little more action, we are an easy, convenient trolley ride away from the activities of Clearwater Beach.  It is almost the both of both worlds!  We are pleased to hear your stay was great and hope you will return again!

title: Great service and surprisingly good food!
review: My wife and I stayed four nights at the Sheraton Sand Key in October, and it would be difficult to improve on the experience we had. While our entire visit was great, the thing that kept popping into my head was the friendliness of everyone on the staff. Whether it was someone in the hall who unfailingly said hello and had a smile, or a staff member of whom we asked a question, the staff at the Sheraton was terrific.  We were looking for a hotel on the beach to stay for a few nights while taking a long weekend, and we booked this property through an airline package. It was the perfect distance from our home in Maryland, and we were very fortunate to have weather in the mid-80s during our entire stay. While the temperatures hovered around 85, there was a constant breeze on the…

title: The best Sheraton experience ever
review: Although I live in Tampa Bay I rarely get to Clearwater Beach. First time I had been to the Sheraton Sand Key and I was there as part of a conference. The facility itself is fine - nothing special - but the level of service we received from everyone from the General Manager to the bell hops was outstanding. Many people at the conference were commenting on the excellent service.  I'm not often very impressed with 'hotel food,' but the meals at Rusty's, the on-site restaurant, were not only very good, but again the service from the chefs and wait staff was exceptional. Definitely would recommend for any type of event you're planning.

title: Great location right on the beach!  I was...
review: There is not enough space here to tell you all of the positive things. I was here for a meeting and I had my 6 year old and wife come along. The entire staff (hskp, fd, pool, bell/con, restaurant...) is friendly and attentive. They follow-up on everything and do what it takes to make things right. Rusty's for dinner is very good- and I never recommend hotel restaurants. The crab cakes are some of the best I have had anywhere- the service in the restaurant is excellent. DId I mention how friendly everyone was at the hotel and restaurant? This was my best experience at a Sheraton- in fact one of my best stays at any hotel. I hate admitting that the hotel restaurant is good, but  it really is worth your time. I hope you all enjoy this hotel as much as we did.  A few (sort of) cons:…

title: Just an overall nice property with good...
review: Just an overall nice property with good service and amenities. The rooms are well appointed with large flat screen tv and good bedding. Pool are is nice and offers a walk up covered grill and outdoor bar with 2 flatscreens. The beach is big and wide open - very relaxing. Good lobby bar and restaurant with free PC and printing capability.  Enjoy!

title: Wonderful hotel on the beach
review: So happy to hear your recent stay with us was enjoyable.  It sounds like you had an opportunity to enjoy several of our amenities - and relax on our wide open beach.  Thank you for choosing our resort, and we hope you will return soon!!

title: Nice, quiet resort.
review: We stayed here for four nights and enjoyed the resort quite a bit. Nice rooms, view of pool and beach, decent restaurants, lovely pool area.   As mentioned before the gulf water is a ways from the hotel. No bathrooms except at the hotel or the nearby Sand Key Park. But it is a lovely beach and you can walk forever. Tons of beautiful shells.  The only complaint I have is the room's bathroom. I usually stay away from Sheratons because they don't seem to pay much attention to detail. They are now renovating many hotels and have done so here but they did not improve the bathroom. Toilet and bath/shower in cramped little room. Sink area very small. Shower water goes from cool to scalding hot back and forth during a five minute shower. These are things that could have been remedied.  …

title: Nice hotel...........150yd walk to beach
review: I am glad to hear you enjoyed your stay and our large beach, it is one of our biggest assets. The shelling is wonderful and you can walk for what seems like years down the barrier island before turning back. Our bathroom is a different story. While we have renovated and updated our rooms, our physical structure is still over 35 years old and limits how we can allocate space in our rooms. For that I apologize. We are continually looking for more efficient ways to use the space effectively. As for the fluctuations in water temperature, these are fixable problems that I will forward on to the appropriate department to remedy. Thank you very much for your comments. Without your concerns we cannot improve our establishment to meet our guests' standards. We hope you will choose Sheraton Sand Key Resort again should you return to Clearwater Beach so that we may make a better impression.

title: Perfect place for a beach wedding
review: Loved our stay at Sand Key resort.  Nice room, great view of the ocean and dining available in the hotel or within walking distance. The beach was quiet and fairly empty during our stay.  My only negative comment is, skip the breakfast buffet and walk to Maggie Mae's which is a five minute walk from the resort.  It was fast, fresh, hot and delicious!  We also had lunch in the little lunch cafe in the resort and was pleased with out selections.  We chose to have dinner at various other local establishments.

title: John Agliano - Asst GM that helps sets service excellance!
review: Before booking I read the thread of comments and was a bit apprehensive, but no more after staying there. I am a Starwood member who was supposed to stay with colleagues at the Hyatt but stayed at the Sheraton. They were wonderful even though busy with conventions. John Agliano, on hearing it was our 34th anniversary, blocked a great room overlooking the pool and ocean, gave us privileges for the 9th floor concierge and health club level ad a bottle of champagne to celebrate. Service was wonderful from John checking up on us, to Bob who gave us maps and directions, to our housekeeping person,  to Peggy who is incredible on the 9th floor with all sorts of useful information as well as being super friendly, courteous and just plain nice. It’s a great location right on the beach…

title: Very comfortable property with private beach
review: I selected the Sheraton because it was very difficult to get a feel for the other hotels based solely on their websites. This seemed like a safe bet and it was. I actually didn't make a reservation, but had the Sheraton in mind in case I got stuck in the Clearwater area, which I did.   The Sand Key area is just down the road from Clearwater Beach. It's a short trolley ride or a walk over a bridge--kind of a long walk. The Sheraton is located directly on its own private beach (The Marriott Suites property is across the street). The water is a distance from the hotel, because the sand in the area has accumulated and caused all of the beachfront properties to gain an enormous sand area.   The Sheraton website advertises the first several tiers of rooms as having a "parking lot…

title: perfect setting
review: this hotel is fabulous the staff are wonderful they couldnt do enough for you we were upgraded to the 6th floor and the club level for free and what a veiw of the pool/beach i dont know why people say its a long walk to the beach the hotel is on the beach but it is 5mins to the sea  the rooms are large  very clean and tidy  the beds are comfy and yes the bathrooms are small but have everything you need overall this is a fab hotel with a great location would stay again would highly recomend this hotel peggy on the club level was very helpful and knew all the local area and the restaraunt in the hotel was very good

title: Exactly what you would expect from a Sheraton resort hotel
review: Thank you for the compliments. We always like to hear when we are doing right by our guests. We hope you will come back and visit us again the next time you are in the Clearwater Beach area.

title: Family Get away Labor Day
review: The Sheraton Sand Key is ideally located for the excellent beach and provides good family amenities including swimming pool, tennis and beach volleyball, and pool table and Wii games for indoors.  The hotel was full during our stay due to an FBI convention, but other than lots of uniforms and some fairly loud evening partying in the room next door, this wasn't really a problem.  We ate out most nights but also ate in the bar one evening. The service was excellent and the food of a good quality.  In general the staff were all very courteous and helpful, with special mention to our hostess in the Sheraton Club lounge who went out of her way to accommodate our late evening arrival and to make sure we had everything we needed at breakfast.  Great tips on local beaches and places to…

title: nice  hotel on lovely sandkey island
review: This was our second extended stay at this hotel. The hotel is located in a beautiful area of Clearwater Beach. In comparing our stay this year to last years stay, I must say we noted changes in the cleanliness of the hotel and quality of the service.  It would be a shame if this hotel spirals downhill.  We noticed several times that our room was not vacuumed and the bathtub was not cleaned daily.  The pool area is not secured. On several occasions we witnessed  people using the pool who were not guests. There is no hotel guest ID system in place and people are coming in off the street and using the facilities.

title: Nice secluded hotel
review: I am sorry to hear that your stay was not as you experienced in the past. We always become concerned when previous guests find our hotel to not reach the standards of their previous stay. I apologize for the lackadaisical cleaning of your room as that does not live up to the standards we instill in our associates. We are aware of the potential security issues than can occur on our pool deck. As such, we do have pool attendants on staff to try and minimize the use of our facilities by non-guests; I apologize if a few slipped through the cracks as obviously our amenities are reserved for hotel guests only. As always, thank you for informing us of your concerns. They will be addressed immediately. We hope you will choose us again in the future so that we may live up to the standards expected of us.

title: lovely views, nice beach
review: This hotel was very nice and clean. The rooms were good. The beds were very comfortable. My only disappointment was the walk to the beach. It was a few feet out and as we were walking to the beach the sand was hot and muddy, it felt and looked like we were walking in urine water. The beach itself was nice but had a lot of seashells so make sure you wear beach shoes. The pool was nice but for the size of the hotel it is very small and was always packed.
