Room service was good but the pizza was not all that great for the price. Overall the stay was good, but if you are looking for the action I suggest you stay closer to Clearwater beach. The drive is short, about 3 minutes, but trying to find public parking is a pain. Personally for the price you are paying here, I would rather pay…

title: Short but so sweet
review: We are so sorry to hear your stay was marred by the water left on the beach!  We had just been through an unprecedented 5 days of rain...and the beach did become so saturated, even our pumps had to work over time.   While this is by no means a common occurrence, we do struggle with this problem when met with extended periods of inclement weather and we work diligently to try and return our beach to its pristine condition. We're glad the rain cleared and you were able to enjoy the pool as well as some of our dining options.  We appreciate your feedback on the pizza as well as the size of the pool as we do take our guest comments to heart.  It is the feedback from our guests' that lets us know where we need to improve our products and services.   Our resort is situated between the Sand Key Park and Preserve and private condo residences.  We  like to  think of our location as  having the best of both worlds. Our serene and secluded location is only minutes from the action of Clearwater Beach. We understand that our seclusion is not ideal for some guests and for those seeking the adventure that Clearwater Beach offers, the Jolley Trolley service is available at our property to escort you around Clearwater Beach  instead of dealing with the parking issues of the public beach.  The trolley picks up right from the hotel and has several convenient stops up and down Clearwater Beach.  I apologize if we did not communicate this service to you effectively.  While we hope you will choose our resort in your return to Clearwater Beach, we understand that location is a matter of preference.  Thank you again for your feedback.

title: great service, pool, and meeting
review: We took a trip to clearwater for two nights to get away from the hustle and bustle of orlando and checked in on speck at the sheraton sand keys resort.  The reception was nice and airy but the corridors leading to rooms and rooms themselves are ok but could do with a face lift. They were not worn but not really inviting. The pool area was reasonable, the pool going to 81/2 ft deep.  There is a bar and a food bar. The beach looks lovely it is a 2 min stroll to the sea n sun beds (which cost $25 for 2 beds n umbrella per day) The beach area is cleaned regularly but get to the sea n there is a lot of sea weed which is not cleaned away. They also warn of sting rays in the sand which were spotted when we were there - so take some wet shoes. We didn't eat breakfast but did eat an…

title: If you want a hotel on Clearwater Beach, use this one
review: This trip was my third stay at the Sheraton Sand Key. My family and I normally stay here for a couple of nights then drive up to Orlando for the remainder of our holiday. Because we are only there for a couple of nights, the 3 times I have stayed there we haven't actually ate there or spent a lot of time looking around in the hotel. But all that matters is the room was lovely, 4 of us stayed in 1 with 2 double beds, was spacious enough for us. Our balcony was overlooking the tennis court and other hotels and to the left was the view of the beach and sea, lovely ! The pool is also lovely and the Jacuzzi relaxing. There is a pool bar with excellent strawberry smoothies ! There is also a little place where you can get bits to eat such as sandwiches located next to the pool. The…

title: Beautiful area, comfy beds, great food!
review: We really enjoyed our stay here.  The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable.  I loved the breakfast buffet.  The hotel has plenty of food options - really, you don't even have to leave.    Though the hotel is on the beach, to actually get to the water is a hike.  If you need to go back to the hotel to use the restroom, don't wait until the last minute!  Also, the pool gets pretty packed later in the day, so make sure you stake out your pool chairs early in the morning - maybe spend some time in the pool in the morning and on the beach in the afternoon.  The only complaint I have is the charge for internet service.  For the price you pay for this hotel, I really think it should be included.

title: Promises, promises - very disapointed
review: We was there for the weekend. Fri-Sun. The hotel is very well located on a wonderful beach. We had booked a room with partial view to the beach: all we saw was a tenniscourt - nothing else. At night we heard every single word our neighbours said. The doors between the rooms were thin like paper. Twice in less than 24 hours we had a false alarm because of fire. the first night we ran down the stairs just to hear that it was a false alarm. The hotel did not officially inform. The next night, the same thing happend again..... Rooms are old and need a decoration. And finally we had to pay for internet access - very expensive!!!! I cannot recommend it at all.

title: not impressed
review: The hotel was well situated on sand key with a beautiful beach but the hotel itself was a bit of a let down. I was travelling with husband and student daughter (you know, the messy kind), so had booked a room for three people. The room was ok but a bit on the small size for three to share, the balcony was crowded with one person on so we didn't even attempt to all sit out at the same time (only two chairs anyway!!). The bathroom OMG, compact would be an accurate description, but at least the shower was lovely and warm. There was tea/coffee making facilities in the room but it was a perculator type setup so you could only make one drink at a time (into starbucks type cardboard cups) and they kept forgetting that we had three people in our room because they kept leaving just two…

title: Great place for sun and sand.  No oil.
review: First of all, this review is all almost all positive (which is unusual for me).  When we arrived at the hotel the check in was quick and pleasant, our room was very nice and had a decent view (though we booked a lower price room) and the room was very well decorated and appointed.  We immediatlety headed for the pool and were able to find a couple of chairs despite the large crowd.  Towels? Check.  Fruity rum drink? Check.  Live surf guitar music? Check.  Sitting by the pool was a great way to unwind the stress of traveling.  The beach is large and very pretty.   We later enjoyed the hotel bar which had tapas and free appetizers prior to heading out for an event.   They have free wi-fi in the bar/lobby and have a Sheraton branded internet/computer center which is nice, but still…

title: Relaxing!!
review: We found this resort to be very relaxing.  The staff is wonderful!  Everyone was very nice and helpful.  The rooms are clean and comfy.  Nice big closet and lots of drawer space.  We could have used a small table with chairs as we chose to eat lunch and breakfast in the room.  You can get a small refrigerator for $5 a night which isn't bad.  And there is a perfect spot for it under the counter with the coffee pot and ice bucket.  The pool can get a bit crowded but very nice.  One end is about 8ft deep so there aren't too many little kids down there if you want to just relax in the water.  They also have a nice big hot tub.  Plenty of chairs out by the pool and towards the beach area.  You can get towels out there as well which is nice not having to lug the ones from the room. …

title: A great getaway to an oil-free Gulf beach resort
review: The Sheraton Sand Key Resort exceeded my expectations.  The ample poolside seating and the large size of the pool itself were well-received by our family, as we’re used to heading out and staking our seats early in the morning to ensure we have a place to sit when we’re actually ready to go poolside.  No need to do that here.  There were options to sit immediately poolside in loungers, nearby in umbrella-covered tables, and there were even grassy areas around with loungers for those seeking a more “zen” feel.  The kids playground on-site was perfectly located.  Food options were fantastic and vast.  The breakfast buffet offered all the options at reasonable prices and it’s a plus that kids eat free!  Inside the hotel, there’s a fine dining restaurant, a more loungy/bar…

title: great hotel, superior service
review: We really enjoyed our stay.  We read some of the negative comments before our trip; however, we encountered no difficulties and thoroughly enjoyed our vacation.  Rooms are nice and beds are very comfortable (always a plus).  Pool is nice and there are plenty of chairs.  The bathroom was not too small as there was a counter wit sink and mirror outside the bath area for getting dressed.

title: Perfect wedding location, great service.
review: We arrived at about 9pm after the hour or so drive from Orlando Airport. The hotel has a big car park that is free to guests so we had no problem finding a space. We walked into the lobby which, to our relief, was very well air-conditioned. We were immediately greeted by the friendly lady on reception who made us feel very welcome. Our room was a decent size with a beautiful view of the Gulf of Mexico, over looking the pool. It was never noisy even with the busy pool being in such close proximity. The balcony was big enough for all 3 of us to stand on but it wasn't huge, we couldn't have all had breakfast out there for example. Our room had a huge LCD TV with HD channels as standard. We didn't watch it much but it was great for catching the odd World Cup game. The rooms were…

title: WOW - Something for everyone in the family
review: I can not put our thanks into the proper words for such a wonderful weekend at the Sheraton Sand Key.  We felt like we were 1000 miles away from home even though it was only 10 miles.  The hospitality and facility could not have been better.  I loved the view of the inter-coastal with the boats and to view the triathlon.  The club pass was an unexpected treat and Peggy was a joy to watch serve the guests and interact with; she turned us on to Guppy’s just up the road which is now our new favorite restaurant.  We were supposed to leave late Saturday because the boys served at 7am mass in St. Pete Beach but we all voted on getting up a 5:30am to make mass then returned for breakfast and a ½ day back on the beach and by the pool.  We truly did not want to leave.  It is the most…

title: Overpriced
review: No refrig  No microwave  small room   very small bath    view of roof  and noise from roof airconditioners comfortable beds   Overpriced!

title: Great Hotel - GREAT location!
review: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key over Memorial Day weekend.  My husband has stayed there a few times before but this was my first time.  It is a very lovely, clean and quiet hotel with extremely friendly service.  The location is great It is right on the gorgeous white sand beach.  It is a hike to the water as the beach is so long so would not work for people in wheelchairs or who have trouble walking but otherwise no problem.  Sand Key was perfect as it was not so crowded and noisey as some other parts of Clearwater Beach.  We highly recommend this hotel as a great vacation spot!

title: Good...but could be a lot better.
review: Good location...very easy to get to from Tampa Airport and away from the craziness of Clearwater Beach. Trolley is very convenient. Hotel very clean and the service great. Two major issues...the walls are very thin and even normal neighbor conversations could be heard through the walls. The beach is beautiful...but the sand is made up of shells and very crunchy...wear beach shoes...the walk is a long from the hotel (but pretty). I wasn't impressed by the sand quality. If you want better sand...go to the beaches on Clearwater Beach...however the trade-off is the crowds are worse and more juvenile up there. The beach location is quiet and extremely scenic compared to the Pier 60 area. Hotel staff were great, friendly and we had no issues whatsoever. Make sure you request a gulf…

title: It was like I was in a commercial for how a hotel should be
review: I stayed at this hotel 2 years ago and thought it was the best hotel experience I have ever had.  I just returned from Myrtle Beach, S.C. and felt compelled to write a review about the hotel where we stayed.  It was NOT good. I recall someone telling me once that people will write letters to complain but rarely to praise. So, I want to praise. (better late than never) Everything about my stay was fantastic. It is a shame that we are surprised by great service these days, but I really was!  We felt like looking for the hidden camera, as if we were being used in a commercial. We were treated like we were the only guests there. The entire staff could not have been more friendly or more accomodating.  By the end of our stay we were on a first name basis with some of them.  I will…

title: A Faithful Get Away - Love the Beachfront
review: I'm almost reluctant to let others know that this is one of our favorite weekend getaways on the East Coast.  The hotel is a solid Sheraton and as other reviewers note, some rooms are better than others.  Our most recent stay overlooked the parking lot, but had longer views of the Bay...which was impressive at sunrise.  Our room was very comfortable and relaxing.  The beach at Sand Key is white sand and we spent an entire day under our rented umbrella and chairs.  The drinks from the poolside bar are quite tasty and the selection is festive.  Who knew you could do so many different things with coconut rum?  I can't speak to the concerns about taking kids to the resort, but for a couple of adults who need to reconnect with nature and one another - it's a perfect escape.

title: Comfortable but Older
review: My DH was here for work in Tampa so I was left without a car. This is an older hotel that needs updating but over all clean & comfortable. I will state that the bathroom is BEYOUND SMALL!! If you like a nice size private bathroom, this is NOT the place for you. That is one thing that would keep us from returning.  If you stay here take advantage of the trolley system to get around. You can look around & traveling by myself for 2 days, I felt very safe.  Hotel was full for a teacher convention. Alot of them must have brought their families & the kids seemd to enjoy themselves be it in the pool or on the HUGE white beach area. Nice but  is away from the hub-bub if you want that. Remember, the trolley will take you to Clearwater Beach, publix, & down to St. Pete. No need to worry…

title: BEWARE OF THIS HOTEL.
review: Thank you for posting your comments and providing us with feedback on your recent stay.  We appreciate your thoughts about our location as we consider ourselves to have the "best of both worlds".  Our setting away from the center of Clearwater Beach does provide a more secluded and serene feeling, while the trolley can put our guests in the middle of it "all".  We're glad you found the trolley system safe, convenient and easy to use as we do consider it to be a great benefit to our guests.  The size of our bathrooms is indeed a challenge.  We continue to discuss various ways to increase the size of the bathroom while not taking away from the rest of the guest room.  Your feedback is important to us as we do try to improve our product and services based on comments from our guests.  Thank you for taking the time to pass your thoughts along to us.

title: Average hotel; $$$$; comfortable beds
review: I am a platinum SPG member, I am so disappointed in this hotel.  Maybe it is Sheratons in general.  This hotel is so dated, the soundproofing SUCKS and the bathrooms are a joke.  The staff is rather clueless and here it is on a saturday night, I have a 3 and 5 year old and there is a massive party outside.  we are on the 8th floor and it is like the speakers are right here with us.  When I called and said i wish someone would have told us there is a dance party USA every saturday night, i was told,  too bad.  So...needless to say...  i will never stay at this hotel.  stay at your own RISK.

title: great choice for spring break w/ teenagers
review: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  We take great pride in our resort and are disappointed to hear your stay was not enjoyable.  In regard to our physical building, it is indeed over 35 years old, and while we can not change the configuration of the guestroom and bathroom, we do try very hard to keep the hotel updated and equipped with the latest amenities.  We also apologize for the fact that our staff failed to handle your issues appropriately.   The hotel across the channel is equipped with a club and is not normally an issue. Unfortunately, there are certain times when it seems the weather conditions do sometimes direct more noise towards our property.  Again, we apologize for your uncomfortable stay and we appreciate your honest feedback as we use all guest comments as a training tool.  Your comments will most certainly be reviewed with our management team and staff.

title: This Place is Paradise
review: Avoid rooms - 213, 216, 313, & 316 unless you do not want a view and enjoy noise from the elevators and people walking on ceramic tile.  [The hotel employees know how bad the rooms are, and joke about it.]  These rooms should only be assigned as a last result with full disclosure to the potential occupants.  Within minutes of moving into our room, we found blood stains on the inside of the comforter.  We reported it to the front desk and a new comforter was dropped off.  No one from management ever called to apologize during our week long stay.   All the hotel employees were nice, and Adrianna/ front desk was very helpful and professional.  For good, affordable Italian food, go to LaGondola which is across the bridge from the hotel.   Small bathrooms; 200 yards from hotel to…

title: Returned home completely relaxed.
review: I've been reading the other reviews of the Sand Key Resort.  Some of the other visitor complaints aren't fair but some of them are.  So please read on... We started off the beginning of our vacation in a suite at the Clearwater Beach Hilton.  That part of town was too touristy and crowded for my liking so we switched a couple days later to the Sand Key Resort (just 2 miles down the coast (over one bridge).  What a difference that made.  The pool isn't an Olympic Sized one but it is still pretty wonderful.  It has two stair entrances and two ladder entrances.  I found it especially pretty and soothing.  My two boys, 8 & 5, loved every minute spent in it especially our 10pm dip the last day.  There is a smaller kiddie pool which my 5 year old who is learning to swim loved as well.…

title: When we first arrived, we were checked in...
review: When we first arrived, we were checked in by a woman who had an attitude with us. We didn't get the room we ordered. The room is fine just the bathroom is really tiny. Workers seriously cleanat 5Am. No good sleep. Food is good at the restaurants except rusty has a piano guy who seems like he is playing random keys and it is loud. The pool and jacuzzi is overflown with kids. The beach is nice although it is a walk, it is beautiful. You do have to pay for beach chairs. The sand does have crushed shells so wear sandals. Service is bad. Give a good tip to the bellhops because they are all scary and they have anger issues.

title: Wonderful Family trip!!
review: The hotel is beautiful, clean and the customer service is fabulous.  We went with our 15 year old daughter and there were children of all ages, from new born to adult children with their parents.  It was Spring Break 2010 and I am sure the hotel was full but never seemed overcrowded.  They decorated for Easter, had an Easter Egg hunt for the kids, it was fabulous.  The restaurant and bar staff was great.  We had a lovely stay.  All of the surrounding areas are kept so clean and the grounds of the Sheraton are beautiful.  My husband and I had been there 18 years ago and it is just as nice today as it was then.  Thank you for an amazing trip and we will be back. :)

title: Disappointing hotel but great beds and friendly staff!
review: I thought this hotel was going to be really nice, but there is absolutely nothing about it worth the price paid.  Good points being the wonderful Sheraton beds and the very friendly staff.  Everything else was disappointing, it looked dated, the pool is tiny, dark restautants with no windows.  If I'm paying for a beach front hotel I like the restaurants to be open near the beach with windows.  The pool side snack bar I thought was going to be ideal but it only serves junk food.  Room had a view of three industrial air conditioners - we  asked to be moved twice but it never happened.  I wouldn't stay there again.  Surey there must be better options in the area for $300.  If you want to be doing things eg boat trips from Clearwater there is a real problem with parking so you need…

title: Wonderful stay - great staff, but hotel has a few flaws
review: We stayed 3 nights at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort - booked it because we could use all points, making for an inexpensive, late winter getaway.  I didn't have high expectations because of the mixed reviews, but must say we were VERY PLEASED with our stay and would recommend it to others.  The staff was wonderful throughout the hotel.  We were given a room with a view of the beach (which we weren't expecting) and had an issue with the in-room safe (basically, I forgot the combination).  Staff was very responsive - came within minutes to fix it, and wouldn't accept a tip.  The rooms were clean and beds, as always, oh so comfy.  Pluses:  great food at the Mainstay Tavern, pool table and tennis courts (for the teens), free parking, beachfront location.  Minuses: small pool, poor…

title: Very family friendly, excellent layout of pool, & deep beach front
review: Unlike most hotels at Clearwater beach, this one has an incredibly large beachfront, is positioned next to a preserved nature park, and turtles have been nesting on this beach for many years too.  I would recommend this hotel for anyone - both with or without kids.  Its also positioned away from the busy main part of Clearwater beach, since this is just minutes away, over the bridge in a more quieter, serene part called Sand Key.  We've been here before and would come again.

title: Everything you need in one place!
review: I stayed here for a girl's get away with my mother, sister, and 18 mo. old nephew. Aside from cool and rainy weather, this was a great trip. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The bathroom is tiny but the shower / toilet are seperate from the sink area. The pool area was very nice with plenty of chairs. There was a small shallow baby pool and a hot tub as well. The "resort" has three restaraunts, a poolside snack bar, and a 24 hour convenience shop inside it. I find this extremely appealing since I like to spend as much time at the pool & beach as possible - who wants to get dressed and drive somewhere for lunch in the middle of your day? The food was very good and typical price ranges for a hotel of this calliber ( expect $9 - $12 for sandwiches). They had a great little…

title: We had a wounderfull wedding and holiday
review: When we booked this holiday we wanted it to be special as we would be getting married there.   All the staff on reception where so helpfull.  The wedding co ordinator was fantastic so help full, she could not do enough for us. Our room was clean and every thing we might need was in there, it would have been a bit nicer if we had a bit more room (myself, my husband and our 3 girls,ages 13, 10 and 8) as we had to have a "roll bed" we did fold the bed up every morning to give us more room. Our wedding day was just as we wanted, so relaxed with beautifull weather. All our meals in the hotel where of a very high standard. I cant wiat to go back soon

title: It's the Staff that make it special
review: Whilst I was here on business, I would certainly return here with the family for vacation. Great location over the bridge from the main part of the resort but right on a wonderful sandy beach.  Room was comfortable and had everything I expected and needed. Bar and restaurant(s) equally good and we found it difficult to drag ourselves away to eat elsewhere.  I found the staff very welcoming, from the bell man, reception or the bar staff. There also always seemed to be management walking the floor and greeting guests. I had a feeling of a family run hotel yet this was a large Sheraton property.   I'll be back.

title: Great, Great, Great
review: I stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key for business. They staff was friendly and helpful! The hotel is located in a quiet part of Clearwater, FL where you can go for a calming walk or job in the morning.

title: Just fine if you are not expecying 4 stars
review: All of the reviews here are accurate.  The hotel is a little tired and noisy, and it does have a very wierd setback from the beach and rooms that overlook a convention center roof and parking lot.  It also is a great location, woth a little distance from the frat party scenec on Clearwater Beach, and it does front a beautoful stretch of the gulf coast.  If you are paying top $ and expecting 4 stars you will be disappointed.  If you are there at an off peak rate and expecting and average hotel in a nice location you will be satisfied.

title: Pleased
review: I traveled with a friend of mine to Clearwater Beach for a winter getaway last December.  We chose the Sheraton Sand Key from Travelocity as it looked like a good buy for the money...and it was.  We were very pleased with it.    For starters, getting to Clearwater Beach ("CB")  from the Tampa Airport was kind of a challenge.  We had initially booked a taxi through Tampa Flat Rate Taxi which is a JOKE!  Don't do it!  We ended up having to wait in the airport for an additional hour upon arrival in hopes the taxi company could find someone who would give us a ride to CB for the rate the website quoted.  Its a weird deal!  Anyway, on the way back to Tampa, we booked a car through the hotel ($65 one way) but it was a luxury car (not a death cab ride) and you could name the time you…

title: Nice location, good people, good food, needs updates
review: I have stayed here for several years.  The location is lovely with direct access to a large beach adjacent to Sand Key Park.  I always come for meetings off season.  The food and staff are excellent, but rooms are a little disappointing.  The ones facing the beach are best, but often I am stuck with a view of the roof of the kitchen and parking lot.  Kind of pricey for that view. The one year I took a guest I asked to be moved and got a better view the next day.  If you can get a beach view then the room it is worth it, if not I'd stay elsewhere. The staff is friendly and aim to please, good food and good service. Also I hate paying for internet access

title: Very Nice Stay
review: I tripped here recently for a business trip during Florida's recent cold spell.  The cold did put a damper on the trip, but my stay at the hotel was excellent.  Here's my thoughts...  Hotel is in an excellent location right on the beach in Clearwater.  Took a taxi from the Tampa airport and with the tip it was around $60.  I would recommend the shuttle service.  I talked to several people who used that and said the roundtrip shuttle fare was around $45.  Check in at the front desk was quick.  Overall, I found all the staff to be very friendly and go out of their way to help you out.  My bags came in late and the conceirge was kind enough to bring it up to my room at 2:30am.  The room I stayed in was clean and looked updated.  The heating/ac unit was controlled via a digital wall…

title: Great location, service.  Amenities are overated
review: As most of the reviews have pointed out the location of the hotel is fantastic. If you get an ocean facing room, the views are gorgeous. Not a multi rise like some of the other beachfront hotels. The service is great - we had a room close to the elevators and asked for a room change due to the excessive noise during the night and they complied and even moved our baggage when we were not around. They have a good bar - mainstay lounge that is open late. The bar has a friendly atmosphere and like other resorts it is common and easy to strike up a conversation. The bartenders are friendly and tend to remember you if you come on successive days  On the cons, the amenities are definitely overated. The pool area is small. The poolside bar is a little separated from the pool area and is…

title: We stay here every year (almost)
review: My wife and I have been to this resort 5 times in the last 7 years.  We love it.  Good service, great beach, great location.  The only thing that could make it better would be a larger pool and pool area.

title: Get the Buffet Breakfast Package.
review: Stayed here for three days in early December.This is the "off season", so Clearwater was dead.Still better than Michigan in December.They gave me a late check out of 1:30 p.m. at no extra charge.Room was great.Strong water pressure in the shower and even stronger hair dryer.Got a room with a view of the tennis courts, but you can still see the Gulf of Mexico just fine.Think this side of the hotel is more quiet than the pool side, but no sunset  view from these rooms.You get the feeling there are  more people here on buisness than vacation.Lots of conferences and meetings going on.Recommend purchasing the breakfast buffet package with your room.It's normally $14.00 per person. Some of the best bacon I've ever had.Home style potatoes,scrammbled eggs,french toast,pancakes,biscuits…

title: Great hotel, very enjoyable stay
review: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in early November & found it to be very nice.  The rooms are a good size (yes the bathrooms are small but they are functional), staff were excellent & a lovely location right on the beach. The local area is a little quiet, but that was what we wanted so it suited us perfectly.  We used it as a place to chill out & do a little exploring from. For the people in other reviews who complained about the distance of the hotel to the beach, I totally disagree with them. The hotel is right on the beach.  Yes you need to walk a little to get to the shoreline, but for us, that's half the enjoyment.  We love strolling on the beach, especially one as pretty as this. We only ate one meal at the hotel & that was good - the size of portion of mine which was…

title: Shabby Chic???
review: This hotel is in a nice location, just south of the over-commercialized Clearwater Beach, directly on the beach next to a park.  I was on a business trip, and unfortunately didn't get to use the amenities (or even the beach). However, the pool, spa and beach looked very nice.  I did use the huge spa one night.  The water's edge is a good little walk, but then the snow-white sand was an invitation to enjoy the chairs and umbrellas beachside.  The hotel, typical of a so-called resort, nickels-and-dimes you to death for internet access, local calls, etc.  My room was a very good value, maybe because it was mid November, and included a very nice breakfast buffet.  At this time of year, at least, I noticed few children around.  For the most part the staff was very friendly and…

title: Great Location, Great Service
review: It has been a while since I have stayed at this hotel, and it is still as good as I remember it!  One of the best atributes of this hotel is its location.  A short walk and you are at waters edge of the Gulf and being on Sand Key, it is a quiet location and very relaxing.  The room was clean and well lit.  Nice flat screen HDTV with good selection of channels Comfortable bed and pillows.   I also enjoy sitting on the balcony  The bathroom was clean as well.  I had a sixth floor room and the water pressure in the shower was actually good.  The bathroom size is a little on the small side.  The wireless internet worked well but I am begining to tire of paying for it, especially at upscale hotels when it is free at most low to mid priced hotels.

title: Nice beachfront convention hotel
review: We arrived late and without a reservation and were pleased to get a room on a Friday night.  The rooms are average/updated and the bathrooms are standard to small.  The rooms are nicer than the public spaces, which are geared towards meetings and large numbers of people, and feel somewhat worn.  The reception and restaurant staff were great.  The restaurant dinner was quite good (not the buffet).  The pool area seems nice.  The beach is LARGE, and the reason we chose this hotel.  $7 for use of the fitness center seems high.

title: Fantastic Beach location, Pool too small.
review: Great location, right on Sand Key, just far enough away from the main drag of Clearwater Beach.  Beach is the main attraction, warm clear water (oh yes) with dolphins 30 yards out most afternoons. 300 yard walk from hotel to sea, but hey, no big deal. Hotel is slightly dated but rooms were fine. We had a sea view (paid for it), otherwise yoiu're looking at the car park (Free!). Plenty of dining options, from pool bar to Rustys (proper cuisine). Mainstay Tavern was good for beers and bar food ( & free Wi-Fi). We didn't bother much in the hotel as we had plenty of recommendations outside. Crabby Bills in Clearwater was excellent. Apparently the Pizza takeaway at the nearby "Shoppes at Sand Key" was pretty good but every time we tried to to get a pizza they were closed/closing.…

title: Not up to Starwood Standards
review: This is first time I have been disappointed in a Starwood property.  The people that work there are fantastic.  That's where the good things end.  If you are with a family with small children, please stay somewhere else.  Although the walk to the ocean is tolerable for adults, it's too far for young children.  Let's talk rooms.  The bed is comfortable and the living space is a little under average.  However, the bathroom area is a joke.  We had to have the coffee maker removed in order to have enough space on the counter for our toiletries.  You could not sit on the toilet and shut the door and there is zero space between the toilet and shower (the sink is outside the actual bathroom).  The "resort" will also charge you $5 a day for a mini-fridge and wanted $24.95 for 3 days of…

title: Excellent accommodation for the business traveler
review: This hotel was beautiful, well-maintained and very well-staffed. Rooms were spacious and nicely furnished. Pool and beach areas were lovely. Food provided to our group was excellent and very generous. An added bonus - the meetings rooms were COMFORTABLE - not freezing cold. It was such a pleasure to work there. Only a two-day meeting, I'm sure not long enough to properly investigate all the amenities of this beautiful location.

title: Very Thin Walls!
review: The hotel is quite lovely, I will admit.  The rooms are fresh and clean. HOWEVER...if you are the type of person that requires a good nights sleep...beware! The walls truly are "paper thin"  In this day and age, I don't understand how this is possible. I can only imagine that they cut corners. You will hear your neighbors toilets flushing, alarms going off, voices, noises (of all kinds) showers and doors slamming through the night. The gaps under the doors also let in much too much light. The last nights stay I left at 4:00am just to get some sleep at the airport!  I am usually the one that raves about hotels and 90% of the time I have no complaints.  This hotel will be on top of my list of not getting a good nights sleep. One other thing...if you arrive later than 9:00pm you…

title: Sheraton Sand Key - a home away from home!
review: This is a great hotel a little off the beaten path in Clearwater Beach, Florida.  Sitting right on the beach you have spectacular views of the Gulf of Mexico especially if you are lucky enough to get a room at the end of the hotel.  It has very nice pool and spa grounds and although it is quite a walk to get to waters edge, it is worth the walk.  Located in more of a residental area, it has everything you would need in a beach hotel; two gift shops, several restaurants, a business center and the most friendly staff ever.  I was there for a business meeting and everything was perfect.  The rooms are of average size but have been remodeled and are very pleasant.  What makes this hotel special is the staff who go out of their way to make sure your stay is very comfortable - I would…

title: Everything you want AND on the beach!
review: This hotel was fantastic!  The decor is warm and inviting, luxurious.  The staff was friendly.  The location of the hotel was ON the white sands of Clearwater Florida.  The water, well it was heavenly, warm and shallow enough to wade or body surf.  We used a beach cabana and enjoyed privacy while on the beach. Very romantic, had everything we wanted!  We'll be back.

title: Nice place to relax
review: My wife and I were looking for a place to relax for a long weekend.  No work, no kids, no worries from Thu thru Sun.  Beatiful location.  Right on beach right next to Sand Key Park.  Great place to take long walks. On site bar/restaurants were good but several other establishments are very close by, some are even right across the street next to the Marriott (i.e. harbor side).  Enjoyed the pool bar where the prices were a bit high (about $8 for a frozen drink ... nice size) but your in a resort so enjoy a little.  Spent one entire day on the beach where you can rent two padded lounge chairs and an umbrella for $25 all day.  LOTS of free chairs around the pool but I think Oct may be off-season.  Nice sized pool was never even remotely crowded.  Towels were always available at the…

title: Excellent location, I look forward to returning.
review: My teenage son and I took our first trip to Florida and decided on this hotel based on previous reviews I read online.  After much research, I decided on the Sheraton Sand Key next to Clearwater Beach.  My first impression of the hotel was good.  Check-in was pretty easy and the staff was friendly.  Parking was plentiful.  I thought for the price ($250 per night) that a refrigerator should be included with the room, but for $5 extra per night, it was definitely worth getting.  I had reserved a gulf front room and was glad that I did (worth the extra cost).  We were on the 6th floor with a nice view of the beach and pool.  I did not find the hotel to be excessively noisy as I chose Sand Key to be just far enough away from the craziness of Clearwater Beach to relax.  Of course,…

title: I would not stay here again... poor hotel
review: I did not enjoy my stay at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort in Clearwater.  First and foremost, it was WAY overpriced.  I paid $250 per night and you can see the attached picture for the view that I had.  Great quality and value.  I'm not one that gets bent out of shape for not getting the best "value" for my money, but for $250 a night I expect to see more than the roof of the building.  Save your money and enjoy your vacation.  Just not at this hotel.

title: Nice Stay
review: Had been at the Sheraton Sand Key 8 years before.  Not much has changed, nice hotel, beach is spectacular.  Rooms are pricey and not sure they're worth the price.  For almost $300 a night, would think there would at least be a small refrig.  Did like the dipped in chocolate strawberries in our room upon arrival.  Rusty's restaurant is very nice for dinner, again pricey.  Breakfast is very good and I think it is worth the price.  Lots of children run the property of this hotel, which can mean noise in the halls at night.  Pool is on the small side and can get crowded, especially with the jumping children.  Beach is a good walk from the hotel which isn't bad unless the heat of the sun is pounding down late afternoon.  Best time we found for the beach was at night, with the nice…

title: Pros & Cons- read for before you decide!
review: I had mixed thoughts about this hotel.  Overall we had a great time but there were some negatives.  You can decide for yourself if the pros would outweigh the cons. First the pros- We booked a suite & it was huge-size of 2 rooms. The bathroom was very spacious- hallway type with the tub & toliet at the end.  With a family of 5-4 of which being girls, we could all get ready at the same time.  Poor husband had to get in early to get his shower.  There was a fridge  with shelves and aweesome Starbucks coffee but no microwave.  We like to eat our  breakfast & lunch in our room so this worked o.k. for us.  Awesome housecleaning staff, did an excellent job cleaning.  We did have one day that they didn't come to clean until 5pm which didn't work for us so went sent them on. Maintenance…

title: Not what I was expecting
review: This hotel is good for sitting at the pool between meetings. It seems to do a brisk business catering to seminars and people who don't seem to travel much.  The suite I had resided under the weight room. Noise until 11 all 3 nights. The walls as you'll read in other posts are insanely thin and it really does sound as if the people are in the room with you. I heard the neighbors setting the alarm clock, the little clicks to get the exact time. CRAZY THIN.  The rooms, especially a suite, should never feel as dated as these. The rattan was a bit worn as was the carpeting. And while the beds were acceptable, they aren't the Suite Sleepers or Heavenly.  As usual, get to the pool at first light and reserve your loungers. But also beware, there seemed to be a lot of novice travelers…

title: Loved the location and staff
review: We're just wrapping up a stay at the Sheraton. My husband is attending a conference here, so I tagged along. Being that we're here for a conference, we really didn't comparison shop, so I can't comment on how it compares to other hotels in the area. The hotel does seem to be a little older, but everything is well maintained and updated. The rooms were on the small side, especially the bathrooms. We had a pool view room, which had an ocean view as well. The pool is really too small. A few bad kids really emphasized that fact. The hotel staff repeatedly spoke to both the kids and parents, but to no avail--big shock. So no one else could use the pool because you couldn't get away from them. The staff couldn't be better. Always very friendly and responsive. We had a minor issue, a…

title: Great Hotel Right on the Beach Off the Main Toursist Area
review: Stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key when were down in Florida to catch some spring training games.  Liked this hotel because it was about 20 minutes from brighhouse field but it was also right on the beach. A mix of families and couples not too many single/friends groups but that was exactly what we were looking for.  Arrived early and arranged early check in room was still not available when we arrived.  Took our cell number and when went to get some supplies called when the room was ready.  Used a combination of starwood points for the stay, which means you will be looking at the air-conditioning units.  It did not bother us too much because we were able to see the bay across the street.   Hotel is has a good pool which can get crowded however if you get there early enough you…

title: Good hotel, outstanding customer service
review: We stayed here from July 9-12, for a relaxing birthday weekend.  The hotel was busy, lots of conferences, a wedding and class reunion.  The pool is indeed too small, we spent our time on the beach.  The chairs and umbrellas do cost $25 a day but it's money well spent.  Also, even though the hotel is on the beach, it's quite a hike to actually get down to the water.  There is a snack cart that drives up and down the beach so you can get food and some mixed drinks.  If you're in the mood for a frozen drink, it's best to hang out at the pool bar.  The sports bar in the hotel was pretty busy every night we were there, it was nice enough for a late night drink.  The rooms are fine, bathrooms are small and the bathtub could use some updating.   The true stand out here was the customer…

title: Nice hotel; great location; pool too small; fab beach
review: We really enjoyed our stay here.  It was a toss up between the Sheraton and the Marriott but I'm pleased that we chose the Sheraton. Sand key is a nice area too. The beach in front was picture postcard.  We couldn't have asked for a better beach hotel.  It's easy to walk over to the restaurants and shops on the other side and to catch the yellow bus that takes you to Clearwater.  The downside to this hotel was the pool.  It was far too small for the hotel.  I'm not a big pool user but it was always so busy and the rules said no more than 32 I believe, in there at one time.  Loads of pool chairs available though.  I would recommend that they take away two tennis courts and add another pool there - worth the investment.  We had breakfast in Rusty's which was a great buffet - no…

title: Floridian's Favorite Beach Hotel
review: I like to do a beach vacation in my own neck of the woods each year, so I'm very familar with the hotels in the Tampa Bay area.  The Sheraton Sandkey is my favorite hotel.  The staff is friendly and efficient and you will not find a larger area of empty beach front.  I go there to relax and walk on the beach.  It is definitely worth upgrading to gulf view room.  And if you have an opportunity, check out Columbia's restaurant which is across the street and a short walk to the right from the hotel.

title: Super Nice Staff
review: I traveled for a conference that was hosted at the hotel (and brought my husband along). The entire staff was very very friendly and overly helpful with everything.  The concierge desk is always staffed and there are multiple other staff members availablein the lobby. One even got on my cell phone to give directions to a lost friend trying to find the hotel!  I felt that everyone at the hotel went out of their way to be helpful. The location on the beach is very nice as well.  As a person who likes to do a little more than just the beach...there wasn't much else around the hotel to do.  There are a couple of places to eat right in the hotel, but public transportation in this area is just "ok'...I would rec having a car.

title: Fantastic Stay At Sandkey
review: I stayed here in June 2009, I was going to stay at the Marriott over the road from the Sandkey but I am so glad I stayed at the Sandkey its right on a fantastic beach. The staff are very friendly and have time to make you at home. I stayed with my wife & son, we had a relaxing time after going round Disney for a week. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Some people have commented on the size of the bathroom maybe the people were to big ! I found everything just right

title: LIked the Hilton Better
review: We stayed @ the Sheraton Sand Key after attending a concert because we wanted to spend the next day @ the beach. The room was "ok", the bathroom was TINY...toilet and shower practically on top of each other with little room to close the door, the single sink and seperate vanity were outside of the bathroom opening right into the room. The bed and linens were VERY comfortable.  The flat screen TV and leather chair and ottoman were an updated touch. We booked a room on the "club" level because it included breakfast, which was served in a tiny room, with about 6 tables. The breakfast was very disappointing, mainly because we stayed at the Hilton down the street on a previous visit and were served in a dining room, with a full breakfast, not just the continental breakfast that we…

title: Wow! Hospitality by Sheraton and what a location!
review: I travelled to Clearwater for the first time and was very careful in picking a hotel as close to the beach as possible. I also try and stay only at 4 star hotels as I am kind of picky with cleanliness, food and room standard. From the checking in experience and thru our 3 days stay we were nothing but pleased. Especially the staff was so warm, friendly and welcoming. We were upgraded as Starwood preferred guests and had access to the lounge with some drinks and hour douvres available to us complimentary. That was super and I still remember the friendly hostess Peggy who was truly a role model in service and friendliness! The hotels rooms were nice and the bed very comfy. The pool big and the hotel is right at the beach so romantic walks in the sunset will for sure materialize if…

title: Nice hotel near beach
review: I stayed at this hotel as part of a recent conference. As a guest, I was treated very well. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The one downside is that the walls seem very thin- I could hear the conversation in the next room. They do have an exercise room, but it wasn't open early enough on the weekend. Wi-Fi is available in the rooms but you have to pay for it (about $12/day). The breakfast on the 9th floor was great, but only available to Sheraton select guests. The pool is not large, but adequate. Even better, the beach is just steps away. The white sand is soft and the water a blue/green. It was perfect at night. The beach was very crowded on a Sunday- probably because of the local crowd. There is a restaurant at the hotel. I ate there for their Sunday brunch. It was…

title: OK but not what was expected
review: My girlfriend and I spent this past weekend at this hotel and let's just say that it didn't live up to expectations.  Don't be fooled by the pictures which make it look like an upscale property ..... it isn't.  The pool area is tiny, rundown, and crowded to overcapacity, the rooms were old, small, loud (paper thin walls) and lacking some basic amenities, and the entertainment in the hotel (restaurants, bars, etc) left a lot to be desired.  Not that this hotel is horrible, it's just very very average, in need of a makeover to get it into the new millenium, and absolutely not worth the $200+ a night they're charging.

title: Loved this Hotel
review: We just returned home from Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  Our family loved this hotel.  The room was big enough for five (although the bathroom was small).  We spend everyday at the beach or the pool.  Everything was well kept and clean.  We will return soon.

title: Best Resort Choice for Families
review: We literally took 3-4 weeks of reading/reviewing in choosing our resort, we were looking for more luxury (3-4 star), with a beach front location.  We have three children (7-11 yrs) and wanted something family friendly.  We were down to two resorts, the Sand Pearl and the Sheraton Sand Key; they are about 2 miles apart.  We eventually choose the Sheraton Sand Key and are REALLY glad we did.  First, we drove to the Sand Pearl and realized quickly the area around the Pier was PACKED, to the point we couldn’t find a place to park.  The Sheraton has a private beach area; only down side was the about 150 yard walk from the pool to the water.  Overall we had a great time, we took a wave runner tour (www.seawakewaverunner.com) out to a small island where the guide (Doug) helped the kids…

title: Relaxing vacation for families with young kids
review: I went for 5 days over Memorial day weekend with my wife and 2 young kids.  I wanted to stay away from Disney to avoid over-sensitization and large crowds, and the Sand Key is perfect alternative.  The kids played in both pools and enjoyed the different restaurant offerings, many suitable for kids.  The hotel is close (~1-3 miles) to a busier part of town with tons of restaurants, mini-golf, pier with boardwalk like atmosphere, etc.  Also, if you have access to the club lounge, the staff is very friendly and helpful.  Negatives include: - Hotel staff could be friendlier (except for club room attendant) - Hotel rooms a little dated - Pool area needs more staff during peak hours - Piano entertainment in restaurant was terrible

title: Beautiful Hotel
review: We arrived at Sand Key on May 1 and stayed for 5 days. Flew into Tampa and then drove over to the hotel. Quick drive only about 30 minutes and very easy to find. The hotel sits away from the busy scene in Clearwater beach and offers the utmost privacy. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The only downfall, in the rooms there was no changing area that was private. The bathroom was tiny and the sink was located outside the bath. Maid service and room service were excellent. Each room has a terrace and they were spacious.  The hotel lobby and restaurants were all clean and well equipped. This is a non smoking hotel, but there are plenty of places to smoke that were designated. The pool for this hotel was a bit small, being the hotel is larger.  There is also a small childrens…

title: Will not return
review: We checked in around 6 pm and was put into room 312, our view was an a/c unit on the roof of the main building, horrible.  The pool was dirty and hot tub was very, very dirty.  The room was decorated very well and bed was comfortable but we found hair on the night stands and in the sink.  Don't plan on getting a good night sleep as you can hear doors slamming and people talking on the balcony.

title: What a view!!
review: We have just returned from a week at the Sheraton, and we would go back in a second.  We spent the first week in Orlando so by the time we arrived in Clearwater we were ready to relax.  The hotel was very good and the staff were second to none, we did not experience any bad service during our stay.  Our room was really nice and overlooked the gulf, what a view!!  We ate in the hotel each day and the food was of a very high standard and reasonably priced.  Rusty's do a breakfast and evening buffet, both are excellent and our 4 year old daughter ate free!!  The hotel is right on the beach and you can walk for miles, it was very beautiful.  The heated pool was great our daughter spent almost the whole week in it.  We cannot fault this hotel, and would definetely return in the future

title: I will come back every year!
review: What a wonderful hotel. My experience was great. Every single person I talked to here was friendly and willing to help. (including the housekeeping when I had to call them because I lost something the night before.) Willy, the poolman, was extremely a treat to visit with at the pool. EJ and Bobbie were great bartenders. All in all, what a pleasant experience and I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

title: Great location, noisy rooms
review: The location is prime. Great views of the Gulf and plenty of beach. Umbrellas and refreshments can be charged to the room which is convenient. The hotel is dated. My in-laws stayed there in 1976 so it's at least that old and the rooms and bathrooms are smaller than a more modern hotel. The walls are VERY thin. Noise kept us awake all night the first night. I requested to be moved and got the top floor which was better.  Still thin walls though. Hallway noise is a problem. Doors have half-inch gap at bottom of each. For the price, I expected more.

title: the most fabulous location
review: My husband and i along with 12 friends stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort for the wedding of 2 of our friends, from 10th may -16th May 2009. We were greatly impressed with the hotel the minute we walked into the reception area.  We arrived late at night very tired after travelling many hours from N.Ireland, and were greeted very wqarmely and friendly by the staff.  We asked for a high floor  room with a view of the sea if possible and we certainly were not disappointed.  We got a 6th floor room overlooking the pool and the sea to the right..  The staff everywhere in the hotel were more than friendly and nothing was any trouble to them, we were surprised with so many people coming and going that the bell men were able to remember our names on each occasion we met them.  The…

title: great getaway hotel- The Best
review: We stayed her..May 1st-May4th...just to getaway..We took the super Shuttle back and forth to the airport... The Sheraton Sand Key was excellent....We first arrived there and ate luch at the Cafe..the waitress was extra friendly...food really good..Room was VERY nice....I asked for  a King bed and they gave us one even though they were full..My husband booked late..so we didn"t know what we were getting...I'm so glad we stayed over in Sand Key...a little further to go( we took the Trolley back and forth if we wanted to go to the other side)..We walked thru the park next door every morning..and then ate at Maggie Maes across the street in the plaza for breakfast...most popular place for locals and tourists...we had at least 1/2-hour wait every time..WORTH IT!!!!!!  Sand Key is…

title: Beautiful location, great service
review: We stayed at this hotel for a week, and enjoyed the large clean room, fantastic location (tropical graden, pool and great beach) and superb service. We had some minor hickups (our own fault) such as lost keys and a safe that wouldn't open, and all of them were taken care of by the hotel staff in a matter of minutes. Also the concierge service was really good, saving us loads of money on tours and giving directions.  The hotel has a little shop with everything you could possibly have forgotten to pack, which is also very nice. The only thing which was somewhat disappointing was the fact that you had to pay additional fees for nearly everything. Internet was not free, and the (limited) gym was $7 per day. Also, the hotel advertises a private beach, but you had to pay $25 to get a…

title: Great hotel, great location.
review: We recently stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key with our 3-year old and had a wonderful experience. The beach was quiet and the pool and playground were welcome distractions for our daughter. Pool, beach toys and towels were provided making this an ideal hotel for those traveling for a quick getaway who don't want to bring along a lot of gear. The staff were very friendly and helpful in answering all of our questions and accomodating our requests. The Sheraton is right over the bridge from Clearwater's busier side and very quiet. We would definitely stay here again!

title: Decent weekend getaway at the beach
review: On very short notice, we found out we needed to attend a family function in the Tampa/Clearwater area.  Without a lot of time to plan or research hotels, we were afraid we would have to compromise and/or pay through the nose. As it happens, the Sheraton Sand Key ensured we had to do neither. With a AAA discount, our harbor view room (view of parking lot and then harbor), was $234 per night and there was an additional "buy one night and get 50% off the second night" promotion in place. So, we paid about $396  for two nights, including tax and fees. Check-in was easy and efficient. The young man at the desk agreed to give us late check-out on the day of our departure. The property is nicely appointed ,if not fancy-schmancy , and the comfortable and clean rooms are decorated in…

title: Not good for sleeping
review: The hotel is very nice.  Service good.  Dining expensive.  Only problem was the paper thin walls.  You could hear conversations in the next room, almost like they were sitting on your bed.  You can hear every noise in th hallways also.  Lots of young children running and screaming up & down the halls.  Baby in the next room?  You'll hear every cry!  Pool is so loaded with children, you have no chance to swim or lounge.

title: you won't find us back there any time soon
review: We booked a room with 2 double beds for my wife and adult daughter and myself.  When we were shown to the room, it had a king size bed and rollaway cot. There was nothing they could do as it was Easter week and they were totally booked.  That evening we dined across the bridge at the Bone Fish Restaurant and had a wonderful meal at reasonable prices.  The following morning I told the ladies I would meet them in the restaurant for breakfast and walked out to the pool area.  Each pool chair had a towel and personal item on it and there was absolutely NOONE on them. In fact there was not a soul in the pool or in the pool area.  This was at 8 A.M. We ate breakfast and and went to grab a few towels for the beach and it was 9 A.M. and still noone at the pool but all of the chairs were…

title: Truly a wonderful paradise and experience can't wait to return again!
review: My husband and I decided to make our first trip to the Gulf of Mexico this year and stay at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  We were greeted by wonderful staff that treated us not as customers but close friends.  Providing information not only about the resort but the barrier island amenities and other attractions that we were interested in.  We truly found the experience a great getaway from our busy metropolitan lifestyle and felt so relaxed.  The food at the restauarants, the tavern, Rusty's, the cafe, and the poolside area delicious.  Everything was exceptional.  The views of the intercoastal waterway and the Gulf were extremely breathtaking.  Take a trip to John's Pass Boardwalk to Madiera Beach, Bubba Gumps Seafood is a step back in time to Forrest Gump era Great Food and…

title: Perfect... Beautiful... Clean... Family Friendly ....we'll be back for sure!!!!
review: We absolutely loved this place! Very family-oriented.  Most everyone who stayed here were fanilies - all ages of children.  Eveything was perfect - but one thing that stands out for us is that this hotel is located across the bridge ( Sand Key) and away from the usual "Spring Break" crowd .  So it was very quiet and peaceful.  But if you wanted to be in the heart of the Spring Break crowd - you could drive, or take the Jolley Trolley  (that picks you up right outside the door of the hotel) and literally just a few minutes across the bridge (beautiful view on both sides!) you could  be where the action is - many watersport activities, boat rentals, cruises, etc. to choose from all in one area!  Also the convenience of a Walgreens just at the end of the bridge.  Everyone of the…

title: Great for families, probably not so much for singles or honeymooners
review: Great hotel in terms of cleanliness, Rusty's restaurant very nice hearty dinner buffet for $19.99. Good internet access in bar if you want to check email or print flight tix. My friend and I are single and I'd say it is more for families. We didn't go to the pool once because it was mostly young kids and really noisy. Beach is quite a walk down off the hotel, so if you're looking to walk out the door and be on the beach, it's not that close. Takes a few minutes to get there but it wasn't a deal breaker. Decent grounds overall with a strip mall across the street but not much in the way of stuff to do. We took a cab to Shephard's bar and hung there one night.

title: Spring Break...Yikes!
review: First impressions... very nice lobby, little shops and well manicured grounds.  Very well kept and clean.  Rusty's looked great, but we didn't make it there for a meal.  Friendly staff.    We used our points for 2 nights at this property so we got the 3rd floor SPG special with a view of a wall and large air conditioning unit :)  Laughed a bit with the other SPG guests on the third floor that with all the money one spends on hotels in order to earn points, you are rewarded with a lousy view!   But all in all, the room was a nice size and very clean and comfortable (aside from the tiny bathroom).  Very, very busy time.  Was a bit naive in thinking all of the broadcasts about the dire state of the economy would make the hotel a ghost town for spring break.  To the contrary, the…

title: Do Not Stay Spring Break Time!
review: Wow...I read 2 other review of this hotel and felt like I was right back at the hotel.  They must have stayed the same week we did...3/28-4/2.  I had a first floor room, which we enjoyed.  The close proximity to the pool/beach was key for us.  We were traveling without our 2 children for a quick quiet (HA!) getaway to celebrate my birthday.    The problem: We were sandwiched between 2 families that allowed  their children to run through the hallways, opening and closing doors all night (until 12:30 am) while the parents sat in the bar.  Real classy!  Come On parents, are you serious?  These kids were between 5-9 yrs old...go to bed!  The next morning we were awoken by thier alram clock that was going off at 7am for HOURS.  They obviously went out to breakfast...we called the…

title: LOVE THIS RESORT BUT.........
review: I love this resort and have stayed here many times.  The location is great and the views are beautiful.  The tiki bar staff (NATE) and others were pure joy and made our stay very enjoyable.  The problem I had was that I had a ground floor room, do not stay on the first floor unless you want to be woken up DAILY at 7 a.m. by vaccuums and by the landscapers blowing grass and mowing the lawns, something I thought could have waited for a better time of day.   I know it was spring break during our stay, but there were WAY too many kids.  You couldn't get a chair by the pool unless you got up early to PUT A TOWEL on your chair, which is written in plain site as a big no no.  The hot tub should be for ADULTS ONLY!...  You couldn't sit and have a conversation and relax without having…

title: A Total Joy!
review: My wife and I came down to Clearwater Beach for a week as part of our annual Yankee's Spring Training / get some sun trip. This is the first time we stayed at the Sheraton. We were amazed at the way everyone makes you feel welcome and at home. When we pulled up out front Steven greeted us like we were long missing family finally back to visit. He insisted on handling all the bags, giving us a tour of the resort, and even helped arrange dinner reservations. Luckily, he was not the exception, but the rule here at Sand Key. The people at the desk could not do enough for us and even got us an upgrade. We had a breakfast buffet plan with our trip. Each morning at breakfast the waitresses took time to talk to us and make sure we were having a great time. They asked about our day,…

title: We would stay here again!
review: Every staffmember that we encountered was friendly and helpful. Our room was an "advance purchase" from the week prior to our stay and was exactly what we reserved. The pool and pool area were very nice. Rusty's Restaurant has a great Prime Rib and Seafood buffet on Saturday nights. Yum! Our server was wonderful and was the Employee of the Year 2008 for the entire hotel!  He obviously loves his job.  Location of the hotel was a quick jump over the bridge from Clearwater Beach and also a straight shot to head south for Indian Rocks and Madiera, John's Pass, etc.  So, it made traveling to/from the hotel easier.  The hotel is set a ways back from the beach -- this was okay with us since it was warm and sunny but windy the weekend we were there. So, after strolling on the beach a…

title: loved it....great value
review: so we booked this hotel/resort for spring break from march 15th through the 21st with the plans to see the yankees play in tampa several times over the week.  we were really happy...first, i travel a lot! and i've never been to a place with more gracious staff from the bell hops to the manager to the desk staff.  the hotel isn't very tall...i think 9 floors butr i think it's fair to c all it a resort.  we got a fabulous rate through travel zoo which included breakfast buffet which is regularly about 15 each.  the buffet ran late...later than most until 11:30 and was a full hot buffet.  we didn't need lunch.  the food was terrific.  there's also a bar/pub next to the restaurant with a pool table and billiards and six comnputers that guests can use....i think four hours of free…

title: Wow ... What a week!
review: We have always stayed at condos along Sand Key, and due to circumstances, were unable to keep our condo reservation.  We found a GREAT deal on travelzoo.com the week before March Break.  We paid $199 (US) a night for two queen sized beds and full buffet breakfast for two adults and one 6 year old.  Our room was the first floor, facing the tennis courts.  We simply opened the patio doors and walked to tennis everyday!  Easy to reserve a court each morning (at front desk, no charge).  We brought our own raquets but they did have some to loan out (no charge).  Breakfast was FANTASTIC ... we went each day around 10am and ate enough to take us through to dinner.  We ordered room service 4 of the 6 nights we were there.  Great service, excellent value for the money, and the one night…

title: Beautiful Gulf Views of the Marriott
review: We booked a three night stay at the Sheraton through Travelzoo, parking and breakfast were included. We arrived at 8 pm and promptly checked into our 'gulf view'  room and were immediately disappointed by the view. We paid extra for the ocean view only to overlook the parking lot, monstrous Marriott across the street and a glimpse of water on the edge of the other hotel. When I inquired about the room, the front desk agent informed me that the hotel was completely book and my other option was a view of a brick wall-- we decided not to move. Room 523 has an adjoining door with the room next door and the paper thin walls meant we could hear the guests next door coughing and talking. Internet was $11.95/day .We left the hotel after one night, it's not worth it! The only good part…

title: nicely renovated older property
review: This is a 100% non-smoking hotel on the beach in Sand Key, opposite the Marriott Suites, with pretty nice service.  The rooms were standard nice, with an in-room safe,hairdryer, iron, coffee pot and icebucket.  The pillows were down and hypoallergenic ones were available as well.  There were many places to eat at the hotel and nearby.  The only downside to the room was a crummy alarm clock/radio.  The reception was horrible and frankly I was surprised that they didn't give one of those fancy DVD alarm clock radios.  Oh, well, no big deal.  I used the telephone wakeup service instead since the radio was so full of static.  This is really a minor inconvenience in light of everything.    The hotel has wonderful concierge/bellman services.  They arranged a limo for me for the…

title: a really nice place
review: ok room. GREAT food...I have never had food as good in a chain hotel.  Rusty's bistro is for real: Great Buffet and fantastic a la carte fish entrees. Very nice staff...hustling the tip, to be sure, but that is okay. Nice tennis courts x 3.  MUCH better location than the Hilton.

title: Amazing location, but one of the least friendly hotels I've ever been to.
review: Clearwater is amazing, so I would recommend staying in a hotel that allows you to really enjoy it. The Sheraton Sand Key isn't it. Not ONE of the employees here have even smiled at my mother and I since we've been here, nevermind greeted us or asked how our stay has been, except for the bellman who was wonderful to our faces and then audibly called us "a**holes" for not giving an ideal tip (this was within 10 minutes of setting foot inside the hotel).  I am TRULY unimpressed by the staff.  The pool area is okay, the pool is kind of small, but the Sheraton is by far the smallest hotel on the island. The beach is definitely the best part - yes, its a hike to get to the water, but the beach is covered in beautiful shells like I've never seen. The sunsets over the Gulf are…

title: Would return in a heartbeat
review: We loved this place.  The pool overlooks the beach and the pool water is heated.  There is a bar and snackbar by the pool.  We were looking for a place to park it --- soak up sun relax and not do much of anything.  We did go to some great restaurants with our rental car.  Not sure how it would be here without a car.  (parking is at a premium in the parking lot)  We asked for a room with a view and were given a view of the tennis courts ... not what we wanted and they fixed it right away.  The entire resort is NON smoking .. you cannot smoke ANYWHERE not even on your balcony or by the pool ... this was a HUGE PLUS for us ... nothing like getting the perfect spot by the pool and someone lights up right next to you.---this doesnt happen here as there is NO smoking.  The ONLY…

title: Incredibly friendly service
review: I've never posted a trip review but felt compelled after returning from a vacation at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  We've stayed at fancier and more expensive resorts, but have never recieved such friendly service from a staff that is obviously very happy working there.  The hotel is the nicest Sheraton I've stayed at.  The rooms have extremely comfortable beds with 37 inch plasmas with HD content.  There is starbucks coffee in the rooms.  There is a large internet lounge with free comfortable access on 5 computers.  The pool is not huge, but plenty big, with plenty of lounge chairs.  The pool ovverlooks the beach with 4 volleyball courts.  We ate dinners at the Island Way Grill, Bellair Grill and Guppy's, all very good.  The hotel breakfast buffet, which was included with our…

title: beautiful location
review: I went with my wife and kids over winter break and we were very pleased with the hotel. I used starpoints for part of the stay and a half-price coupon for the other part of the stay so it was a great deal. We got a room with a gulf and pool view which is a must if staying here. Luckily our weather was good but I could see it being an absolute disaster if the weather isn't good because there isn't much else to do other than sit at the pool and the beach. We did go on the pirate ship one day which the kids loved and I would recommend it for anybody who has young kids. Rusty's was very good and the Island Cafe at the hotel was good also. Off the hotel, Frenchys on Rockaway was very good and a lot of fun. The beach is a little bit of a walk (at least a couple of hundred yards) but…

title: Wouldn't call it a resort
review: The hotel was "nice" and the beach is beautiful.  I felt like I was staying in a mediocre room that had been re-furbished and re-named "a resort."  It wasn't anything special.  We were at the end of the hallway which was nice because we could hear people both in the hallway as well as in their rooms while passing by.  Ask for a room with a view of the water, it's worth it.  It was too cold to go in the pool and the jacuzzi was about 15 degrees too hot.   I was looking forward to using the gym but was turned off at the fee.   The complementary appetizers at the Tavern were nice but the service was awful.  The grille's food wasn't good but Rusty's service and food were excellent.  (of course Rusty's was more expensive)  I would recommend renting a car or going during warmer months…

title: We'll be back
review: When we got to our room it overlooked the rooftop with air conditioning units. Not what we were hoping for. We went down to the desk and they immediately gave us a beautiful gulf view room upgrade. Wow, what a view. While some people complain about the walk to the beach, the sand starts right at the pool. Service was always top notch, Our room was perfect each day.  The hotel could include free in-room wireless, and maybe breakfast, but this is not the Days Inn. It's not cheap, but it was everything we hoped for.

title: Enjoyable
review: The rooms were decent, bar/restaurant downstairs and a poolside bar. Pool seemed nice. Hotel is on the water, but a good 100 yards away - very deep beach. Staff was very friendly.

title: Not worth the price!
review: Booked this as a last night stay from a week stay on Anna Marie Island.   The room booked was 400.00 per night.  Thinking it may be some sort of deluxe amenities, it was not.  It was a normal room, considered premium beach view.  NOT!   You could see the beach, but it was far away.  The hotel was loud, and a party scene.  Not something I like after a romantic quiet vacation on an island.    Room service food was good.    Front desk service had a rude attendant, perhaps a bad day for her?  If you want to spend 400.00 per night, I would recommend going to an Island, beach front house rental, like what we had the week before.  At least there you are at the water's edge, and can see the beach, etc.  This hotel looks great on the www site, and I suppose it would be if the pricing…

title: Weekend Getaway.
review: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend at the Sheraton Sand Keys. I had never been to the gulf coast before and booked my trip pretty blindly. I must say that I was not at all disappointed. (Except maybe for the cold weather, but who can control that?) The staff was friendly. The room was very nice and very clean. I loved the bed and the linens. I typically have back issues when I sleep in hotel beds, but there my back was fine. Although we did not spend any time at the pool or the beach due to the cold weather, the pool area was really nice. The shoreline was a bit far away, but that I could see from the pictures on the internet, so it wasn't a surprise and it didn't bother me. We had dinner in the smaller restaurant and the food was actually better than I expected.…

title: Checked in and checked out....
review: Ugh! The staff didn't greet us. She was in training....told us where nothing was. The ceilings were low and dark. Had a chlorine smell as well. Pool area was small and ho-hum. You could barely see the gulf while standing at the pool area. Yes, the hotel is on the beach....just a million feet to the water. The balconys are the size of a desk and outdated looking. To me, it was awful. So we checked right back out. The "casual" restaurant reminded me of an eating area in a gas station.

title: CLEAN ROOMS , Friendly Staff and Great Service!!!!
review: This was our second visit to theSheraton Sand Key Resort and it was excellent yet again!! The staff are friendly and helpful!! The food was excellent and you are on a secluded area of beach with a great view of the ocean. The rooms are CLEAN!! I am extremely picky and cannot find fault with the cleanliness of the rooms. The furniture is nice and the beds are extremely comfy with great all white linens, no ugly blankets. If you want a worry free stay this is the place!

title: Pleasant hotel, friendly staff, misleading pool/beach photos!
review: We booked this hotel to follow on from a really busy 10 day family holiday in Orlando (i.e. a chance for my wife and I to just relax before returning to the UK).  It was a pleasant hotel with friendly and accomodating staff, but certainly not out-of-this world. For a Sheraton (and a not exceptionally cheap rate) it was perhaps a little disappointing, but overall it was certainly adequate.  The bedroom was large and comfortable with a good bed, ample space and a balcony with a sea-view and outdoor table/chairs.  The bathroom was on the small side with a bath/shower which initially had a problem (didn't switch completely to shower, hence combining shower and bath!), but when we reported this a maintenance staff member came up immediately and fixed it efficiently. There was no…

title: Wonderful stay!
review: Loved the Sheraton Sand Key.  I traveled on business, but brought 2 of my children.  They loved the heated outdoor pool and hot tub! The pool sits right on the beach.
