I had to laugh after reading other revies that claim the beach is a hike!  You step out of the pool, go down 3 steps, and you are on the beach.  Sure, you have to walk to the water, but come on!  It's the beach-right there!  If you want a hotel that sits 2 feet from the water, take a cruise! The staff at the Sheraton were all delightful.  This really makes a stay perfect.  Thank you to everyone!

title: Nice Property
review: This is a clean resort, rooms aren't anything spectacular.  The beach is a good walk from the hotel (hotel is on the beach, there is just a lot of sand til the water!)  They have people drive around on 4-wheelers to get drink and food orders then deliver it  you, which was quite nice.  You have to pay to use the chairs on the beach.  All in all this hotel was ok, next time I would probably look for a higher scale hotel for the cost.

title: Great Florida getaway spot
review: We just spent a long weekend at the Sheraton Sand Key.  We were treated royally by all staff from the moment we entered the lobby.  Rooms were spacious and clean; the property well maintained. All our requests were honored. We had read about the "long walk to the beach" - Actually, you step directly onto the beach from the pool area, but there is a 150 (or so) yard walk to the water. It is the widest beach I have ever seen.  The "long walk" is nothing to complain about in my estimation. If it weren't for the fact that we go somewhere different each vacation, we would definitely return.

title: You will love it !
review: You will love it ! What a great hotel. You come in, and you feel that you are welcome, that you are a valued guest.  This was our second trip to this hotel, and we can only recommend it.  From Front desk to the concierge, from breakfast in your room to fine dining at Rusty's, from the pool area to the beach. This Hotel is just all you are looking for.  Just perfect. Wish all Hotel would be like this one !

title: Enjoyed the Sheraton Sand Key
review: We stayed here before taking a cruise out of Tampa and were very pleased with our stay.  The Front Desk and bell staff were knowledgeable and eager to make our visit a pleasant one.  Our room was very nice.  The bed was very comfortable with good quality linens.  We were also impressed by the very large, flat screen, digital TV.    The grounds were well maintained and we loved the hotel's  broad beach on the Gulf.   A highlight of our vacation was a long walk on the beach.   Spectacular.  As the name implies, the hotel is on Sand Key, away from the tightly bunched hotels on Clearwater Beach.  You feel like you have some breathing room at the Sheraton Sand Key, yet you are not too far away from the restaurants in Clearwater Beach.  We had a good breakfast at Rusty's, the hotel's…

title: Great Relaxing getaway
review: Aug 2008 we stayed for our second time at the Sheraton Sand Key in Clearwater Beach Florida. We had stayed there a few years ago for a week. We need to put together a quick 5 day vacation for the purpose of JUST RELAXING. We made our travel plans about 1 week before we arrived. Knowing how nice this hotel was and the great pool and beach are we knew that we could go there and not have to move off the property for a 5 days if we did not want to. We had amazing weather..HOT but amazing. We have teenage boys who love the beach. We spent hours at the pool, hot tub and beach. The hotel  also has two restaurants, and internet cafe and your usual gift shop. The staff is great, the rooms are very nice and very clean. The beach is beautiful with an amazing Gulf sunset. The dolphins show…

title: Great Getaway with family!!!!
review: Our family has a tradition of meeting the week before Christmas in a warm environment.  This year we chose to stay at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  What an excellent choice we made!!  We loved the area; located on a strip of land between the bay and the Gulf of Mexico.  The hotel is right on the beach.  Some people on this forum complained about the “long” walk to the beach.  It didn’t bother us at all.  The walk was relaxing and peaceful as there were not too many people on the beach.  The hotel is not crowded the week before Christmas.  Most of the staff knew our family by name which is a very nice touch.  I can’t say enough about the friendly staff.   They went out of their way to accommodate us.  I felt the same about the wait staff in the hotel restaurant Rusty’s.  We ate…

title: outstanding beach hotel
review: The resort is located directly on the beach. away from any traffic noise on the Gulf Boulevard. Our very large room on the sixth floor was facing the South with a practically unobstructed view of the Gulf. But the bathroom was strangely arranged.The bath tub and the water-closet were together in a separate space that could be closed by a door, the  water basin on the other hand was right next to the entrance door. The pressure of the tap water of the water basin was relatively weak so that is was easier to wash our hands in the bath tub. Housekeeping service was perfect. Our room had no minibar or small refrigerator. In the tavern, several internet PC 's are complementary available for hotel residents.  We had a room-only arrangement, therefore I can not describe the breakfast…

title: Just neutral....front desk staff could use customer service training!
review: This is a little late, but I rely so much on these reviews and I want to offer my comments about this property.  The property was clean and had quite a bit to offer, but I just wasn't that impressed.  Hotel is clean enough, has two decent restaurants on site, as well as a bar/lounge and outdoor snack area.  Beautiful sunsets, plenty of parking, reasonably priced, location is walking distance to "downtown".  You can rent jet skis and book parasailing right on the beach.  Other than terrible service from front desk staff at check-in (very cold, not at all friendly nor welcoming), the only drawback to this property is the distance from the hotel to the beach.  IT IS A HIKE!  It is flat and the sand is smooth and free of rocks, but it is a long way from the beach to the hotel.  A…

title: Lifes a beach
review: Spent a couple of days at Clearwater before goingto Disney. Nice hotel on the beach, although it is a couple fo hundred yards over the beach to the sea. Enjoyed the stay there, the restaurant, easy access to the town, the pool, the bar. :)

title: Nice Hotel
review: Stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key for four nights and enjoyed the property. Nice location on beach and can walk to a few businesses in the area as far as food etc. (a dunkin donuts, pizza place and spanish restaurant are close by).  Hotel room was renovated, flat screen tv, but overall small.  I could hear our next door neighbor easily due to the door that leads to the adjoining room.   This was my only criticism of my stay.  As a SPG platinumn member I was really taken care of : free wireless internet,  free use of fitness center (really nice), free breakfast on 9th floor lounge, and free drinks and snacks in the afternoon in the lounge (alcohol included).  People at the hotel we very friendly and helpful. Overall a nice stay and I would stay here again for a short vacation.

title: Classy and Sophisticated!
review: We truly enjoyed our one-night stay at the Sheraton Sand Key! The area is gorgeous and from the minute you walk into the hotel, it is absolutely classy and sophisticated without being outrageously priced!  Our room was immaculate with a great view of the beach and seemed to be moderately priced ($174 in July).  The Front Desk staff were very friendly and we also dealt with John, the event manager, because we were looking into having a summer 2009 wedding at the hotel, and he was wonderful!  We thought the pool area was fantastic (It didn't seem too small to us).  There was a bit of a walk to the ocean, but the beach is immaculate and I enjoyed the walk.  You can't go wrong with this hotel!  Absolutely lovely!!!!

title: Getting tired
review: We've stayed at the Sheraton 5 times before and always enjoyed ourselves. Although it has the same excellent location my wife and I felt that some things were not as good as on previous visits. We had a room on the SPG floor which was in  urgent need of redecoration , although we were  pleased to be upgraded to a gulf view room. The ambiance of the hotel seemed to have changed, with less friendly staff who seemed to be going through a mechanical routine with guests rather than expressing personal feelings. There was a cancer related convention taking place on a number of days during our stay. On one day the attendees had a lunch on the lawn next to the pool after which there was an extended speech,delivered over a pa system, about cancer care developments. Clearly these issues…

title: great place
review: Was at the Sheraton Sand Key for a conference and then extended my stay for 4 nights.  The staff were great.  Personable, always willing to help, offer suggestions.  Pool great (small as people have said but still great), beach great (long walk to water which I loved).  Room met my needs for 7 nights (bathroom small but fine for 2 and vanity outside br).  Heard no complaints from anyone at my conference.  Would go back in a heartbeat.  In town, out fave two places were Frenchy's Rockaway Grill (there are many Frenchy's but this is the best, waterfront) and Shephard's (did not try food, more of night spot)

title: One of the Best
review: We selcted the Sand Key on friends recommendations and we were delighted that we did. This hotel stands out as the best in the area. The hotel design, the ameneties, restaurants, bars are simply superb. We stayed four nights and wouldd have stayed longer if possible. The staff were ever so friendly and answered all questions with enthusiasm. On arrival we found they had upgraded us to a suite, we are Starwood preferred guests but had not made any advance requests for this. The suite was very special and I could watch Europe lose the Ryder cup in luxury and in HD. We were in Florida for a two week break and I had the best steak of the vacation in Rustys restaurant. The Island cafe, the sports bar I just cannot say enough about this place, we are going back and will tell all of…

title: A perfect experience!
review: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key after spending 4 days on International Drive, Orlando. We wanted to enjoy an action packed few days in Orlando, then travel to a quieter part of Florida to enjoy the sunshine and chill out! 	 Before our trip, I had emailed the hotel directly and informed them that it was our wedding anniversary during our stay. I asked if maybe they could offer us some kind of complimentary goodies… (I thought, hey why not… If you don’t ask, you won’t get!). Sure enough, we were upgraded to a Gulf View room (which we had not paid for) and on the day of our anniversary, we received champagne and truffles, with a lovely card from the hotel management.   Customer Service means a lot to me when I visit any place, therefore I have listed our opinions…

title: Great hotel great sunset view!
review: Lovely hotel and staff, seems to be getting a bit of a refurb right now.   Rooms nice and very clean but do insist/pay for room with a Gulf view as its so worth it for the sunset view in the evening.  Poolside drinks and food were also good, watch out for the "strong island ice tea's" as they are cheeky and that comes from a Scotsman!  Theres isnt a great deal of places to eat in walking distance but :-Do drive down the Gulf Boulevard as there are loads of great restaurants dotted in the various villages, check out the Mexican Los Mexicano's about 5miles South of Sandkeys at india Rocks beach as its a winner! Do NOT go to Backwaters restaurant across the road from the Sheraton at the shoppes as we ordered 2 fillet steaks and the "vegtables" and baked potatoes were totally dried…

title: Great hotel!!
review: This is a very nice hotel, and you will not be disappointed in booking here. We booked 2 rooms for 5 adults and added on a cot. We requested connecting rooms which we received.  ROOMS: The sink is separate from the shower and toilet which is nice. The bathroom is very small and the sink area is a decent size. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms nicely decorated. I believe every room has a balcony with sliding glass doors. The rooms are very clean. When we requested something from the front desk or housekeeping it came very quickly. The cot we requested wasn't in the room when we arrived, but after making a phone call - it came within minutes.  POOL: There were always plenty of chairs at the pool and towels are complimentary. That was one nice thing: this hotel is not at…

title: Not Great By Any Stretch of the Imagination
review: I am by no means a snobby traveler.  I've stayed in high-end resorts, low-end motels, and mid-range hotels in the US, the Carribean, and Latin America.  Ive been coming to Trip Advisor for many years.  It's a large part of how I pick where I'm going to stay when I go on vacation.    So, when my boyfriend and I decided to head out to Clearwater for a relaxing overnight getaway, I perused the reviews for the top ten hotels in Clearwater.  Based on the ranking and the number of positive reviews, I settled on the Sheraton Sand Key Resort, got a decent floating rate, (discounted even more for being a Florida resident), and booked it.  I was excited because both the Sheraton website and the Tripadvisor reviews touted the Sand Key to be a wonderful four star hotel with tons of…

title: Always Enjoy This Hotel
review: We have stayed here 5 times over 10 years and have never been dissapointed. Good clean happy hotel, good for adults and children alike. There are no problems to mention. Have a good stay and enjoy.

title: Good but could do better
review: Our 1st visit to Clearwater. We may well return but would probably stay north of the bridge. Other reviewers are spot-on concerning the attentive, courteous service and excellent all-round smart appearance and cleanliness of the whole hotel.  Our main gripes, however, concerned the totally inadequate pool size and the fact the shallowest point is 4 ft deep - our 7-year-old is a strong swimmer but could only just about stand on her tiptoes. Also there is extremely little shade; just a handful of circular tables with umbrellas but none at all for the loungers. I like the fact the hotel actively discourages people from the early-morning 'towels on sunbeds' race, and regularly remove towels from beds appearing to be unoccupied! Go to the beach and you have to pay for everything. The…

title: Wonderfully relaxing vacation!
review: We stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key from 8/9 to 8/13/08 after a stay at Disney World.  What a nice relaxing way to end a Florida vacation.  We were very impressed with the hotel in every way.  The staff was very courteous and friendly.  Our room was even nicer than I expected, very clean and modern.  Yes, the bathroom was a bit small, but managable.  We had a gulf/pool view and I really enjoyed sitting out on the balcony every morning with a cup of coffee and looking out over the water.  We ate at both restaurants and were very impressed with the selection and quality of the food and again, the waiters and waitresses were wonderful.  We enjoyed drinks at the Turtle Bar by the pool and inside at the Mainstay Tavern.  The pool was nice, but a little small and crowded during the…

title: Fantastic!
review: My wife and I stayed here for two nights during over the weekend of the 25th July for two nights.  From the moment we entered the hotel we are impressed! The staff, especially in the foyer are so friendly and helpful!  The room was quite nice, even though the bathroom is small...but how much time do you spend in the bathroom on holidays??  The swimming pool is too small for a hotel that size and the best time to go there is probably the evening when its much quieter.  The pool bar is really good...nice and relaxing having a cocktail and beer in that atmosphere! The walk to the beach isnt as bad as everyone makes out...it takes about 2mins!  The sea is really nice and warm!  Clearwater itself is really nice.  I would definately recommend a boat trip in the harbour to see the…

title: Ab Fab
review: This was our 5th time staying at this hotel, so I think that speaks volumes. We take our family because we really enjoy the homely feeling it gives. From the cleaners to the check-in staff, everyone is so friendly and welcoming. The pool is on the small side for this size of hotel but we have never had a problem getting loungers. Anytime we've been we have stayed for 2 weeks and we always ask for a Gulf View room and we always hire a fridge.  This year we noticed some changes, the computers have been moved to the bar area to make room for an extension to the coffee shop,  unfortunately I don't think this is a great idea, also a lot of the bar staff had changed and not for the better. Kids like using computers and were not always welcome in the bar even with parents. Some of the…

title: Great Getaway
review: My wife and I celebrated our 16th wedding anniversary in August of 2008 and stayed at this hotel.  Right away we noticed how friendly and helpful the staff were and how clean the hotel was.  Shortly after getting settled into our room, we were greeted with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries; compliments of the management for our anniversary.  This was totally unexpected and very nice.  During our 2 day stay, we enjoyed the beach, the pool and the hottub and were able to experience two of the restaurants the hotel has to offer.  The service was great!  I will definitely consider staying at this hotel again.  The only thing negative I have to say is that there is a charge for WiFi internet use and fitness facility use ($7 a day).  This was a little discouraging to pay…

title: Simply The Best
review: Stayed with my wife and 2 daughters July 25th thru July 29th and had a fantastic time.  The hotel staff was the best I've ever encountered.  Room was clean and comfortable.  Bathroom was nothing special and actually pretty tiny.  Loved the outside balcony with the ocean view, well worth the few extra bucks.  The pool area was great and the beach even better.  It's a bit of a walk from the pool to the beach, about 4 football fields.  We rented the chairs & an umbrella for $25 and also had a ton of fun on the wave runners that are available for rent.  Both the dinner buffet and breakfast buffet at Rusty's inside the Sheraton were very good.  While there, I seen some of the other nearby hotels and they can't compare with the Sheraton.  We plan on returning to Clearwater next year…

title: A perfect relaxing getaway
review: I had been recently looking for a place to stay to getaway from the daily hassles and stresses.  I decided to take my wife for a one night mini escape to Clearwater Beach.  I searched for some hotels via the net and read some reviews and I came accross the Sheraton Sand Key.  The photos and reviews all appeared to be what I was looking for so I decided to book the stay.   First off, I loved the fact that this hotel was not on the main strip of Clearwater Beach.  It was a more secluded area with less volume and wildness that goes down on the other side of the bridge.  Upon arrival, it was easy to see the outside of the hotel was very well-maintained and the grounds were immaculate.  The check-in staff was extremely friendly and helpfull in pointing out some of the specifics about…

title: Loved the Sheraton
review: I only have positive things to say about this hotel - people seem to be regularly complaining about the noise i was in a room that was adjoining and could not hear a sound from that room (it was occupied!), i admit the pool is slightly on the small side but only seemed to get really busy on a saturday other times there was no problems at all   If you want to stay in a fab hotel when your visiting Clearwater Beach this is the hotel for you

title: Doing a great job...
review: Our second stay in 8 months and not our last. The hotels biggest strength is its staff.. something you don't always expect from a corporate identity but SSK is different. Very well managed but still with a personal touch and every part of the hotel running to great yet unobtrusive excellence. In particular the restaurants (not something we would usually use within resort hotels) were very good and competitively priced.. no need to look outside - particularly for breakfast - which was superb! Noted comments about distance to beach which was next to the pool deck... just one small step for man and could not be any nearer.. the 600 yard stroll to the sea over 600 yards of pristine white sand would (for most) be a walk in Paradise. Location is far nicer outside of the somewhat tacky…

title: Sugar sand!
review: We stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key for a week in June 2008. It was a great trip and we really enjoyed the Sheraton.  Although the walk to the beach was longer than we expected, it was worth it. The beach was awesome with the white "sugar sand" and the clear blue water of the Gulf was beautiful.  The room at the Sheraton was fine - not very big but big enough for our family of 3. The view from our room was gorgeous and we enjoyed watching the sunset over the Gulf.  The only negative thing we have to say about the Sheraton was that the pool, although nice, was just too small for the amount of people/kids that were there.  Our 10 yr old really enjoyed the pool but on some days (the weekend) it was tough to find enough room to really move around in the pool.  Also, the staff was…

title: Noise Patrol
review: Just returned from Sheraton Sand Key.  Can't say enough about the entire staff and management.   From the moment we arrived, until we departed, we were treated with respect.  The girls at the front desk were very curtious. Don would greet us everyday by our first names and shake my husband's hand.  If we needed anything, whether it be dinner reservations or directions, he was there immediately.  Housekeeping was prompt as well.  The girls were always smiling and willing to get us anything too.  The hotel was very clean (inside and out)  The biggest downfall, unfortunately, is the noise.  Most of the rooms are adjoining.  When we first got to our room, we could hear the entire conversation from the next room.  It was as if the door between us was open and that we were included in…

title: Loved, Loved, Loved It!!
review: The Sheraton Sand Key is a wonderful property!  From the physical property, which is beautiful, to the friendly employees, you cannot go wrong with this hotel!!  We dined in every restaurant and highly recommend the breakfast buffet-it is a great price and selection that you cannot beat locally.  The room service as well as restaurant food is also equally wonderful.  I had some of the best pasta and my husband, the best cheeseburger that we have ever had!  After a 6 day stay (two adults and one preschooler), the only downfalls that we could come up with were the distance to the ocean is walkable (but quite a distance) and we prefer a hotel that is more in the midst of the area activities.  Other than that, we recommend this hotel to anyone and will return again.  As far as local…

title: Wonderful relaxing place to stay!
review: Just got back from a  4 day stay at Sheraton Sand Key. It was wonderful! The customer service is first rate! Everyone is very friendly and helpful. The sunsets are amazing and we loved the private beach! I would definately stay there again.  The rooms are a little small and dated but very clean. We spent very little time in it anyway so we didn't care.  The pool is great and there are always plenty of lounge chairs and towells  The restaurants are very good and the prices are very fair.  I am so glad we picked Sheraton Sand Key! So many of the hotels I viewed online looked like dumps once we got down there.

title: Great beach hotel for a relaxing few days
review: This is a great hotel for a few days relaxing on the beach.  Has its own beach area which is nice and great to just chill out.  Nearby Clearwater beach has a few good bars which are a hosrt 5-10 mins drive away.

title: very nice beach small pool compared to picture
review: we just got back from a 4 day vacation in clearwater and stayed at the sheraton.overall it is a very nice hotel.the pool is way way smaller than it seems on the photos but nice. the beach is a little walk but its all sand and well worth is since the beach and water is wonderful. the breakfast at rustys is 14 dollars for buffet which in my opinion is not worth it.there is a dunkin donuts across the street that we went to for breakfast. the rooms could use some updating and the bathrooms are small.  staff was very nice.

title: Sheraton is the only place we would stay in Clearwater
review: Sheraton Resort was a wonderful stay.  Great room, great service, housekeeping was the best, quick to provide anything needed and extra towels for all the beach-going.  Amenities were great.  Bathroom was a little smaller than we would have preferred.  Pool looks larger than reality in picture, but still very nice for families.  If you do not like noise, request a bayside view/room.  The pool side rooms are noisy from the pool-goers as well as a bar across the bay that can be heard all the way into the hotel.  Our room was on the bay side so we were happy.  There was some initial noise with a screaming child in the room next door, but the hotel was quick to accomodate our needs, change rooms if necessary and speak with the room with the unruly child.  This is how we got to view…

title: Needs update
review: Stay was enjoyable,  lovely views - quite a walk to the beach but nice.  Room was standard with small bathroom.  Lobby area was not impressive.    NOISY! Screaming children running down the halls at night. Which is very easily heard, by the way. Could also hear conversations from the room next door.

title: Nice resort with great staff
review: We just returned from the Sheraton Sand Key, and had a terrific experience!  We stayed for 6 nights, and were upgraded to a gulf front room (330).  I was told that the staff at the resort are long-term employees (20+ years of service), and it shows!  Front desk staff, housekeepers, Rusty's staff, and pool/beach staff were terrific.  The only so-so service experience was at the Island Grill, a casual in-house restaurant.  We ate regularly at Rusty's and Maggie Mae's for breakfast, and the buffet at Rusty's was well done and (for a resort) reasonably priced.  We enjoyed being on the quiet end of the beach, although we never took advantage of the beach rentals.  Yes, the rooms could stand some updating, and I've had better quality sheets at a Westin or Crowne Plaza, but overall,…

title: Third stay...needs a bit of TLC
review: My husband attends a conference here yearly and I often accompany him. The staff is wonderful, the bar and Island Grill are nice, although the Island Grill could be so much nicer with some attention paid to the outdoor dining area's ambience. Some screening, plantsand  lighting would vastly improve the view of the sidewalkand parking lot!, I've only had breakfast in Rusty's. (It was great) The location is perfect, away from the hustle and bustle of Clearwter and right on the beach. That said, the downsides are : rooms are very "tired" and need to be renovated, the $25 charge for an umbrella and chairs on the beach is outrageous and the pool is too small for the size of the hotel. I had a facial with Betsy and it was just the very best experience ever...she's magical! All in all,…

title: nice resort on the beach
review: We got 2 connecting rooms, tennis court view.  Nice hotel, nice rooms, although not quite 4 star.  Bedding could have been better (not the same as the Westin heavenly bed), and bathroom as said in previous reviews was very small.  We got good deal though, included breakfast buffet each day.  I booked about 10 months out, and noticed rate went up quite a bit before our stay.  Beach is pretty, yet expensive because we had to rent chairs and cabanas every day.  My teens enjoyed jet skiing right from beach, but that was expensive too.  Tennis was free, but make sure you sign up early for a court.  They lend you racquets and balls, no problem.  Pool  area is nice, with outdoor cafe (convenient).  Hotel restuarants were good, and my husband and son enjoyed the pool table in the…

title: Nice Vacation
review: We are SPG members and had booked a room with points and were given a room just as it was stated in the SPG agreement-no view low floor.  The room was adequate but just steps from the elevator and a tile floor so we heard everything that was going on when people were talking and we also did not even have a view of the parking lot.  It was of the roof tops and wall of the other buildings so sitting on the balcony was not a pleasant experience but we were not paying for the room or any taxes or resort charges so that seemed to off set the non-existant view.  There were no up grades even offered or anything special done for us during our stay.  The SPG program has not given us any extras so far and this was our 4th stay at such a place.   We did enjoy our stay as we were visiting…

title: fantastic bit of paradis
review: Spent a week at this resort to unwind after 10 days in disney! How wonderfully relaxing it was ! Perfect beach, lovely pool and the cocktails served by the pool bar are to die for! Our room had recently been refurbed to a high standard. Loads of room for us 2 adults & 1 child. Great choice of restaraunts meant we didn't venture far at night although there is a very good thai over the bridge towards clearwater. Staff couldn't do enough for us. Would definately go back. The hot stone massage is a must!

title: Don't let them put you in room 318!
review: We stayed here last year and loved it, we were given a room at the end of the hall that overlooked the parking lot. It was very clean and QUIET. This year they gave us a room at the other end of the hall after I asked for a quiet room. We thought all was great and went in for a nap after traveling all day. Suddenly there was pounding and talking out our door, I jumped up to find the staff moving rolling beds out of the stairway/storage area next to our door. I went to the front desk and told of our problems and asked for a quiet room again, I was told that this was just going to happen in the afternoon during check-ins and not to worry. The next morning at 7:00am it happened again as the staff removed laundry carts. They actually have installed a guard over the door handle to…

title: Clearly better in Clearwater
review: For a change this year we stayed in a hotel instead of a house and what a great choice it proved to be.  Our room (for 5!) was clean, tidy and big enough for all of us with limitless tea and coffee provided.  Better still, we were right next to the pool with its bar and snack shack and literally only yards from the beach.  Parking was easy, staff were friendly and helpful and we had the greatest pleasure using our free cocktail vouchers tasting the banana banshees and gin and tonics.  Three children (20, 16 and 13) thoroughly enjoyed the pool and meeting new American friends.  Well worth a trip from England and we would definitely stay again.

title: So-So
review: First:  it is a very lovely property in a very good location.  That being said....rooms are small and the bathrooms are tiny.  Little to no counter space, which makes it difficult.  NOISY!  Screaming children running down the halls at night. Which is very easily heard, by the way. Could also hear conversations from the room next door. Someone pulled the fire alarm around midnight and the whole hotel had to be evactuated.  Honestly - some of the rudest guests I've ever encountered.  And no one seemed to care what their children were doing.  The front desk staff was okay - bit of a 'tude.  The bell/guest services/concierge staff was great. Fun guys and very , very friendly.  The restaurants were ehhh. Nothing special and nothing worth staying in for.

title: they treat you so well
review: we have a wonderful holiday here ,all the staff we came in contact with were all so polite and helpfull. we went as two families all our needs were met to the highest standard.  the hotel facilities were excellent the food was gorgeous and the choices to eat were fab. .If you have older children i would recommend here as there is plenty of company for them of all nationalities.    This was our second visit here and it was as good as the first time.

title: Relaxing Vacation
review: My family and I stayed here for four nights and had a wonderful time. The location is great, right on the beach. The room was spacious and always clean though the bathroom area is a little cramp. We loved the plasma t.v and our balcony that faced the pool and gulf. The pool area was nice and there always was enough chairs and towels. We only ate at the tavern and the poolside bar but both were wonderful. The staff were very accomadating and helpful. All and all I had an excellent stay and would reccomened it to anyone who wants a relaxing stay in clearwater!

title: Great Hotel
review: I stayed here for seven nights after a mad week at the parks! The drive from Orlando is easy and the journey across to Sand Key from Clearwater absolutely beautiful. Although the room was a little small by US standards it was immaculately presented and looked out onto the ocean. My kids ( eight year old twins) loved it, particularly the beach front location which meant they could dig in the sand and play volley ball safely with new friends. The pool is quite small but there are lots of beds and towels etc. The restaurants are very nice and Rusty's does a great breakfast buffet. The Jolley Trolley picks up at the hotel and takes you to Clearwater for a few dollars so you can eat out whenever you want. Crabby Bill's has a nice atmosphere and the Island Grill does superb pan asian…

title: Not a 4* - Be careful!
review: This is not a 4* quality hotel.  The rooms are very small with a peculiar bathroom layout where the sink is outside a tiny bathroom! The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything that goes on in the corridor and in the next door rooms.  The pool is small for a hotel of this size, the choice of restaurants and the food on offer in the hotel is equally not of a 4* quality.  The only thing which measures up to expectations is the location right on Sand Key beach.  There are no restaurants within walking distance.  The whole experience was so far from what we expected that we left early!

title: Beautiful Location
review: First impressions are hard to shake. We were unable to unload our car upon arrival at the lobby, being waved through by bell hops due to a stretch limo parked in front at the check in area - the bell hops weren't interested in assisting us with our luggage.  However, the front desk service, landscaping and location were outstanding. Complimentary Voss Water & chocolate covered strawberries were very thoughtful and lovely.   Peak season prices seem a little high for no inclusive activities or sports equipment. Most everything was extra.  Dinner across the street at our favorite restaurant, Columbia was outstanding and the Mojitos made table side were superb.    The hotel entertained lots of families with children.  The breakfast buffet served in their restaurant was overrun by…

title: Not a four star!
review: Expecting much more from a four star sheraton resort, we entered our room to find more of a run down 3 star leveled hotel. Hotel room resembled more of an older hampton inn hotel. Only benefit being a flat screen HDtv.  Room looked run down and old. Cleanliness fine.   The hotel was entirely packed and loud teenagers were found everywhere. Very thin walls so that you could hear tvs at all hours of the night. So if you are planning a quiet romantic getaway this is not your resort. The hotel did however have a very nice large private beach area.    We left our room at around 11 am one morning and returned around 5 to find that housekeeping hadn't even made it to clean our room for the day; which was not a fun surprise. They decided to come back while we were in the room; which we…

title: Great for family
review: We visited the Sheraton Sand Key hotel at the end of March 2008 and overall it was a wonderful six night stay. The hotel is ever so slightly dated but immaculate presentation makes up for that. Our room had two queen sized beds that were the most comfortable I've ever slept in and the room itself was clean and tidy if a bit on the small side. The balcony overlooked the tennis court which was no problem as the lights went out at about 8.30 and the curtains were so thick that our 4 year old slept like a real baby. The balcony was very small, just about enough room for two of you to sit out there. The bathrooms were small but clean, the water in the shower lacked pressure but there was always plenty of hot water. The staff in the hotel were always polite and friendly and nothing…

title: Starwood Owners disappointed in Sand Key
review: First let me say that we are Starwood Owners and have the opportunity to stay at many Westins and Sheratons in the Starwood Family.  We own @ The Westin Kierlands in AZ.  Pros:  Beach is fantastic!  Yes, you must walk a ways, but the view is to die for!  We rented the cabanas very early in the morning to ensure one next to the water.  Worth the $25 to us.  A girl from the pool restaurant will bring out beverages and take your lunch order for you.  Again, very resonable for resort food and beverages for a family of four.  Beach was very clean and the shelling is wonderful, bring your buckets!  Pool was decent, agree with some reviews that it does get to be a free for all with teens and parents throwing nerfs etc.  Was a little hazardous.  Pool starts @ 4 feet which is pretty deep…

title: Just okay
review: Have to say i was dissappointed with this hotel. For $300 a night i expected more. No kleenex in room. Small bathroom, with sink outside of bathroom, small counter area.  Small child in room beside ours very easy to hear, playing beside the door which connects room, sounded like it was right outside our door. Very expensive breakfast ($50) for 3 people. I've stayed at other Sheratons where breakfast (hot) is included. No free internet access in room(extra charge) No free use of fitness center (extra charge) Nice lobby...nice bed...nice tv thats about it!! Would not stay there again, other hotels in same area, with more to offer.

title: very nice
review: we went to the sheraton sand key on feb.  25 and stayed til             march 1.  the trip was booked thru southwest air vacations.      we found everything about the trip to be in good order.  (except      the weather) .         the hotel was a couple of miles from downtown clearwater       beach.  this was a plus.  parking was free. another plus.       the hotel was clean although the gulfview room with balcony      was a bit small.  the  bars were very nice, both the pool bar      and the inside tavern.  all of the staff at the hotel were first       class.  the maid service was outstanding and rooms were      cleaned by 11 am each day. we only ate one breakfast and       one dinner at the hotel and they were both fine.  there are     many good eating places near the hotel. …

title: Extremely poor customer service!!! - bonnie was very rude!
review: We were extremely unsatisfied at our stay at the Sheraton Sand Key.  We stayed the weekend at this location so that we could meet with “Bonnie”, the so called ‘Manager of Events’ to plan our wedding at this location.  She had no customer service or personality at all.  She went out of her way to make us feel Uncomfortable.  She was rude, useless, & did not answer any of our questions.     We are planning a wedding of 200 guests and stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key to ensure that this was truly the location we wanted to host our wedding. When we initially met with Bonnie she did not introduce herself, shake our hands, or even say “congratulations” on our wedding engagement. There were no brochures of prices in writing; instead, they were made up as we walked around the property. …

title: Gorgeous sunsets, lovely accommodations
review: The Sheraton Sand Key Resort is located at the north end of Sand Key, bordering a state park and has stunning views of the white sand beaches and neighboring Clearwater Beach. The pool area is very clean and well maintained. There's an outside snack bar and tiki bar. The beach is nearly pristine and offers lots of finds of the seashell variety for beachcombers. The fitness center is very modern, boasting new equipment and gorgeous views of the Gulf and the bay. For the price, the resort is sufficiently upscale and offers a lot to do within the hotel or within a short walk. We were traveling with our soon-to-be teenaged son and there was enough to do there to keep him amused. The guests themselves are all very nice. We found many of them to be friendly. I even lost my rental car…

title: Fab - loved it!!
review: My family stayed at this hotel in July 2006 for the last week of our holiday. We had just spent the week in Orlando on International Drive going to the theme parks, so we thought this would be a lovely relaxing last week. The hotel was amazing, so clean and modern, all the staff were so friendly and as helpful as could be. There was an on site shop, internet access in the business center, restaurants and bars. The pool area was beautiful! Right on the beach the - golf of mexico. There were plenty of loungers and chairs and they were never taken by towels which was very good! The food in all the restaruants were great, as were the cocktails from the pool side bar! We got the local trolly dolly from outside the hotel into clearwater town and went on a dolphin watching boat trip…

title: Loved it!
review: This was a great getaway from the Northeast cold front!!!  We love the Sheraton (especially the SPG program).  This is a great place to vacation for families.  The rooms are real clean and the restaurant "Rusty's" is great!  We will be back in the future for sure!  I highly recommend the Sheraton SPG program because after we checked in  they delivered a nice bottle of water and chocolate covered strawberries.  Little touches like that really make a trip.  The property has a huge beach area.  While it is a little walk to the actual beach it is all covered by white sand.  Right next store is a nature preserve that offers nice walking trails and a dog park.  The staff was real friendly.  We had no issues so we can't say how they would handle it.

title: nice place - slow cleaning!
review: We stayed at the Sheraton at Sand Key for four nights in January.  First -the good things:   friendly staff,  outstanding shower!, clean room, nice location right on the beach.  Food was ok and reasonably priced.   So - so things:  The rooms are small, and the balcony was tiny.  It is difficult to climb over the tiny table to get to the other chair if you have two people out there.  Bath is small - no place to set things. If you want to sit on the beach it costs $25 to rent a chair or cabana.  You can sit around the pool for free.  The negative:  During the week the housekeeping staff was up and at it at 8 am.  Vacuuming the halls and knocking on doors.  Not exactly conducive to sleeping in.  On the weekend, they were once again vacuuming the halls at 8 am.  This leads you to…

title: Sheraton Sand Key
review: We loved it! We came from cold Pittsburgh to sunny Clearwater--The first few days were cool but we were able to get some tan! Our got engaged at the beach of the Sheraton and we had a wonderful time relaxing-Lots to do-The Sheraton has an inside cafe with great food and bar with live music-nice place to unwind. Can`t wait to go back!

title: Amazing Place
review: Stayed at the Sheraton last July, we had booked our wedding there. We arrived a few days before the wedding and we were greeted with a lovely room with a Gulf view and bottle of Champagne and strawberries, lovely touch.  The Hotel is brilliant, big resort, 3 places to eat in the evening, great cocktails. Staff very friendly. We loved the hot tub (and i mean hot!). Lovely white sand beach.  The room was lovely, quite spacious, 2 queen beds, table and 2 chairs, balcony with table and chairs. Bathroom not huge but enough space. A fridge is recommend to have in the room, available to hire once you are there.  All in all a fantastic place and we have just booked to go back this year! Highly recommended.

title: Great, Relaxing Place to Stay
review: Good location away from Clearwater Beach proper and right next to Sand Key Beach park.  Didn't feel that crowded at pool or anywhere in hotel.  Rooms were comfortable, reasonably roomy, and fit a rollaway bed with no problem.  Fitness center was quite decent and allowed us to work out every day we were here, although it does cost extra.  Upside of that is that it keeps the little and not so little kids from breaking the equipment.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  The beach is quite a ways away from the hotel (5 min walk) - but I noticed that was true for all the hotels on Sand Key gulf side.  The result is that the beach feels empty.  Went for long walks along the beach.  Great sunsets.  The water is a bit chilly in Dec.   All in all a terrific vacation - very relaxing, and we…

title: Super Staff, Relaxing Vacation
review: Just returned from a stay at Sand Key Resort - the resort was very nice and the staff great!  Everyone from the bellman to the front desk staff to the waiters in the restaurants were so friendly and fun.  The resort is nice, not huge, but with a nice pool area and grounds.  The beach was very, very wide right at the resort and a bit of a hike to the water - not a problem this time of year - might be hot in July.  The shelling was good and the beach and water clean.  Rooms were clean and seem newly redone, but the bathroom area was a little on the small side.  Restaurants were all good, room service fine - some meals better than others, but overall good to great.  We wanted a relaxing getaway - and it was.  Recommend to anyone - we will probably visit again in the Spring.

title: Nice hotel, great location
review: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key with my husband, 3 yr old, and 6 mth old. We really enjoyed this hotel, location, and area. I was skeptical because I usually go to the Atlantic side but Sand Key was nice.   The hotel is clean, well run, with a nice pool (small but lots of chairs), and close enough to Clearwater to be convenient. There is a walk to the beach but the sand is powder white and easy to walk on. The water is not clear like the Atlantic side so swimming wasn't that appealing. The hotel is located next to a large park to the North and a lot of condo buildings to the South.  Here are some things we enjoyed in the area: Maggie Mae's (across the street in the strip center slightly south of the hotel) for breakfast. Great food, good service, and reasonably…

title: Superb Break!
review: Booked this hotel to follow a hectic holiday at Disneyland Florida with my wife and two teenage kids - we were not disappointed! The location was fantastic, right on the beach, and the pool area was clean and well kept. We booked a family room which again was clean and in good order, not the biggest but not small either. This hotel is quite large with good facilities and restaurants, the food was very good. Would definitely recommend this place.

title: Very Nice, Loved the Staff!
review: We check out Trip Advisor every time we go on vacation, and as always we were not dissapointed. We loved The Sheraton Sand Key Resort. We arrived from the airport and were able to check in right away. The room was very clean, and nice. Not huge, but we weren't planning on hanging out there a lot.  We then headed down to the pub for some lunch. Very good food, and reasonably priced. The bartender was extremely polite gave us some wonderful tips on how to have a fun week. We would see him again later, and he remembered us, he made sure we were having fun. The Beach is close by - a nice walk out to the water, and a beautiful sunset every night. The pool was crowded during the day, but very peaceful at night. I didn't mind the crowd, we could just lay on the lounge chairs and relax.…

title: OK business trip alternative to staying in Tampa
review: Was working in Tampa for the week, and after having trouble snagging my usual hotel in town near the office, decided to give the Sand Key Resort a shot as a reasonable trade in for the extra commute.  Commute to town ended up being about 35-45 minutes, but it was worth the tradeoff.  With my SPG gold status, I managed to get a partial ocean view king (didn't book a room with a view), extra water and some nice chocolate dipped strawberries on check-in, and free access to the health club (had the option of health club vs. internet, but my EVDO worked fine from the room).  The room was average for a mid-aged sheraton property (downside: slightly worn carpet, above-average room noise from adjacent room, small bathroom), but the view was nice, the health club was superb (lots of…

title: Much better than the Marriott across the street.  Much!
review: My wife and I completed a three night/four day stay at the Sheraton Sand Key near Clearwater and highly recommend this hotel.  Business brings me to this area yearly, and I desire a clean, ocean-front room with refined amenities and a helpful staff at a reasonable price.  Sheraton Sand Key hits these marks.  The beach location of the hotel is spectacular, right on the eastern end of Sand Key, and by booking an ocean view room for $279, and we had an unobstructed view across the palm-treed pool area toward the Gulf.  There is direct walking access to a gorgeous white sand beach, directly adjacent to this hotel, which flows seamlessly into the local state park.  Bring your kite and snorkel.  Plenty of room for sand and beach games as well as an upscale, Florida themed pool and hot…

title: Average rooms, tremendous service
review: Okay, so we're picky.  We travel often, and expect nice accomodations for the money we are willing to pay.  So it was a surprise when we first viewed our room (#830) at this hotel, as it was very clean with a balcony overlooking the pool and with a gulf view.  However, it was no more luxurious than a pretty nice Hampton Inn on the just-passing-through route. The bathroom was small, without a lot of counter space.   If you desire a suite, #829 can be connected, and being the nosey person that I am, I peeked in.  It was a really spacious living area with a dining table.  If we bring our kids next time, that's what we'll do.  #830 is the end unit, nearest the beach. The service cannot be surpassed, even at the nicest hotel or resort.  Everyone is willing to serve with a smile, and…

title: Depends on what you want
review: I stayed here on 7/3/07 as an extension of a business trip just to relax on the beach for a day.  The room was decent and the overall facility is fairly nice.  The clearwater area is nice, clean and not overly commercial.  As you will notice from the candid pictures posted by other guests there are two things to keep in mind:  1.)  The ocean is at least 200 yards from the hotel, not the end of the world but not the most convenient I've seen  2.) The pool was packed with lots of families.  Otherwise the restaurant food was OK but as others have mentioned the service exceeded the offerings.

title: Nice Place
review: We stayed here one night, and had a pleasant time. The room was very comfortable and the service was excellent. Dinner was fine, the service great, but the food just okay. The beach is really wide which I loved, but my friend would prefer being closer to the pool. I would stay here again.

title: Will go back!
review: We stayed at the hotel from 11/8 to 24/8. Since arriving back in the UK I have read to report regarding the school reunion which took place whilst we were staying. Luckily, we were in room 603 which overlooked the tennis courts and was a quiet room, so we did not experience all of the noise etc from the pool area, so were totally unaware of the police presence etc. I was slightly annoyed that the pool was closed the following morning until nearly 2pm, and was told that it was because of a power failure. To compensate, bottles of complimentary water were provided by the pool area.  I agree that it is annoying that after paying a lot of money to stay at the hotel and to use the facilities, which anyone could park up in the car park, sit by the pool, use the free towels and…

title: Not a romantic getaway!
review: My husband and I were extremely disappointed with our experience at this hotel.  The overly crowded pool was constantly swarming with obnoxious children.  When we wanted to escape the noisy hotel, we tried to relax on a seaweed and shell covered beach that was EXTREMELY far from our hotel.  The walk, in the intense heat, kept us away from the gulf, which was our main reason for traveling to Florida!  There is an insane charge of $25 for 2 crusty lounge chairs on the shore!  Stay away from this hotel if you are looking for a quiet and relaxing vacation.

title: Great Place
review: I stayed here for a short getaway over the 4th of July.  The room was nice, nothing special but clean and modern.  The staff was very friendly and helpful, the best I have experienced in quite a while.  The facility was great.  There was a 24 hour shop that had snacks, drinks, sandwiches, etc. which was really convenient.  There was also a large business center with about 4 computers for checking email, printing boarding passes, etc.  The pool was a little small and very crowded over the holiday weekend but the beach was spectacular.  All and all a nice relaxing place to spend a few days.

title: Wonderful time albeit with a few problems
review: Location- V quiet location on a strip of luxury condos, at the end of Sand Key bridge leading to the main eateries, bars hotels and motels of clearwater about 1 mile away. Close enough but far enough away. Right on a fantastic beach, a real peaceful classy location.  Staff- First class, real old fashion courteous and helpful. A credit to the Sheraton chain. Pete and Jeff in the pool bar the porters and Todd the Housekeeping Manager deserve special praise.  Public areas- The hotel is some 25 years old but you can see evidence of continual improvements and updates. Excellent standards of decor and spotless clean, the look of a real quality hotel in and out.  Rooms- Very clean and smart, well furnished but small with very small bathroom and toilet area. We had an Ocean view room on…

title: Best family vaca. for the money
review: Our family cannot say enough about this hotel.   First and foremost is RELAXING!!!!  We were greeted by a bell hop who brought our bags to our room and then shared so much information about the area and the places the locals loved to eat and visit.  The hotel offers several restaurants from the pool side cafe area, which was extremely affordable to Rusty's for incredible fine dining.  The crab cake they offered there was unlike nothing I've ever eaten!  The beach was amazing and was just a few steps away from an incredible pool & hot tub area which had awesome live Carribbean and Calypso music playing to an incredible poolside bar which offered a great variety of drinks.  You could grab a drink and sit by the pool to view incredible sunsets or saunter down to the beach to catch…

title: Great choice after reading reviews
review: Read lots of reviews on where to stay in the Sand Key and the Sheraton is a wonderful place to stay.  Family orientated and yet Adult catered.  A beautiful hotel and room without complaint.  Definately a 5 star place to stay.  However,,, the price is alot to pay for families.  We did get a nice price on the internet many months in advance.  The food at the beach and pool area was quality.  The beach,,, although a bit of a walk,, was beautiful and we had a lovely 2 days on it.  Staff all were beyond friendly and helpful.  From the girl driving the cart for food and drinks on the beach to the woman working the gift shop... we found everyone extremely pleasant and friendly to deal with.  Definately recommend and would stay again in a heartbeat.

title: Sheraton SandKey - Nice Stay but overpriced
review: Our family just returned from a 1-week stay at the Sheraton SandKey resort.   Part of my homework was looking at the reviews on this site, and I have to say the comments are spot on, so I was not too surprised with what we experienced.    BEACH:  You are paying a premium for close proximity to the beach  - so will start with this.  The beach sand is not as fine as Clearwater Beach just north (I think they truck the sand in annually up there), and yes there were days where the seaweed was heavy, but I can't see what the hotel could have done about that.   The midday sun was relentless and there is zero shade except for the $25 /day umbrellas.   The beach is also a bit of  a trek from the property, although you don't need to cross any streets like the nearby Marriott.  The hotel…

title: Seaweed Beach!
review: Just returned from a five day stay at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  In summary:  PROS:  In our opinion, the only outstanding feature of this resort was the services provided, and the amenities available.  Staff went out of their way to offer any help; concierge staff were absolutely wonderful, front desk very cheerful and we had good experiences at Rusty's and the Isand Grill.  There are three indoor options for meals (depending on the time of day), and a grill outside by the pool.     Computer room was handy, as was the small snack shop in the lobby.    The resort also has volleyball nets, and tennis courts available.     The setting of the resort is very pretty, and hotel is landscaped beautifully.  Many tables available away from pool area, nicely appointed pool area.  CONS:…

title: A resort with more to offer!
review: The Sheraton chain has always been a favorite, and this particular location was one of their best. It is not just a hotel but what I would consider to be a real resort property. The staff is very friendly and helpful, sometimes a bit overzealous! The room was large, and well appointed, with a fantastic soft king sized bed. I feel it was a bit pricey, but the views of the sunset over the gulf from our balcony were breathtaking. A nice touch was the chocolate dipped strawberries on our first night. A turn down service would have been nice as well.  The restaurants in the hotel are nice, just a little humdrum. I would have expected a restaurant with a water view, but they don't have one. The breakfast buffet was a bit pricey and not carb friendly to the two of us on South Beach!We…

title: Great Family Resort Hotel
review: This is an exceptionally good family resort hotel.  I stay in hotels over 50 nights per year and have never had the extremely good quality of service that is given at the Sheraton Sand Key.  We were 6 adults and three children under 5 on a week long family vacation. The staff is extremely attentative without being intrusive.  They seem to anticipate your needs.  Many called us by name after the first day. The rooms are clean and towel service was provided twice a day (more if requested).  Several previous reviewers talked about the rooms being too small, but the rooms are more than adequate in size with nice balconies. The grounds are kept beautifully. The hotel restaurants serve good, wholesome well prepared food at a VERY reasonable price,  All three restuarants were "Kid…

title: Average hotel, small pool but great beach!
review: This hotel is really quite average. The pool is far too small for the size of the hotel, in fact at some points it was so crowded, we couldn't get in. There are loads of beds but no parasols unless you want to sit at a table. There is a nice cocktail bar but the staff are not overly friendly. Pool toilets are awful.  The beach is lovely, white sands but the hotel cahrges $25 a day for a parasol and 2 beds! These should be free!  The restaurant, Rustys, serves breakfast and dinner. The breakfast staff are quite grumpy with the exception of the greeter who is very enthusiastic, but food and price are very good. In the evenings, the buffet is excellent and extremely good value. We ate there twice and were served by Mark both times. He was friendly, cheerful and made us feel very…

title: if you want to be treated like royalty go to sheraton sand key resort
review: Just returned from family holiday to Sheraton Sand Key Hotel.  Had a wonderful time there.  From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty, we were made very welcome by a baggage handler unfortunately I can not remember his name but he made our first impression a very nice one.  Staff at reception also exceptionally friendly and nice, Geoff Malek and Mark Griffiths were very helpful.  Our room was lovely, with a beautiful view of the white sands, blue water and wonderful sunsets. Read several reports/complaints  about the walk to the water along the sand, yes it is shingly but it is beautiful.  On our first day there was lots of seaweed in the water but for the next 6 days it had gone.  If I could walk down that beach every day for the rest of my life I would. We ate…

title: Not a Resort, more like a convention hotel
review: Stayed for almost a week for work that we extended into a weekend vacation.  Hotel was clean and housekeeping and bar staff were great.  Pool was very small and the "tiki" bar closed at sunset though the pool remained open.  It rained one afternoon fairly hard and it took until almost 24 hours later to reopen the pool because of the cloudy water. Once the pool was reopened the pool was taken over by a large group of people who were using one of the conference rooms and all the guests had to leave the pool!  On Saturday night they had a high school reunion which made it almost impossible to park when we came back from dinner.  Internet service was down for 3 days and had to walk across the street and use the Marriotts internet access (which was free - should have used it all week…

title: Not a Great Experience
review: Last month my husband and I stayed at this resort while we were in town for a wedding. There were some good qualities for example, the lounge was nice and the room was clean, however the location of the room was less than desirable. We had a room on the ground floor facing the pool, however it was located right by the elevators  the noise level was so loud that I could not sleep at night. All I could here was loud chatter and crowds of people walking all along the hallways until 3 am. If you do stay here, I would recommend requesting a room anywhere but the ground floor.

title: The sheraton has all you need
review: We stayed at the Sheraton June 25-27 with our 4 children ranging in age from 6-16 after a few days in Disney.  It was very relaxing and we were all ready for some beach time.  Mike greeted us as we arrived at 10 p.m and was great.  He told us a condensed version of the layout and some ins and outs for the kids.  Check in was fine and we did not have a rude person as another reviewer mentioned.  We were given 2 adjoining rooms with a great view of the sunsets.    The next day we headed for a day at the beach after breakfast at Maggie Mae's which I would recomment.  It is only a short walk and there is a Dunkin Donuts if you prefer that instead.  The pool was small but the hotel wasn't as crowded and later in the day(4:30 pm) was no problem finding a chair.  There is quite a bit…

title: Nice stay at the Sheraton
review: The goods out way the bad, so let me get the bad out of the way.  The manager at the front desk was rude and unhelpful.  We arrived around 1pm so the nice valet held our luggage and said he would take it to our room when it was ready.  The person at the check in counter said they would call when our room was ready so we went to the bar to get some lunch.  The service in the hotel bar was horrible.  When we seen the valet walk by with our luggage my husband went to the front desk to inquire if our room was ready he rudely replied No it's not and he told us that he does not have to check us in until 3pm.  Then we heard him being the same way with another guest. He was rude and short and if we had to base our stay at this hotel on his serivce I would have given the hotel a Terrible…

title: Comprehensive review - Almost all thumbs up! Lots of reading but worth it!
review: Just stayed 3 nights and overall really enjoyed it. Went through these same reviews prior to going and wanted more information than we found, especially costs. Well here it is. Wanted to stay longer but @ $228+tax per night (AAA rate) had to limit our stay. LOCATION-Really good spot on Clearwater Beach. A few places to eat locally but luckily this was not in some of the more commercial or shabby areas we saw. We did a ton of research on hotels and this was our 2nd choice of only two we wanted to stay at. The other was the Clearwater Hilton but the rates are really high ($300+/night) there unless you can catch a great internet rate ($145/night). The Hilton is a much better location right at Pier 60 with more local dining options. STAFF-The staff was really friendly everywhere;…

title: Great getaway
review: We booked a bay view double room for a weekend girls getaway (previous getaway locations:  NYC and Seattle).  The property was exactly what we wanted--relaxed, friendly, no rip-off pricing in the restaurants, and easy access to the beach.  THE GOOD:   1)  location, location, location.  Lots of construction getting TO the hotel, but nothing once we got there.  Walking distance to a couple of low-key restaurants and shops.  Nestled in between a big condo complex and a state park. 2)  nice rooms--not huge, but adequate.  We paid the upgrade for the view and felt it was worth it. 3)  beach access.  Yes, it's a little bit of a hike compared to some other resorts, but it's very private once you're down there.  We paid for an umbrella and 3 lounge chairs ($35 or so), and I'd have been…

title: Lots of bugs & traffice...but it was just ok
review: We traveled with our 6 month old son and there was positive and negative things about this resort.  First of all, the lovebugs were a MAJOR issue.  I know thats not the hotels problem, but it ruined our time.  I had to keep a constant eye so that the bugs don't go all over our son.  There were EVERYWHERE!!  Although we did stay during a holiday weekend, there was traffic all over.  It was impossible to get to pier 60.  Plus with all of the construction, it was just a mess.  The hotel was very clean and the staff was extremely polite.  Our room was just ok.  I am a starwood member and I thought I would atleast get a nice upgrade, but our so-called room was one.  Actually the whole floor was for starwood members.  They said the hotel was booked and they couldn't upgrade us.  I was…

title: Not the Best for Small Children
review: My husband, 7 month old son and I just returned from the Sheraton Sand Key where we stayed for 6 days.  We had read all the reviews before we chose this hotel for which we redeemed our Starwood Points.  Our expectations were not very high as this was our first vacation post baby and we were just looking to get away.  The hotel itself is very clean, the bellmen are very helpful and all in all our accomodations were fine.  Our issues had more to do with the services available for what is touted as a children friendly hotel.  It is nearly impossible to get a space in the shade at the pool.  There were 4 or 5 tables that were always taken.  You can go on the grass which we did but the bugs were unbearable - the only place we were happy was in the water which was nice and lots of fun…

title: A relaxing Holiday! Beautiful...
review: Lovely Hotel and beautiful beach.  We had a room with direct view of the pool/beach on a busy Memorial day weekend.  The room was average size but very clean and modern. The beds were comfy which is a huge issue for us.  My children loved the grounds and pool.  The pool area was beautiful with a bar and eating area with relaxing calypso music.  There is a small childrens playground and wading pool. The hotel loans out floats and noodles for the kids.  My only gripe is that the pool should be a little larger for the size of the hotel. The beach is quite a hike with toddlers but a beautiful walk.  I would definitely stay here again. The hotel was located in the nice, quiet area of Sand Key - better suited to us and more resort like than the other ends of the Clearwater…

title: Not the best as far as Starwoods Hotels go, however location is great
review: We (hubby, me, two boys 4 and 2) just came back from a week trip (May 20 to May 27) and here is our review:  PERSONNEL: Special mention to Dan who helped us tremendously with maps and directions to Busch Gardens and SeaWorld.  Also very entertaining to the kids. Also special mention to Angeles who took great care of us as our housekeeping person (noticed that we had children and provided us with extras).  Special mention to Vicky at Rusty's in the mornings who always greeted us with a smile and served us well. I personally did not find the front desk personnel to be friendly (very terse and uncaring).    ROOM: TOO small for value (>$250/night).  The Sheraton is below our expectations (behind LeMeridien and Westin).  We had two queen beds which took most of the room.  The…

title: Sad to leave!!
review: Just returned from a week at the Sand Key Resort and loved it.  Our four year old said it best when he said "But Momma, I want to live here, now!".  The staff and service levels are excellent.  Everytime we returned to hotel from a day out and about, the bellmen, desk staff, and concierge greeted us like family.  They knew our names right away and were always asking if we here having a good time or if we needed anything at all.  Special kudos to Gary at the front desk and Don, the bellman.  These two guys exemplify what good hospitality service is.    ROOM-Room was nice, typical hotel room.  Cleaning service was never an issue.  If we went out to the beach in the morning, the room was clean by noon.  We were surprised that there was no fridge in the room but it didn't matter to…

title: An overachiever on the beach
review: This is a nice mid priced hotel with a great location. Accommodations are typical for a Sheraton, room size etc.. They really shine in their personnel and outdoor facilities. The pool is anything but small, and the walk to the beautiful beach is daunting only to the physically challenged. I particularly liked the outdoor bar and the people who worked there. Though everyone was so friendly and accommodating. Food here is OK, they can recommend some good local restaurants for you, (I highly recommend Guppy's).

title: picky client
review: We stayed for 6 days, my husband was on business, vacation for me. After a bit of complain about our room assignement  (starwood gold member) we were  moved to a 2 queen size beds instead of a king but a much better view, we were never able to get a similar room view with a king size, we were okay with it, view is what counts! First the bad stuffs. The room was average and quite dark , not much privacy, the way the hotel is built people could look into our bedroom from theirs, I always had to keep curtains closed at night and during the day, if I was lying on the bed I had the feeling they could see me. Compare with oher hotels in same category, bathroom is very small, no robes, we had to ask for them, they were delivered quickly, no turn down service, witch is no big deal ice…

title: Best Hotel in Clearwater
review: Clearwater Beach is a pleasant retreat from Tampa, and the Sheraton Sand Key a delightful retreat from Clearwater Beach. We enjoyed the spacious, tranquil beach. The sand quality is just a bit shell-ier than Clearwater Beach proper but far less polluted. A knowledgeable and friendly man on the beach named Ronnie will hook you up with premium parasailing and jet-skiing. A lady in some kind of beach vehicle sells you food and drinks at the water's edge. Those who complain about the long trek to the ocean need to get in shape. I too felt intimidated by the expanse of sand in the pictures, but it's an easy walk of less than five minutes. The hotel makes good use of the extra sand space by setting up beach volleyball and tents for parties. We loved watching the sunset from the hot…

title: Overpriced average hotel - careful w/ the food
review: The hotel is a typical average hotel that happens to be on Clearwater/Sandy Key beach.   The actual water is about 1/2 mile walk on the sand (no exaggeration).  The pool is very small for the hotel.  The pool bar and restaurant closes before 8pm on a crowded Saturday night.  When we arrived Saturday morning at 11am the front desk said that the room wasn't ready but that the room was vacated and is being cleaned.  They took our cell phone number and said the room should be ready within an hour.  When we returned an hour later to check the progress, another clerk said that we were in luck because the room has been vacated and that it was being cleaned.  We were requested to await another hour.  The room was ready 1.5 hours later.  We purchased the romance package which is suppose…

title: Sun, Surf and Sand Key
review: Sand Key is considerably quieter than heavily packed Clearwater Beach to the north and the sprawling nondescript beach communities to the south.  The Sheraton Sand Key is one of two premiere lodging facilities along this mellow and slightly upscale strip of land.  Where the Marriott faces east on the bay side, the Sheraton looks westward toward the Gulf.    This is a first class resort in many ways.  First, the service is exceptional.  From our initial greeting at the valet until final checkout, our interactions with every member of the staff, including restaurant personnel, valet and front desk people, etc, showed a genuine friendliness and an interest in making guests feel welcome and comfortable.  Then there are the facilities, including a beautiful centrally located heated…

title: Great stay at the Sheraton
review: I stayed here for a business trip, and it was a great place to stay.  They were helpful when I called to make my reservations, because it was past the deadline to get the conference rate and they gave me the discount anyway.  I really like the hot tub.  The jets are strong, the water is hot, and it is large enough to fit several people without sitting on top of each other.  The hotel location is good because it is on the beach.  They also have a good variety of restaurants inside.   I also liked that the lobby had lots of places to sit.

title: Lovely Hotel
review: We stayed in the Sand key end of March Beginning of April 2007. I have to say that the Hotel and facilities were first class. Our room was not quite ready upon arrivel, but this caused no problem as we were given vouchers to get free cocktails from the bar, and a pager to page us when the room was ready (which was approx one hour later). The rooms were very clean and ours had a Gulf View which was lovely. Rooms are slightly smaller than the average, but still plenty big enough for our needs. and well equipped.  My one gripe with the hotel was the parking. This Hotel does hold conferances, and at times parking was difficult, which is not ideal when you are a paying Hotel Guest with an 8 year Old child in tow.   Overall a very nice hotel, that i have no hestation in reccomending…

title: Good Place for Kids; Decent Value
review: We stayed over Spring Break (the week before Easter). The hotel was sold out but it didn't feel over crowded. Tons of kids and families but we only heard kid noise thru connecting door to the room next door. The playground is nice (but small) and the pool is heated, with lots of towels available. We played a round robin tennis event sponsored by the pro. It was a lot of fun and had a lot of locals, making it well worth the $10 for 2 hours of good (3.0-3.5 mostly) tennis. The beach is on the property but the water seems like a 1/4 mile walk from the pool over sand and shells. Not good for strollers or wheelchairs. Cabana/umbrella rental at the beach was efficient and not fru-fru. You tell the attendant you want to rent one, he/she gives you the number of what you rented, and…

title: Love this place...........
review: Stayed here during spring break, worth the extra dollars to avoid the crowds. Second time we have stayed here with our two sons 17 and 12. They love it!   Pool is beautiful and clean as are the bedrooms. Beach is clean and the walk to it is not so bad. It’s quiet and frequented by dolphins daily.  The daily buffet breakfast in Rusty's is awesome although a little pricey, but what the hell. The bar food is excellent value and the atmosphere is good. We also did room service one night. It arrived in less than 30 minutes and hot. And you can't go wrong with the evening food served in Rusty's. Service was excellent.  The staff are ALL very courteous from the concierge to the sweet guy renting beach cabanas.   Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and I would certainly pay the…

title: Our 7th time staying here!!!
review: We have stayed at the Sand Key for the past several years during April sch vacation, as well as for Super Bowl and other long weekends.  Most of the staff has been there forever and are wonderful, and I agree with the above review.....the location is perfect...away from the hustle and bustle, but close enough to everything with a short drive.  The trek to the beach is a bit of a hike, but a good way to work off the wonderful cocktails!!!  Very clean thru out, food is Sheraton quality (a high OK).  Pretty good gym and great walking around there....also right next to a national park.  One of our faves in the world!!  We leave on Wednesday to go!!!  YAY!!!

title: Great Resort!
review: We stayed 2 nights at the Sheraton Sand Key.  Although it was a bit pricey ($275/nt for a "view" of the roof top air conditioners), it was peak season, and the price was comparable to the surrounding properties.   The lobby and common areas are beautiful.  The staff was helpful.  The room itself (2 queens) was one of the smaller rooms we had ever had at any hotel, but the beds & pillows were first rate and very clean.  The pool was nice, plenty of lounge chairs.  The beach was great, lots of space, and clean.  Beach service (umbrellas, lounge chairs) is available for $25/day.  BE SURE to dine at the ISLAND GRILL in the hotel.  We found the food to be good and the prices to be very reasonable for an upscale hotel.  Get the soup and salad bar!  Two gourmet soups and great fresh…

title: Good times at Sheraton Sand Key
review: Spent 4 days/nights at Sheraton Sand Key for Spring Break...my wife and 2 children of 11 and 13 years.  Hotel was clean and the ENTIRE staff very friendly - so friendly that my son characterized it as "freaky" - a sad statement on the society he is growing up in.  The formal restaurant, Rusty's I believe, is EXCELLENT.  Live piano, great service, awesome food.  The pool area is very nice, but nothing extravagant - just well maintained with an enjoyable atmosphere.  As others have said I am sure, you should know the walk to the beach is LONG.
