Now, I didn't mind it, but to describe the hotel as "on the beach" would be a bit of a stretch.  My description would be to say it is located on a long stretch of sand which leads you to the beach.  Our room was clean and we had a great…

title: Great beach property
review: Visited for a business conference in late March.  Great cross between a business and resort hotel.  Friendly and helpful staff across the board.  I would stay here again without hesitation.  Pool starts at 4-feet and goes to 8-feet.  Didn't have a problem getting a chair during busy spring vacation period.  The kids' pool is quite small, 1' deep but perhaps only 8-10-foot diameter.  The beach begins right off the pool area, but it's a decent walk to the water edge.  Sand toys are available for use.  A beach cabana or umbrella with 2 padded chairs was $25/day.

title: Great vacation spot!!
review: The Sheraton Sand key was a great place.  The entire staff was friendly and very willing to make our stay enjoyable.  The location was great, and the beach was beautiful!! The morning breakfast buffet was a great value and kept us full until dinner.  The rooms were very clean, the sweet sleeper bed was so comfy!!!  We had a bay/skyline room, I would do this again what a great view!!  I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially people with kids.  We will definately return!!!!!

title: Wonderful Meeting!
review: The Sheraton Sand Key was a wonderful location for our small business group to me Jan 30 and 31st.  We usually have our meeting in South Flordia- Ft. Lauderdale or Hollywood but due to the Super Bowl being in Miami we relocated to Clearwater.  They Staff was very attentive.  I was greeted by the Sales Manager, our group catering manager.  During our stay the General Manager even came by to see how things were.  If we had an issue it was addressed very quickly and professionally.  If the group was not dead set on going back to Ft. Lauderdale in 2008 I would book our meeting there again!  The only draw back is that you have to drive to most of the restaurants.  The hotels Banquet service was top notch, food was excellent and the servings were very large.  Great stay, beautiful,…

title: Great Service- Great Hotel
review: Me, my husband and 4 year old daughter stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key March 22-26.  We absolutely loved the hotel.  The service was outstanding.  One example:  I called to front desk for more towels one evening and the towels were at our door within two minutes and the front desk called back to make sure we received our towels.  We stayed in room 601- a King room.  It was a nice size and decorated nice-modern.  Houskeeping did a great job cleaning everyday.   Along with the great restaurants they also have a gift store with plenty to eat.  The gift store has Krispy Kreme doughnuts, fresh fruit, cereal, muffins, milk, yogurt, etc.  If you have children I recommend renting a refridgerator for $5 a day and going to the gift store for milk, juice, cereal, etc.  We saved quite a bit…

title: Loved this place!
review: My family of four stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort for five nights.  The room we had was a typical size hotel room with two queen beds.  The best part was the balcony where we could sit and watch the activities at the pool, listen to the live music during the day and watch the spectacular sunsets in the evening.  The beach was a bit of a walk and it is mostly crushed shells, not a lot of sand near the water.  They are not sharp to walk on but would have preferred a more sandy beach.  The hotel staff was very friendly and the place was very clean.  There are at least three restaurants on sight - all with great food.

title: very nice hotel,location though is a bit secluded.
review: I have stayed in quite a few Sheraton resorts worldwide I believe this to be an average resort with some attractive features .  I do though believe the hotel to be a little isolated amongst a number of large condos,not necessarily a bad thing if you want to eat in the hotels restaurants every night,but someone who is travelling with young children this can prove a little tedious.  I believe though the hotels service is very good and attentive maybe sometimes a little over zealous.  The Bar was an enjoyable experience very clean with free afternoon aperitifs ,you will though find that the service becomes alot better if you tip well !  I believe overall the resort is well run ,very clean ,fairly good facilities for families and the food is of a good standard.  I would though think…

title: A Conference Hotel
review: This is a good hotel for a conference. For a room rate of $335 to start and the promise of a room with "prime ocean view", my expectations were high. Sheraton pays big companies to develop great ads with catchy phrases but does not deliver on it's promises. There was no great view but rather a side view of the bay. The lobby seemed liked a 3 star hotel lobby and everything was below our expectations. The pool was small and the beach was about a 1/4 mile of a walk. The only redeeming thing about our experience was the staff. The staff was helpful, friendly and extremely attentive. There was no compelling reason for us to visit the Sheraton Sand Key again and I truly wished I had visited Disney instead.

title: Really nice, but have to pay for everything!
review: This is a beautiful hotel and the service is excellent. My only complaints are that guests have to pay to use the internet and to use the gym. For a fairly high-priced hotel, one would think that those services would be free. I attended a conference with some colleagues, so internet access was necessary. The hotel does have a business center on the first floor that offers free internet access (3 computers) and a printer, but when a conference is in session it's often difficult to get access. Also, I would have liked to use the gym, but money was tight and I didn't want to spend $7 a day just to exercise for a half hour!  Otherwise, a really nice place to stay.

title: Definitely Recommend This Hotel
review: My husband and I just returned from a three day stay at this property.  We were very happy with the accomodations and found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful -- the service was absolutely impeccable.  We are Starwood rewards members and there was a big bottle of VOSS water and some chocolate covered strawberries waiting in our room upon arrival.  We also received two free bottles of water per day.  We booked a king, ocean-view room and found it to be beautiful and very clean.  The room itself was a nice size -- the bathroom was a bit small but had a separate sink/vanity area which was nice.  The only complaint about the room was that it wasn't very quiet, but we only experienced noise issues for a little while in the morning hours (we are late sleepers).  It wasn't…

title: Would Stay Again
review: My husband and I just got back from a 4 nights at the Sand Key Resort.  It was just as wonderful as the reviews said.  The hotel itself was clean, well kept, and stylish.  The outside was colorful with beautiful plants.  The pool area was small but we never felt cramped.  The staff were very friendly and helpful in every way. There were a number of  restaurants.  We ate at the island grill for lunch most days.  It was very good.  We chose to go out for dinner in the  local area.  We  would recommend this hotel and return there ourselves.

title: Big Beach!
review: Extremely freindly staff, warm and inviting entry. My teenagers said it was the best hotel they had ever been in and if it was made into an all inclusive resort it would be awesome! Great beach, large enough for what would seem like thousands of people without bumping into each other. Families with children will enjoy the facilities. Great rooms with comfortable beds and my wife loved the pillows. Only minor complaint would be the relatively small bathrooms. A small price to pay for the fabulous grounds. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Worth the money
review: We just recently stayed a the Sheraton Sand Key for 3 nights.  The price was reasonable and the room is what you would expect from a Sheraton hotel.  We travel to the area 3 or 4 times a year and I would stay there again.  The only thing that I could see as a problem is the amount of close parking,  If there is a event going on in the resort,  parking close to the front door can be very rough.  The staff was very helpful and always asked if they could help with something.  I would recommend this place to a close friend.

title: Wonderful hotel
review: After 7 days at Disney World with all our children and grandchildren we needed a place for R&R and found it at Sheraton Sand Key hotel in Clearwater. Sparkling clean rooms and facility with superb staff. Landscaping and ammenities around pool and beach were terrific. Rooms were conventional in size but immaculately clean and well appointed, with those on gulf side equipped with small balcony giving a beautiful panorama of gulf waters and the wonderful sunsets. Directly across the street is Columbia restaurant, (related to famous old Tampa restaurant of same name), and also a great little breakfast place on the bay, Maggies Sunshine Cafe. This hotel is a really great place with great service. (  A minor point for improvement would be to replace the slightly noisy room air…

title: Love the Sheraton Sand Key
review: From the welcome when we arrived though our entire stay, the service was fantastic, the attention to detail great, and the food was outstanding.  The only negative about this hotel is that the walls are thin to the point that you can hear the conversations of your neighbors, or their TV.  We had one of their one room suites, so I can't comment on what others have said about room/bathroom size, but we had ample space.  When our TV remote quit working there was someone there within 4 minutes with a new remote and to check the wiring in case something had come loose.  Ten minutes after that we got a follow up call to make sure everything was done to our satisfaction.   The beach was clean and the pool area had plenty of loungers.  Staff admitted it was a slow weekend - but this…

title: Great Hotel
review: We Stayed in this hotel in June 06. It was our honeymoon and really enjoyed our stay.   The staff are very friendly and the rooms are very clean.   The only problem i had was the air conditioning in the room was noisy and it was impossible to sleep if it was on.

title: Definitely a mixed bag........
review: Keep in mind, that I was staying on business for a conference Nov 12-15 so this review is from the vantage point of a business traveller. This is also my second stay for the same event. I will keep it simple: Pros: Hotel rooms are large and clean. The room service is very reasonable but the food is nothing spectaular. Ordered shrimp cocktail,   cesar salad ,onion soup and key lime pie, the pie being the one item I thought to be better than just average. The service was extremely prompt and courteous. The beds are comfortable and the location is really nice with adequate ameneties, pool, tennis etc. The beach is gorgeous and I dont really understand reviews stating that it is "far away" . These must come from the same people who circle a parking lot fifteen times in order to park…

title: How the other half lives/ budget traveler at a fancy hotel
review: I stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key in November 2006 for a business conference.  I usually stay at mid-range chains, so I was excited to have the opportunity to stay somewhere so fancy – but learned that there are good and bad sides to the equation.  On the plus side, the hotel is immaculate, the beds are comfortable, and the rooms are large and well-lit.  They have a restaurant, a pool-side café, pool-side bar, a tennis pro on staff, a spa, and a gift shop.  On the other hand, they have only 20 or so channels on the televisions, no continental breakfasts, charge by the hour for hi-speed internet access, and are not within walking distance of any non-Sheraton restaurants.   To each their own: Since I don’t play tennis or don’t like paying $12 for a mediocre hamburger I'd have…

title: Great attention to customer satisfaction
review: I have stayed at many motels/resorts, but this Sheraton exceeded my expectations. Your treated with VIP service everywhere you go in the resort. From the beach, outside bar/lunch areas, to the onsite restaurants. The breakfast buffet at Rustys is fit for a King.  Free morning papers at your door. The rooms are beautiful and the beds are plush and comfortable with tons of the softest pillows!  The grounds are immaculate and well tended. A heated pool and nice hot tub nearby.  Your not swamped on the beach and the sand is snow white. A volleyball area fit for a hugh crowd.  But overall I would say of everything that I loved about this place,  the kind people who work there was what stood out the most .  They were always friendly and ready to do whatever you needed to make you feel…

title: very nice!
review: I thought this hotel was great for kids, we have four kids and they absolutely loved this place! This hotel was great! nice pool, awsome tiki bar, great resturants, nice view, a lot of parking, helpful staff, volley ball courts, it was very clean. The only thing i didnt like about this hotel was that our room was pretty small. But overall great hotel I would recommend staying here!

title: Friendly, helpful staff
review: We stayed here on Sunday, October 29, 2006 for one night. We walked in about 1:pm and was able to get a gulf veiw on the 6th floor. All employees from the parking lot to the front desk welcomed us. The room was very clean, the bed comfortable and we had a beautiful veiw. Over priced? Yes and no, but worth it for 1 night. It was nice to have different dining options right on property and room service. We had a late lunch in the lounge, good food, great service. We had drinks at the outside bar, again good drinks and excellent service. We had breakfast in bed and it came 5 minutes earlier then the time frame we asked for! Food was good.   Con.......paper thin walls. I could hear the people next door and outside our room.

title: Nice place, quiet
review: I had stayed here in 1996 and thought it was a nice hotel, so I came back. Here are some quick comments:  Pro's Room was clean and had balcony. Nice beds and bedding Pool area was nice Gulf was a bit far away, but very nice Quiet area Friendly staff.  Hotel was very full, so we were upgraded to a gulf view room for a non-gulf view rate.  They also have a room you can use to clean up after you check out in case you want to use the facility for the rest of the day.  Con's Small bathroom area Hotel is a bit expensive for the off season

title: very fine resort
review: I booked 5 rooms for our extended family for Oct 5 through Oct 8.  Service was first rate, rooms were very clean. The bathrooms were rather small, but who stays for an extended time in a bathroom?    Each room had a small balcony, mine looked over the tennis court. that's OK for me. The Island Cafe had  the best food of all the restaurants in the local area. Service was excellent and the prices were very reasonable. Don't eat the soups, though, too much salt.   The other eatery "Rusty's" was rather expensive, we ate  breakfast there, that was OK.  service was also good . The pool was clean and well maintained.  The outdoor bar near the pool has excellent bartenders. although the  drink selection  is marginal due to the high temperatures (ex:  no red wine).    The beach is wide,…

title: Disappointed
review: We were not very pleased with our hotel stay this past week at the Sheraton Sand Key, Clearwater FL.  I anticipated staying at a hotel right on the beach, but instead it is about a block and a half or two of a walk to the beach.  And, once you get out there, there is nothing that you can buy to eat or drink, so plan accordingly.  If you want to sit on a nice lounge chair, it costs $20 for two.  The attendant out there is very nice, however.  The interior of the hotel isn't that nice, especially the room we stayed in.  I felt like I was in a motel room instead of hotel room.  Plus we were stuck in a room right outside the elevator!  And there is tile floor there, so there is no such thing as quiet.  The walls are very thin, so you can hear everything going on next door.  Overall,…

title: Desk clerk caught lying
review: Stayed here over Christmas holiday 4 people - 2 rooms.  Like the beach area, the other party enjoyed their room.  I am a Starwood Gold member and prefer Sheraton - have for the last 15 years.  I travel with my little dog and usually the Sheraton is very pet friendly.  This one definitely was NOT, although their site advertised that they were.  I told them had dog during reservation call.  Check in all was great - gave me room next to other party &  told me i had a great view until I made the mistake & mentioned the dog.    The desk clerk turned bright red and told me that the room was being renovated and he had made a mistake.  Had to stay in 1st floor room with view of Trucks backed up to our "patio".  Manager admitted clerk lied - eventually they comp'd me a night after I…

title: Nice, but worth the price?
review: The Sheraton Sand Key looked like a "sure thing" based on their Expedia ranking and reviews, and while it is a nice hotel, it definitely has its shortcomings.  My stay was from a Saturday to Sunday.  I booked a "deluxe" room with "superior pool/gulf view".  The first room I was given was a corner room and most of the view was of the side of the hotel.  The desk staff was very friendly however and quickly found a room with the view I thought I was getting originally.  The pool area got very loud from time to time though, so if you stay here, ask for a higher floor if the noise levels will bother you.  Also, although you can see the ocean from the "view" rooms, the gulf is VERY far away (or at least a lot further then I was expecting) from the hotel...you actually have to do some…

title: great family hotel
review: Stayed here August 2006. Such lovely staff concierge in particular. Pool was a little disappointing in size. Breakfast buffet in Rusty's restaurant expensive but very good. Our 3 children enjoyed the beach ,jet skis etc. Yes a pain having to pay for beach sunbeds each day.  Local restaurants great ,children enjoyed 'Shells ' and my husband loved the seafood and wine at 'The Island Grill'. Not enough computers for the guests to use always a queue. We had a great holiday and would recommend this hotel and surrounding area.

title: Not worth the $$
review: Let me begin by saying that the beach property is absolutely incredible and we had some of the best meals at the surrounding restaurants - you MUST try Guppy's down the road; it was absolutely amazing.  That being said, the hotel was a major disappointment.  We paid extra for a beach view and were put in a 'gulf view' room, which looked out over the tennis courts and, if you craned your neck to the left while on the balcony, you could see only a small slice of the beach.  The rooms all around us all housed different groups of one large party, and the one directly across from us must have been the 'party room', with a constant flow of young people going in and out, slamming the doors, which by the way, were extremely loud.  The walls were paper thin; I could hear the actual words…

title: Efficient Pretty Hotel
review: The staff was very helpful.  The room service food was a cut above the usual fare.  The room (we had the Gulf view) was not in any way interesting, and the walls permitted the sounds of a very unhappy toddler next door.  Sand Key itself is beautiful and one feature of this hotel is that it is only two minutes away from the Sand Key State Park and nature preserve.  I would return.

title: Great stay
review: Stayed here after staying in Orlando for four nights. Had only 3 nights here and wish it was more. From pulling up to the resort, our bell man was super-very informative, gave us a tour and was super friendly. Check-in took all of about 3 minutes. Room was clean, beds comfortable, plenty of pillows. We have 3 children and stayed in a 2bed queen room overlooking the ocean. We were a little cramped, but expected that. Bathroom is small, but I actually like the sink outside of the actual bathroom so if someone is using the bathroom/shower, the sink is still accessible. Balcony overlooked ocean and pool and was a favorite sopt of ours. Pool is a little small, but adequate. Many, many lounge chairs and no difficulty getting one at all. Ocean is a bit of a walk, but you are no further…

title: Wonderful place to get married-pity about the hotel
review: We spent a week here and were married part way thru. It was obvious we were getting married but the hotel did nothing to make it a special day.  The hotel is clean and comfortable but has little in the way of entertainment save for one bar which has a different sports screen on each wall!  The best food is in the bistro although the service leaves a little to be envied save for one young helpful waitress. The rooms are a good size and are really clean but the washbasin is outside the bathroom!! and the bathroom is really small compared to other Americal hotels and as English we peferred tea making facilities rather than coffee and it was like asking for the moon.  The views are glorious and the weather was excellent but if we visit here again we will not stay here mainly because…

title: Was ok, but nothing outstanding
review: After a week in Disney World, we stayed 4 nights here to unwind, 2 adults, 2 kids (14 & 11).  First the positive items. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.  The on-site restaurant Rusty's was VERY good as was the room service.  The food at Rusty's was much better than all the off-site places we tried (some of which were downright horrible).  Pricey though... but when you get tired of burgers and beach food, it was nice to know we could have a quiet great dinner.  The negative items.  Over priced imho.  Our room was a deluxe two queen with a gulf view.  Very cramped for 4 people.  Beds were NOT the great heavenly beds found in other starwood places (even though they called them that).  They were average beds/linens at best.  However, the rooms were clean and well…

title: Great & friendly service
review: The welcome on arrival for our 3 night stay could not have been warmer. This set the scene for the rest of the stay and seemed to rub off on all guests as everyone was far more friendly and relaxed than in Orlando, from where we had arrived. There are good facilities for a family with a young child such as us and the location on the beach is fantastic. Gripes are all room related. Our room was in need of renovation. The wall mounted aircon unit was old and very noisy. As mentioned by other reviewers, the bathroom/washroom is too small. However, what we did not expect was the level of background noise. It was very easy to hear all sounds from the next room and in the corridor during the night and this is unacceptable from a hotel in this category. Overall, then, great service and…

title: Second stay, still superb!
review: This was our second time staying at the Sheraton (May 11 - 13 2006), having stayed here in October 2004, we booked it because our experience last time was very good.  My husband and I found it a very clean and comfortable hotel and a great spot for the first couple of nights in our holiday.  Arriving at Tampa airport it’s about 30-45 minutes drive to the Sheraton, and not a taxing drive at all.  This hotel is not dissimilar to other Sheratons.  The bedrooms are very comfortable and spacious (the bathroom is not spacious!) I think the size of the bathroom and its arrangement (sink outside the bathroom) would be an issue if you had young children to bath or were staying in the hotel for a longer time (say 2 weeks), however for us it was not an issue at all.  The main reasons we…

title: Loved the Sheraton Sand Key!
review: I was at the Sheraton Sand Key resort from July 17-23 2006.  From the arrival to the end of my stay, what a beautiful experience!  When we arrived, the bell hop was very friendly and informative about the property and restaurants in the area.  Very few bell men do this without asking them.  The property and grounds are very clean and well maintained.  The most beautiful thing about this property is the beach.  The sand is beautiful but the walk is a little distance to the waters edge.  Not a problem but it is about a 4 minute walk.  On the week end they had a steel drum player playing caribbean music.  A nice touch.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  One night I had a very noisy neighbor and called the staff and they offered me a free breakfast for the inconvenience. …

title: Very Disappointing
review: Stayed at Sheraton Sand Key for two nights at the end of a two week holiday in Florida. We thought this hotel was very disappointing.  Our room on the 6th Floor was ok, but the bathroom arrangement was dreadful.  The actual bathroom is  tiny (containing a toilet and small bathtub with shower) that the floor space is approx. 1 metre squre.  There is not sufficient space to get dried after using the shower.   There is a small sink and vanity unit outside the bathroom and in the actual bedroom with another vanity unit opposite which was basically a shelf with coffee maker and mirror.  I have never seen such an economy arrangement in an expensive hotel like this - we paid $300 per night. The air conditioning is the noisiest that I have ever experienced - it felt as if you were…

title: OVERPRICED
review: A nice enough hotel , but more for the buisness user as there  was a lot of conventions going on. Bathroom was small and air conditionng very noisy.However the staff were excellent, on arrival we were given a nice room on the eighth floor but the noise from next door occupants was terrible!! .We were given an alternative room with no hassle.overall an average hotel very overpriced

title: great family vacation
review: My family and i just returned from a week stay July 9th - 15th at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  My husband, mom and three kids, 6 months, 10, and 13.  I can not say enough about this beautiful resort, we come from New York where we are used to luxury hotels, and this one definately met our needs.  The staff was extremely helpful and friendly.  The rooms were very spacious we were in room 810 which was a suite which was more than enough room for my husband and three kids my mom had a connecting room to us so the kids can go back and forth.  The beach was absolutely beautiful alot of reviews say that the walk is very long but i did not feel that way, my kids and myself had a blast walking to the water and collecting shells.  I highly recommend this hotel for families how want a…

title: A Jewel on the Beach
review: Once again we had the luxury of staying at the Sheraton on Sand Key--a jewel on the beach. The Sheraton Resort offers everything from a cheerful, concerning staff to spotlessly clean rooms, and all the amenities one needs to do nothing but relax for a week! This was our fourth stay and we have never been disappointed with just laying on the beach and enjoying nice dinners at the Sheraton's Rusty's and the Mainstay as well as nearby Guppy's, Columbia Restaurant, Mykonos in Tarpon Springs, and the Salt Rock Cafe. In the past, we have stayed at the Sheraton twice in April and once in late October. This being our first summer visit,  I must say, the resort was very crowded with children, which we expected, and all of them appeared to be having a blast in the pool and on the beach!…

title: just fabulous!
review: We stayed at the Sheraton for 6 relaxing days after 10 days in Orlando. The hotel is beautifully presented and the staff were polite and helpful. Our room was very comfortable and clean with a great view out over the gulf of Mexico. Other reviews mentioned the room size was a problem but it was fine for us - 2 adults + 2 children (11yrs + 15yrs). The pool area is stunning and there were always plenty of sunbeds and tables available. The beach is amazing and there's so much space! we were able to play frisby without hitting anyone! It is a wide beach so it's a 4 minute stroll from the hotel to the water but that's not exactly a hardship, and once you get there the water is so warm and inviting you just want to jump straight in!   Foodwise you have loads of choice. The main hotel…

title: Fantastic
review: We stayed here after a hectic week in Orlando.  The hotel was brilliant and the location was fantastic.  It was lovely just to relax and do nothing.  The staff were very helpful and were always happy to help.  We were quite happy to eat in the hotel in Rusty's restaurant (not really much around unless you have a car or get on the Jolly Trolly).  The food was a great escape from burgers and chips!  If you have a chance go on a dolphin trip (take Jolly Trolly into Clearwater beach) then go with the Little Toot - fantastic with dolphins jumping out of the water.  Very sad to leave.

title: On the beach!  Well, kind of.
review: Make no doubt about it.  The beach is on of the biggest reasons why you might want to stay at this hotel.  The beach is nice, but it is several football fields (American or otherwise, take your pick) from the hotel.  It is set back from the beach for a reason that is not apparent.  I stayed at this location because I was attending a conference in the same which is ample size for several small events (although it is hard to think about work with people parading around in swimsuits and sandles all day.)  I paid a conference rate, but I would think that you could do better if the price on the back of the door is any indication of the normal going rate (although I can't say for sure in this area).  I also found the extra charges annoying.  Read on for more.  Room - My room with two…

title: Fantastic - will go back!
review: Loved this hotel. Stayed here for 4 nights after our 10 night stay at Disney.   We were in room 502 which overlooked the beach and the tennis courts (werent in our room much but when we were our kids enjoyed watching tennis!).  Room with 2 double beds which was ample big enough for the 4 of us.   Regarding other comments that the bathroom was small, I dont really get this - ok, there was just a bath with a power shower inside, and a loo, but outside of this was a large sink and opposite another sort of built-in dressing table with another mirror.  Between the 4 of us we managed to get ready in the evenings just fine!   Beautiful beach with 2 sun loungers and an umbrella costing $20 per day.  Mentioned to my husband on the first day at the beach that there was nowhere to buy a…

title: What a Beach !
review: My husband, twin teenage sons, and I stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key May 26-28, 2006 and was blown away by the location, cleanliness of the room, and fabulous beach access.  The way the pool opens onto the beach is just gorgeous, especially early in the morning when the crowds have not yet arrived.  Yes, it is a bit of a walk to the ocean, but who really cares with that view in front of you the whole way?    My one piece of advice is to certainly make sure have some sort of water socks for the walk.  The beach area does have lots of crushed shells that do hurt a tenderfoot such as myself.  Sandels or flipflops still allow the shells to get in between your foot and your shoe - so I would recommend a tight fitting watersock type shoe or even an older pair of canvas tennies for the…

title: Review of Sheraton Sand Key
review: Nice hotel, slightly south of Clearwater Beach.  Stayed over Memorial Day Weekend, enjoyed the beach, breakfast buffet, and relaxation.  The room seemed to have a modern touch with a flat screen tv, "sweet sleeper" bed, and granite countertop sink.  Yes, the bathroom was on the small side but still functional.  Also, I read on other reviews about some folks complaining about the hotel's distance to the beach.  Folks, I'm telling you that must be a sad reflection regarding American mobility.  This place sits right on the beach!  Now, to get from the hotel to the ocean water is equivalent to 1 & 1/2 blocks (approx.) but that certainly isn't far as you are walking over white beach sand.  It is a very easy walk & if you believe it is long... you need to walk more often.

title: Very Comfortable Hotel
review: I just visited the Sharaton Sand Key with my mother (wheelcahir bound) and my sister.  We had a wonderful, relaxing time.  The staff could not have been more accomodating and always seemed happy to help.  We stayed in a suite and the bath was handicapped accessible.  It was very comfortable and roomy.  Easy to use and very clean.  Our room, two queen beds and a sofa bed, was very well maintained and the house keeping staff was terrific.  Our room overlooked the front of the hotel and the conference center, so there was a bit of noise from the air conditioning units when our sliders were open, but when closed, very quiet.    All of the meals that we had at the Sheraton were fresh, well prepared and reasonable.  The chicken salad sandwiches at the pool were the best ever.  The…

title: Perfect resort for us!
review: We stayed at the Sheraton for one week at the beginning of May and we would definitely go back at this time again as the hotel was not too crowded and wasn't full of screaming kids. There were always plenty of sun loungers around the pool although we preferred to spend our time on the gorgeous, white beach. Yes it is a slight walk from the hotel but we personally liked the exercise and to be honest it only takes about five minutes at the most. The pool cafe has staff who go down to the beach and take your orders for food and drink so your'e not completely cut off. The rental of beach loungers is a bit excessive at $20 for the day, although it was worth it when we saw dolphins playing just off shore on the last day! We ate at the hotel most nights and all meals were excellent. We…

title: Excellent hotel in a lovely location.
review: Have just come back from three nights at the Sheraton Sand Key and overall was very impressed with the hotel.  The staff were friendly, the hotel was very clean and the grounds were lovely.  The pool area is very pleasant with plenty of loungers/chairs and tables with umbrellas and there were always lots of towels available.  However, the pool is far too small for the size of the hotel and got very crowded in the afternoons.   The room was a good size except for the bathroom which was TINY and the sink area was ridiculously small.  My friend and I spent all our time fighting to get at the sink.  How a family would manage I don't know!  Also, there was no fridge in the room and the ice bucket was a joke.  You really do need a fridge in Florida.  We had a great view of the beach…

title: Great staff
review: Went with my two daughters to the Sheraton Sand Key having been recommended as part of a BA holiday. Rooms were a bit small - especially bathrooms - but overall very good. The staff were extremely helpful and polite. The pool area is a bit small considering the number of rooms but there were plenty of loungers available and free towels and the hotel is literally on the beach (and yes it is a bit of a trek to the sea but the exercise comes in handy). We didn't eat in the restaurant but did try the smaller cafe type restaurant a couple of times and it was good value and quality. You really need a car to get around as most things are a car ride away but thats the norm in the US anyway. I'd certainly go back there!

title: The best hotel in Clearwater
review: Overall, a great place to stay, especially if you are accompanied by your kids.  The service was great.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  We will definitely return to this facility.

title: Nice property overall
review: The rooms were fresh and clean, the bathrooms were small - but I don't pick a hotel based on the size of a bathroom; the sink, toilet, and shower worked just fine.  Any resort nickel and dimes you to death, so expect it.  $5/nt for a baby pack-n-play, $5/nt for a nice size fridge (not a tiny one), but they did give 2 free bottles of water/day which was quite surprising.  The beach was one heck of a walk away, too far for our liking.  Except for right near the ocean edge, the "sand" was loaded with small shells mixed with sand - not the best beach I've seen.  The pool was nice, but almost a bit cool for our liking.  The lounge chairs were the best I've ever seen - nicely contoured and very comfortable.  The staff was very friendly everywhere.  Nice to have a poolside cafe for…

title: Very nice stay
review: After reading several reviews on TA, I thought we would give the Sheraton Sand Key a try.  We stayed for 2 nights in April and were very pleased with our decision.  The entire staff, from the bell desk and valet to registration to the restaurants, were all incredibly friendly, professional, and welcoming.  Evereyone seemed to enjoy their job and made you feel like you were a part of the fun of just being there.        The room was clean and comfortable.  Yes, the room was a little small and having more than two people would have been an issue but you're on a beach in Florida, you shouldn't be in your room.  I had also read that the beach was quite a walk from the hotel.  Actually the beach (the sand) starts about 15 yards from the lobby.  It is a wide beach but I would never…

title: Great hotel
review: Just returned from Sheraton Sand Key - excellent hotel where customer service levels are first class.  Lovely buffet breakfast, great poolside cafe, excellent location.  Would definitely stay there again and would recommend to anyone.  Friendly staff, very well cared for rooms and public areas.  Stayed 4 - 12 April 2006.

title: Doesn't deserve four diamond rating
review: After reading all the rave reviews we were really disappointed. The rooms were small. bathrooms tiny and a terrible damp moldy smell in room. The carpet in the lobby was filthy. Service personnel were very nice which was the only thing that was four diamond about this resort.

title: Beautiful grounds
review: Excellent stay at the Sheraton . The hotel is beautiful, rooms clean but typical. Beach bar excellent. Beach too far of a walk. Surrounding town lovely , Hotel staff mostly friendly but some uninformed. The only negative was the pool attendant. Our kids were looking foward to playing volleyball and he would not give us a ball. He said he could have the volleyballs out past 7:oo because people would steal them.Perhaps they should have a sign out shhet.  My daughter was so disappointed.He was there on the third day and he was just a grump. He should be more concerned with the lounge saving. Otherwise loved Clearwater.

title: Beautiful coastline
review: We stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key resort for a week; picked because we like to be away from huge crowds.  The Hotel was beautiful, very clean. The bathroom is very small but was cleaned to perfection everyday.  At first, I was disappointed to be in a room overlooking the tennis courts, but it turned out to be a great place to stay. It also overlooks the Sand Key Park and we awoke each day to the birds waking us up and walked each day on their 1.2 mi walk through the beach and along Clearwater Pass.    The beach is a short walk from the hotel but quiet despite numerous high rise hotels and condos.  If you enjoy long walks on the beach and shelling, this is the place for you. We chose not to rent a lounger on the beach (which I believe should be included for customers) so spent…

title: Not what we expected
review: Not what we expected.  We stayed here after a short trip to Disney (July 2005)-- and were very disappointed.  The rooms are small and the bathrooms VERY small.  The air in the room was very moist and humid --- so humid that the towels never fully dried.  The beach is far away-- so far away that you cannot hear the ocean.  Our biggest disappointment was the pool.  The ONE and ONLY, TINY, LITTLE POOL for the entire resort.  By 10:00am, the water was murky because of all the suntan lotion and people that were swimming.  We were elbow to elbow in the pool.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  We would suggest another hotel if going during a busy time of the year.

title: Great Place
review: Sheraton Sand Key Clearwater Beach, Florida Date:2/26/06  We stayed for a long weekend at the Sheraton. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. We had 2 queen size beds and a balcony that overlooked the gulf the view was beautiful. The bathroom is a little small but otherwise no complaints on the room in general, I didn't spend much time in it we were out at the pool or beach! The pool area is so pretty palm trees, lounge chairs and tables with umbrella's. There are towels available at the pool. There is a tiki bar for beverages and a cafe poolside for snacks or lunch. There is a hot tub which we did enjoy at night. There also is a seperate baby pool for small children. The pool area is on the beach. The beach is very pretty but it is a long walk to the water which I…

title: The Beach and Amenities Justify Price
review: I stayed at this resort for a quick weekend getaway with the wife and kids (feb 24-26, 2006).  The lobby was impressive, but not as impressive as the food quality at the resort's bar-n-grill.  I must say that the room size was a little disappointing.  The beach is a hike, but it's huge and beautiful.  The poolside bar serves perfect frozen drinks.  You can even make up a drink and they'll try to accomodate you.  The pool is small, but the hot tub a couple of feet away is huge and comfortably hot. The poolside cafe serves great food and they believe in giving huge portions too.  Right next door is Sand Key Park.  I went to a local store a brought hot dogs and sausageS, and off to the park we went.  Sand Key Park has BBQ grills about 150 yards from the beach, so as I grilled, my…

title: Disappointing
review: Having read the reviews on this site we had high expectations but were very disappointed. The rooms are small and the bathroom was so tiny that there is no room for a sink in it! This was situated outside the bathroom in a very small alcove meaning all toiletries are on display as you walk in the door.   The poolside cafe and bar are understaffed and the communal areas not kept clean. All in all the hotel has the feel of a slightly upmarket holiday camp not what I expect from a 4 star hotel.  The pool is pretty good but on the small size when the hotel is full. The beach is nice but $20 for a days worth of sunloungers is a bit steep given the prices for the rooms.  On the positive side the decor in the rooms is fairly good and the beds excellent. The location is good for…

title: Outstanding Service!
review: I stayed at this wonderful hotel for 5 nights at the end of December/beginning of January.  From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, the very helpful staff was extremely friendly and informative.  The rooms were lovely, views were fantastic and the pool/beach was just gorgeous.  The location is perfect with its proximity to various hot spots which you do not need a car for as there is trolley service to take you just about anywhere you'd like to go.  I like the fact that it is a bit out of the way from the other hotels so you can enjoy the peace and quiet and just hop on a trolley when looking for a little more action.  I would recommend this hotel and this location to anyone looking for a relaxing holiday away from the craziness of everyday life.

title: Hotel on the beach
review: We had previously stopped at the Clearwater Beach Hotel and would have stopped there again if it had not been demolished. So we looked round for a hotel on the beach, which was not huge and so we came to the Sheraton. It does not have the ambience of the Clearwater, but the plumbing is better.       The room we had a good view of the sea and park, bathroom was not the biggest but you don't stay in there. The rooms also may not be as big as other hotels but the location is better than most and facilities are good.      The swimming pool was closed whilst we were there, as recompense we were given complimentary buffet breakfast at Rusty's which was excellent. A walk along the beach before breakfast allows you to enjoy it all the more.       I would recommend dining at the hotel…

title: What no fridge
review: Have just returned from a 7 night stay and thought there was a couple of points worth mentioning.  Allthough the hotel is well situated the rooms are very dark and much smaller than the Marriotts hotel which is situated just across the road.  Also there was no fridge which for us was a real nusiance.  As previously mentioned a car is a must as there is very little to do in the immediate area( other than swim and sunbath of course!!) Pool however rather disappointing but it is heated, a must for the cooler months! Also the very large apartment block next door obscures the sun completely for 2-3 hours during the day which was a real shame but the locals say during the summer months there is no such problem.    The 4 star rating is slightly generous for this hotel, however the best…

title: Dissapointing given the raving reviews
review: We just returned from a visit to the Tampa area and stayed 2 nights in the Sheraton Sand Key Resort and 2 nights in the Holiday Inn on Lido Beach in Sarasota. Given all the great reviews for the Sheraton Sand Key and it's number one rating in Clearwater we were fairly dissapointed with the hotel. Although the staff is very helpful and the new Sheraton beds are great, I was not overwhelmed with the hotel accomodations itself and the price/quality. We like lots of natural light in the room, but this room was dark and the view not great despite the fact that they said we were upgraded. The swimming pool is too small and the beaches in Sarasota are nicer especially on Siesta Key. Also we like to wander outside of the hotel to discover local restaurants and bars but due to the…

title: Nice Place To Relax
review: A very nice hotel with a beautiful view of the gulf of Mexico.   Nice rooms with terrific beds.   Grille restaurant was very reasonable - good food at a fair price.  Pool had both a grille and bar which were very convenient.   24 hour convenience store at the hotel as well.  Only nick was that the heated pool could have been warmer...overall very nice place.

title: Nice hotel, great services, howling wind made it noisy
review: Room #1 had 2 beds and seemed a bit crowded. Room #2 had 1 bed and seemed much more spacious.  Rooms generally very clean (some mildew on bathroom wallpaper in Room #2); housekeeping stopped by on arrival to check everything was clean. Free bottled water in rooms, more provided on request. Service very prompt. All staff very accommodating and helpful.  Unfortunately we stayed during a howling wind storm. Rooms facing ocean had great view, but were terribly noisy with wind whistling through the heater vents all night. Would recommend asking for a quiet room if you arrive when it's windy. Lovely beach, very clean. Too bad it was too windy to go swimming.  Services were outstanding. Highly recommend joining Starwood Preferred Guest program to get extra free amenities e.g. gym on…

title: Friends wedding
review: This hotel was lovely, with great views overlooking the gulf of mexico and with a phenomenal sunset.  There was a large party of us attending a friends wedding which happened at the hotel. Highly recommend this hotel for a wedding. The vows were taken under palm trees, sun blazing with the sea in the background. Fantastic! The hotel is situated a mile from nearby restaurants and a complex of bars and nightclubs called shephards.

title: Wonderful Honeymoon
review: I have stayed here before, in the early 90's. Haven't stayed since, as the rates are high. We got a package from USAirways and we were thrilled. Room was great, gulof/pool view, king bed. Everything in the room was comfortable. GM Russ Kimble sent us a bottle of champagne to celebrate our honeymoon. Staff, in  word, AWESOME. From front desk to restaurant to bar to poolside tiki hut took care of us. Hurricane Wilma threatened, but it didn't diminish our good time. If you are considering Clearwater. this should be your #1 choice for accommodation.

title: And all that
review: Having read the glowing reviews we were really looking forward to our stay.  From the first minute we walked the door we were greeted with smiles and given very nice gulf view adjoining rooms (as requested and prepaid).  Rooms were on 5th floor and very spacious with chair to loaf about in as well as desk chair.    Plenty channels on TV and in house movies.  Free internet access for limited times (15 minutes at a time) down in business center. The whole atmosphere was laid back and friendly.  we took tennis lessons with the pro Carl Gavine, which were excellent and very well priced.   He is so patient.  Food at the Island Grille first night was very good as was service, returning another night it failed to meet that standard.  That and a pushy waitress in Rustys one morning put…

title: Nice hotel
review: I stayed at the Sheridan Sand Key 2 nights Sept. 11 to 13 at the beginning of our Florida vacation and 2 nights at the end on Sept. 17 to 19, both rooms partial view of beach.    The hotel is very nice, well maintained, beautiful pool area, very wide sandy beach (much quieter then the main Clearwater beach across the bridge, which was a bonus), nice balcony with a great view.  One negative I had was the second room we stayed in was a bit damp, sheets seemed damp both nights, some sort of humidity problem I guess.  First room didn't have this problem.  Our first room had two small queen beds, which made the room a bit cramped for my liking, did not sleep well sleeping in the small queen bed with my wife, but the second room we chose a King bed and a cott for our child, much more…

title: Lovely stay
review: I reserved an ocean view room with two queen beds for four adults for  $268 for Sept 2005. I stayed on a Saturday night and the hotel experience was very postive. The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. Everyone greeted me and my friends warmly where ever we went in the hotel. My friends and I did not eat at any restaurant inside the hotel but, followed trip advisor reviews to eat dinner at Guppy's on the Beach and breakfast Maggie May's Sunrise Cafe. My friends loved the hotel and eating at the above restaurants. Our room was very clean and we had a wonderful balcony with a view of the beach and pool area on the fourth floor facing the ocean. I went swimming in the pool at 8:30 pm and found it empty. I was given club passes (free and unasked for) for complimentery…

title: Real Facts on Sheraton Sand Key
review: Was a little concerned before coming here after reading reviews, but I was JUST here and here's the facts:  1. The pool IS small and the number of chairs somewhat inadequate. The only negative, and not that bad. If I was the mgmt I would fix this ASAP.  2. The rooms were nice, and clean.  3. The staff was great.  4. The 24 hour store was great.  5. The food at the main restaurant was good (not great).  5. The food at the smaller restaurant/snack bar and in the bar was very good.  6. The gulf water is exactly 5 minutes walk across the sand.  7. There was no red tide. Further up the beach (near the park next door) there were dead fish and it smelled. This wasn't anywhere near the Sheraton beach.

title: A super stay at the Sheraton Sand Key
review: My family of 4 stayed at this hotel from 8/22-8/27 and really have nothing to complain about.  We came from a hectic 4 day stint at Disney and were looking forward to some R & R at the beach.  Well, we got it.  We do agree that this hotel does accommodate the "business" crowd but it was booming with many families.  The only downside of our stay was the pool.  Although it was a lovely pool, it was too small for the size of the hotel.  The jacuzzi spa was great...HOT... but relaxing once in.  The beach was a bit of a walk but we all could use the exercise!  We ate at the Island Grille a few of the days and were quite pleased with the food and service.  Rusty's has an awesome breakfast buffet and the waitress we had was fantastic.  The employees/staff were terrific...from the…

title: Perfect combination: Fun in the Sun and Relaxing Comfort
review: After reading many reviews about this property, we decided to take a much needed family vacation at the Sand Key. We arrrived the week of August 22nd and  had a splendid  time. We paid $200 a night for a bay view room on the seventh floor.  Everything you could want in resort is at your disposal.  The pool was very conveninet and family friendly.  The pool size (which we read in previous reviews) was way too small for the amount of swimmers but you could still enjoy it.  It is defininitly something they need address.  But the staff at the pool deck made every guest feel comfortable and provided unlimited towels and assistiance.  Food and beverages were no futher than a stone's throw away.  The beach was a lovely 5 minute walk and was picture perfect.  The hotel would serve you…

title: Small Bathroom
review: Lovely Hotel but such a small bathroom!  Did not like the bathroom sink in the room and not in the bathroom.  The pool was much too small for the size of the hotel.  The restaurants and bars were lovely.  I would not say it was worth $225 a night.  Fabulous beach.

title: Liked it a lot..
review: I have to start by saying that the pool size is ridiculous for the size of the hotel... but who cares about a pool when you have a beautiful beach right there. They have plenty of towels, nice towels too around the pool.  The walk to the shore is about 5 minutes, I laughed when I saw it and remembered that some people said here it was about a mile, it is less than a 1/4 of a mile, it is literally 5 minutes... I walked back and forth a million times and it is not that far. All hotels are set back - I am not sure why.  The room was great, housekeepers (Maria) very nice and so were the front desk staff. I have to say that the concierge was almost non existant, they didnt have addresses for restaurants or information about jet ski rentals.  I asked for late check out and they gave…

title: Loved this Hotel!
review: My husband, 6 month old son, and I just returned from a five day stay at the Sheraton Sand Key.  We were in Clearwater for a wedding, but decided to stay a few extra days.  This hotel is fantastic!  I am a very, very picky traveler, and research hotels extensively before booking.  All of the positive reviews about this hotel were on the money.  Most impressive was the level of service offered by the hotel.  Everyone was exceptionally helpful and went out of their way to meet our every need.  When we arrived, we realized that the shower in our room was stopped.  A service repair person was sent immediately.  The problem was rectified, and the manager called to offer us a $25 credit on our bill for the very short-lived trouble that we experienced.  The beds were very, very…

title: Fantastic Hotel
review: We had 5 nights in Orlando then down to this hotel for 9 nights starting 28th June the weather was great.  The hotel was fantastic the hotel staff a are really lovely and nothing is too much bother.  As we met up with friends from San Fransico we eat mostly in the hotel the food in the Island Grill was great and also when we could eat on our own Rusty's was fab, there was also another place which sold Pizza and burgers if you fancied.  They also had a happy hour in the Island Grill when they would have some nice snacks for free this was also a nice gesture, the pool over the weekend 4th July was very crowded, apart from this weekend it was just nice, also open unti 11.00pm and also the hot tub was great and also stayed open late.  The beach was right at the hotel with maybe a…

title: Great Vacation
review: My wife, daughter and I stayed 6 nights (Jun 11-16) in a room with an ocean view of the Gulf of Mexico.  If you are looking for a relaxing time on the beach, you will find it here.  The room was clean and the staff was very friendly.  The room was quite even though the pool was below our balcony. The hotel had 3 places to eat.  We ate breakfast at Rusty's almost every morning.  They had a breakfast buffet (fruits, cereal, toast, etc) for just $7.95 per person.  The Island Grill had good sandwiches too.  We hit the beach everyday except one.  It was about a 3-5 minute walk from the pool to the beach.  The beach was clean and the water was warm.  The hotel setup beach chairs every morning and you can rent 2 all day for $20. $15 for 2 chairs for half a day.  We would definitly go…

title: hope this helps
review: Just spent two nights over July 4th. Great place for kids. Pool is somewhat small and gets quite crowded. I get grossed out when pool water looks cloudy due to too many swimmers. People of all shapes and sizes, too many, along with infants sharing the same pool made my decision to hit the beach instead an easy one. They need a larger pool and they need a childrens pool. Badly. Don't expect firm, toned South Beach types around the pool. It's mostly families who seem to strive to get as much sun during their vacation as possible. We literally saw people frying out there all day.  Beach is an easy 5 minute walk. Don't believe otherwsie. Plenty of beach chairs ($20/day) w/ umbrellas. Rented jet skis ($85/hr) and saw some dolphin. Hotel food suprisingly good w/a nice variety. Main…

title: Excellent service, but bad time to visit.
review: The hotel is equipped with everything you need for a day at the beach, there are several shops and restaurants available on site so you never have to leave.  The room I stayed in had a patio with a spectacular view of the sun setting into the ocean.    Be sure to visit when the 'red tide' is not an issue.  The hotel is less than a quarter mile away from the ocean front, but the smell of decaying fish was evident immediately upon your exit from the hotel.  Due to this issue, the pool was overflowing with kids.  The head of housekeeping at this location was extremely helpful when a personal item was left behind.  As soon as the item was located (within the first day), it was on it's way home in the mail.

title: Great Family Resort!
review: My husband and I took our 2 boys, ages 2 and 6, to the Sheraton and we loved it.  This is a perfect family resort.  We were there from June 17, 2005 - June 22, 2005.  Pool:  The pool was wonderful.  Fresh towel service at poolside plus the Turtle Bar for alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks, and the poolside cafe for lunch and snacks.  There were always lounge chairs or chairs/tables under umbrellas available.  The pool was never empty, but it wasn't overloaded with guests either.  We swam everyday.  The kids loved it.  Beach:  OK, the person who wrote that the beach is a 20 minute walk must have gone to a different beach.  The layout of Clearwater Beach/Sand Key is kind of confusing.  Some hotels only have waterfront access on Clearwater Harbor (like the Marriott across the…

title: Great Hotel
review: We just returned from 5 nights at the Sheraton Sand Key and were very pleased.  The location of the hotel is fantastic...over the bridge from the busy commercialism of Clearwater Beach, but within easy reach of the beaches and shops.  In short, the room was a good size for us (two adults and a toddler) and the beds were very comfortable.  Upon checking out, we learned we had been charged $10 a day for the rollaway.  We complained to the manager because we weren't aware we were spending $50 on a bed for our toddler.  The charge was immediately removed.  The food at the Island Grille is very good and has a nice salad bar (and ice cream machines for a late night treat).  The small convienence store in the hotel is reasonably priced.  The staff is very helpful with driving…

title: Great property!!
review: Had a wonderful stay at the Sheraton Sand Key.  Very casual but nice resort, with exceptional staff. I have never been treated so well by all the staff at a hotel. It was my husband and I and my 1 and half year old daughter. The beach was a little bit of a walk, but not bad. There was a nice pool which was never crowded, and lots of poolside chairs available at all times. They had a great little playground which my daughter loved and washer and dryers available which is a must with a toddler. It was a perfect low key vacation, very relaxing, yet close to lots of great restaurants and shopping. Will definately be back!

title: Great stay at the Sheraton
review: We loved this place! We only were in town for a couple of days but really enjoyed our visit. The hotel is in a great spot (between a park and a condo, it's not hotels upon hotels as it is across the inlet on the other side of Clearwater Beach). The room was big and not too pricey, the bed very comfortable, our dinner at the Mainstay Tavern was great, and overall we were very happy with our stay and hope to return soon.  There were a couple of problem spots: The pool is too small, and there were lots of kids running around so there's not a great place to go to relax that is right next to the pool. My husband and I grabbed a couple of chairs along the lawn, just a few steps from the pool, and were fine. After a rum runner from the bar, we didn't really care, anyway.   The beach is…

title: First Class Resort
review: My wife and I recently got back from a week at the Sheraton Sand Key in Clearwater Beach and had a very memorable trip.  The hotel was clean, the hotel staff was extremely accomodating, the meals in all the restaurants were prepared to our extreme pleasure.  The resort sits on the Gulf of Mexico, but be advised, it is about a 1/4 mile walk to the shore.  I assume the buildings are set back for extra safety during hurricanes.  The area around the hotel was extremely well maintained and we had the opportunity to eat at some of the local restaurants near the hotel.  The Sand Key Nature Park is right next door and has a foot path for taking walks.  Can't say enough great things about the Sheraton.  This part of Clearwater is a bit removed from the extreme hustle and bustle, so those…

title: Good Family Vacation Spot
review: Sheraton Sand Key is a nice hotel off the main drag of Clearwater (over the bridge in Sand Key).  Not as luxurious as a Westin, but certainly clean and acceptable. The beach is really nice, tons of really good shells especially in the morning. The walk to the beach is easy unless you never walk anywhere. The Island Grille has decent food for a very reasonable price (kids meals were $4 and under) and a decent salad bar. Also try the breakfast place in the small strip mall across the road -- BIG breakfasts for a reasonable price. Only small complaints are that you have to pay $20 /day to rent chairs down on the beach (sand is not comfortable for sitting otherwise) and the hotel's pool is half the size it should be. That said, this makes a great family destination for a reasonable…

title: some great stuff, some negative
review: When you go to this beautiful pricey hotel you need to make sure you know what you are going to get and what you are paying for.  Service is great, lots of towels in the room and by the pool. Some of us got sick in the middle of the night and they brought us extra sheets and towels. There were lots of pillows in the room and they are very nice pillows and good beds too. Clean nice rooms a bit small for our family of four, nice decor too and all rooms have balconies. BEWARE however: the pool is very small (but clean)and there were many kids when we went Mar 30- Apr 6, the pool was sooooo crowded that it was not enjoyable sometimes although we made the best of it. No room to swim or really play much without bumping into people constantly and getting splashed. Water was always a…

title: Loved Sheraton Sand Key!
review: We just returned from a lovely week's stay at the Sheraton Sand Key, and chose the property based on the positive reviews - we weren't disappointed. We brought our children - aged 2.5 and 7 - and were very happy with every aspect of our vacation - it is a great, low-key Florida vacation alternative to Disney and Orlando.  Hotel is on Sand Key, across a bridge from the honkey-tonk of Clearwater....nice to be away from the crowds, spring breakers, and commerce. Hotel is small and very nice - staff are really superior and the Sheraton Service Promise is wonderful - if it isn't right, they'll fix it right away.  Rooms are fine - not huge, but absolutely up to snuff. We stayed in an ocean/pool view room on the Starwood Preferred Guest Floor - in Room 637. Two queen beds, television,…

title: Superior Staff!!
review: Stayed here at the beautiful Sheraton Sand Key during Spring Break.  The hotel was filled to capacity!.....that being said, I can't say enough about the staff!!!!!......courteous, cheerful and eager to please.  Anything that went wrong or you didn't like, was rectified immediately!  The food at the Poolside Cafe and the Island Grill was good and the price was reasonable.  There is also plenty of free self-parking.  The beach is one of the prettiest in Florida and one of the widest!.....but the walk to the Gulf is only a few minutes (where were some of those other reviewers walking to?)   My only complaint was that some people were putting towels on lounge chairs at 7am and then not returning until noon (what else is new!)  But they did have extra lounge chairs stacked up at the…

title: Great Family Spot
review: We statyed at the Sheraton Sand Key The first week of April.  I was concerned about a Spring Break crowd since we were traveling with our childern ages 8 and 10.  Since it is removed from the main strip of Clearwater Beach, it was perfect for our family.  Lots of other families by the pool and at the beach.  My kids had a great time looking for shells on the beach.  One night right at sunset, we saw dolphins playing.  It was great.  The room was fine.  Not large, but comfortable and clean.  Great beds.    We enjoyed the informal Island Grille restaurant for casual dinner and the cafe by the pool for lunch.    We would stay here again on our next adventure to Florida.

title: A Great Hotel - But with Some sub-Standard Rooms
review: to start off with the positive side, the service at the hotel as well as both restaurants were excellent and good value for money, the pool is on the small side and can be very crowded with kids, the room itself was large enough and ok, however, if you have a pre-paid voucher for a standard room, you might end up on the first floor in a back corner directly adjacent to the climatisation engine for the hotel (e.g. room 201), which was so noisy that we requested an immediate change to another room, which we were fortunaltey able to get, still in the same corner, but two floors higher, however in general try to obtain a room in the upper floors and with ocean / pool view, if you are looking for a quiet relaxing vacation, if not for the room we had, the hotel would have gotten 4 to…

title: Well Worth A Stay
review: My wife and I and 3 kids (11, 10 and 6) stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key for a week to split our two 4 day spells in Orlando (a break from the parks - rest and recuperation). We can certainly recommend this place, although probably pricier than many other options. The hotel is very clean and the view is fantastic. The service is top notch, including the Sheraton Service promise. Any slight issue we had was dealt with within five minutes.  The beach is fantastic and right next to the pool. The stroll to the sea (across white sand) is a delight - anyone who complains about a 100 yard walk must be very lazy! Families of dolphins live right off the beach and are very visible from the shore, one day coming within 20yds of the shoreline and jumping around. Still recommend a dolphin…

title: Loved the Sheraton Sand Key Resort
review: Just returned from a week at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort.  The beach was beautiful, hotel very clean, the staff went above and beyond to make our stay a pleasant one.  The Island Grille had excellent food, salad bar very good.  Also the outdoor Pool Cafe had the best pizza.  The outdoor pool bar had the greatest mudslides too!  It is a convenient location, close to lots of shops and restaurants, and took a drive down to "John's Pass", watched the dolphins, great place.  Will definitely be going back next winter.

title: Overall, a great hotel
review: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key from February 28th - March 5th and were not disappointed.  The rooms were clean and the staff attentive and friendly.  The average temp that week was 65 to 70 degrees so it was too cold to swim in the ocean.  It was still fun to walk along the water and collect shells though.  (there are MILLIONS of shells here...make sure to wear something on your feet!).  The heated pool was very nice.  Once you are in it it's hard to get out.  We never did get to go into the hot tub though because there were always people in it.  There are many choices for dining at the resort if you don't want to leave.  The food was adequate but not great in our opinion.  The breakfast buffet was a bit of a letdown for the price.  We may have gone at a bad…

title: Great Place !
review: Recommended.  Great place.  Excellent, attentive and friendly staff and service.  Great balconies for view of beach.   Family friendly.    Sand Key is across a small bridge from Clearwater Beach.  This area is upscale from Clearwater Beach, quieter and with less traffic.   One side of hotel is a municipal park the other is a large upscale condo complex.  Across the street is the Marriott.  Room was spotlessly clean and in excellent condition.   All standard amenities.    Nice pool with separate wading pool for kids and a separate hot tub area.  Nice snack bar in the pool area and a also a separate tiki bar by the pool.  Plenty of beach lounges and towels and lots of area to be away from others if you like.  Room was very quiet (was at the end of a corridor two floors from the…

title: Beachin!
review: Beachin resort and what a marvelous view from our second floor room!  When I discovered I was to attend a seminar at this glorious resort, I was happy to get away from the Michigan winter for a few days.  What a pleasant surprise when I saw the SSKR setting; it's on a  lovely part of the island away from the hustle bustle tourist area and close to the beautiful public Sand Key Park.   The beach is rated or the top 5 in the US; take a stroll on the beach, do some shelling (wear some water shoes though; those shells are tough on feet), watch the sunset--just hang out.  Rent a cabana for $20 a day if you'd like to incline yourself that way. The pool is warm and sparkling; the jacuzzi is more than inviting.  A poolside restaurant and a bar add to the relaxing atmosphere.    The…

title: Great Place!
review: On our recent visit to Florida we decided to take in one of the coasts and get married there. Boy, were we happy we chose to stay at the Sheraton in Clearwater! The place is great and we are hoping to go back again next year.  The private beach is really nice but if you want it to be a bit more lively take the 10 minute walk or 2 minute drive to Clearwater beach and chill out there. If you like a really quiet beach, this is the place for you - especially out of season (when we went). The whole pool area is cleaned every day (at about 6am before anybody would dream of using the pool, unless you’re mad). The restaurants, bars and little shops are excellent and the staff in them are typically friendly (if only us Brits were as constantly happy as the Floridians)  Our lovely…

title: One of my favourite hotles
review: This is the third time we have stayed at this hotel. Why do we keep returning? First of all the location, sufficiently far away from the more claustrophobic area of Clearwater itself, but close enought to sample many of the fine restaurants in the surrounding area. Salt Rock restaurant is worth a visit about 10 minute drive. The hotel is very clean, well maintained and rooms are comfortable with excellent beds. However the AC units are noisy. The staff are always helpful, and on this trip when we were evacuated due to Hurricane Charley, very accommodating in changing our reservation dates due to the circumstances. The beach is great, and worth the walk to reach the sea. A nice little room with free internet access is great for catching up on e mails, and for the kids to use MSN…

title: Great Hotel
review: This hotel is one of the best in Clearwater. We changed from the Radisson to this hotel. The Radisson had an extreme mold problem. This hotel is so much cleaner and nice. The rooms are not very large but standard size. The staff is extremely nice and the hotel is located right on the beach. The bartender by the pool remembers everyone and their drink. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Very Good
review: Date of stay - September 20, 2003. This hotel is very clean and comfortable and gives fantastic views of the bay. Moreover, the staff goes out of your way to make your stay as pleasant as possible. Upon getting to our nice clean room, my husband turned on the T.V. to check out some football games. The reception was very poor and there was no sound. We reported the problem and a maintenance man was at our door within minutes (if not seconds) to fix the T.V. Shortly after the maintenace man departed our room, we received a call from a front desk clerk apologizing for the T.V. inconvenience. As compensation, we were given a choice of $15.00 room credit, a free movie, or free full breakfast for two in Rusty's restaurant. Now that is what i call service. But that is not all.......the…

title: Loved It!
review: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key for 2 nights and thought it was a fabulous place. We had a terrific view of the pool and gulf from our very clean and comfortable room. The staff was very helpful and accomodating. The pool area was very spacious with sun and shade. The beach was a great place for collecting shells. We did prefer going to clearwater beach for sunning and walking at sunset as the sand was not so filled with shells. We did not eat at the resort. Our stay was everything we expected it to be and we were very pleased.
